story:
Hello, my name is Robin. I've been studying game design and development for 2 years. 

I've decided to take my skills to use to tackle a problem that I've come across, with the help of my colleague Tobias. As a gamer of many years, I do miss the good old games and like Warcraft 3, particularly it's tower defense defense with it's many unique maps. However, even though the maps are still in circulation, they are not updated regularly, and when they are it's by someone who made so drastic changes to the map that it ruins the original feel. The plan is to create our three favorite game modes all available in one game. We'll add more game modes continuously.


As of right now the plan is to create:

  • Elemental TD
  • Wintermaul
  • Tower Line Wars

Hopefully, if this campaign reaches its goal, all this will be available, either free or for a very small fee. Of course, contributors that help a certain amount, will get the game for free regardless.


We're looking for funding to hire help with graphics and network coding.

We hope you want to support this campaign and we hope you find it as awesome as I do.

 

Virtual high five!

story:
Product by 
  Suresh



Hexa Dice

HEXA DICE are long hexagonal shaped dice, with 1 to 6 numbers in words engraved on its faces. Each side is flat with beveled edges, contributing to a sleek, comfortable feel for game play. This dice are made of high grade aluminum and available in Black,Red & Blue anodized color finishing’s.

These dice sets fit perfectly in any collection, whether you are a casual gamer, a dice collector, or just like shiny objects.

Available in three color variants

Prototype

Render Image

Render Image


Concept

Introducing new style of playing with hexa dice, Just simply roll it out from your hands and find your number on top face  _ See it in action —>




Campaign Schedule





Photo Shoot - Prototype


What I Need & What You Get

Hi everyone! My name is suresh. I am a mechanical engineer. I always passionate about creating new things, that is why after my graduation I decided to become product designer.  And now I am introducing you Hexa Dice in my first campaign.

And this campaign will help me to continue my education in product design, and also to continue my research and development of new products.  To make all this things happen I need your support.

You will get your preferred pair of precious anodized aluminum Hex dice to your home within scheduled time. That’s my promise.


Risks and challenges

The risk is after my graduation. I have put all my efforts and full time on this project for designing and implementing.

As it is my first campaign I am going to face new challenges to go everything in smooth manor. But no need to worry I am ready to face those things.

At present the hot challenge is I should meet minimum order quantity to start manufacturing.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this page in your social media, so that few more people will know about this campaign. Thank You.


FAQs

-How can i select color ?
I have created individual perks for each color. So you can select what ever color you like.

-What about packaging ?
I am looking for best packaging. I will update about packaging in very soon in the campaign.

-Payment options?
Contributors can pay with their credit or debit card.

story:
Short Summary

Hello,
We are fans of StarWars. Our Team developed an interesting variation of the spherical droid #BB8 in the form of a Dice  #DD6


We are planning to issue two series of standard white and black metal.
This series for fans of Star Wars and for collectors of dice. In future we want to make glow levitating dice on special stand - it will be like element form future.

                                               (Resin model)

                                                (Metal model)


We spent a lot of time to create our product prototype and array of samples, starting from the design concept and ending with the realization of the product.
A concept for DD6 is taken from BB8. It all started with the creation of a standard dice. But we decide to go on and make a lot of ideas.

                                     System 1 (side)


                                     System 2 (side)


                                      Our workshop)


                                           Scheme

                                 A lot of variations

                                        

                                         Modeling



 




What We Need & What You Get

This is our 1th project and we want to continue this theme.
We need 1K$ to build operating matrix for resin meterial and about 2K to build operating matrix for metal dice and tests.

We have some ideas how to make this astro-dice even better.
But we need your help.
We look forward to your support.

Risks & Challenges

We have been working in this direction for 2 years and  of course there are moments of production and delivery, but all of these problems we solve, because we keep our reputation.

Other Ways You Can Help

We also will be glad for your help.

  • get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • use social networks
  • https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=1000109...

story:
Another Day: Orruss is an Open-World Survival and Multiplayer game, taking place on an abandoned military island, currently being developed by two people.

After some new discoveries of hidden islands, Orruss was the most talked about and after a while, people kept coming. Finding they can never leave, they started doing whatever it takes to survive.

You will have to keep looking for weapons, utilities and resources to loot so you can survive as long as possible until you find a way to escape.

The game will feature two types of gameplay modes: 

1.Classic Open-World Survival 

2.Battle Zones(100ppl-FFA/TEAM, 5v5v5v5)

 

After development is over, the game will be available for Windows PC.

The project started in March 2017, we were playing video games and all of a sudden we came with lots of ideas that could improve the games we were playing. We love shooters, RPGs, MMOs and survival games so we decided to start developing a game that has all of the above.

We want to bring to life a big and entertaining map for players all around the globe to play. We started slow, thinking of a place where everything should take place, and decided that it should be an island at first with two more connected neighbor islands coming later if the game does well. 

Having in mind games like DayZ, H1Z1, Miscreated etc, we are trying to make something our way with different mechanics and play styles. We are going for a semi-realistic way so that players get a realistic feeling without annoying mechanics.

We are developing the game using Unity3D because we are accustomed to the engine and can work easily with it. We are focusing on game-play, but at the same time Unity does offer beautiful graphics.

We are working hard on it and we hope you'll join us in this campaign to make this happen.

List of features

The game is a survival game where players have to survive as long as possible by looting items from all over the map or from other dead players.

Mechanics

  • Hunger, thirst, coldness
  • Inventory system
  • Melee, ranged weapons and guns
  • First and third person cameras
  • VOIP
  • Healing (bandages, med-kits, pills, injections, food and drinks)
  • Swimming 
  • Driving cars and boats
  • Enterable buildings
  • Animals
  • Seasons with dynamic weather
  • Day and night cycles
  • Three game-play modes
  • Character customization (TBD)

Weapons

  • Pistols
  • Rifles
  • Assault rifles
  • Knives
  • Attachments for every weapon
  • Shields

Game modes

  • Classic multiplayer survival (100-man server)
  • Free-for-all/Team battle zone (100-man server)
  • Free-for-all 5v5v5v5 battle zone (20-man server)

Zones

  • Three islands (one at launch)

Platforms

  • Windows PC (Steam)
  • Consoles (TBD)

In the FFA 5v5v5v5 battle zone, the map will have 4 closed zones with 5 people in it. Only after one player remains alive in the zone, one way will open so he can escape and move on to the next zone with the three remaining players.

Developing such a massive game requires time and money in order for the game to be improved as much as possible. We've got the time, but the funding required for the game to be developed with all the features that we want is beyond our reach, so we created this campaign for people to discover our project and to help us fund the game. 

We are a small team with lots of time and we need to grow, and for that we need funding and that's the main reason we are here.

We are open to questions and suggestions and to discuss the game with you.

We don't have a fixed goal, we'll use what we get and what we have. Everything goes in developing the game with better and polished features.

Even if we don't have a fixed goal, if the Indiegogo goal we established is reached, every feature seen above will be available at release and every cent above the goal will be used to hire more people and improve the game more and more with new features and new places.

story:
The game

  • 16 slimy characters with powerful abilities to choose;
  • 20 interactive stages will shake the way you play;
  • Up to 4 players local on the same screen;
  • Online mode with matchmaking and ranking;
  • A variety of skins and unlockables!

The Brawl Mode is a quick way to dive into battle; the players can choose among the sixteen characters and then change their team to play against each other in 1v1, 2v2, 1v3, FFA or any other combination.

Each character has a basic attack that can be either ranged or melee and a different set of abilities. One dash or movement ability, a skill that can be either offensive, defensive or supportive and a Special ability for ultimate damage.

From a burst of spikes to shadowy arrows that create a void to suck projectiles near you, there are a lot of combos to discover combining these abilities, and the right timing when using the ultimate Specials can change the course of the match.


 

Alpha

The alpha demo is already up and free to download at sunkenbrawl.com

With 8 characters, 4 stages and the Brawl Mode! The game supports keyboard commands and Xbox 360 controllers for up to four players locally, so you better invite your friends with controllers to play!

Or you can just wait for the Beta while you watch some of our alpha gameplay videos on Youtube and Twitch ;D


 

Beta

Is coming very VERY soon!

In the next couple weeks, the Beta will be up with more characters, stages and online play.

We just need to plug in some cables, push some buttons and turn on some switches and soon you will be able to play Sunken Brawl with your friends even when they are not messing everything at your home!

The partnership with AWS will ensure you have the smoothest online experience, with your matches running on the best servers in the world!


 

What We Need & What You Get

We need US$20,000 to finish the game until February 2018, when we will launch the game on PC. The perk options are pre-purchases of game copies, with the possibility to buy a single copy or packs of four copies by the price of three, and some premium packages for the investor-fans that really want to help us get the game to the next level.

All buyers get guaranteed access to the Beta as soon as it's up in late October 2017. We will send batches of Beta keys to people subscribing to our newsletter too, but invites will be limited while we get everything running stable.

You are our earliest supporters and we thought we had to give you something special back. So, everyone who buys a copy of Sunken Brawl through Indiegogo will get this exclusive in-game $piky cap to show off! On top of that, the Glass Bam’s cowboy hat goes to everyone who buys a pack of four copies with his perk, and Lamiana’s witch hat is exclusive to those giving us candy on Halloween and buying the Ocean Origins Deluxe Edition.

Through purchasing one of the exclusive investor perks, our most dedicated fans and people wanting to help us deliver the most diverse game experience can participate directly in the game production!

They will enter into direct talks with us bringing their ideas of gear sets or levels they want to see in-game, how they look and how they work, and we will make it happen. With J-Lea’s, Akuarou’s and Superstar’s perks, investors get everything from the rewards of the previous perks and will add more content to the game on top of what we have already planned. Even a boss fight!

These are just some examples of things we want to put in the game. What else can you come up with? The exclusive levels and gear sets designed by investors will be unlockable by everyone, you decide how other players will unlock it and we will put your name in the credits for your creations!

The Team

We are Umizon. A team of four game developers from São Paulo, Brazil, trying to make it happen. Sunken Brawl is our first project with all four together, but we've worked separately on smaller projects before since we met in college during our game design graduation.

Suikou is the lead programmer and producer; Bruno Aguiar is the musician and sound designer, Danilo Coronado takes care of writing and marketing the game and Henrique Fernandes draws and animates the fish.

We are working hard every day to bring you the best game we possibly can. We go to every single indie game event we can afford to. Even when we are not invited in, we put a notebook and four controllers on the outside for people to play. And they love it! That's what keeps us going: your love for gaming and the good times you have with our game.

We are making this game all by ourselves without any funding until now, only with the support of our family and friends and some freelance jobs. Also, we had to hire an artist to help us with the levels' backgrounds and character concepts, while our main artist is taking care of the animations and effects in-game. Part of the money will serve to improve old art and effects, as well as bringing more scenarios and skins for the characters.

Although we are all very committed to finishing this game regardless of commercial success, we need to pay some bills to put it on the market for you guys to play and hopefully continue making games as a way of living.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't get your copy of Sunken Brawl now, that's ok! Let's say you want to wait for the Nintendo Switch version? There are plenty of other ways you can help!

  • You can share this campaign with your friends on your social media and spread the word about this amazing upcoming fish fighting game you want to play;
     
  • You can download the Alpha and subscribe to the Beta at sunkenbrawl.com to help us test and balance the game until its launch;
     
  • You can make gameplay videos and streamings of our game and give a shout out to this campaign, that would help A LOT;
     
  • You can contact someone at Nintendo, Microsoft, or Sony and tell them "hey, I want to play this fish fighting game on your console, give those guys a devkit!";

Anything you can do to help us is very much appreciated, thank you very much! 

Remember to like us on Facebook and to follow us on Twitter for the latest news, and for everything Sunken Brawl, go to sunkenbrawl.com

Cheers! ;D

story:
Before I go into the details, I want to take a moment to stress that everything below is *subject to change*. Player feedback will be used in every way possible to shape development of these features, and any others that arise. This is still very much a "big idea" and I don't have all the answers, yet. But I feel that a company who's very foundation is based on a customer-first approach simply has to be better than anything else out there.

"What is it?" Initially I'm thinking a fantasy "RPG" for the mobile market. I put RPG in quotes because to a paper and pencil role-play gamer like me this isn't quite accurate. If you are familiar with the plethora of hero-collector games in the mobile market, then you know exactly what I'm talking about. Personally, I would love to include some classic flavoring though.

The market is already saturated, why try to make the same thing? Everything in the market right now has the same flaws. Companies are more concerned with collecting the heroes in your wallet than in providing you a game you can enjoy playing. I believe WE can do better together. A company in tune with it's customers' wants and actually working towards those goals, how can that fail?

In the beginning, both in terms of development and gameplay, there will be a main continent. A smattering of cities and some "dangerous wilderness" between. You'll probably need to kill a bunch of rats in the sewers to get started. Maybe even several times. Games of this nature always have some grind to them. I want to employ a variety of techniques so no one feature becomes overused, boring, or monotonous. After graduating from the sewers you will encounter a variety of "quests" mostly involving ferrying people or things to different locations. There will be a fair amount of back-n-forth. This too is a classic method of making more game out of limited resources. Moderation is key. Instant gratification leads to a game which is too short. Too much grind leads to frustration. Getting a good balance and a sense of accomplishment is critical. I'm intentionally including this at the forefront of the design process rather than an afterthought.

Down the road bigger things will arrive with the "discovery" of new islands. Another trope of classic games. This is an important mechanism because it allows unlimited expansion capability. I'm not designing a game to make a profit and then "flip" it. I want a game that can continue to be fun to play for as long as there are people willing to play it. A lofty goal in today's world.

I'll be explaining some island concepts in greater detail in coming updates. For now some highlights:

  • The mainland continent is the starting point for everyone. "World Events" are an important way of engaging players and will almost exclusively feature mainland content or locations.
  • Some islands will work similar to the mainland but introduce more difficult challenges or exotic creatures. Risk is an important feature in the game and it will be possible to get in over one's head. But islands will help prevent new players from wandering into something extraordinarily unfair.
  • A volcano that serves no purpose except to provide a "king of the hill" simulation. This will provide more organized guilds with a group vs group combat mechanism.
  • Millionaire's Island. The spenders' paradise. This island will feature some exclusive content, most of which will be prohibited in other areas. 
  • "...and much more!" The possibilities are endless.

"What about the heroes?" This is primarily a hero-collecting game is it not? Yes!  I'll give examples of a few concept characters in the updates. There are reasons I don't want to divulge too much info about lots of characters. It's an area of design that's very subject to change. "Operating Budget" will influence how many, and which heroes can be brought to life first. But I want to cover how heroes and hero progression will work. I foresee 3 types of heroes: full-Combat, support-Combat, and non-Combat.  All heroes will progress in three main ways, eXPerience, items, and skills. Nothing new there. XP is as boring as it sounds. It's a numerical value and heroes will "level up" at defined thresholds. For items I'm leaning towards classic looking "paper-doll" character sheets. Early in development heroes will likely all have a very simple, cookie-cutter template with some item slots on it. As heroes (and the game) develops I want these templates to change in ways that suit each character individually. Most games use very formulaic systems that are easy for them to implement and maintain. 20 bits of A make an itemA. Combine itemA and itemB to get itemC. By the time you get to LMNOP you need hundreds of bitA to assemble the requisite "recipe". Bo-o-o-r-ing! My idea is to have some items be "consumable", but not all. For example, you might find a leather cap lying about in the early dungeons. Later you encounter a novice blacksmith who can craft you the steel shell of a basic helm, but you'll need to provide the "liner". So the leather cap is consumed in making the basic helm. The next scenario might lead to a crafter who can reinforce the structure making it into a superior helm. A new city might house an artisan who will append wings or horns and make it a great helm. The new item replaces the old at each step. Conversely, there might be a different path where instead you purchase a ready-made chain-mail coif. You would equip the better gear leaving the leather cap in inventory. Over time you can accumulate a stash of rudimentary gear. The idea is when a new hero joins your party you won't need to slog thru the level 1 rats every time, they can start out with hand-me-down gear. Lastly heroes will acquire skills. The methods of learning new skills will be as varied as I can possibly make them. Unlike most RPG these will not follow a predetermined tree in most cases (tho character themes will dictate what's reasonable). But skills will be acquired mostly by interacting with the world. The end result I hope is combat with alot of variety.

"Combat? now we're gettin' somewhere!" The most common and most prominent type of heroes will be Combat based. Battle will play out on traditional hex-grids, primarily in one of two modes. The ambush/skirmish style will pit two teams in a standard face-off at either edge of one stationary screen. The gauntlet mode will begin w heroes on the left edge and will be a side scroller, allowing for longer battles and perhaps even platformer or puzzle elements. Early in game play/development each hero will have it's own internal artificial "intelligence", and will play out in their own frustratingly inept way (on purpose). As the player progresses through the game you will unlock options, skills, and Support heroes which give you greater control over the field, such as formations, initiative, group spells, and other tactics. Combat will naturally be a major element in both progression and day-to-day play so variety is a central concern.  Unless there is extensive player feedback to the contrary, I intend to make Combat heroes killable. What other games might call "hardcore" mode would be the default. There will be stages of "incapacitated" which would precede death. Victory over the battle might allow recovering some/most/all incapacitated heroes. Unlike most games, end-battle healing will not be automatic tho, to add macro strategy. Permanent, irrevocable death will be rare, but the threat is there. I feel risk is important to creating exciting game play. Most heroes will be replaceable by revisiting whatever area grants access to them. A small number may come at a RL co$t.

Support heroes will be a part of Combat but not actively engage on the grid itself. These cheerleaders will take up position on the sidelines to exert their influence on the field. They may provide group blessings, targeted healing or even rain artillery down upon your foes. Support heroes will less common, and more difficult to obtain than the bread-and-butter fighters. 

Non-combat heroes encompass everything else. These might be merely decorative, or "trophies". Such heroes would only be visible when a player's avatar is travelling or interacting with a city area. A subset of such superfluous heroes will accompany you and be visible to other player entourages in interactive areas. Other heroes will provide more practical purposes like daily resources or gold. Acquiring key heroes provide access to new content areas. Some will be very rare and hard to find for those who enjoy the hunt and expanding their collection. While some special heroes may be awarded only to those who contribute to game development. I intend to make it impossible for anyone to have *every* hero, so there will be a sense of accomplishment for those who succeed in acquiring a broad assortment.

As you can see, this is an ambitious undertaking. And there's alot more I'll delve into in comments/updates. The harsh reality is that all of this takes time and money. I can chip away at this in my "spare time". But I'd rather not, it will take too long. I'm a programmer, designer and a "big picture" thinker. Not so much an artist. This campaign will determine if graphics come from clipart, Fivver, or professional artists. Will program development come from me, a few college students, or a professional team? It's up to you. I'm determined to do this without any outside financial help, to eliminate obligations. Right now is your very first opportunity to "vote" on the future of this idea. The voting booth is right over there --->
story_txt:
Before I go into the details, I want to take a moment to stress that everything below is *subject to change*. Player feedback will be used in every way possible to shape development of these features, and any others that arise. This is still very much a "big idea" and I don't have all the answers, yet. But I feel that a company who's very foundation is based on a customer-first approach simply has to be better than anything else out there."What is it?" Initially I'm thinking a fantasy "RPG" for the mobile market. I put RPG in quotes because to a paper and pencil role-play gamer like me this isn't quite accurate. If you are familiar with the plethora of hero-collector games in the mobile market, then you know exactly what I'm talking about. Personally, I would love to include some classic flavoring though.The market is already saturated, why try to make the same thing? Everything in the market right now has the same flaws. Companies are more concerned with collecting the heroes in your wallet than in providing you a game you can enjoy playing. I believe WE can do better together. A company in tune with it's customers' wants and actually working towards those goals, how can that fail?In the beginning, both in terms of development and gameplay, there will be a main continent. A smattering of cities and some "dangerous wilderness" between. You'll probably need to kill a bunch of rats in the sewers to get started. Maybe even several times. Games of this nature always have some grind to them. I want to employ a variety of techniques so no one feature becomes overused, boring, or monotonous. After graduating from the sewers you will encounter a variety of "quests" mostly involving ferrying people or things to different locations. There will be a fair amount of back-n-forth. This too is a classic method of making more game out of limited resources. Moderation is key. Instant gratification leads to a game which is too short. Too much grind leads to frustration. Getting a good balance and a sense of accomplishment is critical. I'm intentionally including this at the forefront of the design process rather than an afterthought.Down the road bigger things will arrive with the "discovery" of new islands. Another trope of classic games. This is an important mechanism because it allows unlimited expansion capability. I'm not designing a game to make a profit and then "flip" it. I want a game that can continue to be fun to play for as long as there are people willing to play it. A lofty goal in today's world.I'll be explaining some island concepts in greater detail in coming updates. For now some highlights:

story:
Get Involved

Al Jones Corporation was founded in 2012, in Phoenix, AZ, USA, as an educational support service provider offering training and curriculum development in personal credit profile management and general financial literacy. In 2014, it changed its focus to developing games which would educate and entertain. That year, it developed Lyrics Guru®, the first cross-platform and real-time song lyrics trivia game, where the player receives series of song titles with lists of words and the player must match the correct word found within lyrics of the song.

In early 2015, it launched the Android and iOS app versions of the game.  Later that year, Al Jones Corporation received a certificate of appreciation for its respecting sponsorship of The 2015 Mayor's Disability Awards from the City of Tempe, AZ.  

Prior to the ceremony, Al Jones, President of Al Jones Corporation, discussed with multiple attendees, the creation of a version of the Lyrics Guru® game for those with a visual impairment.  "How soon will it be ready?" was a common response from those replying to him.

It was at that moment, he realized the magnitude of an under-served market in the general population which needs an expanded selection of fun and challenging entertainment developed in an alternative format.

In March 2016, it launched the playing card version designed for those with low vision.

Let your contribution help teens and adults with visual impairment, build their self-esteem interrelationships, when we manufacture, donate and deliver to them, 500 jumbo sized decks of the new playing card game, Lyrics Guru®.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to custom print manufacture, ship deliver the playing card decks within the Phoenix, AZ, metropolitan area, to organizations which provide services to teens and adults with a visual impairment. 

Perks

The $2,995 will cover the costs for print manufacturing, shipment and delivery.

 

  • 2" full-color Lyrics Guru® lapel pin

 

  • Lyrics Guru color barrier-free T-shirt

Women's

Women's V-Neck

Kids

Men's
 
Have Berty, the mascot of Lyrics Guru®, perform at your private party!
He loves being the hype man and hyping a crowd! It's mime meets hype! He likes hugs, word games, reading song lyrics and music trivia, dancing, listening to performers and watching sound engineers in a recording studio; going to flash mob events, concerts, backstage parties, songwriting collaborative meetings, video game conventions, weddings, birthday and grand openings.
 
Turn on some pop or hip-hop music, and shout, “Go Berty…go Berty…go Berty…!” and share in the laughter with those around you. 

If goal is not met, your contribution will be used to minimize the cost to custom print manufacture, ship deliver the playing card decks within the Phoenix, AZ, metropolitan area, to organizations which provide services to teens and adults with a visual impairment.

The Impact

The National Federation of the Blind's Blindness Statistics, updated September 2015, discussed the State of Arizona has 157,100 non-institutionalized reported to have a visual disability in the year, 2013.

"Games...have an appeal that doesn't fade with age, and in virtually every culture they're considered a normal recreational activity for adults..."~ American Foundation for the Blind (Playing Games)

 

"Large-print playing cards with large letters and numbers can be purchased... through specialty companies. These decks make it possible for individuals to enjoy...card games with friends and family. A dark background makes the cards easier to see on the table." ~VisionAware (TM) Resources for Independent Living with Vision Loss (Recreational Activities for Seniors with Visual Impairments : Card Games

 

"You do a trivia quiz because you want to answer the questions, see what you know and display your mastery of the subject matter at hand. The score lets you know how well you did but your primary interest is the questions themselves. No one is telling you that you have to answer these questions, your motivation is intrinsic (self display of mastery) and so the questions aren't seen as an obstacle but as an opportunity." ~ Will Kerslake, Game Developer

"I listen to music all the time and I like to print lyrics of songs and memorize them. Sometimes I can feel the meaning in a song if I listen closely. I can find inspiration and courage in good songs. I am always looking at good parts of songs and thinking of how I can make my own songs." ~ Cassandra

"I began listening to lyrics more closely once I realized how much music is made that relates to me." ~ Ashley

*The cited statistics and quotes above are used as reference and to emphasize the value of your contribution to help those with visual impairments. They do not reflect a direct support for this campaign.

Al Jones Corporation (Lyrics Guru app) also supports the American Foundation for Cardiomyopathy (http://americanffc.org/our-sponsors) and Earl Jones Institute (http://earljonesinstitute.com/).

Al Jones Corporation was a table sponsor at Tempe Presents: White Cane Day - A Resource Fair on, Thursday, October 15, 2015.  Berty, the mascot and brand ambassador for the song lyrics trivia game app, Lyrics Guru, was there to greet and capture photographs with attendees.  Staff presented and demonstrated the conceptual version of the text and voice controlled version of the app to the public. 

Al Jones, President of Al Jones Corporation also expressed his opinion on advances in assistive technology.

 

(Picture of Berty and two women attending Tempe Presents: White Cane Day - A Resource Fair 2015)

Jones also attended the 2015 Phoenix VA White Cane Day‏, Thursday, October 29, 2015, where he interacted with table sponsors and committed to speaking to fellow veterans at a support group in December 2015.

Challenges

Al Jones Corporation, recognized the need for an expanded selection of games in alternative formats for those with visual impairments and accepts the challenge to develop them.

Our plan is to solve this challenge by developing the following:

 

  • Large print, full color, colorblind barrier-free pallet, jumbo sized playing card game version of the game, Lyrics Guru;
  • Text based and voice controlled app version of the app, Lyrics Guru;
  • Tabletop version of the game, Lyrics Guru;
  • Text and voice controlled adventure games, where users direct the action by entering voice commands when prompted; and
  • Multi-language versions of the text based and voice controlled app version of the app, Lyrics Guru.

 

 

Share this with someone!

story:
Medieval Steel Warriors is a historical medieval battles simulator. HMB is a new sport, where guys fight each other with medieval weapons. They are fully dressed up in medieval armor.

In contrast to the existing medieval games, our game focused on the maximum realness of fight with sport rules accepted by HMB community. We cooperate with the best HMB fighters. Every member of our team, before getting involved into the project, has to come through the train with one of them fully equipped with armor.

You will feel yourself a real HMB fighter playing Medieval Steel Warriors. Join us and let's make a great game together!


Core features
  • Realism. You will be able to learn and repeat each game movement in reality! 
  • Connection of real and virtual trainings. You can count your real workout for your game character! 
  • Open source client and game server. We allow players to make modifications of the game and to open private servers. 


Why crowdfunding and what we want to do

We know a lot of people are annoyed of the games created to squeeze all the money of players. This is the reason why we want to avoid the attracting of investment companies which could dictate their rules. Since we have no investors we are free to create fun and interesting game together with you. And you don't have to think about the necessity to complete 50 more quests and collect all the free bonuses.

We will be happy if our game inspires you to join us in real sport halls.

To reach maximum realism of fights we attract as consultants the best HMB fighters. To reach maximum realism of fights we attract as consultants the best HMB fighters. And use them for capture of movements.

Sergey Ukolov


Ivan Vasiliev


Max Plaksin


Alexandr Nadezhdin


Artemiy Gershvald



We also believe that it is impossible to make a good simulator if the developers are not engaged in the game subject. That's why all of our developers have to wear armor and train with HMB fighters.




About Our Stretch Goals

$ 200,000 USD
Initial goal

$ 300,000 USD
+ Female characters
+ Fights at different times of the day
+ More armor and weapons
+ German translation

$ 400,000 USD
+ Visible damage of armor and weapons
+ More locations
+ Several warriors on one account
+ French translation

$ 500,000 USD
+ MAC & Linux version of Medieval Steel Warriors
+ Clubs with unique bonuses, status and achievements
+ Real fighters of the present and past and historical figures as your opponents
+ Spanish and Italian translation


Why we choose flexible funding

You may notice, that we will receive all raised money even if we won’t reach our funding goals. We choose this type of funding, because we will work on this project, regardless of the success of this campaign. We love it and we want to create a good game. Without money, it just takes a lot more time. And will be less items in game.

In other words, any amount of money will help us reach our objective and we’ll still be able to fulfill your perks. If you are still in doubt, you can ask any questions to us here or on our page on facebook. We are open for communication :)






More about the game

Battle Mechanics

Battles in the game take place on special areas and different number of participants on each side from 1v1 to 21v21. The main task of a fighter during the battle to survive and not allow the enemy to continue the fight, inflicting damage, breaking gear or slung over the fence.


How our fights are different from others?

Many strikes and techniques used in the existing games, are ineffective or just not possible in real life, though look beautifully. It isn't suitable for our simulator therefore we consciously refuse many spectacular things. You will be able to learn and repeat each game movement in reality. Also all the tactics of combat in the game will be usable in a real battle.


Training in real gyms

Unique feature of Medieval Steel Warriors is connection of real and virtual trainings. If you are actively engaged in the gym, you can count your real workout in the game and enhance your character. To be cool virtual fighter you are no longer required to sit at the computer for hours ;)


The training of fighter

During the game your character gets the points that can be distributed to improve strength, agility, endurance, etc. You decide which features and how to improve them depending on your fighting style. However, the higher the value of the characteristic, the more points are spent for each improvement.

Also, the character has skills that develop only when they are used. Initially, a beginner knows about all the techniques in theory, but don't know how to apply them efficiently. Using the techniques during the fight or training, the player improves the skills and their combinations, making them faster, more successful and accurate.


Training halls

For development of the fighter you can visit virtual training halls. The efficiency of your trainings will change depending on indicators of the hall. For example, in the branded hall with the fencing instructor you improve skills faster.

Anyone will be able to open training halls in game. Moreover, if you are the owner of the training hall in reality, you can decorate a virtual hall as a real and specify your contact information. Free of charge.


Craft items

Players earn money by fighting but if you need a break and money not enough you can do crafting gear. Already at medium crafting skills, you will be able to make weapons and armor better than is sold by NPCs.


Matchmaking and devices

Selection of opponents for fight is carried out automatically or by a direct call on duel or the appointed fight between teams. With automatic selection of the enemy system will select an opponent equal to you. In duels and team fights you should estimate the rival.

Due to the different control playing with a mobile device, you cannot fight with the players on your PC. And vice versa.


Championships

Eventually various championships for individual fighters and teams will take place in game. The rules will be slightly different depending on the scale and participants of the championship. So for the leadership in all events it will be necessary to become really skillful fighter, not just dress up in the best things.


How much is the game?

Medieval Steel Warriors is free-to-play game. Everything in the game will be available for ingamemoney or achievement.

The PC version of game will initially have restrictions, it will be impossible to use the general and private chats, there will be no access to auction and trade, fights will be inaccessible. To remove the restrictions, you will have to buy a digital key for real or ingame money.


Open source client and game server

Over the years in the gaming industry, we understood that the absolute protection against cheaters on the client does not exist. Therefore, we have decided not to interfere with the honest players and focus on improving the game server logic that any attempts to cheat are not possible or became immediately visible.

Through this approach, we can afford to open the source code for the client and the game server (the code which is responsible for authorization, financial operations, operations over game subjects and change of indicators of fighters remains closed).


Create fights with your own rules

With open source client and game server we allow players to make modifications of the game and to open private servers. In addition, each private server will appear in the list of servers for all players after moderation. Those who wish to play on a private server will be able to select it from the list to automatically obtain the missing resources in the client and start playing.

Technical preview

Now we have a technical preview of the game. Movements of fighters in it are used from other games. We will capture correct movements after fundraising.

Summary

Element of Survival is a role-playing survival game like no other. Instead of cause and effect, Element of Survival is almost entirely dice based. Every activity you do will cause a die to roll, and the number it rolls will determine your fate. Will you run into good luck, or go face to face with a bear?

Plot

On Element of Survival, you choose your plot. Launching with the beta, there will be only 1 scenario, but the other 4 will quickly join it, giving the player options on their survival situation. Each scenario will pose a different major problem. Lost In the woods follows your character who got lost in the depth of the woods. The chilly nights are your worst enemy. Collect tools, harvest wood, and build a fire. This is the only way you'll make it out alive. Other scenarios include: Marooned on an Island, lost in the desert, stranded from an airplane crash, and zombie apocalypse(and sandbox for those that pledge $20 or more)

Fund Raising Information

Funds raised in this campaign will go towards the following resources:

Having graphics made for items

Paying admins and someone to assist me with customer support

Getting a dedicated SQL server for database storage

Getting the game on Steam greenlight

Making a website for the game

Advertisement

Details

EOS uses an online server to store all users information in a database, so no matter what computer you log on from, you can pick up right from where you were. In the future, this will be utilized to add player encounters. This is also used to prevent hacking, by using both admins to watch accounts, and a simplistic anti hack that checks for rapidly changing values or values above the caps. The game is written entirely in Visual Basic and SQL.

About Me

I'm John, a 15 year old developer, gamer, and social media manager. I gained interest in computers from the time I was younger, and discovered the fun realm of code. Since then, it has been my goal to develop something that people will use, and have developed many things. EOS is a project I started for fun, but soon decided it had potential when I saw interest. Since then, I've been working hard to get a beta online. I look forward to launching this game and having a community.

story:
My name is Kai Alias. I am a 3D artist, part-time lecturer for 3D/drawing/animation since 2009, and I love co-op story driven games!

Stray Alloys is a labor of love, created by Faiz (our programmer) and me. It’s fueled by our passion for retro games and shooters. 

Faiz and I used to share a computer lab, where he was creating a super early prototype on his own while I was teaching university students. I saw his work and said, “let's start something here!” I had only one condition for helping him, I wanted the game and the story to be playable with another player. Other members of the team were guys I worked with from previous workplaces; they wanted to join in and the rest is history! We rented a new place and started working on our game project there. Most of us work on these part-time due to budget. It has been 2 years with a very limited budget of USD $917 per month.

 

Stray alloys & Co-op Legion Studio mean a lot to us as we are developing our first game and the first game produced in Brunei as well. We want to change the general perspective on the games industry in Brunei. We want investors to see the benefit of investing in something new, not just from a monetary point of view, but something to help the community by creating new jobs. We want to change people's mindsets here, where it's not about just working a 9 to 5 job, we want to make people care about the things they do and their jobs, instead of just caring about a degree/diploma and credentials. Most people here assume it will automatically guarantee a stable job, which is not the case.

 

We feel the gaming industry in general, is moving away from co-op story campaign; most games are either singleplayer-only or PvP multiplayer games, with many adopting mobile style monetization schemes. Occasionally, a co-op story-driven campaign will appear, but they are few and far between.

 

Additionally, we want to allow people to mod our games. Mods are great! People out there are trying things differently, coming up with very inventive and imaginative modifications. Helping create a platform for others to create their own games or earn a living making mods is something we encourage. If you feel the same way, please support us any way you can!

Currently, we are only focusing on the PC platform. In the future, other platforms may become viable options.

We designed several items and did 3D mock-ups.

Early concept of health potion

The initial idea was to make a health potion as a tribute to old RPGs. Although just thinking about it from a functional point of view, having a beaker as a health potion wasn't a great idea. We still wanted a pay tribute to old RPGs but at the same time, we wanted to make the items like functional and futuristic.

 

 

First 3D mock-up for the health potion

This stage, as much we wanted to mimic the old version of health potions, Red was not working for it, Our health bar was green as well. So we changed that.

 

Latest 3D mock-up for our Health Potion

Note: Inspired by a water bottle, and the formula is a formula for green apple flavor. 

 

3D mock-up for our energy pick up

So I didn't want to let go of the old health potion design as it's got a certain charm to it, so I decided to incorporate the design to the energy pick up.

 

3D mock-up for item delivery system

So instead of having some random items just floating around, we wanted to make some sense with the item placements. 

 

Early 3D mock-up for ammo pick up

So the initial design was designing the ammo to be a battery. So the inspiration was laptop batteries but realized the design needed to look more like a magazine. Hence the next design.

So one of our reward tiers is to be part of our game as a character or boss. I will sculpt the backer's head as their default head.  we haven't decided, which boss they will be. We do their default head and based on the boss they turned out to be, we can add scars or facial features etc etc to the backer's desire.

Backer's head sculpt progress

So we have one investor/backer who is interested in being in our game. We usually ask our investors or backers if they want to be in our game. Most say no as they don't have the desire and just want to support the game and get the merchandise like the figures and statues.

We recently started a 3D printing business as well called 3D Forge Studios that is dedicated to making 3D prints for people. This gives us the opportunity to make our figures/ statues for our backers; since we are big fans of game merchandise as well. We got the Form 2 SLA printer to help us with that. We plan to print a master copy and make duplicates. We have some Creality FDM printers but the quality and the amount of detail we can do with those are limited so we will be using the Form2 printer to make our figure/statues.

Form2 SLA Printer from Formlabs

 

Other Progress Notes:

  • Updated old character rig system with new rig animation system to accept motion capture data
  • Added new gameplay mechanics such as shield mechanic, minimap, item inventory, melee combat system and upgrade system.
  • Improved AI system for minions with multiple behavior trees

 

 Raw Co-op Footage for Voice chat test on Steam server

 

Keep in mind this a pre pre alpha build test so there will be bugs and issues, not the final game or close to it as we got a very long way to go. But this is just to let people try out our progress so far. We only had 2-3 weeks to put the map together and everything else, we have a very limited budget and resources so keep that in mind while playing our demo. We would like to get more funding so we can hire better people for certain things such as sound fx, music and level designer or more people for the assets such as 3d models, programming, animation and other stuff. So if you want to help us let me know, IF you're looking for a paying job, well we'll short on funds right now but the moment we get money or funds, everyone will get paid.

DEMO BUILD 1.5.2017

Controller Mapping (XBOX CONTROLLER):

  • LEFT ANALOG STICK - Move
  • RIGHT ANALOG STICK - Look
  • L3 (PUSH IN LEFT ANALOG STICK AND HOLD) - Run
  • R3 (PUSH IN) - Zoom in/out
  • DPAD - Weapon selection
  • A -Jump
  • X - Interact
  • LEFT TRIGGER/L2 - Aim
  • RIGHT TRIGGER/R2 - Shoot  
  • BACK/SELECT BUTTON -  Toggle on/off Mission Objective
  • START - Menu screen

Keyboard Binding:

  • W - Strafe Forward
  • A - Strafe Left
  • S - Strafe Back
  • D - Strafe Right
  • SHIFT - Fast Run
  • SPACE-BAR - Jump
  • LMB - Shoot ( can only use while aiming)
  • RMB - Aim
  • 1 - Weapon slot 1 UP (Blaster/ machinegun)
  • 3 - Weapon slot 3 LEFT (Flamethrower not working at the moment/ Shotgun)
  • 4 - Weapon slot 4 RIGHT (Rocket launcher/ Grenades, Has issues with push back right now, need to tone that down)
  • E - Interact
  • UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT ARROW - navigate puzzle 
  • BACKSPACE - Toggle on/off Mission Objective
  • O - Add Health (Debugging purposes)
  • P - Lose Health (Debugging purposes)
  • Z - Zoom
  • / - Instadeath (Use if the game has bugged out for demo only)

Known Issues with Demo build 1.5:

  • Avoid using grenades on orange minions and first two minions as you need to kill them to activate the moving platform.
  • Avoid using grenades or explosives on the boss as it sends him flying and makes it too easy.

Known Issues with Demo build 2.3.2019:

New Edit: Make sure at the lift bit, press and hold the right mouse button to see the cursor and press E to activate the lift (For the controller, hold the Left trigger and activate lift with X/Square for Xbox controller or PS controller)

  • Make sure to drop on the crates/boxes from the cranes.
  • Crouch and shoot animation, no animation for this action or needs to be disabled
  • Can shoot while using the shield, which we haven't disabled yet.
  • Explosives had too strong force push sending boss outside the map.
  • Flamethrower needs to be fixed, damages players.
  • Roll Dodge is too slow needs to be faster.
  • Shield ability needs to lock to screen so the character is always facing forward.
  • Ammo for rockets and grenades is unlimited.
  • Gravity is a bit floaty need to tune that.

 

Currently, we are spending 917USD per month, here's the breakdown for our current budget:

  • 587USD for Rent
  • 147USD on Internet ( ya, our internet is really expensive for JUST 30MBPS but what to do)
  • 147USD for Faiz (Our programmer, ideally we want to give 184USD to 367USD per person on the core team)
  • 36USD for Azim (Our Animator, I know it's a joke pay but that's all I can afford, he understand our situation BUT I want to give him 184USD to 367USD as well)

367USD per month is low but still we need to budget things unless we get tons of money then I can spare 1,000USD per person. 

  • For a lean case, we're looking for 4,000USD per month for rent, internet and the core team, including myself. 
  • For the best case, we're looking for 8,000USD per month so we can spend 4,000USD for outsourcing work such as music, sound effects, level design, more modelers and animators.

 

We plan to work on this game for 3 to 5 years ideally but if things get complicated maybe 5 to 7  years. If we can get proper funding it might be shorter but we want to make sure investors are prepared IF we don't hit the 5 year deadline.

  • For Lean case, 4,000USD per month for 5-7 years will be 240,000USD for 5 years (336,000USD for 7 years)
  • For Best case, 8,000USD per month for 5-7 years will be 480,000USD for 5  years (672,000USD for 7 years) anything after will be great and will be spent on just increasing the production value aka hiring more people.

Here's our schedule to do for each year when funded:

First Year: Pre-production work to be done (Story, Script, All character concepts, All environment concepts, level design all should be done) 

Second Year: Production work to be done (All character models and Level models to be done) 

Third Year: More Production work to be done (Gameplay finalized, VFX all done, All levels to be done and cutscenes to be done with voice acting)

Forth - Seventh Year: Post production work to be done + Debugging(Polishing the game, finishing up the artbook and statues) 

 

We might add T-Shirts, digital and physical wallpapers to the rewards but I would like to discuss it with backers, if they want it or not. I'm not keen on T-Shirts as different countries have different sizes and it's easy to mess that one up but if backers still insist on wanting T-Shirts, I will add it to the rewards.

  

240,000USD for Minimum Core Development for our game project

  • Includes co-op/solo campaign with the story but very limited production value for storytelling.
  • Includes mod support
  • Includes art book + figures for backers

336,000USD for Basic Core Development for our game project

  • Add on to increase to production value to cinematic
  • Additional levels to campaign

480,000USD for Mid Level Development for our game project

  • Add voice acting with limited animated cutscenes
  • Improve gameplay mechanics and design
  • Increase production value for:
    • Character models
    • Script and dialogue
    • Environment + concepts (artbook)
    • Sound Design + Music

672,000USD and above for Best Development for our game project

  • Full-voiced and animated cut scenes 
  • Full High production value in:
    • Character models
    • Script and dialogue
    • Environment + concepts (artbook)
    • Sound Design + Music

IF for some miracle we manage to raise 1,000,000USD - 3,000,000USD for our game project

We will want to outsource all our cutscenes (we will need to discuss with our backers, if they prefer the cutscenes to be animated in-game or high production 3D cinematic similar to blur studios or just animated in 2D) 

 

Aside from keeping regular updates either weekly or monthly progress, Any backers putting 1,000USD+ will have access to our files and financial spending so they know where the money is going.

I know there's a lot of scammers out there saying they are making a product and end up not delivering anything at all, making anyone who genuinely wants to produce something a lot harder. I got a letter of recommendation from 'Derek Eversfield', who is a veteran animator in the animation industry.

Aside from being a veteran animator, Derek Eversfield is also an apprentice and great friend with the legendary figure artist 'Glenn Vilppu'. You can easily IMDB Derek Eversfield and Glenn Vilppu is pretty famous in the art world. Things that Derek is famous for working on:

  • BraveStarr 
  •  Iron man (1996)
  • Chip N Dale
  • HBO Spawn

I had the pleasure to work with, study under and someone I can call my close friend. He is willing to put his reputation of over 34 years on the line for me and I don't plan to disappoint him, my team or anyone who put money in our product. 

So the good news is we ever lose our way somehow, I can talk to Derek for advice on how to handle problems and what to expect in the production pipeline as Derek has the experience to guide me and my team if we ever need it. 

 

We are a very small studio with very little budget. We run the studio with little outsource work and limited investment money to help develop Stray Alloys. The challenge is that we want to create our game at the highest quality we can make. Right now, we are at a mediocre level of production. We want to push this to a very professional looking production where we can be proud of.

If we raise enough funds, we can improve pretty much everything such as:

  • Level designs
  • Sound effects
  • Assets
  • Voice acting/Sound dialogue
  • Cutscenes
  • Story/Script

Part of the challenge is that we are asking for a lot of funding because we don't want to underestimate the cost as the worst case scenario will be developing a game and running out of budget to continue. 

If we don't reach our goal, we will still continue to develop our game just it will be developed at a much slower rate and lower production value, which is where we are at right now and we are not happy at the rate of progress we are going it. We want to do more!

Another challenge we face with recent development is that the PC marketplace is shifting. Our original intention is to sell our game on steam and other platforms but Epic store is being aggressive in getting exclusives. We understand why Epic is doing this but we also understand why people still prefer steam. So we are hoping to sell on both marketplaces as one we are using Unreal Engine 4.

IF we get fully funded, we will listen to the backer's request. I just hope Epic will respect our decision to let us sell our game on other platforms. Epic definitely makes great incentives compared to steam from a developer's point of view, but we want to be for the community. We will keep everyone up to date when the time comes. 

Alternatively, if we don't get funded and somehow Epic funds our project then at that point, we probably will have to go exclusive to their marketplace. But we are hoping to avoid that scenario. But that's the plan if things don't go well in Indiegogo funding.  

 

  • Khairul 'Kai' Alias as Director/ Producer/ Lead Character modeler + Technical artist/ Business Manager
  • Mayhuddin Zin as Assistant Business Manager/Concept Artist 
  • Faiz  Hamzi as Lead Programmer/Lead Technical Artist/3D modeler
  • Azim Mohammad as Lead Rigger/Animator/ UI Designer
  • Sharif Jaffary as Lead Concept Artist/ Storyboard artist

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you love our game or a fan of co-op campaign games, you can help us by sharing this campaign and tell the world about our game.  Share on any social media platform.

If you like to contribute your time and skills for the project, that would be great too if we don't raise enough. but hopefully, we can raise the funds so everyone gets paid. Any help will be appreciated. 

 

You can like, follow and share our facebook pages : 

https://www.facebook.com/cooplegionstudio/

or

https://www.facebook.com/3d-Forge-Studios-10885...

@cooplegionstudio

or

@3dforgestudios

You can subscribe to our youtube channel:

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwF9kFzJdgQMJK...

 

We already have patreon, if you want to support us through there instead :

 https://www.patreon.com/cooplegionstudio

 

We have a public discord server:

https://discord.gg/ZB3PBe5

 

If you like to email me personally:

kaialias86@gmail.com

or

cooplegionstudio@gmail.com
story_txt:
My name is Kai Alias. I am a 3D artist, part-time lecturer for 3D/drawing/animation since 2009, and I love co-op story driven games!

Stray Alloys is a labor of love, created by Faiz (our programmer) and me. It’s fueled by our passion for retro games and shooters. 

Faiz and I used to share a computer lab, where he was creating a super early prototype on his own while I was teaching university students. I saw his work and said, “let's start something here!” I had only one condition for helping him, I wanted the game and the story to be playable with another player. Other members of the team were guys I worked with from previous workplaces; they wanted to join in and the rest is history! We rented a new place and started working on our game project there. Most of us work on these part-time due to budget. It has been 2 years with a very limited budget of USD $917 per month.
 
Stray alloys & Co-op Legion Studio mean a lot to us as we are developing our first game and the first game produced in Brunei as well. We want to change the general perspective on the games industry in Brunei. We want investors to see the benefit of investing in something new, not just from a monetary point of view, but something to help the community by creating new jobs. We want to change people's mindsets here, where it's not about just working a 9 to 5 job, we want to make people care about the things they do and their jobs, instead of just caring about a degree/diploma and credentials. Most people here assume it will automatically guarantee a stable job, which is not the case.
 

We feel the gaming industry in general, is moving away from co-op story campaign; most games are either singleplayer-only or PvP multiplayer games, with many adopting mobile style monetization schemes. Occasionally, a co-op story-driven campaign will appear, but they are few and far between.
 

Additionally, we want to allow people to mod our games. Mods are great! People out there are trying things differently, coming up with very inventive and imaginative modifications. Helping create a platform for others to create their own games or earn a living making mods is something we encourage. If you feel the same way, please support us any way you can!
Currently, we are only focusing on the PC platform. In the future, other platforms may become viable options.
 

 
From 15/8/2018, we designed the main character Ray, from several different concept ideas, 3D sculpts, some test renders look and finally to what we have is an in-game model. 

First early concepts of Ray
 

Early Concept ideas for Ray
 

Concept for Ray
 
 
The concept for Ray's Gear and Equipment
 
 3D model for Ray's Jet boosters
 

Hand canon transformation concept + Weapon design variations concept 01
 

Hand canon transformation concept + Weapon design variations concept 02
 
 Early Animation Rig Test for Ray's Gun Arm
 

Early Helmet 3D sculpt for Ray's Helmet
 

Close up of Ray's face without helmet concept after an incident  
 

Rough 3D head + helmet
 
Ray's Melee Animation set 
We didn't get to implement the melee system currently but that's what we are working towards right now.
 

Early Test render and Test texture/material
 

Current in-game 3D Model
There are side characters in development but I do want to leave some surprises for players when the game is complete. That secret I need to hold until the game comes out. 
 

Along doing the concept, modeling for the main character, we also were doing concept and modeling for the enemies.

First concepts for standard drone
You can tell we used the last concept for the jumper drone as we felt it's got an interesting look.
 

Early Concepts 01 of Drone 
 

Early Concepts 02 of Drone
 

Early 3D render of Drone
Here you see our early iteration of the drone. initially, we wanted a drone with wheels just to show some drones that were weak and primitive but at the time, we tried to animate and make the wheels have physics to them and turned out too heavy to have many of these fighting the players. So we had to change the wheels to something else. we decided to go with a flying drone. We may go back to wheels if we get funding and see if we can hire someone who can easily fix this problem or not. But at the moment, we won't be using this design. 
 

Latest design for drone minion/wire-frame view 
 
October 2018 Update for our Mini Drone
 

Early concepts for Jumper drone
So we redesigned the jumper drone and one of the jumper drone designs we changed into an ostrich drone.  As you can tell, we started the concept since June 2017.
 

3D sculpt and build up for Jumper drone
 

Jumper drone sculpt with turret attachment for enemy upgrade/harder difficulty
 

3D model wire-frame for Jumper drone without optimized mesh
 

3D model wire-frame for Jumper drone with optimized mesh
 

Color test with 3D Jumper drone
 

In-game 3D model of Jumper drone
 

3D model build up Ostrich drone with an upgrade
 

In-game 3D model of Ostrich Drone
 

3/4 view for Ostrich drone
 
Ostrich Minion Animation set
At this stage, we did all the animation for the Ostrich drone but haven't added the AI for it and the Jumper drone we started doing the animation for it. The video above was recorded at an earlier time and we had technical issues during that time, so sorry for the quality though.
 

First concepts for shield/sniper type minions
 

Early Concept of shield minion
 

Shield minion and other concepts
 

3D buildup iteration for shield minion eyes/head
 

3D build up for shield minion
 
Shield Minion Animation set compilation
 

3D rough buildup Shield Minion arm gun upgrade
 

Test Render/Material 01 for shield minion
 

Test Render/Material 01 for shield minion
 
Early AI progress for Shield Minion
 

Due to a lack of budget, we only have time and money to design one boss. We're hoping to do more and quicker if we get more funding. 

Early concept 01 of mech boss
 

Early concept 02 of mech boss
 

The concept for mech boss
We're big fans of giant mechs so we had to include it as one of our bosses, plus it's a good way to show the scale of power. 
 

3/4 view of giant mech boss
 

3D build-up test for mech boss
The 3D build up for the mech boss is different from the concept, but like everything else, all is subject to change. 
 

Mech pilot war veteran concept
The face is subject to change since we're letting backers get to be some of the bosses.
 

We did some UI design layout for the upgrade trees for weapons and character. Icons for the UI are subject to change as they need some work.

Weapons Upgrade UI Screen Concept
 

Character Upgrade UI Screen Concept
 


The concept for Environment city
 

Early 3D mock-up for City
From concept to a 3D mock-up. The first city level we planned would be something based close to our world but with some differences. The skyline would have a distant planet and giant structures supporting the atmosphere dome for the space station. The idea is that each space station represents a different style, country and culture.
 

Blocking for our city level
 







Buildings we built for our city level
 
 
In game screenshot with Unreal Engine of our procedural made building 01 
 

In game screenshot with Unreal Engine of our procedural made building 02
 

We designed several items and did 3D mock-ups.

Early concept of health potion
The initial idea was to make a health potion as a tribute to old RPGs. Although just thinking about it from a functional point of view, having a beaker as a health potion wasn't a great idea. We still wanted a pay tribute to old RPGs but at the same time, we wanted to make the items like functional and futuristic.
 
 
First 3D mock-up for the health potion
This stage, as much we wanted to mimic the old version of health potions, Red was not working for it, Our health bar was green as well. So we changed that.
 

Latest 3D mock-up for our Health Potion
Note: Inspired by a water bottle, and the formula is a formula for green apple flavor. 
 

3D mock-up for our energy pick up
So I didn't want to let go of the old health potion design as it's got a certain charm to it, so I decided to incorporate the design to the energy pick up.
 

3D mock-up for item delivery system
So instead of having some random items just floating around, we wanted to make some sense with the item placements. 
 

Early 3D mock-up for ammo pick up
So the initial design was designing the ammo to be a battery. So the inspiration was laptop batteries but realized the design needed to look more like a magazine. Hence the next design.
 

New 3D mock-up design for the ammo pickup view 01
 

New 3D mock-up design for the ammo pickup view 02
 

3D mock-up of container for multiple health potion
 

3D mock-up of container for multiple energy pick up
 

3D mock-up of container for multiple ammo magazines
 

3D mockup of Inventory chestbox
 
Early Inventory UI management 
 

So one of our reward tiers is to be part of our game as a character or boss. I will sculpt the backer's head as their default head.  we haven't decided, which boss they will be. We do their default head and based on the boss they turned out to be, we can add scars or facial features etc etc to the backer's desire.

Backer's head sculpt progress
So we have one investor/backer who is interested in being in our game. We usually ask our investors or backers if they want to be in our game. Most say no as they don't have the desire and just want to support the game and get the merchandise like the figures and statues.
We recently started a 3D printing business as well called 3D Forge Studios that is dedicated to making 3D prints for people. This gives us the opportunity to make our figures/ statues for our backers; since we are big fans of game merchandise as well. We got the Form 2 SLA printer to help us with that. We plan to print a master copy and make duplicates. We have some Creality FDM printers but the quality and the amount of detail we can do with those are limited so we will be using the Form2 printer to make our figure/statues.


Form2 SLA Printer from Formlabs
 
Other Progress Notes:

Updated old character rig system with new rig animation system to accept motion capture data
Added new gameplay mechanics such as shield mechanic, minimap, item inventory, melee combat system and upgrade system.
Improved AI system for minions with multiple behavior trees

 
 Raw Co-op Footage for Voice chat test on Steam server
 


Keep in mind this a pre pre alpha build test so there will be bugs and issues, not the final game or close to it as we got a very long way to go. But this is just to let people try out our progress so far. We only had 2-3 weeks to put the map together and everything else, we have a very limited budget and resources so keep that in mind while playing our demo. We would like to get more funding so we can hire better people for certain things such as sound fx, music and level designer or more people for the assets such as 3d models, programming, animation and other stuff. So if you want to help us let me know, IF you're looking for a paying job, well we'll short on funds right now but the moment we get money or funds, everyone will get paid.
  
NOTE: PLEASE READ ALL THE NOTES BEFORE PLAYING BOTH DEMOS
Build 1.5 was made two years ago when we first started and inspired by mega man of course. We made our own characters and building our demo level at this current time. Below are the key binding and controller mapping.

Demo build link here (Keep in mind you need 20 gigabytes space for both demos as the demo have not been optimized as they are purely for testing, please read all notes before playing and apologizes for any bugs):
(Link removed after campaign ended. Backers can ask for link or new people can go to our patreon's page here: https://www.patreon.com/cooplegionstudio and pledge just a minimum of 1$ to gain access to our demos)

Avoid using grenades or explosives on the boss as it sends him flying and makes it too easy.

Roll Dodge is too slow needs to be faster.

Currently, we are spending 917USD per month, here's the breakdown for our current budget:


587USD for Rent

147USD on Internet ( ya, our internet is really expensive for JUST 30MBPS but what to do)

147USD for Faiz (Our programmer, ideally we want to give 184USD to 367USD per person on the core team)

36USD for Azim (Our Animator, I know it's a joke pay but that's all I can afford, he understand our situation BUT I want to give him 184USD to 367USD as well)

367USD per month is low but still we need to budget things unless we get tons of money then I can spare 1,000USD per person. 

For a lean case, we're looking for 4,000USD per month for rent, internet and the core team, including myself. 
For the best case, we're looking for 8,000USD per month so we can spend 4,000USD for outsourcing work such as music, sound effects, level design, more modelers and animators.

 
We plan to work on this game for 3 to 5 years ideally but if things get complicated maybe 5 to 7  years. If we can get proper funding it might be shorter but we want to make sure investors are prepared IF we don't hit the 5 year deadline.

For Lean case, 4,000USD per month for 5-7 years will be 240,000USD for 5 years (336,000USD for 7 years)
For Best case, 8,000USD per month for 5-7 years will be 480,000USD for 5  years (672,000USD for 7 years) anything after will be great and will be spent on just increasing the production value aka hiring more people.

Here's our schedule to do for each year when funded:
First Year: Pre-production work to be done (Story, Script, All character concepts, All environment concepts, level design all should be done) 
Second Year: Production work to be done (All character models and Level models to be done) 
Third Year: More Production work to be done (Gameplay finalized, VFX all done, All levels to be done and cutscenes to be done with voice acting)
Forth - Seventh Year: Post production work to be done + Debugging(Polishing the game, finishing up the artbook and statues) 
 










We might add T-Shirts, digital and physical wallpapers to the rewards but I would like to discuss it with backers, if they want it or not. I'm not keen on T-Shirts as different countries have different sizes and it's easy to mess that one up but if backers still insist on wanting T-Shirts, I will add it to the rewards.
