story:
ABOUT ME 

 

Hello everyone! 

My name is Daniel Petersen. I'm 23 years old guy from Denmark.

I have this big passion for gaming, and now it has evolved into making games! 

I’m building my own game called Confict & Teamwork which I have already used a lot of time and energy on making this a dream come true!
 Hoping for this to be a project that other gamers would like and support. Daily I’m educated to work with IT and I'm at this moment working as an IT-supporter. But I really want to have my own gaming business.

 

ABOUT THE GAME

 

This game is going to be a multiplayer game. 

One game, 100 players. They will be divided into two big teams of 50, These 50 players will be split into squads. You decide if the squad is 5, 4, 3, 2 or solo players. 

Later on it will be possible to split the teams in 5,10,25 players instead of 50, so more teams with less players.

Your squad is allowed to team-up with other squads on the team. But mostly you play with your assigned squad. So, you don’t have to focus on what everyone else is doing on your team of 50.  But it will be a good idea to help the rest of the team, if you are able to. 
The team needs people who gather resources, secure the capture points, makes weapons, scouts and sneak up on the other team. each class have different tasks, that will give the team and yourself more points. 

 

There’s going to be different tasks:

Main task

Finding the opponents flag.
Getting the flag to your own base.

 

Semi main task                     

Capture points.
(There's 3 capture points on the entire map)

 

Secondary task

Depends on witch class you are, and what you and your squad choose your main focus to be: capturing the flag, defending/attacking capture points, supporter, and so on.

 

You can win by stealing the other teams’ flag and getting it back to your own base. This gives your team instant win.
You will have about two minutes from you steal the flag before the opponent team gets a warning about the flag is missing. From now on you need to run and hide a lot.
The flag will make you run slower than normal. If you are a FLAGRUNNER you will run faster than other players, but still slow with the flag. So, you need help from your team. This is where you guys need to teamwork a lot. 

You will get extra points if you stick to your own tasks.
If you get some kind of task, you need to complete it for extra points. This will make sure people don’t do less or more than others. And makes sure people don’t just walk around in circles.

 

GAMEPLAY

 

Teamwork
In this game teamwork is important. You have to work together for this game to work out. 
You need to find a way to communicate and split the assignments (building, crafting etc) between players on the squad.

There will be squads of 5-2 people. And with every squad-size, you will play differently. 

 

Solo players
If you choose to be a solo player in the game. You are most likely to be a scout. This is the perfect assignment for solo players.
You main focus will be to assist squads all around the map, where it's needed. 

 

Capture points
There will be 3 capture points on the map.  
These are really important for the entire game. With capture points you will get more points to buy weapons, tools, medic and more. You will also have less respawn time and will be able to respawn at the new capture point.

 

Killing the other team
You will have a easy time killing. Because you need to have the opportunity to kill a whole squad by yourself if they don’t pay attention to their surroundings, and dont teamwork. – so, look out! ;-)

 

Permadeath
After a certain amount of time, if the flag has not been captured from any of the bases, there will be PERMADEATH! This means you will win if you are the last man standing! 

 or have two out of three of the capture points in X number of minutes, this will make people not just wait and camp. If you get killed during the permadeath you can just leave the game, and still get your reward.

 

Spawning
There is going to be X minutes from you die till you respawn again. 
When you have one or more capture points you respawn faster. 
You can also buy less spawn time with the points you get from doing your assignments, tasks and from capture points.

There will be less spawn time at the base, than smaller places as your capture points and spawn points which a specific class can make. 

 

LOOT
One should look for loot, such as ammo, weapons (will be rare to find), medic, and things to build, cover, etc.
Some special classes can craft/build many suitable things out of the materials your squad finds or buys, and all classes have different things they can craft/build.
It's important to loot because when you die and respawn it is expensive to buy all your gear again, and sometimes it is better to save your points, for situations where there is no time to loot 

Weapons
You can make a lot of different weapons out of parts that you find around on the map.  You can find barrels, stocks, hull etc. And combine them in different ways. - Of course some parts, doesn't fit together, and some fit very well the better they match, the better the gun will be.(recoil, range, penetration etc.)
 Some guns can't be changed, only its attachments (scopes,suppressors,mags)

 

Building/crafting/resources.
It will be hard to get good weapons and ammo. So dont waste it, but with that said most things can be turned in to a weapon or used as one.  Sticks can be sharpened, rocks can be thrown and traps can be made.

You can craft/build many things, like bows, spears, guns, traps, buildings, covers, ammo, armor, decoys, scopes, explosive, etc. When you start (if no points are used) you will spawn with some stuff to help you craft and get going. this will be like a knife, or others stuff. This depends on your class.

 

Assignments
In the start of the game you and your squad chooses a class and a main focus on the map, that can either be: going for the enemy flag, capture points, scouts, supporters, saboteurs, or more. then you will get assignments depending on what class you are and what focus you and your squad chose. example if you are a craftsman, and the focus is capture points you will get assignment to craft weapons and ammo for your team, while you and your squad will get a assignment together to capture, defend or hold a capture point. 

Every class and squad will get different assignments to mainly follow, and i would recommend following the assaignments, unless you and your squad really thinks this is a good plan or have a game changing plan.
Following the assignments, will give you an advantage, in the way of points, that you can use on weapons or other kinds of gears.
This will make people not run around doing nothing.

 

Classes
In the game there will be different kinds of classes. You are going to pick what you want to be in the start of the game. You are not going to be able to change your class when the game start. There can only be one of each class in one squad.
 

 

What classes are going to be in the game? 
Here are some examples of the classes and what they can do

FLAG RUNNER
Will run faster when the player is running with the flag.
Can be able to cheat with his destination, so he will not be easy to find.

BUILDER
Will be finding resources for the team and makes respawn points (more will be added) 

MEDIC
Are going to revive  players on the team.
Revives players quicker than “regular” players who are not a medic.

CRAFTSMAN
Makes weapons out of resources. 

HUNTER
Being able to track other players.

MARKSMAN
Good with sniper.  

STEALTH
Has a Ghillie suit.
Can't be tracked.

TRAPPER
Makes traps.

And more will be added. 

 

COMMUNICATION
In the game there will be proximity type chat and proximity VoIP.
Only people inside a radius of the capture points or the base are able to see the proimity chat.You cannot type with the whole team on the map. ONLY with the people inside a certain radius. 
 You can't type to the enemy team. the proximity VoIP works so only players close by can hear you, that also means the enemy can hear you if they also are inside this radius. 

 

MATCH LENGTH
A game can be more than two hours long, so be sure you have good time before starting a game. 
 But it can also be very short, if a team are managed to get the enemy flag. 

 

RAGDOLL
If you are getting shot in the leg or are to close to an explosion there is a chance that you will trip over, and this will make you vulnerable for some time.

 

 

POINT SYSTEM
There is a in-game point system.  These points are some you will get while playing and are reset every game. 

what you can buy with these:

Respawn time

Weapons

Medic

Class ability 

Tools

Resources

More will be added. 


There is also a point system in the menu.
You will get a amount of points after every game.
You will get more depending on whether you win, how good you played and how high league you are in.

What you can buy with these:

Loot creates.

Weapons create

Tools create

Skin creates.

You can also buy skin creates, but nothing else. Nobody likes "paid to win"!! :D  

 

 


LOOT CREATES

If you win a game, you are going to get a random skin create or a random create (not trade able items) and points. 

If you lose a game, you will only get some points.

What kind of creates are there in the game? They have different rarity!

Skin create

Weapon skin create

Item create

Weapon create

Tools create

There is going to be a lot of different rarities. They will be split into colors, so you can see how rare it is. 

 

LEAGUES AND RANKS

You will get better chances for good skins when you are going into higher ranks. 

You will be rated for how many points you scored through the game and if you followed your Tasks. You will most likely end up in a game with other players with the same rank or league as yourself. With a higher rank or league you will get better skin creates and more points for creates. 

 

MATCHMAKING

Players who only wanna troll will be marked with the "troll mark" and will only be able to join other players with the "troll mark" for some time. So they won't be trolling around people that wanna play serious. 

 

WHAT YOUR MONEY WILL BE SPEND ON

 

 

GOALS FOR THIS PROJECT 

 

$35.000-100.000 USD: is my main goal for the project. If it reaches this goal I will 100% get the game out as wanted. But I will still release it if it does not reach the goal. 

 

$200.000 USD: I will make a big update and make some new maps, game modes. Maybe something like 10vs10, survival, and smaller maps.

 

$300.000 USD: Advanced building system, and much more!

 

$400.000 USD: Season updates, big content updates, graphic reworks and more, every season

 

$500.000 USD: Single player mode, it will have focus on open world, story and new gameplay every mission. I am already designing something in my mind.

 

 

Help support the game, on other sites. 

 LikeSubscribe Follow   Visit (Soon)

 

 

SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS

coming soon

story:
D. Ezra Sidran, PhD is a computer scientist and an award-winning and bestselling wargame designer. His research in tactical artificial intelligence (AI) has been supported in part by DARPA (the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency). General Staff is the first commercial implementation of this research.

The General Staff Wargame is a computer wargame designed to simulate any land battle from the 17th, 18th or 19th century using the TIGER/MATE AI system (papers describing the underlying principles and algorithms of this AI can be downloaded here and here). Later versions of General Staff will cover the 'Ancients' and 'Modern' periods.

The General Staff Wargaming System is an easy to use wargame construction set. It consists of a suite of modules for creating armies, maps and scenarios. The 30 most popular (as voted by our fans) battles are included free for early backers.

The General Staff Wargaming System includes:

  • The General Staff Wargame 
  • The General Staff Army Editor
  • The General Staff Map Editor
  • The General Staff Scenario Editor
  • 30 Famous Battles

story:
#Official Twitch Channel

#Official Facebook

#Official Discord Channel

#Official Youtube Channel

THE NEW #BETA FEATURES LIST

 

betav1.0

Auto-run by holding left mouse button.

Finally ! You can now move your hero just but holding your left mouse button! This new feature was requested by a lot of players during the #alpha.

Light radius system

A new light radius following your hero that make the environments look better, especially for indoor zones.

A better camera refresh rate.

Enjoy a new camera angle with a better refresh rate and feel the Diablo atmosphere around you!

A new and better user interface.

This is a big improvement from the #alpha :) Enjoy it

Weapon switch skin for all class.

Each time you will equip a weapon, you will now see it live on your hero.

The original Diablo2: LOD storyline

Same quests, same zones. Nothing have changed this time.

A new inspect feature.

It's now possible to look at the inventory of other players in the game. Compare each other's gear just by clicking this little button in the party panel.

But also...

-All heroes from the #ALPHA have been wiped.

-The first part of the #BETA is almost ready and will be launch (soon) with two zones:

  • The Blood Moor
  • The Den of Evil

-A major revamp of the magic find system/formula.

-All skills have been rebalanced.

-The difficulty of the game reflects more the one from Diablo2.

-In general, all cooldowns have been reduced.

-TONS of bug fix.... (tons really)

-And much more...

IN THE FUTURE... (work in progress)

 

Gems, Runes, Jewels, Sockets items system

I would love to add a socketed system into the game in the future.

 

ACT 1 : GAMEPLAY FOOTAGE SHOWCASE (VIDEO)

 

ACT 2 :  GAMEPLAY FOOTAGE SHOWCASE (VIDEO)

 

ACT 3 :  GAMEPLAY FOOTAGE SHOWCASE (VIDEO)

 

ACT 4 :  GAMEPLAY FOOTAGE SHOWCASE (VIDEO)

 

ACT 5 :  GAMEPLAY FOOTAGE SHOWCASE (VIDEO)

 

How many people are on our team?

Only one, me. The 6 666$ will be used to fund the future of the project. The biggest challenge I face is the time required to build the future of the game, but with some monetary assistance, I'll be able to eliminate many of the challenges and focus only on it.

What about Blizzard?

They contacted me. Everything is fine. I am using the Starcraft 2 engine editor to make this happened so there is no problem!

What needs to be done? Is it completed?

No, it's not. The first thing I would like to do is adding some items. I would like to complete the skill trees for all class and add a socketed system. After that, if the monetary support is there, I would love to finish the quests and all the zones for each Act (1 to 5) and maybe add a little Act 6! :)

How to play? Do I need Starcraft 2? When the #BETA start?

The #BETA will start (soon). It will be accessible in the Starcraft 2 arcade for free to ANYONE. You do not need to buy the Starcraft 2 game to play The Curse of Tristram! Simply download the (FREE) starter version of Starcraft 2 via the battlenet launcher and you are ready to play! 

SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS?

Recommended Requirements

Operating SystemWindows®

10Windows® 10 64-bit

Processor

i5 or AMD FX Series Processor or better

Video

NVIDIA® GeForce® GTX 650 or AMD Radeon™ HD 7790 or better

Memory

4 GB RAM

Storage

30 GB available HD space

Internet

Broadband Internet connection

Resolution

1024X768 minimum display resolution

Special thanks!

Nanakey (Spell's effect)

Delphinium (Spell's effect)

TaylorMouse (Modeler/Animator)

xxxDragonRiderxxx (D3UI / Import)

Progammer (Starmovie)

Dustin (Collision angle system)

Doronamo (Main Tester QA)

Michael Lokka (Official Soundtrack Mixer)

Blizzard Entertainment

story:
Welcome to Tale Of A Wolf

Introduction

Tale Of A Wolf is a story driven, open world wolf adventure.

Set on the magical island of Sylvanna, you join Ako - an elemental wolf, who is the current guardian of the land in a struggle against the humans!

The core gameplay loop consists of;

  • Exploring Sylvanna
  • Helping your fellow animals
  • Recruiting new pack members
  • Taking down human camps
  • Collecting essence
  • Levelling up your abilities and your pack members
  • Rinse, repeat!
  • Challenge the Elementals!

Demo

You can find a short playable demo of Tale Of A Wolf for the PC here - DEMO LINK

The demo is set in Sector 4/6 of Sylvanna, has one mission available and will typically take around 30 minutes to finish.  You can use a DS4 controller in this version, however it is advisable to use a keyboard to enter the menu when you rename your wolf pack - I will be adding support to enter names via a joypad at a later stage.

 

In this demo you will have the Ice Form at your disposal, please take a look at the 'Read Me' file within the download to get an idea of the controls and attacks. 

You can also remap some controls via the in game menu.

If you have any issues or questions please feel free to join the Discord Server, it is a great little community!

Unique Features

Ako can transform into 7 elemental forms to protect the island, including fire, ice, water, lightning, earth, light and dark!  You can decide your own form at the start of the game!

Each of the elemental forms have a unique boss linked to them, these are called the Elementals.  The Elementals were once guardians of the land themselves, until their lust for power consumed them! 

Once the humans have been cleared from Sylvanna, you can seek out the Elementals and unlock all of their forms & abilities!

The Underworld

In death, your soul is separated from your body and you enter the Underworld.  You will need to absorb spirits to return back to the physical realm!

Get ready to recruit your pack, explore Sylvanna, help other animals, take down the humans and restore the natural balance!

The Game World

Environment

The game features a realistic day and night cycle already implemented, including a range of weather states. 

One moment the sun will be shining, then there could be a thunderstorm.  Be aware, wolves hunt at night, and you may end up in someone else's territory.

Hunting

Wild animals and creatures roam freely - Deers, Bears, Fish, Toads, Hedgehogs, Crab, Rabbit, Fox.  

You don't have to attack any animals within an area, that choice is yours.

Will you be an apex predator or a protector of the land?

Animals will need help on the island, keep an eye out for them as they will prove valuable along the journey. 

Scent Vision

Scent vision allows you to easily identify a target from a distance whilst slowing down time.

Each living entity has its own colour designated.

Exploration

Tale Of A Wolf isn't all about combat - there are great awards awaiting those who like to explore! Tracking scents will award far more essence that anything that you can kill on Sylvanna!

Cave System

The island includes an extensive cave system, utilising Unity's new terrain tools and allowing the playable area to be expanded dramatically.

Creatures like spiders lurk in the dark corners of the map- you have been warned!

Fire Mechanics

Tale Of A Wolf offers a destructive fire mechanic, you can pick up branches scattered around the map and set them on fire if you go to a bonfire.  

You can use fire to burn down human tents and equipment - any object set on fire, will be destroyed and there will be no way of restoring the object unless you load a previous save game.

All living things on the island are affected by fire, causing damage when coming into contact with the element.  

Human structures and equipment can now also be destroyed using magical attacks.

Wolf Pack System

There will be other wolves on Sylvanna and not all of them will be friendly. 

Prove your dominance and they will join your cause - later missions will require a pack in order to be completed. 

Human AI

Humans have set up multiple bases of operations. 

There will be an airport, shipping docks, large/medium/small encampment and stray camps to explore.

 

Each will have their own unique problem to overcome.

Use tactics to overcome the humans.  You can destroy generators used by the humans to knock out power to camps - this will turn off power to all lighting, radar and radio equipment.

With no radio, the camp cannot call for backup. 

As long as you approach an enemy from behind and they have not seen you, you will be able to perform a takedown kill which will defeat the enemy instantly.  

So who am I?

Thank you for taking the time to look at my project.  My name is Luke and I'm a developer from Oxford in the UK.  Recently made redundant due to Covid-19, I'm looking to start my career as a full time independent game developer.  

I have been working on Tale Of A Wolf for 12 months now, I love the project and I love working with the community to improve the project!

Originally I was funding the project myself, however after losing my job and my son being sick in the hospital at the same time this is no longer possible. I'm now hoping for your help to finish the project on time for the December 2020 release window!

The project was a success on Kickstarter in May 2020 where it was backed by 125 awesome Wolf-Lovers.  I raised funds on Kickstarter back in May for the soundtrack and voice acting for Tale Of A Wolf.  You can see how much the project has grown since the Kickstarter campaign by checking out the updates here.

Now Tale Of A Wolf is coming to Indiegogo.  This means that if you missed the Kickstarter, now is your chance to back the project, secure a discounted digital copy and help me make my dream come true!

Please feel free to join the Discord server, I am active there every day and can answer any questions you have regarding the project.

Rewards

The rewards for backing Tale Of A Wolf span from digital copies of the game to awesome feelies and special rewards!

Digital Copy

Every backer will get a digital copy of the game upon release, this will be sent via a Steam key.

Early Access

Tale Of A Wolf will be participating in The Steam Game Festival: Autumn Edition!  An improved demo will be available via Steam between October 7th – 13th.  Shortly after this event, the project will enter early access.  Every backer that is eligible will be notified at this time.

Name In The Credits

Every backer, regardless of your contribution level will get their name in the credits!  I want you to feel part of the journey and show you how much I appreciate your support!

In Game Graffiti

Keep an eye out for your tag, backers will get their gamer tag or name of choice put into the game via graffiti!

 

If you have a custom image you would like to use, get in touch, I may be able to work something out with you!

Why IndieGOGO?

I have spent a considerable amount of time over the past 12 months bringing the project to life and I have been able to fund the game myself up until this point. 

After being recently made redundant due to Covid-19, 4 days after the birth of my son.  I am no longer able to continue to fund the project. 

The funding will be used to cover living expenses so that I may continue to work on the project full time until the release date.

Upon a successful campaign, I'm hoping to start my career as a full time independent game developer and I need your help to make Tale Of A Wolf the best it can be!

Risks & Challenges

Tale Of A Wolf's main features are implemented and the game is near completion.

As in every project, setbacks may occur, which could lead to delays. I will work hard to prevent that, and if there are delays, I will try to minimise them as much as possible.

This game is my dream and I'm having a great time working on the project and I'm extremely motivated, so you can count on my best efforts to deliver the best experience I can make.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't back Tale Of A Wolf right now that's totally fine! There's other ways to support the project!

The most important is to share this campaign wherever you hang out online!  Honestly that means more than most people realise!

Also check out Tale Of A Wolf on Twitter!

Finally, wishlisting Tale Of A Wolf on Steam goes a long way in helping out the project!

story:
Playable demo is here!

DOWNLOAD THE VERSION FOR WINDOWS!

Feel free to submit your feedback HERE.

Red Rust is an action packed game for PC about fighting robots and travelling through time by direct orders from Comrade Stalin!

Scroll Down for Much More Information

 

Couple of words about who we are. The core development team are three people:

Alex Yaremchuk

Alex has been working in games his entire career. He started as a game reviewer in the 90s but he gradually transitioned to game development and post-production. During the past 15 years he worked as a 3D animator, 3D modeler and game designer for some of the largest gaming studios in Eastern Europe. He is the art director and lead designer of Red Rust.

Roman Yaremchuk

Roman is the lead programmer of Red Rust. In a few months he will graduate from one of the leading Universities in Prague with the major in computer programming. He had discovered his calling as a game developer when he first encountered the Unity engine! He's been working with Unity for several years now.

Olga Bekreeva

Olga is responsible for a myriad of things. She does 3D sculpting for Red Rust, she does 3D fabric simulation and she will be making all the hand painted character figures you can find in the Rewards section. She is a very skilful crafts-person who's been making dolls and miniatures for over a decade. 

Together we (and several friends we are working with) are the ArtSource Digital studio. And the funds will go towards completing Red Rust and releasing it around November 2022. So far we have been 100% self-funded and we really need your help and your support to make it to the finish line!

 

Imagine a combination of a classical beat 'em up and a Contra-style shooter. That essentially is the idea behind Red Rust. Simple concept yet polished gameplay, great art and animation and cool characters. Characters like Red!

Red is a ruthless KGB spy who's been chosen personally by Comrade Stalin.

In the year 1985 Comrade Stalin still rules over the Soviet Union as a cyborg and a beloved Secretary of the Communist Party. 

It all begins in Berlin. Once Red lands her ballistic missile, she must locate the time machine and proceed with her secret mission.

The game consists of several time zones, and each time zone has several levels. 

Levels in turn hold all sorts of dangers including epic confrontations with mechanical monsters!

 

 

 

 

$22K – Interactive Comic Book Style Cutscenes

The easiest way to show the story progression is through simple text or dialogs within the game. But a much better method would be an interactive comic book style sequences! That means producing substantial amount of extra art assets and possibly even expanding the story. 

$30K – Flying Levels

Remember we were talking different gameplay situations? This is it! 
In the old days flying shooting levels were almost a mandatory thing for an arcade game and for a good reason: they are fun and they help to shake things up. Here you will be riding a Soviet ballistic rocket shooting enemies with your trusty Makarov pistol!

$40K – Driving Levels

How about having a driving level as well? That is really a dream come true! Just look at the concept design. Here you will be either chasing someone or escaping from a threat, like this giant robot! That can be even turned into a crazy boss battle of its own!

$65K – Branching Story

That’s a tough one, because that complicates the level design and expands the scope of development. But it certainly adds to the replayability.  Remember how in Contra Hard Corps at the end of some levels you could choose the direction the story takes? That’s super cool, but if we want a similar thing in Red Rust, that requires more levels and a reworked story.

Make no mistake, we really want to do it!

$75K – Printed Artbook and Soundtrack on Vinyl

The game development process generates a ton of cool art assets, like concept designs and test renderings of 3D objects and characters. It's such a shame that often in gamedev these piles of extra art end up collecting virtual dust on some hard drive somewhere. We can't have that! We are already offering a Digital Artbook as a perk, but nothing beats a physical printed Artbook. Printed artbook will have even more stuff!

 

Concept designs, character models, sprite sheets, background art. We want to publish an Artbook that will tell the tale of the development process and show the evolution of the game. 

This won’t be just pictures, there will be stories to read in this book too. We have plenty of stories!

It's also a chance to contemplate the progression of the project and to see all the designs that didn't make it into the game.

And we are so proud of Red Rust Soundtrack that we want to have it on Vinyl with an awesome cover art!
 
Both the Artbook and Vinyl Soundtrack (if funded) will be available for the backers at a significant Discount!
 
Get in touch with us directly.

 

We are a small development studio based in Prague, essentially a family business and we have the vision. For many months we've been pouring every spare ounce of time and money into this project, but we can only do so much without additional financial support.

Get in touch with us directly.

We want to see it through and make sure the game does not only see the light of day but is also good. And to make this happen we need to put more focus on it. Look at all that we've done while bootstrapping, and now image what we can accomplish with your help!

We envision Red Rust as a fun and addictive action game with great character designs, snappy animation and a story which is interesting, sometimes funny and sometimes heartbreaking. 

And most importantly, we want to get the community involved in the development process of the game. 

There are perks available that let you essentially join the effort or leave a permanent mark in the world of Red Rust!

 

 

A side-scrolling fighting game and a shooting game are two fundamentally different beasts. They have different mechanics and different pacing, but both genres are fun. We've decided to double the fun by mixing fighting with shooting in such a way that they don't upstage each other.

In other words there are parts of the game which are just about fighting and there are those which are about shooting. A typical Red Rust level is not just one monotonous stretch. It has a number of fighting and shooting situations and at least one boss battle (sometimes two). We put huge emphasis on bosses because we like developing and animating robotic monsters. It is tremendous fun!

Right now we have the prototype, it's still glitchy in some places, but we have the basic game mechanics up and running. The fighting system and the shooting system are working. Now we need to clean up the code, get rid of those bugs and create more content: more levels, more characters, more animation. 

We plan to release the game around November 2022. Red Rust will certainly be out on Steam and Atari VCS. 

Fun fact: Red alone has about 40 individual animations already done!

 

Boss battles are an integral part of Red Rust, because each mechanical monster not only has the potential to look really cool but also to introduce a fresh in-game situation.

Our prototype here has two shootouts with bosses and several more bosses (for other levels) are already in development.

We plan to have one or two boss battles per level (depending on what we can afford). Each one is presented as a 3D character, meaning that it has to be designed, modeled and animated.

Get in touch with us directly.

 

We went with somewhat unusual combination of 3D characters and hand-drawn backgrounds for the majority of levels.  Red Rust is a heavily stylised game with bright colors and we wanted  it to look like an interactive cartoon. 

2D backgrounds are not only more expressive than 3D, they also allow us to produce and test levels quicker. And we want to have a reasonable number of levels.

All characters are manually animated (no motion capture) and even the effects are mostly hand drawn!

 

Music is the soul of any game, we firmly believe that! Especially a game with any type of narrative. To make sure Red Rust has a soul we joined forces with two amazing composers: Michael Sobin and Roman Jelínek.

Michael wields an electric guitar and he does tracks with plenty of drive and ton of character (check out his YouTube channel where he does amazing covers of retro game music). And Roman (he composed main theme for the title screen) makes music which is cinematic and more lyrical. 
 
Berlin Level by Michael:

Boss Battle by Michael:

 

The Rewards we are offering fall into 4 major categories: those we can deliver very soon (within 1 – 3 months) and those which take longer to produce (like the game's entire soundtrack, the artbook and the game itself). And also there are digital and physical rewards. 

Physical rewards are naturally limited and they include:

-wall posters signed by the team;

-T-shirts with Red Rust characters;

-collectable figures;

Few words about the t-shirts and collectable figures

We've ordered a few test prints of the t-shirts. They are of a very high quality and you can select the size and the color of the t-shirt:

But we are still working on the frontal designs so you will have to give us a little time to finish those. And we will reach out to you so you can pick the design you like best from the selection of several. 

Physical collectable figures come in two flavours:

-4.5-inch figures (in height OR length) covered in metal paint and varnish;

-large 7.4-inch fully colored hand-painted figures; 

***

Both types are produced on demand so again it will take few months for us to deliver. 

If you are getting one or more of the figures, you will be able to pick any character done so far. We will get in touch with you personally and give you the choice of currently available characters. 

Hand-painted figures are more sophisticated. They are produced by us inside the studio. First we make individual elements (it's easier to paint that way) which are then carefully colored and glued together. It's quite an undertaking therefore we only have a VERY limited number of those. But again, you can pick any character.

 

And talking about the characters!

All too often characters in arcade games are an afterthought. It's not the case with Red Rust. We are very methodical when it comes to designing the game and designing the characters. We go through multiple sketches and iterations (you will see them in the artbook), we consider the backstory of each regular enemy so everything can fit the narrative.

These are the game-ready characters completed so far:

Remember, right now it's just the prototype of one level, so we will have many more characters.

 

Even if you cannot contribute money you should know that even the mere fact of you reading this means a lot. Thank you so much! 

If you like Red Rust and want to help us more, please, share the Campaign on Social Media. Post it on Twitter and Facebook/Instagram, talk to your friends and maybe they will jump on board and sail with us towards a better, shinier future! 

 

 

Red Rust Web-Site

ArtSource Digital Web-Site

Get in touch with us directly

Both the Artbook and Vinyl Soundtrack (if funded) will be available for the backers at a significant Discount!
 
Get in touch with us directly.

 

We are a small development studio based in Prague, essentially a family business and we have the vision. For many months we've been pouring every spare ounce of time and money into this project, but we can only do so much without additional financial support.
Get in touch with us directly.

We want to see it through and make sure the game does not only see the light of day but is also good. And to make this happen we need to put more focus on it. Look at all that we've done while bootstrapping, and now image what we can accomplish with your help!
We envision Red Rust as a fun and addictive action game with great character designs, snappy animation and a story which is interesting, sometimes funny and sometimes heartbreaking. 
And most importantly, we want to get the community involved in the development process of the game. 
There are perks available that let you essentially join the effort or leave a permanent mark in the world of Red Rust!
 
 

A side-scrolling fighting game and a shooting game are two fundamentally different beasts. They have different mechanics and different pacing, but both genres are fun. We've decided to double the fun by mixing fighting with shooting in such a way that they don't upstage each other.

In other words there are parts of the game which are just about fighting and there are those which are about shooting. A typical Red Rust level is not just one monotonous stretch. It has a number of fighting and shooting situations and at least one boss battle (sometimes two). We put huge emphasis on bosses because we like developing and animating robotic monsters. It is tremendous fun!


Right now we have the prototype, it's still glitchy in some places, but we have the basic game mechanics up and running. The fighting system and the shooting system are working. Now we need to clean up the code, get rid of those bugs and create more content: more levels, more characters, more animation. 
We plan to release the game around November 2022. Red Rust will certainly be out on Steam and Atari VCS. 
Fun fact: Red alone has about 40 individual animations already done!
 

Boss battles are an integral part of Red Rust, because each mechanical monster not only has the potential to look really cool but also to introduce a fresh in-game situation.

Our prototype here has two shootouts with bosses and several more bosses (for other levels) are already in development.

We plan to have one or two boss battles per level (depending on what we can afford). Each one is presented as a 3D character, meaning that it has to be designed, modeled and animated.

Get in touch with us directly.
 

We went with somewhat unusual combination of 3D characters and hand-drawn backgrounds for the majority of levels.  Red Rust is a heavily stylised game with bright colors and we wanted  it to look like an interactive cartoon. 

2D backgrounds are not only more expressive than 3D, they also allow us to produce and test levels quicker. And we want to have a reasonable number of levels.
All characters are manually animated (no motion capture) and even the effects are mostly hand drawn!

 

Music is the soul of any game, we firmly believe that! Especially a game with any type of narrative. To make sure Red Rust has a soul we joined forces with two amazing composers: Michael Sobin and Roman Jelínek.

Michael wields an electric guitar and he does tracks with plenty of drive and ton of character (check out his YouTube channel where he does amazing covers of retro game music). And Roman (he composed main theme for the title screen) makes music which is cinematic and more lyrical. 
 
Berlin Level by Michael:


Boss Battle by Michael:


 

The Rewards we are offering fall into 4 major categories: those we can deliver very soon (within 1 – 3 months) and those which take longer to produce (like the game's entire soundtrack, the artbook and the game itself). And also there are digital and physical rewards. 
Physical rewards are naturally limited and they include:
-wall posters signed by the team;
-T-shirts with Red Rust characters;
-collectable figures;
Few words about the t-shirts and collectable figures
We've ordered a few test prints of the t-shirts. They are of a very high quality and you can select the size and the color of the t-shirt:

But we are still working on the frontal designs so you will have to give us a little time to finish those. And we will reach out to you so you can pick the design you like best from the selection of several. 
Physical collectable figures come in two flavours:
-4.5-inch figures (in height OR length) covered in metal paint and varnish;
-large 7.4-inch fully colored hand-painted figures; 
***
Both types are produced on demand so again it will take few months for us to deliver. 

If you are getting one or more of the figures, you will be able to pick any character done so far. We will get in touch with you personally and give you the choice of currently available characters. 

Hand-painted figures are more sophisticated. They are produced by us inside the studio. First we make individual elements (it's easier to paint that way) which are then carefully colored and glued together. It's quite an undertaking therefore we only have a VERY limited number of those. But again, you can pick any character.

 

And talking about the characters!
All too often characters in arcade games are an afterthought. It's not the case with Red Rust. We are very methodical when it comes to designing the game and designing the characters. We go through multiple sketches and iterations (you will see them in the artbook), we consider the backstory of each regular enemy so everything can fit the narrative.
These are the game-ready characters completed so far:

Remember, right now it's just the prototype of one level, so we will have many more characters.
 



Even if you cannot contribute money you should know that even the mere fact of you reading this means a lot. Thank you so much! 
If you like Red Rust and want to help us more, please, share the Campaign on Social Media. Post it on Twitter and Facebook/Instagram, talk to your friends and maybe they will jump on board and sail with us towards a better, shinier future! 
 
 
Red Rust Web-Site
ArtSource Digital Web-Site
Get in touch with us directly

story:
Step 1: Indiegogo
Step 2: Thunderclap
Step 3: Steam Greenlight
Step 4: Sign Up on Resurrection Games



E-sports Tycoon is an addictive game where you manage & customize a gaming café that is exclusively owned by you. It is a Simulation Role Playing Game (RPG)/ tycoon game.
  • You get to play the role of a manager who not just hires gamers to play tournaments (amateur to pro-level) but also handle a cafe; equip it with the latest PCs, gaming consoles, arcade machine etc.
  • If you loved Game Dev Story, then this is *the* game for you!

What do we mean by upgrading the café?

You get to upgrade the following:

  • PC with CPU, monitor, PC games & Gaming Gear;
  • Gaming consoles with model type, TV, games & gaming gear;
  • Lounge Area:
  1. Update your space to better & more comfortable PC chairs, console couches & couches in the waiting area.
  2. Apart from this, you also can update the lounge area with a little snack bar that also has a soda machine and yummy treats.
  3. It doesn’t stop here. Make your café look beautiful with funky posters on the walls. For gamers who are waiting to use the café, can engage themselves on various arcade machines that you can upgrade your café with.
  4. As if this wasn’t awesome enough, you can even expand the area occupied by your café, as the game progresses. (Think 2 to 3 PC/ consoles , 1 arcade machine, Vs. 20 PC / consoles, 2 snack bars, 5 arcade machines & a plethora of gamers waiting to get into your café!)

But why should I upgrade my café?

  1. REPUTATION: Upgrading your café will improve the reputation of your café amongst gamers & fans alike.
  2. HOST TOURNAMENTS: Initially when you hire gamers, they will be able to play tournaments hosted by international gaming associations. But, as your café expands, you can hold you OWN tournaments within your café!
  3. GET A BETTER RETURN FOR YOUR INVESTMENT! Better quality technology & a swankier ambience for your café, will fetch you more money, more gamers & more money per gamer.

How do I upgrade the café?

THIS INVOLVES SIMPLE BUSINESS MECHANICS: To begin with, earn money from visiting gamers, use up the initial capital to set up the café and progress in the game thereon, based on earning more money from visitors, hiring gamers to play & win tournaments, beautify the café and so on.

This seems like a lot of work (& fun), do I get any help?

  • Yep, of course you do! Bring in a super-efficient manager based on his scouting and gaming attributes. [You get one manager at a time. If you are not happy with his skills, you can fire him and hire another one. Remember you are the boss, ALWAYS!] (See video for reference).
  • Sponsors: Based on the reputation of you café, you can attract some kick-ass sponsors  who will not just bring  in investment meant for, say, land expansion but also improve the brand worth of your café.


Awesome! So how do I hire gamers and form my E-sports team?
  • SCAN GAMER PROFILE: Each gamer who visits your café, has a profile that indicates his/her attributes. Based on this you can hire any gamer/s and form a team for playing games of various genres.
  • HIRE BASIS YOUR GENRE PREFERENCE: Attributes of a gamer imply how well he is playing games of different genres. (See image below for reference) E.g. a gamer may be awesome at arcade games, but may not do so well in racing games.
  • THERE IS SOMETHING FOR EVERYONE! Each gamer can play across as many as 6 gaming genres, that are, Arcade, Sports, Racing, RTS, FPS & MOBA.
  • TRAIN, FIRE, HIRE GAMERS: As the game progresses, you can train your gamers on different games. If you are not satisfied with a gamer’s performance, you can always hire a new one. (We promise there will be plenty of talent out there!)
  • MULTIPLE TEAMS: Not just one team, You can have as many as SIX teams, one for each genre.



We, at Resurrection games completely believe in the idea of providing our audience with “Value For Money”.

While some of our users may like the game idea instantly, some may not be swayed with it almost immediately. (We do hope to woo all of you!)

We do not want our dear users to spend on a game that they may not be entirely convinced with.

That’s why we bring you the COMPANION APP. This is a completely FREE to play game that we will be releasing, so as to provide users with a preview & taste of the real E-Sports tycoon game!

So what does this companion app entail?



  • You get a room, instead of a whole café.
  • You get to create 1 gamer at a time, hire him; train him by making him play games.
  • Raise the ranking of the gamer and sell the gamer for a great price, and earn money.
  • Not just this, but you can see the tournaments being played by the gamer you sold, and his performance level.
  • You can also buy games, gaming gear, upgrade consoles etc. & decorate your room as you like and make it look funky.

    Who buys my trained gamer?

    • Users of the full game, E-sports tycoon, buy your gamer basis his performance, to form a team and play in the tournaments.
    • You need to train and sell a minimum of 5 gamers – to form a team and upgrade your role to that of a manager.
    • But tournaments can be hosted only in the full game.
    • Not just this, but you will also get a % share of rewards as earned by gamers you have sold with respect to whether they win in the tournaments.
    • That’s not all. The gamers hired, trained & sold by you, can compete at the International Level and still be the no. 1 team in the world!
    • Tentative Feature: We are planning an in-game conversion of a "Gamer Tycoon" user to "eSports Tycoon" for a certain in-game money in "Gamer Tycoon".



    WE BELIEVE, THE SKY IS THE LIMIT! And we prove it to you right here, with our expansion plans.

    Own cafes around the world and mark this as just the beginning. Yes, our expansion plan is as BIG and as GRAND as it gets!!

    Key features of expansion plan:

    • E-SPORTS TYCOON GOES “SOCIAL”! Trade gamers amongst your friends & compete with a friend’s team in tournaments.
    • BUY GAMING CAFES AROUND THE WORLD: Conquer the international gaming scene by becoming the richest tycoon in the history of E-sports!
    • HOST INTERNATIONAL GAMING EVENTS:  As the game progresses you will be vested with the power of hosting the biggest gaming events all around the world!


    At Resurrection Games, we are firm believers of Electronic Sports and naturally we advocate gaming as a real career opportunity for young gamers around the world.
    • E-sports tycoon is our way of bringing to life, what we TRULY believe in.
    • We want the users to experience what it is like to manage a team of gamers, to bid on talented gamers, make them compete or stick to business by making their café one of the best in the gaming world.
    • OUR DREAMS FOR THIS GAME DO NOT END HERE. We are a true believer in E-sports and feel that it can be looked at as a viable career option for avid gamers. While in our home country this may be at a nascent stage, but in most other nations, E-Sports are being widely accepted as an actual sport event with gamers enjoying the status of a celebrity within the gaming community.
    • This is why we need YOUR HELP, in raising money to bring this game to life.
    • Of course, we have a number of ATTRACTIVE PERKS for you, to support us in bringing this game to life.
    • Our unique perks are all about connecting with the game by being an in-game character, registering your personalized clan, deciding how the cafe should look or to host a custom tournament which will be played by hundreds and thousands of gamers.

    We are a small team and we carry the same risks of all small game studios: Lesser visibility and fewer marketing avenues.
    • However, we also carry the strengths of a small start-up: Less overhead, no hierarchy and most importantly, passion for our game to see it through to completion and beyond.

    In case, we fail to achieve the targeted funds:

    • Development time may increase.
    • Art style may be subject to change

    We call upon all eSports fans to support us so that we can make it bigger than EVER!!

    We appreciate Indiegogo for providing us with a platform to launch this campaign from India with the least complications. We would also like to call upon kickstarter backers, anyone & everyone who supports E-sports and loves gaming.

    Your support is key in bringing E-sports: the game. to completion.

    Whilst the basic framework of the game has been completed, further content creation and system requirement will require time to reach the quality and quantity that we wish to offer.

    100% of your contributions will go toward development:

    • Art/animation and Development
    • SFX and Music (entirely out-sourced)
    • Taxes
    • Software license fees
    • Indiegogo Fee
    • Hardware for testing purposes (if needed at all)


    19,000$: 3 Member Team  for 6 months. Team includes Game Designer| 2xDeveloper

    6000$: Game Art Outsourcing: We bring in Gary Lucken from Army Of Trolls to make the best pixel art for Esports Tycoon 

    2000$: Sound Designer Outsourcing.

    3000$: 10% Fee for Indiegogo and Processing.

    60,000$: Companion App "Gamer Tycoon":

    • Development (4 months)
    • Art
    • Sound
    • Database/Networking

    50000$: "eSports Tycoon" Expansion

    • Development (6 months)
    • Art and Sound
    • Additional Networking
    • Social Features



    1$:     Thank You for showing your support.  You will receive a “BACKER” credit.



    5$: We appreciate your support; you receive an eSports Tycoon Digital Wallpaper pack which will include wallpapers, concept art and more + “CONTRIBUTOR” credit.

    8$: 250 Steam Downloadable Copies available for grabs @8$ + “EARLY BIRD” credit.

    10$: You will receive a Steam downloadable copy of the game + 5$ Perk + “PRE ORDER” credit.

    15$: Mobile Versions (iOS & Android) + Steam copy. All these games run in sync, so play the session on any of your devices + 5$ Perk + “EXCLUSIVE BUYER” credit.

    20$: Beta “EARLY” Access to E sports Tycoon on all devices + 15$ Perk + “FAN BOY” credit

    30$: Digital Gamer Card + Companion Access (Alpha + Beta Update Access) + Custom Updates. We assure you, there will be no item in game, you don’t see first + 20$ Perk + “SUPER FAN BOY” credit.

    40$: You get to register you name as an in-game gamer. You will be seen visiting café and will be available for “HIRE” in eSports Tycoon + 30$ Perk + “GAMER” credit.

    50$: In-game pet. Get this special pet hanging out in your cafe among the regular gamers + 40$ Perk + “PET LOVER” credit.

    75$: Register your name as an In-game Manager. You will appear as a candidate when people want to hire a manager for the café and their teams + 50$ Perk + “MANAGER” credit.

    100$: Appear as a Pro Gamer with your custom clan tag in game. Your character will have higher stats from the day you appear + 75$ Perk + “PRO GAMER” credit. Pro Gamers won’t appear as normal gamers in-game.

    250$: Our team will get in touch with you and together we will create a character that will look just like you and have custom gear, clothes etc + 100$ Perk + “CUSTOM BACKER” credit.

    500$: Register you custom clan names (Max 5 Players), Same as Personalized character, but for the whole clan. You can also customize your clan logo and gear. + 250$ Perk + “TEAM OWNER” credit.

    1000$: Host a custom tournament with our team. Your idea, we implement and help you host one of the swankiest tournaments in the history with a huge number of prize pool+ 500$ Perk + “TOURNAMENT HOST” credit.

    2500$: Be an in-game sponsor. Stand among the biggies like Razer, Asus, Alienware, HyperX etc by bringing in your brand to sponsor new cafes to the user. Your brand will remain permanent in eSports Tycoon. We work together to create unique designs for the cafe and help your suggestion become reality of how cafes should look + 1000$ Perks + “SPONSOR” credit.



    30,000$: This is the bare minimum product we will be creating for PC, available via Steam if we get green lit, else we will distribute via GOG or Desura.

    50,000$: We will be able to release content for eSports Tycoon and mobile versions of the game available on iOS and Android.

    60,000$: We reveal a new art style and localize the game in top 6 languages.

    75,000$:  We bring in more upgrades and make in-game events larger than life!

    100,000$: We develop a companion app “GAMER TYCOON” to serve as a gamer trading platform for the eSports Tycoon and free to play gamers.

    125,000$: 2 Additional Land Expansions, More Poster Packs and Mini Games for each genre in competitions.

    150,000$: We bring an Expansion to eSports Tycoon by making it more social, bigger and global domination.

    175,000$: Various Special Rooms like Boot camp and Custom PC's & Consoles.

    200,000$: We add mini-games to the Companion app + localize for 4 more languages, taking localization count to 10 languages.

    250,000$: "Compendium" Book containing backer's names, clan names, credits, Artwork, Achievements, Personal Characters. Add-on functions to both the games. Real-time leader board, top gamers and transfer informations.

    500,000$: We take eSports Tycoon to the next gaming convention post release.

    1,000,000$: We break Indiegogo's most funded in "Gaming" Category! We host a real gaming tournament for all competitive gaming genres.

    Resurrection Games is a small, 3 member game studio founded in Mumbai, India by former employees of the game industry. After years of working for other corporations and studios, we have decided to embark on our dream project: E-Sports Tycoon: The Game. 
    • We LOVE RPGs, business simulations, and pixel art!
    • We wish to release this title as we think it’s really a cool one and nothing like this has been ever done before!
    • Being avid gamers, we think of promoting gaming with a game, when we think of E-Sports Tycoon.
    • We are already in prototyping stage and are working ahead. But as there is more to finish the product, we need funds to cover other aspects like sound, extensive art/animations to survive this production stage.
    • We ask for your help to meet our goals and help us achieve the true vision we have for the entire E-Sports franchise.
    • We are also collaborating with Gary Lucken from Army of Trolls fame, on the art front. With Gary's 19 years of experience in Pixel art and his love for video games, we feel we have found the right person to make it look exceptionally retro!

    When does eSports Tycoon release ?

    If we get funded successfully, we are looking at January 2016 launch!

    When is the beta releasing? How do I get in?

    Beta version of the eSports Tycoon will be releasing a month or two before launch. Dates being tentative, we will be releasing more updates on our dev blog about our progress.

    Do you have an alpha build?

    Yes! We are working on the alpha build and are planning to release a public alpha during the campaign. We are looking for a Mid-End August Launch on Gamejolt.

    When does companion app release ?

    2 months post eSports Tycoon release.

    Do you need help on the project?

    Currently, we don’t have the funds but yes, we need someone for Game Audio, who understands the idea and can lift up the tempo.

    Will it be DRM free?

    Yes!

    How do custom perks work?

    We may ask you to fill a simple form for custom perks < Personalized character, like Gamer Name, Card, Manager and Pro Gamer.

    Our team will get in touch with you personally and discuss for perks > Personalized Character, like Character, Clan, Tournament and Sponsors. We would like to know more about you so that we bring in that same energy and personality to it.

3000$: 10% Fee for Indiegogo and Processing.
60,000$: Companion App "Gamer Tycoon": 


Development (4 months)
 Art
 Sound
 Database/Networking

50000$: "eSports Tycoon" Expansion


Development (6 months)
Art and Sound
Additional Networking
Social Features







1$: Thank You for showing your
support.  You will receive a “BACKER”
credit.5$: We appreciate your support; you
receive an eSports Tycoon Digital Wallpaper pack which will include wallpapers,
concept art and more + “CONTRIBUTOR”
credit.


8$: 250 Steam Downloadable Copies available for grabs @8$ + “EARLY BIRD” credit.


10$: You will receive a Steam
downloadable copy of the game + 5$ Perk
+ “PRE ORDER” credit.


15$: Mobile Versions (iOS & Android) + Steam copy. All these games run
in sync, so play the session on any of your devices + 5$ Perk + “EXCLUSIVE BUYER”
credit.


20$: Beta “EARLY”
Access to E sports Tycoon on all devices +
15$ Perk + “FAN BOY” credit


30$: Digital Gamer Card + Companion Access (Alpha +
Beta Update Access) + Custom Updates. We assure you, there will be no item in
game, you don’t see first + 20$ Perk
+ “SUPER FAN BOY” credit.


40$: You get to register you name as an in-game gamer.
You will be seen visiting café and will be available for “HIRE” in eSports Tycoon + 30$
Perk + “GAMER” credit.


50$: In-game pet. Get this special pet hanging out in
your cafe among the regular gamers + 40$
Perk + “PET LOVER” credit.


75$: Register your name as an In-game Manager. You will appear as a
candidate when people want to hire a manager for the café and their teams + 50$ Perk + “MANAGER” credit.


100$: Appear as a Pro Gamer with your custom clan tag in
game. Your character will have higher stats from the day you appear + 75$ Perk + “PRO GAMER” credit. Pro
Gamers won’t appear as normal gamers in-game.


250$: Our team will get in touch with you and together we will create a
character that will look just like you and have custom gear, clothes etc + 100$ Perk + “CUSTOM BACKER” credit.


500$: Register
you custom clan names (Max 5 Players), Same as Personalized character, but for
the whole clan. You can also customize your clan logo and gear. + 250$ Perk + “TEAM OWNER” credit.

1000$: Host a custom tournament with
our team. Your idea, we implement and help you host one of the swankiest
tournaments in the history with a huge number of prize pool+ 500$ Perk + “TOURNAMENT HOST” credit.
2500$: Be an in-game sponsor. Stand
among the biggies like Razer, Asus, Alienware, HyperX etc by bringing in your
brand to sponsor new cafes to the user. Your brand will remain permanent in eSports
Tycoon. We work together to create unique designs for the cafe and help your
suggestion become reality of how cafes should look + 1000$ Perks + “SPONSOR” credit.




30,000$: This is the
bare minimum product we will be creating for PC, available via Steam if we get
green lit, else we will distribute via GOG or Desura.


50,000$: We will be
able to release content for eSports Tycoon and mobile versions of the game
available on iOS and Android.
60,000$: We reveal a
new art style and localize the game in top 6 languages.
75,000$:  We
bring in more upgrades and make in-game events larger than life! 
100,000$:
We develop a companion app “GAMER
TYCOON” to serve as a gamer trading platform for the eSports Tycoon and
free to play gamers.
125,000$: 2
Additional Land Expansions, More Poster Packs and Mini Games for each genre in
competitions.
150,000$: We bring an
Expansion to eSports Tycoon by making it more social, bigger and global
domination.
175,000$: Various
Special Rooms like Boot camp and Custom PC's & Consoles.
200,000$: We add mini-games
to the Companion app + localize for 4 more languages, taking localization count
to 10 languages.
250,000$:
"Compendium" Book containing backer's names, clan names, credits,
Artwork, Achievements, Personal Characters. Add-on functions to both the games.
Real-time leader board, top gamers and transfer informations.
500,000$: We take eSports
Tycoon to the next gaming convention post release.
1,000,000$: We break
Indiegogo's most funded in "Gaming" Category! We host a real gaming
tournament for all competitive gaming genres.


Resurrection
Games is a small, 3 member game studio founded in
Mumbai, India by former employees of the game industry. After years of working
for other corporations and studios, we have decided to embark on our dream
project: E-Sports Tycoon: The Game. 


We LOVE RPGs,
business simulations, and pixel art!
We wish to
release this title as we think it’s really a cool one and nothing like this
has been ever done before!

Being avid
gamers, we think of promoting gaming with a game, when we think of
E-Sports Tycoon.
We are already
in prototyping stage and are working ahead. But as there is more to finish
the product, we need funds to cover other aspects like sound, extensive
art/animations to survive this production stage.

We ask for
your help to meet our goals and help us
achieve the true vision we have for the entire E-Sports franchise.
We are also collaborating
with Gary Lucken from Army of Trolls fame, on the art front. With Gary's 19
years of experience in Pixel art and his love for video games, we feel we have
found the right person to make it look exceptionally retro!





When does eSports Tycoon release ?
If
we get funded successfully, we are looking at January 2016 launch!
When is the
beta releasing? How do I get in?
Beta
version of the eSports Tycoon will be releasing a month or two before launch.
Dates being tentative, we will be releasing more updates on our dev blog about
our progress.
Do you have
an alpha build?
Yes!
We are working on the alpha build and are planning to release a public alpha
during the campaign. We are looking for a Mid-End August Launch on Gamejolt.
When does companion app release ?
2 months post eSports Tycoon release.
Do you need
help on the project?
Currently,
we don’t have the funds but yes, we need someone for Game Audio, who
understands the idea and can lift up the tempo.
Will it be
DRM free?
Yes!
How do custom
perks work?
We
may ask you to fill a simple form for custom perks < Personalized character,
like Gamer Name, Card, Manager and Pro Gamer.
Our
team will get in touch with you personally and discuss for perks >
Personalized Character, like Character, Clan, Tournament and Sponsors. We would
like to know more about you so that we bring in that same energy and personality to
it.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Curran Knudtson. I am 13 years old and launching my first business venture, THE GAMING GATEWAY, your one-stop shop for crazy. 

WHAT BUSINESS VENTURE, you ask?

Well, fantastic of you to ask! I have been interested in technology, game development, video and music for the longest time. And in the past year, I have really become excited by the possibilities of beginning my own business long before college. Thanks to some of the ideas being generated with my best bud Sumanje, my brother Emil (who is writing his first book) and my experience at Kunsmiller, an arts-integrated school (and my awesome peeps there), I am now officially on summer break and making this happen!

This summer I will be in NYC living and working while my mom does an art thingy and I am working on this there, in the midst of so much inspiring creative energy. 

I want to build a computer and make my first professional video detailing how to do this. It should be funny. 

From there, the sky is the limit but I absolutely need the tools to make this happen--the hardware and the education.

What I Need & What You Get

I have created a budget that consists of all the parts needed to build my own kicking graphically-savvy computer (roughly $1500). I also need a camera, tripod and sound equipment AND since I am going to be living in NYC this summer, I am planning to use these funds to take some coding and gaming workshops at the iD Tech Camps!

The perks are pretty cool, I do believe. You will get your 15 minutes of fame as Andy Warhol sort of predicted. It was actually a group effort. Kind of like this!

Beyond building my first computer and making my first professional video about building a computer titled "BUILDING A COMPUTER WITH A TEENAGE GEEK", I am also pulling out my old film camera that was given to me by a great aunt. It used to be my great uncle's and I started shooting with film when I was six. 

The Impact

I'm new at this but learning as I do it. I think I'm living in one of the coolest times EVER in that I can begin building my education, future and understanding of economics here with you all. My parents had to change dirty diapers and walk on newspaper routes to explore having a business (and they only got paid $1 or $2 an hour). TIMES HAVE CERTAINLY CHANGED!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford the basic perk, I'd be ever-appreciative if you could send the message out to your virtual community. I'll be following up with updates for you all over the course of the next few weeks! And will land in NYC here soon to get moving! I'm super excited to have you get to the end of this sentence too! Thank you for reading!

story:
TagandReelease is basically a board game based on an off-shore sport fishing tournament format. The more weight you bring to the scales determines the amount of prize money you take home. The object of the game is to win the tournament.The player with the highest amount of prize money at the end of the game wins the tournament. You have the option to enter the calcutta and go across the board in the Blue Marlin , Tuna , Mahi Mahi and Wahoo divisions. Actually this is the way blue water tournaments are operated along the Gulf coast , East Coast , West Coast and the Bahamas. Points (weight) will be deducted from your scorecard when you run aground , have a backlash or pull the hook on a grander blue marlin.

A player (angler) will be awarded points when they catch a grand slam , world record or grander (over a thousand pounds) marlin. 

The rules of the game are very basic and simple. Players from six years old to 100 are encouraged to participate. There are 24 categories of trivia questions to choose from on the board. Anglers roll the dice and advance the number of spaces they roll after they answer the question. If they can't answer the question correctly they do not advance. Example: Angler rolls a box car (12) and lands on the category"Gourmet Galley"  question: In counting shrimp - what would a 26/30 count refer to?  A. The amount would feed between 26 and 30 guest.  B. There would be between 26 and 30 shrimp per pound. C. There are between 26 and 30 calories per pound of shrimp. D. All of the above. The correct answer is B.  Angler rolls a 5 and lands on "Species" What is another name anglers call Tarpon? A. Blue water rocket  B. Sky rocket  C.Silver Queen  D. Silver King. The correct answer is D.Categories include: Tackle Box , Kayak Fishing , World Records , Trolling Tunes ,Trash or Trophy Fish , Pirates , Watering Holes and 17 more. I also have true or false questions included. If you end up in "Davy Jones Locker" you will be dis-qualified.  When the shotgun blast sounds off the tournament begins. The "Committee" boat can't call off the tournament even if the sea's swell up to 16 feet. The only way the tournament gets cancelled is by a hurricane. The angler with the most weight (Prize Money) on the leader board when the scales close is the winner.  TagandReelease is conservation oriented  and educational. You will learn something new on every voyage. I have been an avid fisherman since the age of six. Now I mainly Kayak fish in the gulf of Mexico along the emerald coast. I have spent nearly  20 years perfecting this fantastic new board game. This has been a labor of love. Everyone that enjoys "Life, Liberty and the pursuit of Happiness" should put this game on their bucket list. Please support this endeavor and make it a reality. Play a round of TagandReelease and you'll be hooked for life.
Thank you to all the pirates , wenches and big-game angler's throughout the world that love to fish and support my project.  Tight Lines and Calm Sea's , Robert Martin

story:
The Most Recent Press Release on the SpawnCandy Development Project

Hi Gamers', and welcome to the SpawnCandy.com Development Campaign! It's a new year and our team is on a mission for 2015. This project is being developed to provide all gamer's on all platforms with the very first worldwide one stop user customized personal gaming environment centered around both casual and competitive gaming.  In addition to professional gaming, we are constructing  SpawnCandy with 6 components internally that will do for Gamer's of all levels everything that would ordinarily require multiple accounts on many websites to accomplish. One network that does it all.

Although SpawnCandy will have world class games news, reviews, and media channels for our user's, Additional features of SpawnCandy will be competitive gaming tournaments, events and ladders coupled with the SpawnCandy internal live streaming feature known as the "Go Live Network".

To fully understand the significance of the SpawnCandy Development Project and what it brings to the gaming industry for all gamers' worldwide please view the video below as each internal component is explained in detail.

    



                                    This project is dependent on your support.

We have accomplished an amazing amount of behind the scenes work over the last 36 months and have finally reached a place where we will need to utilize contracted developers and their teams to finalize this project in 2015. 

We have provided the basic mobile application development process and cost estimations for SpawnCandy mobile for all supporters to view. The Quotation on services and mobile development for both (iOS and Android) platforms is estimated at 31,000  combined. please view it here. Phase 1 Design

Staying socially connected has never been easier. User's will have the ability to add their social feeds directly to their dashboard within their gaming environment. So receiving your Tweets, Facebook messages, and Youtube sub notifications can all be managed from inside your customized dashboard. You can receive and reply to all messages and notifications internally. 

 Phase 1 Design                                                                                                   Press Release 


  "The trademarks, logos, and service marks (collectively the "Trademarks")        displayed herein are registered and unregistered trademarks of SpawnCandy    Entertainment, its affiliates and others. You can view trademarks owned by    SpawnCandy Entertainment on LegalForce Trademarkia at this link: 

          http://www.trademarkia.com/spawncandy-86473218.html

story:
In a little place...

...within the untouched regions of the world...


...lived a joyful pod of harp seals.


For as long as they could remember, their lives had been happy and content.


Until one day, their sea had become polluted by a mysterious substance.  As a consequence, deep-dwelling creatures of all kinds were corrupted.  In a frenzy, these creatures clambered up onto the ice, shattering the peace enjoyed by the seals for so long.

But, just as the seals cried out in panic, two members of their pod emerged from the ocean.

These two little ones couldn't escape the chemicals!

The seals looked on with uncertainty, as the pair shook off the strange liquid...

...and watched them begin to glow with a miraculous, calming light.

A great power swept through their fluffy bodies.

The horde pushed even closer.

A quick glance between the pair of young pups was more than long enough for them to agree on their destiny:  they would rise and fight.  They would be harp seal heroes!


About Us

Greetings!

My name is Jimmy Lei, and I am the lead developer for Studio 99, an indie game studio based in the state of Ohio in the United States.  After having developed two indie games for two different teams, I decided I wanted to contribute my own designs to the game industry.  Studio 99 specializes in developing games for mobile devices including the iPhone, iPad, Android and Windows platforms.

I've always believed that video games, and games in general, have had the ability to impact our lives with productive results.  Through them, we've taken up the role of the hero, reminding ourselves of the power of right over wrong, learned humility in victory and defeat by competition, and created lasting memories with our loved ones.  Games have always been an integral part of our identities, and we intend to make ours with the responsibility to this legacy in mind.


The Project

As you've gathered from the story above, your goal as the empowered seals is to protect the pod by repelling berserk sea creatures.

The outstanding feature of this game is the ability to play with a partner on the same device.  To this end, we've dedicated extra attention to developing controls that are comfortable for two players.  In addition, gameplay will be tuned to foster cooperation and support.  Technology has given us processor speeds that are now fast enough, and screen sizes that are now detailed enough to freely experiment with the idea in true indie fashion.

The gameplay, at its core, qualifies this title as an active defense game.  The enemies will move toward the seals on their paths, and you intercept them by moving your finger to attack with your seal in real time.  You complete a stage when you successfully defend the pod, and you must try again if you don't.  You'll also be able to choose how your seals will develop their abilities as you advance through the game.

The game is being developed with C# and Unity, a game development platform that significantly improves our workflow and build stability.  Currently, the game engine is 60% complete, concepts are at 75%, and assets sit at 10% completion.


Why It's Worth It

While the advent of smartphones has connected us to each other in remarkable ways, we must be careful not to forget the benefits of face-to-face interaction; we've all noticed when others pay a little too much attention to their phones.  Rather than fight progress, however, I feel that we should find ways to embrace it properly.  I want to create something that will fit into the catalog of games that brings friends and family together.  Thus, I decided to design our game to encourage these shared experiences.

As with most industries, innovation both sustains and improves the standard. Today, the mobile game market is saturated with carbon copies and updated classics.  While these products have a place, I feel that it is time for independent game developers to take risks and generate unique experiences.  When I founded Studio 99, it was with this exact promise...to dedicate myself to producing "creative fun."

And...

We chose the little harp seal pup as this project's mascot to stand for the humane treatment of animals.  We recognize and respect that the Canadian government has made progress to limit seal hunts over the years.  Even so, the innocence of these animals still serves as a powerful lesson for the sanctity of all life.  We've also included, as an optional perk, our own pledge to donate to an animal rescue center on your behalf.


How Your Donation Will Help

To date, I have invested my own funds and full attention to the project over the course of the past ten weeks.  Now it's your opportunity to give us the chance to continue our commitment.  If our campaign goal is met, the donations we receive will be used as follows:
  • 1,900 for regular living expenses during production per month for four months
  • 630 for equipment including a backup storage device and tablet for our artist
  • 840 to cover crowdfunding costs like credit card fees

Donations that take us past our campaign goal will be used towards improved equipment, software licenses, and future content.  Also, take the time to explore the perks we're offering--they all come with the ad-free version of our game.

If you have any questions about donations, perks, or other topics, feel free to contact us!


Looking Ahead

We intend to challenge ourselves with an aggressive schedule, and although we ask for four month's worth of funds, we expect to release our game in a half year from the conclusion of this campaign.  To give you a more concrete idea of our plans, the following is a list of targets by month:

  1. game engine complete / playable build available
  2. major art assets finished
  3. reward system framework and user experience (UX) in place
  4. title and other menus complete / begin designing stages
  5. stages and enemy AI set / most assets completed
  6. complete game final look and feel / final testing phase
Since we are a very small team, individual schedules and setbacks present a unique obstacle to production consistency.  It also means that member must spend the time to be more meticulous for a professional product.  However, after having seen our progress since the game's inception, I'm confident that our dedication will bring another quality title to fun-loving people everywhere.

Finally, to honor your own confidence in us, I'll be posting regular updates and material as the campaign continues.

Spread the word, and thanks for your time!
