story:
We aim to create a narrative role playing experience inspired by Andrew Gabara’s untitled game universe created, one Sunday at a time, for the last twenty years. Affectionately referred to as ‘Drew’s Game,’ this amazing science fiction epic has endless possibilities in the gaming industry, transcending genera and traditional narrative pitfalls. Help us bring his stories, characters and universe to life today.

Introduction

            “Why don’t you just make your tabletop game, like… a real game?” My best friend asked me some time ago. It’s quite a leap from tabletop to a screen and controller, I thought, giving a list of the difficulties. “Difficult,” he said, “but not impossible.” Over some time I toiled with the idea in the background of my mind. I have a saying I tell people playing video games, particularly on the more difficult settings (I love to play a new game on its hardest setting). It tends to drive them nuts, but it is true. ‘Just make the difficult stuff easy, then it’s not so hard.’  

                I purchased a camera a few months ago for vacations, holidays and perhaps to make some instructional videos for some graphic arts techniques. I hung up the old green-screen in my kitchen and began some tests. I found myself inspired in a different way. I thought of our tabletop game and how I could make it come to life, perhaps in video shorts. Soon I had the 3d printer cranking out helmet pieces while I cut, sewed and glued fabric. My girlfriend was very curious, but I don’t like to share until I’ve really done something tangible. That weekend I invited that same friend over and, after a few beers, told him to suit up, grab a prop gun and get in front of the green-screen.

                Over the next few months I found a way to make the difficult aspects of this project manageable. It’s a disservice to call it easy, but it certainly isn’t that hard. I’ve developed techniques for using real footage in template scenes to bring to life everything that happens in our tabletop game sessions. With a little creative programming, green-screen shooting and integrating digital effects and music, I found I could create content at a rapid pace.  

                So here we are. I did what I could with my cheap camera and kitchen/studio to create this crowdfunding video. If it’s not clear that I need funding, at the very least for a quality camera and microphone, then I’ll pat myself on the back for doing what I did with what I had. I’ve assembled a team who is excited to work on this project, put together a wardrobe of costumes and shelves of prop weapons. We’ve plotted scenes, began work on digital locations and consolidated digital assets like muzzle flashes, blood spray, HUDs, energy weapon effects, creepy birds, waves of fog, rain, lightning and many, many more.

               Now I need you, now the team needs you. We need a community of like-minded people who love tabletop games and role playing games in general. If you love D&D, Shadowrun, Rifts, Vampires or any other RPG, tabletop or video game, you’ll love what we’re putting together. If you loved Telltale games like The Walking Dead, the Netflix experience Bandersnatch, or narrative games in general, please donate, and we won’t disappoint. I thank you, ahead of time, for your interest and your donations. Together we can bring the spirit of tabletop, role playing games and narrative stories into the modern gaming experience. This is just the beginning, our first story together. Thank you so much for being a part of it.

                                                                                                Sincerely,

                                                                                                Andrew Gabara

 

The Story of ‘Against the Storm’

                The world is full of light in the 2060’s. Dreams of scientific accomplishment are now everyday realities. Micro-Fusion generators now power vehicles and homes for decades at low cost and air pollution has become something of the past. Stasis technology has allowed for food supplies that never spoils, supporting the ten billion inhabitants of the planet. Affordable air travel and global communication networks allow for almost everyone to be a citizen of the world. An AI controlled financial and trade system prevents the depressions and economical crashes of the past. Medical technology has made most diseases a thing of the past, and cybernetics have restored the most grievously injured back into themselves. World governments even collaborated to create massive Generation Ships, carrying the best and brightest of the planet out into the stars explore and spread humanity beyond our delicate blue orb.

                But underneath the light of these technological wonders are the shadows of greed, conflict and ignorance. Power sources were immediately weaponized, leading to a new generation of deadly energy weapons. The gap between the super wealthy and an average citizen has expanded to usher in a new age of global oligarchs. Technologies are limited to those who can pay, and those who fail to repay their crushing debt face dire consequences. Corporations have grown to monstrous entities that topple governments and reduce stable populations to festering hovels for the sake of profit. The Generation Ships have a noble mission, but the hundreds of thousands that were selected have left organizations without their most intelligent and rational employees and operators. Nuclear war is considered obsolete, its explosions would leave nothing to be gained, so a new era of weapons has dawned. Biological weaponry, or Bios, are used to exterminate populations without damaging infrastructure. Infected humans transform into horrific mindless creatures, very effective, but proven difficult to control.

                This warped world culture was the final nail in the coffin of non-violence. World governments and corporations conspired to create mercenary forces who travel from country to country acting in whatever interests are profitable and without fear of repercussions or war crime trials. It is a violent world, most are out for only themselves, but, within the darkness, humanity remains. People still hope, still help and still cry out for peace and reason. Little did they know, a storm was on the horizon.

                In the spring of 2062 odd weather patterns began developing across the globe, baffling meteorologists and geoscientists. Within three days a massive super-storm formed over North America. This is the story of those who fled inward, to the eye of the storm, doing whatever they can to survive under extreme conditions. 22 years have passed since the storm formed, it remains as a circular wall of wind, trapping all within The Eye.

                During the chaos, when the storm first formed, local government, law enforcement and military stationed in the area banded together, under the guidance of the Mayor, to organize and secure safety for its citizens… at any cost. The Last City holds the last remnants of what civilization once was, sustaining thousands of innocents and protecting them from the harsh and cut-throat survivalists of the Storm-Lands outside its walls. Over the last 22 years the Mayor has warped society, now serving his totalitarian dictatorship as ‘Loyalists,’ willing to go to any extreme to sustain their way of life. The Mayor extorts those living beyond the city while forcing labor and allocating resources within the walls. You may find his acceptance of harsh realities intolerable, or join his regime to bring law and order to all of the Storm-Lands. These, and many more choices, await you in ‘Against the Storm.’

Stats, Skills and Abilities

               The rules of this game balance Character attributes, Player decisions and chance. When creating your Character, or while spending your Characters earned Experience Points, you decide what Statistics, Skills and Abilities you will have.

                 Stats are split into three categories, Physical, Psychological and Phenomenal. The typical human treats 3 as the average while an active, heroic or adventurous person would have 4 as an average. Hector the Enforcer has high Physical stats, even for an adventurer.  When faced with Physical challenges, Hector should overcome most with relative ease. Though he has an average Intelligence, he has great Perception (see threats coming and notice things in the environment) and above average Constitution (good memory recall, resistance to pain and psychological trauma).

                When creating a Character the player will see what bonuses they have to starting skills. Hector the Enforcer has Melee, Firearms and Environmental in his ‘+++’ starting skills category, meaning those tasks will be much easier to perform (each ‘+’ indicates a +10 bonus to that skill, so Hector begins with +30 to Melee, etc.)

                Each starting Character variant has at least two Special Abilities when beginning the game. These are often passive bonuses or changes to starting gear. We can see Hector the Enforcer has ‘Tribulant,’ which gives him additional Deflection (a Hit Point category) that grows as the game progresses. Meanwhile, his ‘Geary’ bonus starts him with a Shotgun, sidearm and a reloading kit, a powerful bonus to get the player going in the early game.  

Skills

                There are many, many Skills that can be used in a variety of situations. Having a few points in many Skills gives you lots of options, while putting all your points into a few Skills limits your options but grants higher rates of success. Each point in a Skill represents 1% increase in your probability of success, which is swayed by difficulties, situations and other factors. There are dozens of Skills, each represents something you can do in the game. There is a Skill for everything, and everything has its Skill.

                I.E.           Athletics, Convince, Deduce, Appraise, Diagnose, Electronic Hardware, Fabricate, Repair, Masonry, Sneak, Ritual, Navigation, Traps, etc.

                Skills are also put into broader categories, in sets of three, to give perspective on their use. Some bonuses apply to everything in a category. 

                I.E.           Mechanical, Spirituality, Scout, Building, Stealth, Medical, Investigation, Science, etc.

  

                   Combat Skills

                Combat is a major part of the game, and thus has its own set of Combat Skills. The Playable Characters in this game have a wide variety of Combat Skills allowing them to use a plethora of weapons and techniques, some quite Character specific. General Skills like Firearms have categories; Pistol, Longarm, and Repeater. Energy weapons have their own categories, as well as Melee combat skills. Some weapons fall into multiple categories. An assault rifle would be a Longarm-Repeater. A machinegun pistol would be a Pistol Repeater. This also works with Energy weapons. The laser pistol ‘Lasseter’ (seen in our Guns Showcase Video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oI3Fk9_vlAY) fires a fiery beam, making it a Pistol Beam weapon. 

                     Abilities

                Beyond your starting Special Abilities, Characters may spend EXP to learn new and exciting Combat and Non-Combat Abilities. Sometimes this requires a tutor, but most often reflect the path a Character is already following. Hector the Enforcer will have Abilities that revolve around Executions or Knocking-Out enemies, as well as passive Abilities that make it easier to confront multiple enemies, etc. Hector the Scout has options to improve travel, avoid or seek out encounters, provide special navigation during ‘Delves’ and avoid combat damage by seeking cover before a conflict even starts. Hector the Scavenger will have the opportunity to find and hold more gear, particularly ammo, as well stashing excess items in secret locations to retrieve later. These are just variants of Hector, there are many, many Abilities to be unlocked for all the Characters, allowing for lots of replay-ability, even as the same Character.

Combat System

               Our combat system balances reliable skill and luck of the dice. Based on a unique Tabletop experience created by Andrew Gabara, the rules of combat are complicated enough to hold depth, but simple enough to understand quickly. There are two types of combat, Battle and Resolute.

                ‘Battle’ combat has a taste of the familiar turn-based strategy found in other games. Characters are all displayed on the screen with the Player Party on the left foreground and enemies on the right background (typically). Our game is unique in that all human players and enemies are created from green-screen acting, giving them a real life feel.          

                Our Action Point system allows for a new type of combat interaction. Players and enemies do not actively take turns, or wait for their turn to act. Instead, each has its own Action Points that refresh periodically and are used for all actions that character can take. Want to jump away from a grenade? That’ll take an AP. Want to fire your pistol at an enemy? AP. Re-calibrate your allies Shield system to restore some HP? That will use AP as well. Actions and abilities may have ‘Cooldowns’ and ‘Warm-Ups,’ making characters vulnerable to Counterattack and Interruptions.

 

                We’ve also incorporated a range system and environmental system. Sometimes enemies and allies are behind the frontline, making them a long run to engage in melee and difficult to hit with short ranged weapons. Characters can also take cover behind objects in the terrain, giving a bonus depending on its size and durability. It’s perfectly rational to take cover from a sniper until they run out of ammo, and beats charging them like a pack of fools. You can shoot from a distance, take cover from ranged attacks and ignore cover with melee. Terrain also makes a difference, effecting how far a character can move and how effective their evasion or dodges are (particularly while wading through knee high mud). Ranged weapons can also lose effectiveness due to weather like heavy rain, fog and wind. If a wave of fog or heavy rain rolls in, characters have a chance to rush ranged enemies to close the distance. If you’re being shot at from across a muddy grove, take cover behind that nearby rock and fire back. There are even impenetrable cover locations that make you immune to ranged attacks, provided you don’t poke your head out or try to shoot back. Pausing uses an Action Point and allows your character to survey the battlefield, giving you more information depending on Perception, Skills and Abilities.

                ‘Resolute’ combat takes place in a narrative environment without strict guidelines of a Battle but following the same guidelines for success. Resolutions often have higher stakes, ending with a characters defeat or death, and changing the overall story. Resolute combat can involve stealth, a harsh turn in dialog, an escape, a hand-to-hand challenge, etc. Our Crowdfunding video gives an example of this as Hector interacts with the Mayor. Though it is not an active battle, the stakes are still life and death, and could change the path of the entire game. Resolute indeed.

                Because we use live actors as character representations, we are limited in physical damage that we can show. This works perfectly with the universe and the combat system, which uses Defenses as Hit Points. Every character may have the following types of Defenses;

                Deflection: Filmed and shown as a Dodge, Evasion, near-miss or literal deflection. Despite how it is displayed, Deflection only occurs when Dodging, Evasion, Sprinting, Cover and ‘luck of the dice’ fail, thus reducing these Hit Points. Deflection is the most common and easily restored type of Hit Points, and almost always the first to take damage.

                Shield: An energy shield that absorbs damage. These are rare and wide in variety. Some only effect bullets, others are skin-tight and stop anything, there are also ‘Bubble Shield’ varieties that take damage before Deflection and are so wide they can sometimes include nearby allies. Shields also restore in different ways. Some powerful versions need to be recharged at a power source, while others slowly charge over time. The most elite Shields restore quickly and have great amounts of Hit Points, but it is rare to find one without one weakness or another… Many powerful Shields are completely ineffective versus melee.

                Barrier: A rare mystic form of defense. Gained from powerful artifacts, rituals, marks and deeds. Mystic Barriers are as wildly varying as they are difficult to acquire and maintain. 

                Armor: Wide in variety and type, preventing physical damage to the character. Armor is the most common type of Defense after Deflection, and can be repaired in the field with the right skill, resources and tools. Armor can often be improved upon by raising your characters Fabrication skills. Your adventures will also lead to opportunities to make allies to furnish and repair your Armor, and there’s always scavenging and theft to fall back on.

                …and finally Health. When a character takes damage to their Health they may be injured, which gives negatives to actions. An injured character is weaker, often dealing less damage in melee and having a more difficult time hitting with ranged weapons. Injured characters may also be unable to use certain skills and abilities until healed. Often injuring a character changes combat from a Battle to a Resolute situation, giving the player more opportunities to choose an outcome that suits the narrative they’re progressing towards.

                Combat is not necessarily the core of our game, but it can be, with Delves. In a Delve, your character or group will explore a particularly violent area, filled with human foes, monstrous Bios, or dangerous mechanical enemies. Great rewards lie throughout the Delves, but at great risk. Delves hold many secrets for those able to complete them, giving the player powerful new dialog and combat options as the game progresses. Delve locations often have different versions or missions that take place within them, giving opportunities to gain more EXP, new gear and even unlock new abilities.

               Thanks for checking us out! You can find our Facebook here                        https://www.facebook.com/Against-The-Storm-3280...

        Please Like and Share to help spread the word and make our project happen! 

                Email us any questions at

AgainstTheStormEmail@Gmail.com
story_txt:
We aim to create a narrative role playing experience inspired by Andrew Gabara’s untitled game universe created, one Sunday at a time, for the last twenty years. Affectionately referred to as ‘Drew’s Game,’ this amazing science fiction epic has endless possibilities in the gaming industry, transcending genera and traditional narrative pitfalls. Help us bring his stories, characters and universe to life today.Introduction            “Why don’t you just make your tabletop game, like… a real game?” My best friend asked me some time ago. It’s quite a leap from tabletop to a screen and controller, I thought, giving a list of the difficulties. “Difficult,” he said, “but not impossible.” Over some time I toiled with the idea in the background of my mind. I have a saying I tell people playing video games, particularly on the more difficult settings (I love to play a new game on its hardest setting). It tends to drive them nuts, but it is true. ‘Just make the difficult stuff easy, then it’s not so hard.’                  I purchased a camera a few months ago for vacations, holidays and perhaps to make some instructional videos for some graphic arts techniques. I hung up the old green-screen in my kitchen and began some tests. I found myself inspired in a different way. I thought of our tabletop game and how I could make it come to life, perhaps in video shorts. Soon I had the 3d printer cranking out helmet pieces while I cut, sewed and glued fabric. My girlfriend was very curious, but I don’t like to share until I’ve really done something tangible. That weekend I invited that same friend over and, after a few beers, told him to suit up, grab a prop gun and get in front of the green-screen.                Over the next few months I found a way to make the difficult aspects of this project manageable. It’s a disservice to call it easy, but it certainly isn’t that hard. I’ve developed techniques for using real footage in template scenes to bring to life everything that happens in our tabletop game sessions. With a little creative programming, green-screen shooting and integrating digital effects and music, I found I could create content at a rapid pace.                  So here we are. I did what I could with my cheap camera and kitchen/studio to create this crowdfunding video. If it’s not clear that I need funding, at the very least for a quality camera and microphone, then I’ll pat myself on the back for doing what I did with what I had. I’ve assembled a team who is excited to work on this project, put together a wardrobe of costumes and shelves of prop weapons. We’ve plotted scenes, began work on digital locations and consolidated digital assets like muzzle flashes, blood spray, HUDs, energy weapon effects, creepy birds, waves of fog, rain, lightning and many, many more.               Now I need you, now the team needs you. We need a community of like-minded people who love tabletop games and role playing games in general. If you love D&D, Shadowrun, Rifts, Vampires or any other RPG, tabletop or video game, you’ll love what we’re putting together. If you loved Telltale games like The Walking Dead, the Netflix experience Bandersnatch, or narrative games in general, please donate, and we won’t disappoint. I thank you, ahead of time, for your interest and your donations. Together we can bring the spirit of tabletop, role playing games and narrative stories into the modern gaming experience. This is just the beginning, our first story together. Thank you so much for being a part of it.                                                                                                Sincerely,                                                                                                Andrew Gabara The Story of ‘Against the Storm’                The world is full of light in the 2060’s. Dreams of scientific accomplishment are now everyday realities. Micro-Fusion generators now power vehicles and homes for decades at low cost and air pollution has become something of the past. Stasis technology has allowed for food supplies that never spoils, supporting the ten billion inhabitants of the planet. Affordable air travel and global communication networks allow for almost everyone to be a citizen of the world. An AI controlled financial and trade system prevents the depressions and economical crashes of the past. Medical technology has made most diseases a thing of the past, and cybernetics have restored the most grievously injured back into themselves. World governments even collaborated to create massive Generation Ships, carrying the best and brightest of the planet out into the stars explore and spread humanity beyond our delicate blue orb.                But underneath the light of these technological wonders are the shadows of greed, conflict and ignorance. Power sources were immediately weaponized, leading to a new generation of deadly energy weapons. The gap between the super wealthy and an average citizen has expanded to usher in a new age of global oligarchs. Technologies are limited to those who can pay, and those who fail to repay their crushing debt face dire consequences. Corporations have grown to monstrous entities that topple governments and reduce stable populations to festering hovels for the sake of profit. The Generation Ships have a noble mission, but the hundreds of thousands that were selected have left organizations without their most intelligent and rational employees and operators. Nuclear war is considered obsolete, its explosions would leave nothing to be gained, so a new era of weapons has dawned. Biological weaponry, or Bios, are used to exterminate populations without damaging infrastructure. Infected humans transform into horrific mindless creatures, very effective, but proven difficult to control.                This warped world culture was the final nail in the coffin of non-violence. World governments and corporations conspired to create mercenary forces who travel from country to country acting in whatever interests are profitable and without fear of repercussions or war crime trials. It is a violent world, most are out for only themselves, but, within the darkness, humanity remains. People still hope, still help and still cry out for peace and reason. Little did they know, a storm was on the horizon.                In the spring of 2062 odd weather patterns began developing across the globe, baffling meteorologists and geoscientists. Within three days a massive super-storm formed over North America. This is the story of those who fled inward, to the eye of the storm, doing whatever they can to survive under extreme conditions. 22 years have passed since the storm formed, it remains as a circular wall of wind, trapping all within The Eye.                During the chaos, when the storm first formed, local government, law enforcement and military stationed in the area banded together, under the guidance of the Mayor, to organize and secure safety for its citizens… at any cost. The Last City holds the last remnants of what civilization once was, sustaining thousands of innocents and protecting them from the harsh and cut-throat survivalists of the Storm-Lands outside its walls. Over the last 22 years the Mayor has warped society, now serving his totalitarian dictatorship as ‘Loyalists,’ willing to go to any extreme to sustain their way of life. The Mayor extorts those living beyond the city while forcing labor and allocating resources within the walls. You may find his acceptance of harsh realities intolerable, or join his regime to bring law and order to all of the Storm-Lands. These, and many more choices, await you in ‘Against the Storm.’Stats, Skills and Abilities               The rules of this game balance Character attributes, Player decisions and chance. When creating your Character, or while spending your Characters earned Experience Points, you decide what Statistics, Skills and Abilities you will have.                 Stats are split into three categories, Physical, Psychological and Phenomenal. The typical human treats 3 as the average while an active, heroic or adventurous person would have 4 as an average. Hector the Enforcer has high Physical stats, even for an adventurer.  When faced with Physical challenges, Hector should overcome most with relative ease. Though he has an average Intelligence, he has great Perception (see threats coming and notice things in the environment) and above average Constitution (good memory recall, resistance to pain and psychological trauma).                When creating a Character the player will see what bonuses they have to starting skills. There are dozens of Skills, each represents something you can do in the game. There is a Skill for everything, and everything has its Skill.                I.E.           Athletics, Convince, Deduce, Appraise, Diagnose, Electronic Hardware, Fabricate, Repair, Masonry, Sneak, Ritual, Navigation, Traps, etc.                Skills are also put into broader categories, in sets of three, to give perspective on their use. Some bonuses apply to everything in a category.                 I.E.           Mechanical, Spirituality, Scout, Building, Stealth, Medical, Investigation, Science, etc.
                     Combat Skills
                Combat is a major part of the game, and thus has its own set of Combat Skills. The Playable Characters in this game have a wide variety of Combat Skills allowing them to use a plethora of weapons and techniques, some quite Character specific. General Skills like Firearms have categories; Pistol, Longarm, and Repeater. Energy weapons have their own categories, as well as Melee combat skills. Some weapons fall into multiple categories. story:
Hello Indiegogo friends! My name is Gregg Lawson, Founder and Lead Producer for Edensky Studios - A small Los Angeles based gaming company founded in 2017.

This campaign is to introduce our first RPG title - Dash Hounds

Before switching to, or even the idea of creating video games remotely existed, the studio was deep into the development of 2D animated short films and pitch materials for online television platforms. We funded our animated stories and dreams through our day jobs, and more recently, some of us have even left those jobs to commit to the studio full-time.

We spent several years through the fascinating adventure that is developing original content within the 2D animation industry. We soon realized something about our work was missing, there was a voice within ourselves that was being suppressed. We ultimately, as a small studio, had to make the decision whether to continue pursuing 2D animation or completely follow our intuition and move forward - Even if that meant starting all over again.

Months after that pivotal decision we decided to strategically alter our course towards what we love most, what would better engineer our wild imaginations, and most importantly guide our Creative Compasses: Creating Video Games.

 

View our previous animated works here!

 

Meet The Team!

 

I love to find purpose in anything we find  passion in. I believe in discovering your process,  given your own creative compass, identity, and  simply listening to your intuition. I hope that our games can help educate, and have our players acknowledge and discover their own strengths and passions through our stories.

Fitness/Nutrition is vital to my energy balance  and mental state during long production days.  I use the power of music to also reset, and  relax. My journey in storytelling began with  Classic Cinema, and my favorite Pixar film is  Ratatouille!

 

Gregg Lawson - Founder & Lead Producer

 

"It's been a dream of mine to work on a video game project with the studio and now we're making it a reality. Life is full of lessons and I've been an avid student. I'm hoping to incorporate so much of what life has taught me into Dash Hounds so that each player walks away with useful knowledge to help them each day.
Education is what drives me day to day. My favorite television show is Avatar: the Last Airbender because I believe it uses an entertaining medium to teach children and adults life lessons while remaining interest during every episode. Now that's something we can aspire towards!"

Joseph Vonderlinden - CoFounder & Lead Game Designer

 

"I've been drawing since the womb, probably. But I've definitely been creating art since I could firmly grasp a writing utensil in my tiny hand. I have a Bachelor's Degree in Animation, and continue to use my skills and imagination to come up with characters and illustrations that excite me. I like to find new ways to express my creativity while still remaining true to my interests in design. My hobbies include napping, sweating in the gym, playing whatever current Sims game is out, and messing around with tarot cards."

 

 

Marie Story - Art Director

 

"Hiya! I am the goofball who will always try his hardest to make you smile.
I’ve always been an avid gamer. There is a wonderful feeling when I complete an RPG after weeks or even months (or more) of digital (and real) sweat and tears. I also know more about Pokémon than most people are willing to admit.
Swimming and Hiking are my favorite forms of exercise. I have a Bachelor’s in TV, Film & Media Studies as well as an Associate Degree in Broadcasting Communications. I am currently authoring my first book as the idea came to me almost 12 years ago. Don't get me started on ideas because I will never shut-up."

Spencer Tuel - Head of Story / Editorial

 

 

 

Using our backgrounds in animated film/television entertainment and indie development, we wondered what it would be like to develop a PC game using similar story and cinematic techniques, while utilizing game creation tools such as the Unreal Engine. The idea for Dash Hounds was conceived on the simple notion that people love, and praise dogs. In fact, we do too! 

We then realized, what if we presented our own stories in their purest form. Our own adapted  experiences from our childhood.

 

The Dash Hounds Story:

Dash Hounds is a story-driven RPG where humanity lives in a dog-centric world. After watching your best friend win their first competition, you are inspired to rescue your first dog. You and your best friend are not the only aspiring regional champions in your neighborhood, however. Your rival, who is also your neighbor, rescues the sibling of your dog and challenges you to rise to your very best. Your town’s prolific dog trainer will also have a hand in your journey to become the greatest. Your relationships with these characters will evolve with every competition and conversation.
Throughout the game, you will be able to interact with the world and its inhabitants as your customized human character as well as your dog. This new ability will help you solve puzzles and complete quests as you progress through the story.

 

The Origin Of The Name:

The name Dash Hounds was conceived on the notion that speed, agility, and power-up stats would be the game’s core mechanics with mini-racing challenges. It soon evolved towards the concept of a full-fledged RPG, where a much larger story about the world began to unfold. The game’s title was meant to be tentative but became the official name soon after development started.

The first idea for Dash Hounds spawned from a discussion with a group of friends sharing their memories and love for their own dogs. We then realized we had to share our own experiences into a game that other people could emotionally engage and connect with.

 

The Game Mechanics:

The prominent game mechanics you can look forward to with Dash Hounds are: Cooperative Character Gameplay, Character Customization, a Mission Based Story Structure in an open world, Progression based Leveling Systems, and Mission Based Puzzle Solving through exploration and NPC Dialogue.  

 

  • Mission Based Puzzle Solving will encourage the player to explore this new world and see all that it has to offer.
  • For our leveling system, we decided to twist the traditional RPG stat sheet with our own made specifically with Dash Hounds in mind.
  • Cooperative Character Gameplay will have you utilizing your customized character as well as switching freely to your dog(s) to complete various tasks. This will allow both characters to work together and have their bond grow as you progress through the story.
  • Character Customization is a classic RPG staple that we want to allow you to personalize your character and dog(s) to your liking. Our goal is to have you immersed in the world and feel attached to your character and their journey.
  • We chose a Mission Based Story Structure because we love the way it is presented in the GTA series (namely the fifth) as well as Red Dead Redemption 2. This gives meaning and purpose to every mission as we can craft the story more personally around such a mode.

 

The Conceptual Journey of Dash Hounds:

- Bubble Beach Island (Unexplored Region in Summer Expansion)

- Bubble Beach Shores  (Unexplored Region in Summer Expansion)

 

 

The demo was crafted in the Unreal Engine, and assets used are pre-existing materials to convey visually and technically what it is we'd like to accomplish in the game, whether it be mechanics, mini-game challenges, map design, and more..

 

The Conceptual Characters of Dash Hounds:

Although your personal character will be customized, below are some conceptual character designs that we originally had in mind for other trainers you may encounter on your journey! 

These characters are a very close representation of what may be visualized in the final product.

Meet Proto! Dash Hounds' un-official mascot. (He was our first 3D Prototype in the Unreal Engine when developing our demo) 

Seasonal Releases of Dash Hounds:

Think of Seasons as expansions to the game.

The  first installment of Dash Hounds will begin in the season of Summer, and with each additional season released, more content will be available in-game to support the games progression and your journey.

Each Season will include content such as Character/Dog accessories, brand new maps/quests, Holiday themed events/items, and much more!

The best part is, there will be NO micro-transactions. Just Seasonal packs!

 

 

 

Our team has completed hours of necessary research to understand the costs associated with the full development of Dash Hounds, startup studio overhead, and comprehensive tax compliance.

We believe it's very important to share with you the transparency in our budget breakdown, and what your contributions will collectively support.

The funding will not only contribute to the development of Dash Hounds, but also to secure the longevity of the studios' future so that we may be able to focus solely on making the best game we can, with the best team and resources available.

Production timeline estimates will vary depending on campaign finance success.

 

** This chart represents a fully funded campaign and a 2-year development period **

 

We also understand the realities that may occur if our campaign isn't fully funded. Below you will see financial phases in which your contributions will support and potentially speed up the development if the campaign doesn't reach it's primary goal!

 

What happens once a Phase is successfully funded?

For each Phase that is achieved, we will not only release a special bonus perk, but also additional contributions to animal facilities!

The Phases help represent the speed of production and development.

 

$12,000

  • Additional Production Equipment & Software
  • 2D Production Artists
    • Additional Conceptual Character, Prop, and World Designs.
  • Software Subscription Costs, Digital Assets, and Taxes
  • Marketing Costs
    • Estimated Development Timeline ~ 4 Years

 

$50,000

  • Above
  • One Salaried In-house Full-Time Employee on Dash Hounds
  • Additional 2D Artists:
    • Additional Conceptual Character, Prop, and World Designs.
  • 3D Artists:
    • Modeling, Texturing, Rigging, Lighting, Animation
  • Composer / Expand Original Soundtrack
  • Additional Marketing Costs
    • Estimated Development Timeline ~ 3 Years

 

$125,000

  • Above
  • Two Salaried In-house Full-Time Employee on Dash Hounds
  • Hiring Additional Art Department Aids:
    • 2D Artists
    • 3D Artists
  • Additional Donations to Rescue Facilities
    • Estimated Development Timeline ~ 2.5 Years
    • Expedited Development Period

 

$275,000

  • Above
  • Quality Achievement
  • Complete Salaried In-house Full-Time Staff on Dash Hounds
  • Creative Studio Space
  • Additional Donations to Rescue Facilities
    • Estimated Development Timeline ~ 2 Years
    • Expedited Development Period

 

 

 

Our perks are simple.

Your contributions will go a long way in support of our game, and we want to give you something back in return for your support.

To the right of the screen, you will see various tiers you may choose to support our development of Dash Hounds. 

However keep on the lookout for surprise tiers! We will be releasing a few brand new perks as the campaign moves forward to ensure our backers get what they need to enjoy the experience!

 

 

10% of our campaigns proceeds, ( as much as $10,000! ) will benefit local no-kill animal shelters that we have partnered with in conjunction to this campaign. If we meet our stretch goals however, more locations will be added to our donation roster as well as a donation increase.

 

What Issues Could Dash Hounds Help Solve?

We believe Dash Hounds can help solve and spread awareness for one of the largest issues across the globe, and that is the mistreating and misunderstanding of animals. We aim to provide our players of all ages with humane insight, practices, and education integrated throughout the game, all while maintaining exceptional gameplay and entertainment value.

 

Operation Adopt (TAPS) in Burbank, CA

 

Mission: Operation Adopt focuses on getting family-friendly animals out of shelters and into a kinder and structured setting where we get to know them and find them homes where they have the chance to excel given their age, size and personalities. We also fill a void for people who want to adopt animals, but find the shelter environment upsetting.

History: The Animal Protectorates was formed in 2012 to provide public education on the cruelty of puppy mills. When the city of Burbank passed legislation to stop the sale of these commercially bred animals in pet stores, The Animal Protectorates opened Operation Adopt as a way to offer animals for adoption while helping decrease overcrowding and euthanasia at local shelters by freeing up space. This legislation is now law statewide.

Purple Collar Promise: Once The Animal Protectorates makes a commitment to an animal at the shelter, we also make a promise to him or her. That promise is that no matter when or why they lost their family, we will always be there to provide a safe place for them. This promise is represented by a symbolic purple collar which every animal receives at the shelter.

For More Information - www.tapsusa.org

 

Nevada SPCA in Las Vegas, NV

Mission: We work to achieve our adoption goals by treating each animal as an individual, with a name instead of a number. We strive to match each rescued animal with people by personality and lifestyle in order to have the best chance to find a forever home. We seek homes for the animals where they will be treated, cherished, and appreciated as members of the family.

The Nevada SPCA, a nonprofit organization, operates a no-kill animal sanctuary, promotes humane education, makes referrals for lower-cost spay/neuter and vaccination services, and challenges people to be the best possible guardians for the companion animals in their care. There are no time limits for the animals at Nevada SPCA. On any given day, Nevada SPCA's headquarters is home to more than 1,000 rescued animals.

The vast majority of the animals we rescue did absolutely nothing to in any way deserve becoming homeless.  This is true in most other shelters and rescue programs too, though there is a misguided perception with some that rescued animals are "broken", "second-hand" or "second-rate" animals.  These animals have become homeless due to their previous owners passing away or becoming hospitalized, moving away, failing to secure them in homes and yards, losing family homes to foreclosure, becoming jailed or instituted, replacing them with puppies or kittens, etc., or sometimes abandoning them for no reason whatsoever.

For More Information - www.nevadaspca.org

 

There are many different ways to get a studio and projects like ours funded. Between angel investors, venture capitalists, IPO's, and even bank loans, our team specifically chose to crowdfund with Indiegogo's easy to use platform and project supportive community. With your support for Dash Hounds, we can give back to you (our new friends!), and give back to the animal rights community. We are determined to bring our vision to reality without losing creative control, however long it may take us.

No matter the final result of this campaign, we are beyond grateful for the support and opportunity to share with you our story and passions. It's been a risk worth the taking.

This campaign was made possible by Indiegogo, tons of coffee, and the greatest team of friends any studio could ask for.

Thank you for supporting our adventure, and always remember to give your dogs plenty of pets!

 

 

Follow And Join Our Adventures!

 

Join The Discussion!
story_txt:
Hello Indiegogo friends! My name is Gregg Lawson, Founder and Lead Producer for Edensky Studios - A small Los Angeles based gaming company founded in 2017.
This campaign is to introduce our first RPG title - Dash Hounds
Before switching to, or even the idea of creating video games remotely existed, the studio was deep into the development of 2D animated short films and pitch materials for online television platforms. We funded our animated stories and dreams through our day jobs, and more recently, some of us have even left those jobs to commit to the studio full-time.
We spent several years through the fascinating adventure that is developing original content within the 2D animation industry. We soon realized something about our work was missing, there was a voice within ourselves that was being suppressed. We ultimately, as a small studio, had to make the decision whether to continue pursuing 2D animation or completely follow our intuition and move forward - Even if that meant starting all over again.
Months after that pivotal decision we decided to strategically alter our course towards what we love most, what would better engineer our wild imaginations, and most importantly guide our Creative Compasses: Creating Video Games.
 
View our previous animated works here!
 

Meet The Team!
 
I love to find purpose in anything we find  passion in. I believe in discovering your process,  given your own creative compass, identity, and  simply listening to your intuition. I hope that our games can help educate, and have our players acknowledge and discover their own strengths and passions through our stories.
Fitness/Nutrition is vital to my energy balance  and mental state during long production days.  I use the power of music to also reset, and  relax. My journey in storytelling began with  Classic Cinema, and my favorite Pixar film is  Ratatouille!
 
Gregg Lawson - Founder & Lead Producer
 
"It's been a dream of mine to work on a video game project with the studio and now we're making it a reality. Life is full of lessons and I've been an avid student. I'm hoping to incorporate so much of what life has taught me into Dash Hounds so that each player walks away with useful knowledge to help them each day.Education is what drives me day to day. My favorite television show is Avatar: the Last Airbender because I believe it uses an entertaining medium to teach children and adults life lessons while remaining interest during every episode. Now that's something we can aspire towards!"
Joseph Vonderlinden - CoFounder & Lead Game Designer
 
"I've been drawing since the womb, probably. But I've definitely been creating art since I could firmly grasp a writing utensil in my tiny hand. I have a Bachelor's Degree in Animation, and continue to use my skills and imagination to come up with characters and illustrations that excite me. I like to find new ways to express my creativity while still remaining true to my interests in design. My hobbies include napping, sweating in the gym, playing whatever current Sims game is out, and messing around with tarot cards."
 
 
Marie Story - Art Director
 

"Hiya! I am the goofball who will always try his hardest to make you smile.I’ve always been an avid gamer. There is a wonderful feeling when I complete an RPG after weeks or even months (or more) of digital (and real) sweat and tears. I also know more about Pokémon than most people are willing to admit.Swimming and Hiking are my favorite forms of exercise. I have a Bachelor’s in TV, Film & Media Studies as well as an Associate Degree in Broadcasting Communications. I am currently authoring my first book as the idea came to me almost 12 years ago. Don't get me started on ideas because I will never shut-up."
Spencer Tuel - Head of Story / Editorial
 
 

 

Using our backgrounds in animated film/television entertainment and indie development, we wondered what it would be like to develop a PC game using similar story and cinematic techniques, while utilizing game creation tools such as the Unreal Engine. The idea for Dash Hounds was conceived on the simple notion that people love, and praise dogs. In fact, we do too! 
We then realized, what if we presented our own stories in their purest form. Our own adapted  experiences from our childhood.
 
The Dash Hounds Story:
Dash Hounds is a story-driven RPG where humanity lives in a dog-centric world. After watching your best friend win their first competition, you are inspired to rescue your first dog. You and your best friend are not the only aspiring regional champions in your neighborhood, however. Your rival, who is also your neighbor, rescues the sibling of your dog and challenges you to rise to your very best. Your town’s prolific dog trainer will also have a hand in your journey to become the greatest. Your relationships with these characters will evolve with every competition and conversation.Throughout the game, you will be able to interact with the world and its inhabitants as your customized human character as well as your dog. This new ability will help you solve puzzles and complete quests as you progress through the story.
 
The Origin Of The Name:
The name Dash Hounds was conceived on the notion that speed, agility, and power-up stats would be the game’s core mechanics with mini-racing challenges. It soon evolved towards the concept of a full-fledged RPG, where a much larger story about the world began to unfold. The game’s title was meant to be tentative but became the official name soon after development started.
The first idea for Dash Hounds spawned from a discussion with a group of friends sharing their memories and love for their own dogs. We then realized we had to share our own experiences into a game that other people could emotionally engage and connect with.
 
The Game Mechanics:
The prominent game mechanics you can look forward to with Dash Hounds are: Cooperative Character Gameplay, Character Customization, a Mission Based Story Structure in an open world, Progression based Leveling Systems, and Mission Based Puzzle Solving through exploration and NPC Dialogue.  
 

Mission Based Puzzle Solving will encourage the player to explore this new world and see all that it has to offer.
For our leveling system, we decided to twist the traditional RPG stat sheet with our own made specifically with Dash Hounds in mind.
Cooperative Character Gameplay will have you utilizing your customized character as well as switching freely to your dog(s) to complete various tasks. This will allow both characters to work together and have their bond grow as you progress through the story.
Character Customization is a classic RPG staple that we want to allow you to personalize your character and dog(s) to your liking. Our goal is to have you immersed in the world and feel attached to your character and their journey.
We chose a Mission Based Story Structure because we love the way it is presented in the GTA series (namely the fifth) as well as Red Dead Redemption 2. This gives meaning and purpose to every mission as we can craft the story more personally around such a mode.

- Bubble Beach Shores  (Unexplored Region in Summer Expansion)

These characters are a very close representation of what may be visualized in the final product.

The best part is, there will be NO micro-transactions. Just Seasonal packs!

story:
About Us

With the motto “Everyone Plays”, AppA11y’s goal is to level the playing field by linking the visually impaired and sighted communities through fun and exciting social games. We are an indie game studio based in Northern California with a history of making awesome accessible mobile games.

This campaign will allow us to take our most popular game, Dice World, to the next level and deploy it on Alexa where users can play hands-free. Dice World is a fun social game with six dice games:

  • Yatzy           
  • Farkle           
  • Pig
  • Balut           
  • Threes           
  • 1-4-24

Why?

"Thanks for including us" were the words from our users that launched this project aimed at bringing Dice World Audio on Alexa to the 280 million visually impaired around the world. The visually impaired like to play games just like everyone else, but the problem is their options are very limited. While there are some games designed for the visually impaired, most are simplistic with limited functionally and designed with only the visually impaired in mind.

Our games allow the visually impaired to play with their sighted friends and family without either knowing the difference. We level the playing field making the visually impaired part of the gaming social community.

Dice world has received a lot of positive feedback and lately our users are requesting Alexa games. With your help we can deploy the two time AppleVis game of the year, Dice World on Alexa. This campaign would give us the resources to create a whole new gaming experience on Alexa for both the visually impaired and their sighted friends and family. 

If you have never played Dice World and want to get a better understanding of what it is about download and play today!

      

 

Impact

The impact to both us and our users will be huge. Many of our visually impaired users have shared how sound controlled devices have changed their lives for the better. Those conversations often end with the question, "When are you guys going to Alexa?". The truth is, it has been on our roadmap for some time. We have started setting up the framework, but the project has stalled due to resource constraints. Launching new products requires a substantial amount of time and money. This campaign will allow us to hire the staff required to make hands-free game play a reality for the visually impaired.

We have a history of creating fun accessible games on budget and on time. We have a plan in place and are ready to execute it. This project has us super excited  and we cannot wait to give the millions of visually impaired a new and fun way to play games! And while we do everything with the visually impaired in mind, who wouldn't want to play Dice World hands-free?

 

What We Need & What You Get

In short, we need funding. We have started this project, but need 2 additional developers to help us get it across the finish line. Once we reach our campaign goal we plan on releasing on Alexa in less than 90 days.

With your contribution you will be part of something cool as well as score some sweet perks, such as:

  • Dice World gold
  • Your name on our website
  • Premium set of metal dice to use at home
  • Leather Dice World dice cup with dice
  • Premium Dice World set that includes leather cups, leather case, and dice
  • Your name in our game
  • A dice character in your likeness added to Dice World mobile for all the world to play

In addition to getting some cool swag while supporting a great cause, all contributors will be given beta access to Dice World Audio. Join the Dice World community today!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute that is ok, you can still help by playing Dice World mobile and by spreading the word! Thanks for your time, please take advantage of the Indiegogo share tools to share this campaign with your friends, family, and anyone who likes to have fun!

story:
The founding story: GamrPod

Help us unlock the next celebrity streamer!

Founding Team - Sam Speaker & Dalton Carroll:  

Sam and Dalton met at the beginning of their tenure at Temple University where they instantly found a common interest in video games.  As NCAA men's soccer players, they found that one of the best ways to spend their time outside of school and practice was to play split screen video games on their (at the time) large 30 inch TV.   

  • Sam Speaker  - Sam graduated from Temple with a bachelor's degree in Accounting and started his career at Ernst and Young as an auditor of Fortune 500 public companies. While still at Ernst and Young, Sam connected with an owner of a startup packaging manufacturer who needed someone to open the West Coast market for the fast growing company.  Given his lack of sales experience, lack of network, and lack of knowledge of the packaging industry, Sam decided that it was just the challenge that he needed.   In less than six months, Sam successfully grew the west coast market while also inheriting the Boulder, Colorado based team.   Less than 2 years later, needing to return to the East Coast, Sam returned to Philadelphia where he resides today.   Since early High School where he had a short stint of a competitive Halo career, Sam has diligently looked for ways to break into his industry of passion, gaming.  
  • Dalton Carroll - Dalton graduated from Temple University with a degree in Media Studies and Communications with a focus in audio engineering and quickly entered the entertainment industry as a producer at the world renowned Milkboy Studio in Philadelphia.  While there, Dalton had the opportunity to meet, record, and produce for stars such as Meek Mill, Nicki Minaj, Kiesza, Flostradamous and many more.     Continuing his passion of recording music at night, over the next few years Dalton spent his days in the customer service and sales industry where he found a passion for networking and collaboration.  When he wasn't producing music, Dalton continued to enjoy playing video games.  

As Sam and Dalton watched the rise of video game streamers and the simultaneous boom of Fortnite, they began to notice a trend:  streamers, esports players, and competitive gamers were moving away from affordable consoles and onto PC's.  And those top streamers were those that had extremely powerful PC's that could output over two hundred frames per second without any lag at high resolution.  At the same time, the count of new streamers entering twitch was doubling year over year.  That's when the investigation began.   The influx of new streamers was riddled with low quality, low resolution, no face cam, low ping productions that drew little to no viewers.  That's when reality hit, kids wanted their shot at becoming the next big streamer but are using under powered rigs to do it.   Perhaps the next Ninja or DrDisrespect was stuck behind a low quality production?

GamrPod gives new and prospective streamers a place to grow their stream and community without the need to spend thousands of dollars on a PC and streaming setup.   For veteran streamers, GamrPod's are available when they are away from their home rigs while travelling allowing them to stay in touch more frequently than ever before.  

GamrPod is fully equipped with a high end PC, peripherals including web cam and microphone, a green screen, the most popular games and broadcasting software.  GamrPod's will be found at local esports and gaming facilities where staff will able to assist in stream setup and maintenance.  GamrPod's are able to be reserved by the hour through an internet based reservation system.  

See 3D concept of a GamrPod here.

What We Need & What You Get

Where the funding going: Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.  Our proof of concept GamrPod is currently in production with a local esports facility identified and verbally committed to be its home.  With several other local gaming and esports facilities interested, this funding will be used to help us build additional GamrPods in effort to get GamrPods deployed and available for use as quick as possible as interest for streaming stations is growing daily.  

Our Unique Perks:  We wanted GamrPod's to be state of the art, eco friendly, and comfortable.  

  • High End PC: Intel Core i&-8700K processor & Nvidia GeForce GTX 1080
  • Dual Monitor Display:  Stack mounted dual monitors.  One for gaming.  One for broadcasting and community interaction.  
  • Professional Peripherals:  1080p autofocus camera and background eliminating green screen.  Noise canceling microphone for crisp voice capture. 
  • Sound Insulation: 1.6” sound insulation made from recycled materials to tune out the noise.

  • Ventilation Fans: Two ultra-quiet fans keep you cool under pressure.

All in a less than 4ftx4ft foot print!!!

What happens if we don't reach our goal:

  • Although we hope that we do, reaching a fraction of our funding goal will help us in bringing more GamrPods to market faster.  

 

The Impact

Video games and streaming communities have been a place where individuals who didn't think they belonged could find a community that accepted them for who they were.  With your assistance, you will help get more GamrPod's out in the wild allowing for more young gamers to take their shot at becoming the next famous streamer or even find a community that accepts and believes in them.   

Further, you can help Sam and Dalton more quickly achieve their dream of successfully bringing a product to the hands of young gamers and entertainers that gives those gamers a shot at achieving their dream and finding their community.   

 

Risks & Challenges

Many challenges are ahead for GamrPod but the founding team of Dalton and Sam come well equipped to deal with them.   

  • Sales & Marketing Experience:  The founders bring startup sales and growth experience which will allow them to connect and negotiate great deals with the right partners.   
  • Finance and Accounting Experience:  Sam is a CPA and has been a proven high performer when working with public and private companies.  Known for his analytical skills and attention to the details, Sam will be effective in ensuring budget, forecasting and cash flow.
  • Production and Equipment Experience:  Dalton has led sound productions for more than 10 years on personal and commercial projects giving him the understanding of soundproofing and acoustic leveling. 
  • Manufacturing Experience: Following his time in the finance and accounting discipline, Sam worked closely with the operations and manufacturing team spending hours in and around  large scale packaging manufacturing facilities where he encountered extended manufacturing outages and successfully navigating the resulting consequences.  
  • Passion:  Sam and Dalton both possess the tenacity, persistence, and passion needed to overcome any and all challenges ahead.  

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can or can't contribute, its no problem, we would still love your help.  Please share our Indiegogo campaign on your social media.  You can use the Indiegogo sharing tools.

Help us unlock the next celebrity streamer!

story:
In December last year,

we have already achieved success on Kickstarter! We raised funds 2,836,872 yen!​

PV2：

 

Features:

❄E-mote Animation System（All characters have animations）

What is e-mote animation system?

Please visit the e-mote website to confirm which game uses e-mote animation. https://emote.mtwo.co.jp/works/

❄Fully Voiced in Japanese（Include mouth animation, please watch the promotional video）

❄ English, Japanese, and Chinese Language Support

❄CG Gallery (40CGs or More) 

❄Music Gallery

❄Free Full Content patch

 

Hello, everyone! We are a Japanese company called "Pureworks", and are experts at making visual novels with animation character sprites. This time, we have brought you the first game we have developed: it is called "White Wings"!

This is a story about love and humanity, and it focuses on a slightly warped love triangle.

In this game, we use the E-mote animation system to make character sprites! Next year, the game’s official version will be sold on Steam!

 

This is an agonizing wintertime love song.

At Shoba Senior Middle School in Shizuoka Prefecture, the stress and tension of preparing for Shoba Senior Middle School entrance examinations affects those in their later teenage years.

They might encounter a life of separation from each other. Some of them may meet again, while others may never see others again.

Secrets that are covered by rapidly falling snow are interwoven with a sorrowful rhythm.

 

Broken families,

Experiences of bullying,

Tears concealed by smiles.

Is the taste of first love sweet or bitter? Who will be redeemed, and who will enter the abyss?

Attracted, estranged, separated, hurt.

Young men and women, three encounters, each carries sorrowful secrets in the cold winter.

Embracing each other and absorbing the earth’s final, small bit of warmth.

We are developing this visual novel to give everyone a better gaming experience, so we have decided to use Kickstarter to launch a crowdfunding campaign!

If you donate funds to support our game "White Wings", you can receive this game’s physical version as well as its limited first edition peripherals!

 

During the last winter before Shoba Senior Middle School entrance examinations, Shoba Senior Middle School welcomed a pretty transfer student named Miyazawa Moe.

She was assigned to sit next to Fujiwara Hiro, and had a heavenly appearance as well as an unapproachable air. She looked like an ice-cold snowflake and indifferently floated into Fujiwara Hiro’s heart. It seemed like a romantic beginning.

Miyazawa Moe looked pretty and had outstanding grades, but was very cold and detached. Her classmates did not welcome her, and did not develop close relationships with her. However, her talent and beauty touched Fujiwara Hiro, whose family had already been broken. Furthermore, she also seemed to regard Fujiwara Hiro as someone unique. He couldn’t help but feel moved by Miyazawa Moe, but it was just that when he tried to get close to her, he found that it was really too difficult to get close to this girl.

At the same time, Fukihara Reika, a charming girl with a warmhearted smile, also had a chance encounter with Fujiwara Hiro.

She was outgoing and magnanimous, had a warm personality, and was also a bit bizarre, which gave Fujiwara Hiro a feeling he had never previously experienced. Fujiwara Hiro was obviously attracted to Miyazawa Moe, while Fukihara Reika’s vitality and uninhibited personality as well as her enthusiasm may have caused other people to see her as stubborn and unyielding. However, Fujiwara Hiro thought that Fukihara Reika was just like an angel opening up her wings in front of him. Fukihara Reika’s warmth and radiance sparked enthusiasm and hope within Fujiwara Hiro, who seemed to treat others with kindness, but actually was afraid of interacting with others. Fukihara Reika was too enticing for him. He couldn’t hold himself back, and was fatally attracted to her.

On one side was the unapproachable ice-cold beauty, and on the other was the unfathomable elfin girl.

His heart drifted between these two girls and remained indecisive.

How could he choose between them and make sure that it was the right decision?

Irie Kenji

Identity: Fujiwara Hiro’s father, Fukihara Reika’s stepfather

Age: 40

Occupation: Film Producer

Character Description:

Several years ago, Irie Kenji wanted to have a romantic life with Fujiwara Kayoko. Therefore, after they had worked together, he married her, and eventually had a child. However, because he was dissatisfied with Fujiwara Kayoko’s obsession with her work, the two of them always got in arguments. Afterwards, he had an affair and they ultimately divorced. One year later, he lived with Fukihara Reika’s mother. Since his marriage had failed, he excluded and felt disappointed in his son Fujiwara Hiro, especially after he found that his son had had an improper relationship with his adopted daughter Fukihara Reika. Irie Kenji thought that this was Fujiwara Kayoko’s way of getting her revenge after the breakup of their marriage.

Preview of some Background Art:

Our company "Pureworks" is currently working hard to develop "White Wings", which is a new visual novel-based game that we will be launching. This game will use an E-mote animation performance system! We hope that during this game’s performance, we can provide you with a unique realistic experience! This game aims to portray a warped love triangle along with the changes in its characters’ emotions, in addition to humanity’s warped nature and its battle between good and evil.

We hope that this crowdfunding can provide this game with a better gaming experience.

We will provide crowdfunding for Japanese-language dubbing for all of the characters, along with number of CGs as well as English-language localization!

In order to achieve this objective, we have decided to use the Kickstarter platform to raise development funding. We have prepared many prizes for those who have supported and helped us. These include Steam digital games, physical games, limited first edition games, acoustic official soundtracks, as well as many kinds of unexpected peripherals!

Of course, as everyone knows, the most important returns for this game are Japanese-language dubbing and English-language localization! We have prepared a large quantity of rewards for those people who want to provide us with assistance! They include many unexpected returns! 

Therefore, before deciding, please make sure to carefully read the information about the returns! 

We hope that our wish and intention can reach the hearts of those backers! 

We greatly appreciate your assistance!

"Pureworks" is a new game development team from Japan. We focus on providing high-quality animation-based visual novels that we provide to countries throughout the world. We intend to change the impression that ‘visual novels are static’.

 

Kanda Sasara

Original Painting

Mei Miyamura

Background Art

Ten-year background in drawing games

Fantasy Curve

Game UI Interface

Made many UI and source materials for visual games

Team JRM2

We used JRM2’s E-mote animation system. Thank you very much for your support and cooperation!

 

STAFF

Planner：林原亜悠（Hayasiharaayuu）

Scenario：Claire

Character original painting：神田ささら（Kandasasara）

Background art：明宫村（Mei Miyamura）、有限会社スノーフレイク（Snowflake Co., Ltd.）、株式会社ソフパル（Sofpal Co., Ltd.）、株式会社ネクストン（Nexton Inc.）、チュアブルソフト（Chewable soft）、sugar pot/Twinkle、（株）キューン・プラント（Kuhn Plant Co., Ltd.）、たぬきそふと（Tanuki soft）

LOGO：とりあか（Toriaka）

UI：空想曲線（Kuusou Kyokusen）、freepik

Program：Variable D（The NVL Maker）

E-mote animation system：M2 Co., Ltd

Director：神田ささら（Kandasasara）

Produce：pureworks Japan

Publisher：pureworks Japan

Translate：James、LOC

（Character CV）

宮澤萌（Miyazawa Moe）：藤岡あかね（Hujioka Akane）

​吹原玲花（Fukihara Reika）：涼花みなせ（Suzuka Minase）

​小笹惠（Ozasa Megumi）：口谷亜夜（Kuchidani Aya）

内藤雨音（Naito Amane）：華本うさぎ（Hanamoto Usagi）

​奈切沙依（Nakiri Sayori）：白崎透子（Sirasaki Touko）

天神辰彦（Tenjin Tatsuhiko）：しるびな（Sirubina）

藤原佳世子（Fujiwara Kayoko）：藤宮ひとこ（Huzimiya Hitoko）

入江賢治（Irie Kenji）：水野健介

川口（Kawaguti Hiroya）：水野健介（Mizuno Kensuke）

木下（Kinosita Rika）：華本うさぎ（Hanamoto Usagi）

Cram school teacher：華本うさぎ（Hanamoto Usagi）

SE：Free Sound Effects、魔王魂（Maou Tamashii）

BGM：mifuno studio、Pianos DauGe、PeriTune、musicisvfr

Twitter：@info_pureworks

 

Steam Publisher：https://store.steampowered.com/curator/36084691

 

 

E-mail: info@pureworks.jp

Support: support@pureworks.jp

 

Production time and budget overruns have always been a problem. However, we can solve any problem. During the production process, we will continually update you on our progress. We can ensure that we will not create risk for our backers. Everyone, thank you for your trust and support!
