story:
Glass Wing Retold is a reboot of the 2014 Glass Wing (originally made for contest).

As the young and acrobatic Mayfly, jump, climb and puzzle solve your way through a unique adventure!

The new mechanics in this game will allot for a better variety in the way that the stages are designed, to progressively incorporate the abilities that Mayfly unlocks through her adventure, which will include all of the ones from the original and a few more.

Spin Glide (Works like Yoshi's Flutter Jump from Super Mario 64DS)

High Jump

Ball Form (allows her to roll around in a manner similar to Goran Link or Samus)

Spark Blast (a light blast that can break brittle stone used while in ball form)

Flight (Which will now be based on Armored Core's style of flight for ease of use)

Glide Swim (Plans to be similar to the Zora Link swim in Zelda MM)

As has been shown in the video, in addition to using her abilities, Mayfly also uses items in ways to both solve puzzles and improve her platforming ability. Originally the utility was: sword cuts vines, axe cuts trees, hammer breaks cracked rocks, shovel digs up hidden items,  spear punctures electric globs to be used to power machines, and magnet moves magnetic platforms and the torch lights dark places and burns wood. There will all be kept but new features will make through, like using the spear and axe as make-shift platforms, I'd like to see the other items given a similar treatment. But I am most excited about the prospect of having a much more in-depth use of the magnet to make a lot more exciting puzzles that involve both moving and rotating platforms around to configure them in usable ways to pass areas.

 

This game is going to have a much more in-depth and connected world. Where as the previous game had what to many seemed like scattered environments tied by "twilight trials." My current plan is to have worlds connected in a much more realistic way, and having the twilight trials instead pop up from time to time as a sort of dream-segment challenge for the player which need not be completed but will reward the player with by providing insight on Mayfly's perspective on her situation.

Given that both the flight and swimming mechanics for this game are going to be much more user friendly, that opens up the possibility to create worlds that make full use of them in new ways. And I have just the idea for how that could be appropriate. In a previous game that is related to Glass Wing, I introduced the "Stone Cloud":

These are gigantic, motionless mountain like figures that float in the sky. I'd like to have one appear as the basis for a new world for Glass Wing, where in gravity is given a Super Mario Galaxy like treatment.

The mechanics of this game carefully shadow N64 hits like Super Mario 64 and Zelda OoT, to the point where Mayfly is capable of doing virtually all of the fundamental movements in both of those games including Diving, Ledge-Climbing, Wall-Jump, Side-Jump, and Z-targeting!

https://from-soy-sauce.itch.io/glass-wing-retold

If you'd like to get a feel for yourself, the development for this game is such that there is a Youtube development video log series that details mechanics as they are implemented, with an accompanying prototype build to test. The current prototype can be found above!

What sets Mayfly apart though is that she is effectively a non-combatant. She does come across various items that would classically be considered weapons, but Mayfly is too physically weak to fight (though you are allowed to try if you want to). Mayfly instead uses her items as tools to get ahead, and a combination of acrobatics and stealth to get around monsters. She will also learn new Glass Wing abilities throughout her adventure in a way similar to the Metroid games.

A non-fighting protagonist might sound boring at first, but by framing the game this way, as fans of the original game have explained in reviews, it allows for the enemies to feel a lot more dangerous and scary and this relationship with them has it's novelties. And besides, adding a detailed combat system would take focus away from the highlights, the platforming and puzzles, and I could easily see it just coming down to being way too similar to Zelda if there is combat.

I like to think that the format of an IGG campaign is a neat way to allow the fans to have more direct influence on the project!

 

This way everyone who supports will get something!

For Anyone curious how this idea started out.

My last project, a related game to Glass Wing.

A copy of this game!

Documents for lore and special art!

OST!

Beta tester!

After the first official demo is up, the prototype builds will discontinue, but beta-testers continue to check the game as it gets built up to a point...

Beta tester till the very end!

Hat accessory for Mayfly!

Toy Cameo of your own design!

Design a monster that will appear on the field.

Hypothetical gimmicks for added replay value!

Your OC appears in the game, Mayfly can talk to them too.

Your own challenge area will show up in the game!

Create a side quest to go along with your NPC!

Create an extra chapter to the main game as an extension!

NOTICE: All designs will be looked over so as to have appropriate adjustments to fit with the style of the world.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=783169036&result=1

 

Glass Wing Retold is being made because fans of the original wanted to know more about the Glass Wing world as well as Mayfly and Ferace as characters. Since I saw no where to go with Mayfly after her growth of a character at the end of her adventure, I felt it best to make a more detailed telling of the story.

Fans have told me that Mayfly and Ferace make each other interesting characters in a kind of Yin Yang way. Ferace is a gigantic and and powerful demon, but also an emotional and desperate person who really does want to build a world where fewer people suffer. Mayfly on the other hand is a weak and small demon that has a strong will and is always thinking things through an analytical perspective. 

In this world, there are demons like Ferace and Mayfly, but among them are also the "mindless monsters." Ferace explains that they used to be just like the main characters but something caused them to regress into something lesser, feral and unpredictably dangerous. But Ferace has been around for a long time, and he has never seen a Glass Wing become a mindless, so he takes it upon himself to capture the Mayfly the Glass Wing to try and find out just what it is about his curious kind of demon that separates them from the rest, and possibly find a way to altogether stop future demons from becoming mindless if not to find a cure of some sort.

That much was clear in the first five minutes of the original game. But this time I would like the space to create Metroid Prime Echos like background cutscenes that can provide insight as to just why Ferace wound up with the mind-set he has, and how it is that Mayfly sees this. And there in lies the possibility of creating a wider breadth of personality for Mayfly. I would like to create situations where the player is able to have different outcomes based on the decisions that they make within certain puzzles, and these could also result in triggering different interactions with Ferace, and possibly also the introduction of more characters as well.

One Character that I would really like to try and work into the game as I think they could do well to provide more insight on the nature of the monsters with a different perspective than Ferace would be that of another demon. One that first appeared in Remnants of A Beautiful Day, the "Darkspot":

Or at least some variation of this fairly disturbing character.

But to balance things out, there was actually one more additional perspective I wanted to introduce to this game, and that would be of another Glass Wing. Perhaps one that you find mid-way in your adventure, or maybe one that's actually a very close friend of Mayfly. Maybe both. Either could be used to really help with the world building component.

I am programming, animating, writing, and designing the graphics for this game myself, as well as doing some of the OST. As such, most of the money will be for my own living expenses as well as to be used to buy new hardware and software to speed along the development process. Needless to say, some of the money is for fees and taxes regarding the product as well. Everything else will go to audio: both music and voice acting!


The game should be finished by May of 2017.

Mayfly's inability to fight is actually a very important part of her character which has to do with the inception of the original Glass Wing. The driving thought behind the constitution of Mayfly was "Is it possible to play with the 'Damsel in Distress' trope to see what kind of adventure someone in peril who is far too weak to fight might save themselves?" And as such she originally only managed to escape her captor not by strength, skill, or even wits, but sheer luck. Of course, since she is forced to go on the adventure that's the point where she starts to become something more, but never really a "hero".

story: Story
story_txt: Story

story:
What are people saying?

 

Hi, we're a design duo who have created multiple products around the world and are now trying our hands at creating a card game that will make you hate 2016 all over again (in the best way possible). We have also teamed up with amazing gaming industry experts, who have brought 'Magic' to a lot of people's lives, to make it happen annually.   

For many of us in this generation, 2016 has been considered one of the wierdest years in our recent Sapien timeline. From Brexit to Trumpism to Harambe, it seemed like bad juju was all around-- and no one could have seen it coming. That is why it is important that you fund this campaign unless you’re a masochist (or actually want to do better by this world this year by remembering and learning from all the things that went down in 2016). With your contributions, you’ll help bring to life a game that is a surprising memory refresher about all the current events that went down last year, especially for those who--for the most part--have attempted to move on forever. So ask yourself, are you ready for that commitment? If so, click the destiny you’d like to choose.

The Game

 

How to Play:

First, gather your open-minded friends and loosen up with drinks.

Each round, someone (the "cardmaster") will act, draw or rap the card they pick. You get 30 seconds to prep for your presentation, so that means you get to google that event on your phone if you need to. All the rest of the people do is guess that event. The first person to guess correctly wins that card. If you get 10 cards, you win the game!

Plot Twist: There are also good event cards! We know! We couldn’t believe anything good came out of 2016 either! These cards are marked with a green thumbs up symbol at the bottom. If a cardmaster draws a good event, the first person to guess correctly wins DOUBLE points!

To Drink or Not to Drink?

We also have a drinking guide for this game, because sometimes it’s easier to handle bad news when it comes with a pint of beer.

Prototyped?

We've done game sessions with different groups of people, from San Francisco all the way to Myanmar, and have improved this game upon the game tests held. What did we see while we were playing? People dropping knowledge on each other; asking questions about events; and laughing so hard your stomach hurts. Maybe the drinking guide helped, but the hilarity was genuine!

Visit our Instagram to see the game in action! https://www.instagram.com/fckthisgame/ 

The Impact

When you fund F*ck 2016 The Game, you fund the possibility of capturing history. 2016 was considered one of the worst years (for everyone interested in playing this game anyways). We experienced some tragic events that showed a world that many of us didn’t recognize, a world we had previously assumed was steadily moving towards progress. A lot of not-quite-as-tragic-but-still-news events happened (like Kim Kardashian’s robbery) and by virtue of living in the age of social media, much of our history was defined by trending tags around popular stories. All of this matters to how we remember our years.

By funding this campaign, you’ll help encapsulate all the noteworthy things that happened and yes, make light of shitty situations, but also never forget that we are built from our shared history and need to learn from the past. These cards spark conversations and remind us that dialogue makes history, and that we can learn from each other as well. When we played this game with a group of friends, we witnessed at least five conversations about current events triggered by questions like: "Oh, what happened with that?" or "I didn't know that went down!" Perhaps by funding this game, you’ll help people in the world #educatethemselves. Sometimes the only way to move forward and get people’s attention about the things that matter (and sometimes don’t matter) is to inject humor in it.

If this works, we can continue to capture moments in history onwards, so that they don’t die as trending tags but live on as active discourses feeding movements, as lessons and as portraits into the world we live in. Maybe one day, you’ll have five years worth of history in a shit-talking deck of cards that you can pull out whenever you need a refresher on all the things we can work on changing in the world.

Our Ask

We are raising $10K to create an abomination of a game that will be all funs and will sharpen your current events knowledge. Most of the funds will go into the creation of this game, but a portion of the funds will also be donated to two organizations supporting education in underserved communities and homeless youth. We’ll chat more about the organizations we’re excited about supporting below.

If we are able to hit $100K in funds, we will also develop a mobile app and a site to submit all the events you hate (or love) about 2016, 2017 and every year onwards. You will even be able to add your own custom cards for your groups of friends or family! This will be a game that can be continuously updated until death do us part. "How can you create an awesome game so easily!?" You might be wondering. We have a solid design and development team with years of UI/UX and engineering experience that will tailor the best app experience for you and all parties onwards.

The Perks of Being Awesome

A Portion of the Proceeds Go To Some Amazing Nonprofits

It’s not all (not) fun and games! We’ve spent some time working in education development and with underserved youth, and these are things we’re really passionate about. We want to be sure our little game is doing some good in the world, so we will be donating a percentage of the funds to two organizations:

DonorsChoose.Org: “We make it easy for anyone to help a classroom in need, moving us closer to a nation where students in every community have the tools and experiences they need for a great education.”

NAEHCY: “The National Association for the Education of Homeless Children and Youth (NAEHCY) is a national membership association dedicated to educational excellence for children and youth experiencing homelessness. Through state and federal policy and technical assistance to our members, students, and the public, we change systems so all children and youth can learn, succeed academically, and achieve their dreams.”

Risks & Challenges

We are fully invested in this idea, and have made all of the partnerships to deliver this awesome “f*ck you” to 2016. We’ll be working closely with distributors to check card quality, packaging, and logistics to ensure that this is delivered on time. Since we are currently in the concept stage, the biggest challenge is hitting our contribution goal. Ideally we would love to reach at least 10k so that we can get a steady streamlined printing and packaging process going, and know exactly how many to push to print.

We are also working with industry experts who have built board games and card games that have added "Magic" to many peoples lives; as well as successful campaigns launchers on Indiegogo and Kickstarter. Under their tutelage, we are carefully mapping timelines and logistics so that you get your game as soon as possible.

Who is Behind This?

We are a design duo, coming up with all things creative, fun and (hopefully) long-lasting. Matt is the founder of NOMA Creatives, a design and development agency that has worked with clients large and small; and is the co-founder of Raddish, an app that helps you find plant-based meals, made fresh from your neighbors. Prior to his current endeavors, he helped grow Lyft from one to 30+ markets; traveled the world with a team of 8 people to launch and research startup and innovation ecosystems in Santiago, Istanbul and Yangon; and has advised companies such as Zeplin.io.

Saya is a learning experience designer, pushing the boundaries of how we innovate and educate. She is the founder/CEO of Aril Studios, a hands-on consultancy delivering contextual learning experiences that inspire people to learn. She is also a founding member of a school in Myanmar, which promotes dignity and diversity. As a graphic designer, she has led a branding workshop at NASDAQ Entrepreneurial Center. She holds a Master's from Stanford University's Graduate School of Education and is a passionate visual illustrator. 

We’re also in love (ew, we know). One of the things we share is our desire to create interesting and weird things and put them in the world in the hopes that others will enjoy it. This game is born of that, though perhaps “enjoy” isn’t the right word here.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to share some love for this game, please forward this Indiegogo link to a friend, ten friends, or your entire social network. If you know someone that wants to write about this game, tell them to drop us a line at yo@fckthisgame.com.

Happy New Year, and f*ck 2016!

 

**Note**

In case you didn't catch the cheeky humor and are thinking, "these two aren't serious about this game". We wanted to clear the air and state that this game is very important to us and we believe this will be the first of many games that will take what we, the people, #hashtag about and create meaning off-line, while also pushing communities around the world to have true discourse about real events. This is only the beginning of our journey, and we hope you will join us on it. Thank you!

She is the founder/CEO of Aril Studios, a hands-on consultancy delivering contextual learning experiences that inspire people to learn. She is also a founding member of a school in Myanmar, which promotes dignity and diversity. As a graphic designer, she has led a branding workshop at NASDAQ Entrepreneurial Center. She holds a Master's from Stanford University's Graduate School of Education and is a passionate visual illustrator. 
We’re also in love (ew, we know). One of the things we share is our desire to create interesting and weird things and put them in the world in the hopes that others will enjoy it. This game is born of that, though perhaps “enjoy” isn’t the right word here.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you want to share some love for this game, please forward this Indiegogo link to a friend, ten friends, or your entire social network. If you know someone that wants to write about this game, tell them to drop us a line at yo@fckthisgame.com.
Happy New Year, and f*ck 2016!
 
**Note**
In case you didn't catch the cheeky humor and are thinking, "these two aren't serious about this game". We wanted to clear the air and state that this game is very important to us and we believe this will be the first of many games that will take what we, the people, #hashtag about and create meaning off-line, while also pushing communities around the world to have true discourse about real events. This is only the beginning of our journey, and we hope you will join us on it. Thank you!

story:
Want to donate via PayPal? you can do so by using our Patreon instead!

https://www.patreon.com/homeofindies 

 



Development will still begin even if we don't hit our goals, but with your support, we can create an even better platform at each milestone!


Introduction

marketing tools, website builder, mini-funding, marketplace, in-depth tutorials and more in one location...


 

The indie game industry has major problems. The issues we see today have been brewing for years. Nowadays, developers often have to search high and low to hopefully find the resources they need. The indie devs of today spend countless hours looking for help and resources when they could be spending time working on their games. They often lack a “Home” to call their own and are forced to rely on themselves. We believe the indie community deserves better.
 

Home Of Nerds was founded in 2016 by James Harris, Emily English, and a handful of others, who are passionate about gaming in general. James has been running various large projects of this caliber for many years, and also has 10 years experience in the web development/design field, along with our other mature graphic design and development team. We started by creating our own news platform from scratch - www.homeofnerds.com - which is aimed at the community and is not just another generic news site. Within our community, we have created a hub on our official Discord partner server with over 1600+ indie developers, who chat about all sorts of topics and get help daily with their projects. The reason behind starting the Home of Indies project is that we see first hand the lack of help, advice, and resources that are available to independent developers. We see talent go to waste on a daily basis - either through lack of funds or lack of direction.
 

With the contributors’ help, we will provide a platform that will assist developers as never before. By working closely with sales experts and market leaders, we will provide an extensive step by step resource center which will consist of easy to follow guides on every aspect of indie development and marketing. By providing these resources, devs will no longer need to spend hours looking for help on difficult subjects. The most recent and up to date guides for every subject important to indies will be right at your fingertips and we aren’t stopping there.
 

Home of Indies will enable developers to craft their own professional custom websites with very little effort, for free. This allows each developer to have a professional webpage that of studio quality and is individual to them. The customizable widgets will allow indies to add any features they feel will help their development in the industry. We don’t just give you a profile. We give you the tools to build your own professional studio. However, Home of Indies will be much more than just an indie gaming website builder. That is not our only focus. We are striving to provide everything indie developers need to be successful. We are helping developers succeed in all phases of creating a game; including the need for a simple yet feature packed website.

 

* Basic Wireframe
 

A unique advantage of indies having their own website is that it gives devs more options to sell their games than ever before. Simply and elegantly from their own website, indies will be able to sell their games without needing to redirect to a 3rd party. The decision whether to sell through Home of Indies, Steam, or Itch.io is up to each and every individual developer. We have no intentions of competing directly with the market leaders in gaming today. We’re here to help provide devs a front end resource so that indie developers do not need to always give out a third party link. Instead, they can work on building their own brand by directing potential customers to their own beautiful websites showcasing their games. This includes assistance in handling game key distribution, website control panels, and help with marketing on the back end of your website.
 

Using customizable tags and dynamic internal SEO, both the public and fellow devs will be able to find the indie games they are looking for. All the features for Home of Indies that we are going to provide will be simple and easy to implement. No matter your skill level, we will provide the resources you need for any game.
 

We are also going to provide something unique to the indie scene. This is the option for devs to use our “Housekeeping” feature. Differing from major crowdfunding sites, this ‘micro-funding’ is where you can ask fans, friends, and family to help fund your projects on a small scale. Once you have your website designed they way you want, drag and drop the housekeeping widget onto your page. Choose the amount you wish to raise up to an undetermined cap, enter some info, and you are ready! We don’t take any cuts and you will receive your funds as soon as the payment processor allows. Small amounts here and there can mean the difference between someone giving up on their game and completing the project. Also, unlike other crowdfunding options, your campaign is not solely targeting the public. Fellow indie devs from better economies, or who have been successful can support other devs through this method.
 

Home of Indies will also allow users to find indies that are hiring as part of our fully driven job board. Mark your project as looking for help informing people what positions you are looking for or if you prefer post on the job board itself.


Other indie marketplaces are, even now, makingentry for developers more difficult by increasing fees and competition for start-ups. Indies, now more than ever, need options. You need a marketplace that has your best interests at heart and supports you every step of the way. Home of Indies will provide just that. Personal support for every indie developer through our team of people who are just like you.

 

How will the money be spent?

 

Home of Indies is asking for £10000 to go towards maintaining and developing the platform and being able to support the various challenges that come with creating a platform of such diversity. Once we raise the money we will keep our dedicated community 100% informed on what we are accomplishing with your donations. Either through our weekly dev blog emails, or updates coming from our online sources, we will be completely transparent with the funds provided.

 


 

 

 

Indie developers will come to the website and will be greeted by various already running indie projects, as well as a resource center. They will be able to create an account with all of their main details as well as creating their own limitless website, via Bootstrap 4. Devs will be able to drag and drop widgets and create their website with ease.

Whether they have no prior knowledge, or more advanced, they’ll be able to code directly on our servers and get help when they need it. Devs will be able to use their own domain with our service.

 


 


 

Once a website has been created, it'll appear on our homepage, and the developer can share it with the rest of the indie community and beyond. We use the latest technology, which will enable creation of a high-quality studio worthy website that will be interesting to potential new supporters of the project.


 





 

Once their site is up and running, developers will be able to take advantage of our widget selection. They can drag and drop a buy button, add PayPal accounts, and take sales straight through the website they have created with us. They will also be able to add more widgets such as mini crowd funding, which we have nicknamed “Housekeeping”, which is where whoever visits the developers’ unique page can donate. "Widget can also be used as a off-site widget"
 

This takes the need for using any other third party websites out of the equation, and it'll allow for indie developers to do everything they need through Home of Indies without having to go elsewhere. Our mission with Home of Indies is to create a HUB and Haven for indies to start their journey and gain the support they need to grow their audience and brand. We want them to realize that they are not alone.


The amazing indie developers out there deserve a supportive community. They deserve better than the options that currently exist.  With your help, we can build a foundation and grow our community. Together, as devs from all around the world, we can pull together to provide something all indies desperately need: a Home.

 


 


 

When indies join our community we will assist with every step on their journey. This includes ongoing editorial coverage, marketing, and social promotions on our mother site; Home of Nerds. and tons of other outlets where news, reviews, and interviews are written/recorded daily by our team and others. When Home of Indies is up and running, Home of Nerds will support developers by showcasing projects and studios.
 

All of the aspects that go into creating a successful game can then come under one roof. Being a part of Home of Indies gives developers potential for more exposure, more funding, more manpower and more time to make their game. Once the creation is ready, Home of Indies will still be there to give advice and support in the marketing and sale of it, which is something that simply does not exist at this point in time. Developers are left to work all of that out on their own or to pay large amounts of money for the help. Wouldn’t it be great to have guidance and knowledge from people who are already experienced and connected to the industry?
 

We have people on our Discord server who have made and distributed their games; writers, artists, and musicians with experience; PR and marketing industry professionals who have specialized in video games; social media veterans and people who have worked successfully on their own businesses for years. They are already part of the community, and ready to give their time to make Home of Indies what it needs to be.


There are many indie developers out there. We want them to know that they are not alone in this difficult business. Whether you are a developer or a fan of the indie gaming business, there are places where this campaign would be of interest. If you can show support by donating, that’s amazing. If you can’t, you can still help. Spread the word and make it known that there is soon to be a resource that will fulfill the needs of indie devs around the world. We believe that Home of Indies is going to be a huge boost for the entire community, and we can’t wait to get to work.

 

Take a look at the quality of the website you will be able to create for your studio via our builder with these bootstrap examples.

 

 

>> http://expo.getbootstrap.com/page2/ <<

These are showcased from the bootstrap expo, *these have not been produced by us. These are examples to what can be built using our drag and drop builder. Unsure of what bootstrap is? visit http://getbootstrap.com/

 

 

Q: Why use HOI instead of Humble, Itch.io, or Gamejolt?

We have no desire to compete with Steam, or other hosting services! Our main goal is to be the best resource for you and your project. We want to give you a professional website, free hosting while providing access to loads of resources for you to market, update, and sell your game direct on your website - saving you time, and money! You can also get mini-funding direct on your website. As you are starting to see, we aren't competing with them - we are creating something to bring professionalism and polish to the indie dev community while streamlining where you have to go for it. All resources and needs, all in one place, eliminating the need to code a website or pay others to make your project stand out.

 

Q: Is HOI a website builder similar to Wix or Weebly but for indie game devs?

Home of Indies will have a website builder for indies, but that is not our main focus. We are changing the way indies develop games by providing everything they need all in one location. Many people today need simple, yet elegant websites to catch people's interest, and indie developers are no different. We are simply providing another helpful resource for free to people who need help setting up an amazing website. Our site will provide the help and community indies need for every phase of their game - not just help in making their website.

 

Q: Just seems like one more thing I have to update/manage

Your own website is one of the most important marketing tools you have. Although other listings elsewhere are nice, a quality website dedicated to your project can either attract or detract from your game and it often decides the first impressions of you as a developer.  If your website is updated you can then easily use that content wherever else you are marketing. While other websites can be helpful, your own website should represent the professionalism of both your community and of yourself.

 

Q: What is the minimum age to join?

Various countries have laws designed to help protect children and their information. In order to remain in compliance with these laws users for Home of Indies must be over 13 years of age.

 

Q: What if I already own a website?

You can still add your website to Home Of Indies. We will give you the widget code to integrate into your own website allowing you to use all the features we provide. We will also have a fully documented API available.

 

Q: How many developers will be allowed to join?

There is no limit on the amount of developers. Developers will always have a home here!

 

Q: Will this support custom domains?

While we aren’t going down the route of being a domain registrar, we do have our own name servers. Connecting domains you have purchased to Home of Indies is absolutely okay and can link to us in a matter of minutes.

 

Q: What is the marketing system like?

The marketing system we are providing for Home of Indies users is an extensive resource guide to assist with difficult subjects, as well as coverage from our Home of Nerds network. For example, guides and advice for marketing, help on how to contact press, as well as countless other topics. We are going to provide the one-stop-shop resource center for developers saving indies countless hours while they look for help.

Developers who are looking for extra help with marketing can also talk with us on promoting through our mother site Home of Nerds. This will be on a per-dev basis but we look forward to discussing this with you when you reach this point.

 

Q: Is programming knowledge required?

Home of Indies will make the process of creating a website and our widgets very simple and easy. Drag and drop is today's premise, That means you don’t need to be an expert at web design in order to make a site. However, brave users will have the capability to fully edit their sites and use our code builders.

 

Q: What happens if the website is shut down? Can we get the website in source?

While we are almost completely sure a shutdown will never ever happen, we allow full source download of your website. Thus, your content is always in your hands and will be available to backup your website according to your needs.
 

Q: Will you curate the content? What content can be stored on the website?

Each website created is owned by the user. Visitors to your site won’t even know we were involved. However, the use of features from us such as job boards, our “housekeeping” mini-crowdfunding, or any other widgets that represent us will not be allowed if the website hosts illegal, pornographic, or hateful content.

 

Q: Can a user have multiple websites?

Yes, although one website is allowed per account

 

Q: When are you looking to launch Home Of Indies?

As soon as we reach a certain amount of funding we will begin development. Many of our wireframes have already being created and we’re looking forward to sharing with you the progress each week until we officially launch.

 

 

 

 

Our developers & designers have over 10+ years experience 

 

 

Lanyards for everyone!

 

 

£5 and above.

 


 




https://www.GOPublix.com - https://www.mjoshua.com
https://www.launchyourindiegame.com
 

 

If you have any further questions, contact us! via Discord or Twitter
 



www.homeofindies.com

story:
Hello world my name is Nicholas Sample and I'm the creator of a new card game called Project Caterham. Im a man of many hats : disabled military veteran , full time student, designer,  and father of three. Growing up, I was an only child and only had video and card games to keep me company most of the time. When I wanted to play and share these games with others I found that most games I played weren’t a pick up and play affair. Now as an adult, I have the opportunity to make a card game that is fun and quick if you need it to be. One that can be useful from one player to 100 players. I think Project Caterham is that game. Taking cues from some other games that have been popular in the last few years and adding the functionality and card usage that makes for a more portable and versatile game. 

(What I Need & What You Get)

“Why is this campaign only $1,000? Don't you need more than that? ” :

• The answer is no I really don’t. I’m not trying to set out to make a record breaking crowdfunding campaign and although I want as many donations as possible, the numbers being worked out ensures the game gets in as many hands as possible and me making a very small profit.

“So what am I getting out of supporting this? ”: 

•You get limited edition pressings of the game, limited edition cards and at certain tiers having a hand in the creation process of other editions of the game.

“ So what if this game doesn’t make it though funding? ”:   

•We will push on and make the game and everyone that buys the game will get exactly what they paid for.  

(The Impact)

So with this campaign I want to make a modular game that includes user input and other forms of media as well : Smartphone Apps, console games and PC. With a good deal amount of money I can hire an professional artists for limited editions of the game. The first step is the initial funding and exposure. 

•I want this campaign to show and prove that people are interested in this concept of game and would want this game to expand. I have future ideas and plans but I need to be shown their is an audience for this idea. 

(Risks & Challenges)

My only risk and challenge right now is to make sure orders are going to be on time after the campaign is over.

•I will give constant updates on the status of orders and engage the community that builds around this campaign as much as possible.

(Other Ways You Can Help)

Tell your family, friends, co-workers, students, teachers, landlords, children, local senator, pets, favorite publication(web and print) and random strangers about this game and campaign. If can’t contribute to the campaign please share this on your favorite social media sites for others to participate.
story_txt:
Hello world my name is Nicholas Sample and I'm the creator of a new card game called Project Caterham. Im a man of many hats : disabled military veteran , full time student, designer,  and father of three. Growing up, I was an only child and only had video and card games to keep me company most of the time. When I wanted to play and share these games with others I found that most games I played weren’t a pick up and play affair. Now as an adult, I have the opportunity to make a card game that is fun and quick if you need it to be. One that can be useful from one player to 100 players. I think Project Caterham is that game. Taking cues from some other games that have been popular in the last few years and adding the functionality and card usage that makes for a more portable and versatile game. 
(What I Need & What You Get)
“Why is this campaign only $1,000? Don't you need more than that? ” :
• The answer is no I really don’t. I’m not trying to set out to make a record breaking crowdfunding campaign and although I want as many donations as possible, the numbers being worked out ensures the game gets in as many hands as possible and me making a very small profit.
“So what am I getting out of supporting this? ”: 
•You get limited edition pressings of the game, limited edition cards and at certain tiers having a hand in the creation process of other editions of the game.
“ So what if this game doesn’t make it though funding? ”:   
•We will push on and make the game and everyone that buys the game will get exactly what they paid for.  
(The Impact)
So with this campaign I want to make a modular game that includes user input and other forms of media as well : Smartphone Apps, console games and PC. With a good deal amount of money I can hire an professional artists for limited editions of the game. The first step is the initial funding and exposure. 
•I want this campaign to show and prove that people are interested in this concept of game and would want this game to expand. I have future ideas and plans but I need to be shown their is an audience for this idea. 
(Risks & Challenges)
My only risk and challenge right now is to make sure orders are going to be on time after the campaign is over.
•I will give constant updates on the status of orders and engage the community that builds around this campaign as much as possible.
(Other Ways You Can Help)
Tell your family, friends, co-workers, students, teachers, landlords, children, local senator, pets, favorite publication(web and print) and random strangers about this game and campaign. If can’t contribute to the campaign please share this on your favorite social media sites for others to participate.

story:
Super Smash Bros has been a critical part of our lives, forming us amazing friendships and encouraging self-improvement over the last 16 years. One thing that we didn't have, though,  was anywhere but our parents' basements to play. 

Now we are going to provide to our Bellingham, WA community something that we wish we had had in our youth...a venue dedicated to not only the support and growth of Smash in ESPORTS, but also the plethora of beloved and oft-forgotten games of the past.

We will open an area where gamers of all ages can come to play from a wide selection of retro games, as well as an event space for local, regional, and eventually, national video game tournaments.

We, as passionate lovers of the art  and science of gaming, shall further its reach to all peoples.


Thank you for donating your  modest riches and generous wishes.

story:
1. 4 types of detailed sails-ships miniatures (each with own great history, provided below):
  2. Wind impact on ships movement
  3. Two-sided board
  4. Variety: basic and advanced rules
  5. Optimal age for one of the players: 6-12 years. Other players age: 6-106!


First steps of the naval game project were made by Bombat game team in 2010. The project was conceived as an alternative to PC games for our own children. We recalled very interesting, simple mechanics of the seafaring miniatures genre. Our basic mechanics trace their roots back to military headquarters games of naval officers. The greatest historical naval battles were modeled in these games and they brought up several generations of naval officers. During our work in libraries we found rules of the naval learning game published in 1848!

Naval Battle proposed now for your attention allows modelling battles of the 2 opponents fleets (each of 4 different sailing ships) and thanking to this project we want to extend maximum number of players to 4 and publish English version of rules (currently we have it in the electronic form only). We selected Indiegogo platform, because it allows making project for Ukraine citizens, so this is the only good chance to start expanding our brand around the world. We successfully published our first game of our naval series in Ukraine in 2012. A lot of ideas on project development arose during our communications with our customers. With your help we can present the project in the USA, Europe and other regions!

We designed our fleet with great care. Models for our designs are real sailing warships, each with its own glorious history. When your ships sail across their gameboard sea, keep in mind that several centuries ago, their real "brothers" furrowed seas and oceans, salty air filled their sails, menacing broadside guns terrified foes, and brave crews sailed and fought their way into world history!

Naval Battle includes among its components two sets of four different ship models (in total 8 ships) that, in our opinion, are the main representatives of the Sail Epoch. They are Brig, Galleon, 28-gun Frigate and 100-gun First Rate Ship. 

Scale of miniatures is 1:1700.

A large quantity of sailing ships were created during the Sailing epoch. 4 models are used in our game. 

  • We want to expand our game to 4 players, it means to create 2 additional sets of 4 ships with sails color different from the existing 2 sets (white and red).
  • We need to print English rules of the game. Electronic version of the rules is on the link.
  • As the basis (game itself) already exists and has been played dozens of times, and we in any case want to expand number of players, we put the minimal target of USD 500.
  • Due to the same reason you will get game in the period of 15th-30th of December 
  • We ask you not only make contribution or purchase the game, but also tell to your friends about us when your kids will enjoy the ships miniatures and the game itself! And you will see soon other our games!


2 years ago we had a project on other crowdfunding platform. It was hard to make as we have to find an intermediary located in the USA (due to limitations of that platform). Also we put rather high target (USD 15 000) and finally it killed the project. It was very hard to take, as a lot of efforts (physical and emotional) was spent.... Now here we avoid these risks: no intermediaries and conservative target.


Please share the project with Indiegogo sharing!

story:
Yahtzee itself is a simple game popular around the world. The specific thing about this yahtzee game is that it is more complex than usual one people got used to play.

About me and current game

I am very addicted yahtzee player and played it a lot. As there is no good enough online platform for that game I tried to start my own and give something worth to yahtzee fans. 4 years ago I started it and invested around $3000 in development. As I am not a programmer myself I invested my own money and paid programmers to make it for me.


Current version of the game you can find here: Online Yahtzee 

Current stats (without any promotions):

  • 2000 daily visits
  • 8200 registered users (most of people play unregistered)
  • Over 450 official games per day (over 1000 total)
  • 2500 facebook fans


Current problems:

  • A bit messy code
  • Some security issues (people can hack high scores)
  • Game in flash and should be changed to html 5
  • Financial issues (paying everything myself: hosting, fixing issues)

But still it works pretty good and has a lot of players!

Goals

  • Make it #1 yahtzee game online (it is currently close to that)
  • Playable on all the important devices (tablets, phones...)
  • Make it profitable with cash games and tournaments and memberships

What I Need to Succeed

$70.000 is needed for complete successful version on a long run. Money invested goes for development ($53.000) and promoting the game ($17.000). Dedicated hosting and management will be done and invested by myself.

What if I don't get 100% of funds?

In that scenario all the money will be invested in improving the current game depending on amount got. Phases of development are very clear so money will not be wasted but will try to get the most out of it!

What You Get

Yahtzee lovers and yahtzee players will get supporters badges depending on amounts sent described in perks.
Premium membership includes advanced personal profile options and will include entrance to all the scheduled real money tournaments in mentioned period.
Note: If project is not 100% funded then low amount backers will be included as official supporters on a dedicated page in place of official supporters.

Risks, Challenges & Predictions

There should be no risks at all. Current game already works fine for 4 years and the only risk is that it will be not so popular as expected. So it can only go better than it is now.

Game currently has 8250 registered players but more than 70% of people play unregistered because of no real motivation to register. Not any kind of promotion is done because of lack of time and finances.

  • Implementing leagues, tournaments, multiplayer mode, player achievements and other things will higher percentage of registered players
  • Facebook version and mobile devices versions will bring it to wider audience
  • Implementing cash games and tournaments will make game profitable
My predictions are that when it is completely done and planned amount invested in marketing it should have over 75.000 active players. When finances are in case to achieve positive balance it is only needed around 5.000 active members (and only 1% of it to be paying members is enough)

Why I believe in success

I work 6 years as a freelance internet marketer and have pretty good success in that field. Helped a lot of small and medium businesses achieve their goals and now it is time to focus on my own projects.

Without any promotion I managed to make one pretty popular yahtzee platform so with putting it on a professional level and investing smart in internet marketing it must become #1 yahtzee game online.



Game Development Phases

Phase 1 - Single Player Plus

  • Reprogramming game from flash to html 5
  • Security issues solving
  • Database and code optimization
  • Adding a lot more worldwide/country/player statistics and personal players pages with achievements
  • Upgrading to better hosting for faster game loading and problems with bandwidth
Funds Required: $2500 ($2250 for development + $250 for promotion)
Deadline: 10 days

Phase 2 - Multiplayer Mode

Adding multiplayer option for playing real time 1 vs 1 with ingame chat included plus implementing more stats dedicated to multiplayer games.

Funds Required: $2500 ($2250 for development + $250 for promotion)
Deadline: 10 days

Phase 3 - Tournaments and Leagues

This phase includes implementing leagues and tournaments. 
  • Worldwide league system plus country specific leagues
  • Open daily, weekly or monthly tournaments
  • Tournaments which require qualifications (best score, most games played, etc)
This phase also requires adding a lot more statistics and players achievements.

Funds Required: $15000 ($12500 for development + $2500 for promotion)
Deadline: 20 days

Phase 4 - Payments and rewards system

This phase includes adding payment options. Although game will always be free to play this phase should make the game profitable.
  • Monthly premium membership - Entrance for tournaments with real money prizes, advanced players statistics, eligible for getting real money prizes on daily, weekly or monthly basis for best scores
  • Ingame currency/tokens - Used for entering special and real money tournaments; 1 vs 1 real money games
  • Withdrawal system
As this will include implementing real money into game this phase will also introduce a new set of tournaments for real money.

Funds Required: $7500 ($5000 for development + $2500 for promotion)
Deadline: 10 days

Phase 5 - Advanced game management

Till this phase everything will be automatically done without option for manual modifications (Leagues, tournaments and stats will work automatically without option for changing).
This phase will include:
  • Creating professional admin system for advanced management of all the game parameters without programmers involved.
  • Option to manually create tournaments with specific requirements.
  • Option to create special events and promotions
  • Option for premium/token members to create tournaments

Funds Required: $7500 ($6000 for development + $1500 for promotion)
Deadline: 15 days

Phase 6 - iOS, Android and Facebook versions

Connecting with Facebook and also creating versions for mobile devices for iOS and Android. Facebook 

Funds Required: $15000 ($10000 for development + $5000 for promotion)
Deadline: 30 days

Phase 7 - Clan Wars & Ultimate Yahtzee Experience

This phase will introduce clan wars and will also include a lot of tweaking, reprogramming and tweaking depending on user experience and real time testing.

  • User created clans & teams
  • Clan statistics
  • Clan tournaments and wars
  • Country vs Country tournaments
  • World single & clan championships
Funds Required: $20000 ($15000 for development + $5000 for promotion)
Deadline: 30 days

story:
Our mission statement

We are dedicated to bringing a fun and welcoming gaming experience to our customers and providing merchandise and supplies to meet their gaming needs.

Our business plan

We intend to carry a wide variety of Pen and Paper RPGs from major publishers and lesser known publishers alike, as well as popular trading card games and collectible card games, collectibles, and comics.

Our business will be located in Johnson City, Tennessee, a college town with a high demand for game and hobby shops.  There are few other businesses in the area that cater to this demand.  We also will be allocating space for players to enjoy the games they play, both card games and tabletops, since other stores in our area are out of the way or do not have space allocated for this.

 We intend to grow our business over the years to come and contribute to the local economy.  

Our Goals

We are two friends and lifelong gamers with a desire to share our passion with the world!

We aim to bring a new kind of experience to rpg gamers and pop culture enthusiasts in our area.  We have nearly 15 years experience with Tabletop and Pen and Paper rpgs, as well as TCGs and CCGs; and we intend to bring this experience and dedication to others in the area.  We will offer knowledgeable staff and a friendly environment for people to come for gaming supplies and even a dedicated location for players to meet and run games.

The campaign here is an attempt to limit the amount we would need to get in loans to startup which will go a long way towards ensuring our long term success.

We intend to use any funds raised towards making this dream of ours a reality, even if we cant hit our goal any funds raised help towards acquiring our business license, leasing a space, and the actual infrastructure of our business (POS system, display cases, storage space, security cameras, etc.)

We have several years of experience in management and are working towards business management degrees as well to help secure our success.

Our goal is to carry books and resources from well known publishers as well as expand knowledge about lesser known games. We also want to cater to trading card games and CCGs as well as miniature war games to fill in a lack of such stores in the area.

story:
Lifestyle Media Pods

The future and the new way to play your video games and watch your favorite movies!

Lets take a few moments to analyze the value.

----------Immerse Yourself.----------

--------Enhanced Experience--------

----Inside is where it happens.----

---------------Get in to it---------------

Now thats value.

About Box'd Entertainment Inc.

We manufacture recreational and gaming products designed to create immersive media environments and provide our customers unique and heightened experiences. 

We are energized by a "can do" attitude. Our Credo is that one can identify and solve a problem. That it has a vision and energy to transform an idea into a viable product. We question the status quo and deliver an answer that may be a bit radical. It is the embodiment of the American pioneering spirit.

We have a vision to be a major factor in shaping the future of gaming and entertainment, enabling players to experience the utmost level of immersion and engagement, thereby improving performance and enjoyment.

We have a mission to be the product of choice for the world's gamers and media consumers. Box'd Entertainment design and delivers the most immersive gaming, recreational and entertainment experience in the market, helping everyone enjoy and enhance their media consumption experience.

While gaming was the initial application for product development, we discovered something else during the prototype and testing phases.  Just as the Lifestyle Media Pods were ideal for gaming, it was also an optimal experience for watching a movie. It was a truly stunning and immersive experience.

When other companies focus on products to wear for example gloves, vest, glasses/goggles, and headsets. We focus on all of that in one unit. No need to wear silly uncomfortable products that you’re not able to wear for long periods of time. No need to change a room, remodel a basement or garage all that does is brings a houses value down because it may not provide value to that next owner. No need to worry about that here. We got the all in one package that will blow your entertainment enjoyment away.


About the Founder

Matt Winchester is the Founder. He’s also the inventor behind Boxd’s pioneering Lifestyle Media Pod (LMP) product. 


His gaming world came into perspective when he was 8 years old and his mother the gamer she is, introduced games into his life. She would play Super Mario and Duck Hunt on Nintendo’s new gaming console. Matt’s fascination and passion for games began to grow and started to become an important part of his life. 

For the next 25 years, he realized that video games aren’t always ideal to be played in the living room. In his opinion, there are various levels of distractions not to mention, high foot-traffic areas. When gaming and movie enthusiasts take over a public space (e.g. living room or basement) they are sometimes criticized for having loud speakers or causing distractions and offending others. In spite of having widescreen TV’s it is still very easy for gamers to get distracted and be able to enjoy a game to it’s full potential.  

Out of this frustration, Matt’s idea to create a solution came into play.  He realized that the only solution to the problem was simple; he needed to create something that would allow more privacy and fewer distractions to gaming lovers like him.  That’s how he came up with the, Lifestyle Media Pod.



In The Box



Gameplay






Features Packed to WOW.

Dimension to get started.


(Note: Dimensions are an estimated measurement, wood products tend to fluctuate slightly.)


The Key



Marketing

Box'd Entertainment Inc. knows marketing is crucial for a business to survive. Having a new or niche product out on the market customers tend to have difficulties understanding the value behind it. This makes it harder for businesses to market their products and to use basic marketing tools. With the right kind of marketing, we can better educate our customers. This is where we need your help. 

During this campaign we will be offering free shipments on all units within the 48 states (Contiguous United States). That’s a saving of up to $2,000 based on the size, weight, crating of units and location. We have partnered with a local carrier who is willing to help and support with shipments for Box’d Entertainment Inc. In addition, we have aligned different perks depending on the amount of your contribution. This is as a token of appreciation for your support.


Here is a break down of where the funding will go.

(Note: This does not include free shipping perks.)


If your passion is gaming or watching movies, this product is a truly exceptional product you must have.  The ability to immerse your self inside this media pod is like no other.  Don’t take our word for it. 

Get In To It. 


 Your help will be greatly appreciated. 

 
If you are unable to show your support at this time “Get In To It” spread the word.
Don't forget Indiegogo share tools!


Perks

Please message us on your shirt size, men/women or controller design for  (PS4, XBOX1, XBOX360) based from the perk you select. Thank You.

Boxd Entertainment Pen

Boxd Entertainment T-Shirt

     


Boxd Entertainment T-Shirt (Ladies)

      


Boxd Entertainment Nike Polo

story_txt:
Lifestyle Media Pods
The future and the new
way to play your video games and watch your favorite movies!Lets take a few moments to analyze the value.----------Immerse Yourself.------------------Enhanced Experience------------Inside is where it happens.-------------------Get in to it---------------
Now thats value.

About Box'd Entertainment Inc.
We manufacture recreational and
gaming products designed to create immersive media environments and provide our
customers unique and heightened experiences. 
We are energized by a "can
do" attitude. Our Credo is that one can identify and solve a problem. That
it has a vision and energy to transform an idea into a viable product. We
question the status quo and deliver an answer that may be a bit radical. It is
the embodiment of the American pioneering spirit.
We have a vision to be a major factor
in shaping the future of gaming and entertainment, enabling players to
experience the utmost level of immersion and engagement, thereby improving
performance and enjoyment.
We have a mission to be the product
of choice for the world's gamers and media consumers. Box'd Entertainment
design and delivers the most immersive gaming, recreational and entertainment
experience in the market, helping everyone enjoy and enhance their media
consumption experience.
While gaming was the initial
application for product development, we discovered something else during the
prototype and testing phases.  Just as the Lifestyle Media Pods were ideal
for gaming, it was also an optimal experience for watching a movie. It was a
truly stunning and immersive experience.
When other companies focus on
products to wear for example gloves, vest, glasses/goggles, and headsets. We
focus on all of that in one unit. No need to wear silly uncomfortable products
that you’re not able to wear for long periods of time. No need to change a
room, remodel a basement or garage all that does is brings a houses value down
because it may not provide value to that next owner. No need to worry about
that here. We got the all in one package that will blow your entertainment
enjoyment away.
About the FounderMatt Winchester is the Founder. He’s also the inventor behind Boxd’s pioneering Lifestyle Media Pod (LMP) product. 




His gaming world came into perspective when he was 8 years
old and his mother the gamer she is, introduced games into his life. She would
play Super Mario and Duck Hunt on Nintendo’s new gaming console. Matt’s
fascination and passion for games began to grow and started to become an
important part of his life. For the next 25 years, he realized that video games
aren’t always ideal to be played in the living room. In his opinion, there are various
levels of distractions not to mention, high foot-traffic areas. When gaming and movie enthusiasts take over a public space (e.g. living
room or basement) they are sometimes criticized for having loud speakers or causing
distractions and offending others. In spite of having widescreen TV’s it is
still very easy for gamers to get distracted and be able to enjoy a game to
it’s full potential.  Out of this
frustration, Matt’s idea to create a solution came into play.  He realized that the only solution to the
problem was simple; he needed to create something that would allow more privacy
and fewer distractions to gaming lovers like him.  That’s how he came up with the, Lifestyle
Media Pod.

In The Box
Gameplay












Features Packed to WOW.Dimension to get started.


(Note: Dimensions are an estimated measurement, wood products tend to fluctuate slightly.)
The Key
Marketing
Box'd Entertainment Inc. knows marketing is crucial for a business to
survive. Having a new or niche product out on the market customers tend to have
difficulties understanding the value behind it. This makes it harder for
businesses to market their products and to use basic marketing tools. With the
right kind of marketing, we can better educate our customers. This is where we
need your help. 



During this campaign we will be offering
free shipments on all units within the 48 states (Contiguous United
States). That’s a saving of up to $2,000 based on the size, weight, crating of units and location. We have partnered with
a local carrier who is willing to help and support with shipments for Box’d Entertainment
Inc. In addition, we have aligned
different perks depending on the amount of your contribution. This is as a
token of appreciation for your support. 

Here is a break down of where the funding will
go.



(Note: This does not include free shipping perks.) 
If your passion is gaming or watching
movies, this product is a truly exceptional product you must have.  The ability to immerse your self inside this
media pod is like no other.  Don’t take
our word for it. 
Get In To It. 

 Your help will be greatly appreciated. 
 If you are unable to show your
support at this time “Get In To It” spread the word.
Don't forget Indiegogo share tools!
PerksPlease message us on your shirt size, men/women or controller design for  (PS4, XBOX1, XBOX360) based from the perk you select. Thank You.Boxd Entertainment PenBoxd Entertainment T-Shirt


     

Boxd Entertainment T-Shirt (Ladies)

      

Boxd Entertainment Nike Polo

If you refer anyone to us and make sure you let them know to follow the link, depending on the total amount donated by those you have referred. You will receive the perk that matches your total referral contributions. Hurry there's no time to waste.

story:
Patrimoine culturel, fiction transmédia et fun

Avec La Ligue des Gentlemans Cambrioleurs nous avons l'ambition de faire un jeu original, riche en gameplays et culturel.

Nous sommes attachés à notre région. C'est pour cela que nous sommes gamesBERRY et c'est aussi pour cela qu'on a souhaité l'utiliser comme toile de fond à notre univers. Au gré de hasards et de nos recherches, nous avons puisé dans ce patrimoine et bâti un cadre original et unique pour notre jeu.
Dans LGC vous découvrirez les mystères de Fiers Horizons, des monuments emblématiques du Berry, ou, en tout cas ce qu'ils sont devenus dans cette uchronie.

Du Berry à Fiers Horizons...

Cet univers a été conçu autour de 3 éléments centraux :
  1. un personnage : Alexandre Jacob
  2. une ressource rare, et même unique au monde : la quinciite
  3. et un territoire, celui de Fiers Horizons, dont le nom est tiré d'un jeu de sonorité avec VIERZON.

Plus qu'un jeu, un univers !

Fiers Horizons, c'est un jeu : la ligue des gentlemans cambrioleurs, mais aussi une nouvelle en cours de publication "Sombres Mémoires" et une bd (allez voir la galerie d'image !) qui constitue le chapitre 1 du jeu et qui raconte l'histoire d'un des protagonistes de cet univers : Matthias.

Un gameplay varié et original

Nous nous sommes inspirés de différents jeux, que se soient des jeux vidéo ou des jeux de société pour bâtir le nôtre. Voici certaines de nos inspirations :

  • Scotland Yard,
  • B.A.T. 2 the koshan conspiracy,
  • Paranoïa Mandatory Bonus Fun! Card Game,
  • Seed - the human condition,

story:
Unique battle system with mixture of turn based with real time battles

Fight and defeat enemies in strategic fights using a unique battle system inspired by best of JRPGs mixing best of turn based with real time game play.


Evolving Weapons
Unique weapons and skill progression system based on item and skill levelling with a skill tree offering multiple choices. Make crucial choices about your skill progression and customise weapons accordingly.

An Anime/Fantasy Open World
An Anime themed fantasy world inspired by the likes of Zelda games but much bigger. Begins your journey in the plains of Lodran, from grassy plains to hidden valleys to high mountains, from ruins of ancient cities to the dark recesses of under-world, explore freely a vast gaming play ground.

Choose Your Destiny
Live a rich and stirring adventure driven by the choices you make along the branching storyline and many sub-quests.

  • Release Platforms: PC/Mac/Linux and XBOX ONE/PS4/Wii U (Stretch goal required) and PS Vita (stretch goal required)
  • Release date: 2016
  • Early Concept Demo developed by a team of 5 people available for download


Lodran

Lodran, once a peaceful world, guarded by the power  of very ancient and mystical crystals and resulted in creation of three peaceful and harmonious realms of Sartou, Multa, and YarKahhn existing in balance.

And then It came..

Nobody knows the origin of It but it brought armies after armies of pure evil from the void opened. It destroyed the great magical city of Sartou, turning it into a haunted, ruined wasteland. In such desperate times, all people of Lodran formed The Committee and handed over all the powers of crystal through it to the Grand Commandant, Darrion, of the armies of Multa for the defence of Lodran and its three realms.


Battle after battle, victory after victory, the committee pushed the invaders back in the void in an effort to throw them back in the void and close it off with the powers of crystals. On the verge of defeat and unable to break the siege It released the most unimaginable horror, a terrifying weapon which people came to call "the sickness".

Now 50 years later war is still going on but people of Loran weakened by the sickness are losing hope and the bridgehead around the void is growing again.

The Sickness

While invaders stood in the fortress they had built around the void, the plague they released quickly spread in the lands of Loran. A frightening infliction, slowly turning everything it effects into half living and half dead, an intense pain leading to a madness.


The Committee

when Sartou got destroyed with its armies decimated, people formed the Committee and handed all the powers to its leader Darion to defeat the invaders, he did not get the approval of the power ruling house of YarKhaan. To counter this he started a civil war and rampaged through YarKhaan destroying any resistance he met. The Committee rules by decree and ruthlessly quells any opposition to its supreme authority. Any one who questions its authority has no other option but to run and seek protection in the vast desolate places of the old kingdom of YarKhaan.


Burshi is inspired by the tradition of great JRPGs for strategic combat and character progression, and we mixed it with successful western RPG model of open world and freedom to explore this world with a non-linear story.
Combat
Combat will offer a mixture of turn based with real time battles. Also weather or day/night cycle will buff up or down your weapon or spell depending upon your weapon/spell choices.


Advanced Leveling System
In Burshi, character can earn experience and level up their stats by it.
In addition to this classic system, weapon and skill categories will also earn experience the more you use a specific type of weapon or skill. For example a two handed weapons will earn experience if you use them more or a single handed weapons in case you use them more. The same goes for skills, using two weapons in both hands will level up 'two hands' skill more than 'one handed' skill. Your use of swords more will result in levelling up sword skills rather than archery. In short, you can not only finely control how you level up your character but build completely different characters by levelling them up differently. While levelling up you will gain 'Perks' which you can use to strategically upgrade your weapons and skills. Each choice you make, using a certain type of weapon, or a spell, or using perks to upgrade will strategically effect your game play.


Non-Linear Story
Burshi will offer a rich branching story driven by choices you will make.
Be warned, this will mean that you will not be able to play through all of the story in a single play through, as game is built so that your choices are not just cosmetic but does effect the overall story. On the other hand, this story than will offer you significant re-play value as well.

Your behaviour and choices will change the lands of Loran and your future possibilities according to who you talk to, who you decide to help or battle, quests you complete, the allies or enemies you make etc...


Why Crowdfund

We have been funding game development with our own funds. With Indiegogo, we hope to be able to boost development of our game further and offer gamers more and better content.

With extra funds we plan to add more members to our team for both artistic and development side. This will also offer us a great deal to preserve our creative freedom and independence. We intend to use portion of the funds to also fund great game sound design as well as more game sound tracks.

We have been working for months to make a good game, with your help we can make a great game!

 Please Vote for us on Steam Greenlight

Referral Rewards:

Refer your friends through indiegogo share tools on the left side and when your and your friends contributions reach a milestone you'll be enrolled for rewards draw:

1. Dragon  Pack (2 packs available): 

When your and or your friends contribution is at or above 300 USD.

Get Dragon Age: Origins, Peggle, Dead Space 2, Command & Conquer Generals + Zero Hour, Medal of Honor Allied Assault War Chest, Plants vs. Zombies Garden Warfare, Dragon Age II, Bejeweled 3, and Mass Effect 2

2. Assassins Pack (2 packs): 

When your and or your friends contribution is at or above 200 USD.

Get Hitman: Absolution, Supreme Commander 2, Murdered: Soul Suspect, Lara Croft and the Guardian of Light, Kane & Lynch Collection

3. Friends Pack: If your and or your friends contribution is at or above 100 US, we'll give to such valued members of our community invitation to participate in Alpha testing Daastan: A Dire Beginning @ 35 USD each. Plus 20 of the members will win one extra surprise steam game @ 25-50 USD.

story:
1000 World's Cutest Vocabulary Videos to the Karuta Card Game

With big dreams and a small budget, often times a collaborative effort is necessary.  An environment where everyone pulls together their resources to make one fully functioning machine of talent is the best way to make your dreams come true.  In 2012 we made a 1000 words into cute videos to enable children to learn and study for the English SAT.  If everyone pulls together and we can raise funding, I know this can be a success!  

Do you ever think about investing in the future of children?

Do you want to help but don’t know how?

Do you believe in learning while having fun?

If you answered, “Yes” to any of these questions, you may want to keep reading…


What We Need & What You Get

While we have been enjoying the quality of these videos, we would like to move to the next stage to make this video more enjoyable and accessible to many people by making this into the Karuta Card Game.

What is Karuta Game?


Karuta  is a Japanese card game. The basic idea of any karuta game is to be able to quickly determine which card out of an array of cards is required and then to grab the card before it is grabbed by an opponent. There are various types of cards which can be used to play karuta. It is also possible to play this game using two standard decks of playing cards.

There are two kinds of cards used in karuta. One kind is yomifuda (読札) or "reading cards", and the other is torifuda (取り札) or "grabbing cards." As they were denoted, the words in the yomifuda are read and players will have to find its associated torifuda before anybody else does.

Cited from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karuta



The Impact

There are many children who want to study English but has no access to computer or any device to play our video and watch.  By making this videos into card form in enjoyable game, we are sure that those children will also be benefited.

Risks & Challenges

We have created these cute characters in the videos. Now we have to incorporate those cute figures into card games. Simply copy and past the contents from the videos would not make a fun card game. With the fund we will receive from you, we will hire and consult the professional game creator such as Elan Lee who created Exploding Kittens.

*SAT is registered trademarks of the College Board.
