story:
My name is Louis Paul Wanshura. I was born in Minneapolis, Minnesota on February 14, 1992 into a very athletic family. Both my father and his brother played college baseball. Growing up, hockey was my life and blood during the Winter but I would always get the itch for dusting off the crooked sticks come Spring. As a youngster, I vividly remember not being able to sleep before a round of golf. The next morning, in my own awakened dream state of playing against the best players in the world on the greatest courses in the toughest conditions. With time I've only become more obsessed with the game but in more of a passionate, meditative way. We play the greatest game along side of mother earth - we are truly in mother nature's backyard. I know my relationship with the game of golf is "different" and that's why I am so passionate about my golf game and golf as a whole.

This campaign is important to me because as of this very moment, this is the only way I can obtain funding to pursue my dream which I will not stop pursuing until I achieve my goals.  My athletic career has been plagued with injuries, which stopped me from playing college sports, but I am finally healthy. With the help of contributors, you will help me achieve greatness in the golf world by winning tournaments and growing the game of golf through my mental game teachings.

Tournament entry fees range from $100-$950. I plan on playing up to 4 a month. Travel expenses range from $200 for a one day tournament up to $600 for a 3 day tournament for all expenses.

Money game entry fees will range from $50-$500. In which I plan on playing a few times a week.

My golf mentor/Coach will cost between $500-$1000 a month. Fitted Golf equipment will cost between $3000-$4500. Playing in a few tournaments a month and money games along with my coach I will easily hit the $50,000 mark for a full 12 month season.

Every individual who helps fund my dream will obtain tickets to any tournament they would like to attend. Along with any perks they feel obliged to (with in reason). Last but not least, money. Depending on the amount contributed, you will obtain a percentage of the money I will earn worldwide in my career as a professional golfer.

You are helping more then a golfer, you are helping the entire game of golf grow through simple mental game techniques and strategies. For too long, golf has been viewed as an "old white man's game." I will be apart of the movement to make it more of a sport that everyone wants to be a part of. 

This is my first project to raise money for my professional golf career. I hope you believe in me as much as I believe in myself. Hypothetically speaking if I don't make it to the PGA Tour the money will not go to waste as I am also studying hypnotherapy, sports psychology, and holistic medicine that will allow me to help teach the game of golf to the masses. So this will be great contribution in the field I will be studying. However, as I've mentioned, I will not quit until I reach my goals in the golfing world.

Please help get the word out about me, Louis Paul Wanshura, professional golfer. Please help guide me to reach my goals. Thank you very much for taking the time to consider contributing to my dream. Have an amazing day and please contact me with any further questions or comments (952) 297-2716, louiewanshura@gmail.com.

I know my relationship with the game of golf is "different" and that's why I am so passionate about my golf game and golf as a whole. 

This campaign is important to me because as of this very moment, this is the only way I can obtain funding to pursue my dream which I will not stop pursuing until I achieve my goals.  My athletic career has been plagued with injuries, which stopped me from playing college sports, but I am finally healthy. With the help of contributors, you will help me achieve greatness in the golf world by winning tournaments and growing the game of golf through my mental game teachings.

Tournament entry fees range from $100-$950. I plan on playing up to 4 a month. Travel expenses range from $200 for a one day tournament up to $600 for a 3 day tournament for all expenses.

Money game entry fees will range from $50-$500. In which I plan on playing a few times a week.
My golf mentor/Coach will cost between $500-$1000 a month. Fitted Golf equipment will cost between $3000-$4500. Playing in a few tournaments a month and money games along with my coach I will easily hit the $50,000 mark for a full 12 month season. 

Every individual who helps fund my dream will obtain tickets to any tournament they would like to attend. Along with any perks they feel obliged to (with in reason). Last but not least, money. Depending on the amount contributed, you will obtain a percentage of the money I will earn worldwide in my career as a professional golfer. 

You are helping more then a golfer, you are helping the entire game of golf grow through simple mental game techniques and strategies. For too long, golf has been viewed as an "old white man's game." I will be apart of the movement to make it more of a sport that everyone wants to be a part of. 
This is my first project to raise money for my professional golf career. I hope you believe in me as much as I believe in myself. Hypothetically speaking if I don't make it to the PGA Tour the money will not go to waste as I am also studying hypnotherapy, sports psychology, and holistic medicine that will allow me to help teach the game of golf to the masses. So this will be great contribution in the field I will be studying. However, as I've mentioned, I will not quit until I reach my goals in the golfing world. 

Please help get the word out about me, Louis Paul Wanshura, professional golfer. Please help guide me to reach my goals. Thank you very much for taking the time to consider contributing to my dream. Have an amazing day and please contact me with any further questions or comments (952) 297-2716, louiewanshura@gmail.com.

story:
If you've been into a Library in South Staffordshire the past few years, you may be aware of the gaming events that happen there.

Perton, Codsall, Wombourne, Brewood and Penkridge Libraries have all offered very well received game events in the past, planned and delivered by yours truly! My name's Scott by the way ^_^.

Unfortunately, doing these events has become increasingly difficult in recent months so I'm going private! Some of you may know I've been working on a World Record Attempt at doing the Longest Minecraft Marathon. Unfortunately, it's proving difficult to find professional witnesses, so consider these events an alternative until I can get that off the ground.

In the future, I'm hoping to move this new business of mine onto offering parties, pub events, conventions and team building for business. The dream would be to own a store, have a mobile vehicle kitted out to bring the party to you and ultimately make a living off my hobby,  but for now, I'm starting small and testing the waters.


What We Need & What You Get

 

I'm looking for £500 funding (mostly because £500 is the minimum target Indiegogo will allow). With this, I will be delivering 3 Minecraft Hunger Games events at Perton Library, Tuesday 22nd December 2015.

The funding will be split, with the first £200 going towards paying for my time and venue hire, then anything raised over that amount will be invested back into the company to deliver future events for you!

If you support this Indiegogo, in exchange for each £5 contribution, you will secure one ticket to one of the three event sessions (of your choice) happening on the 22nd December at Perton Library! If you require a double ticket, a contribution of £10 will allow you to secure a double ticket.

Please note, that if the campaign does not reach at least £50, the events will not go ahead as planned. In this instance, the campaign will be cancelled and your money will not be claimed.

 

The Impact

 

Idyll Games is now a registered business and this is something I would love to seriously pursue in the future, but for now, I'd like to see if the demand is there and offer something back to all the people who have participated and supported the games program I have run in the past at Perton Library and across the county.

Every penny will help me move closer to making a living doing what I love.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, aren't interested in gaming or just don't aren't able to attend the planned event, you can still help! share this Indiegogo with your friends, on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram.... tie a printout to your cat or something? Every bit helps!

story:
RUS Description  |  ENG Description  |  Backer Area Page

IMPORTANT!
We plan to release the game even if we are unable to reach the Funding Goal!
(We use Flexible Goal)
But of course, this may affect the release date. Details in FAQ

Hey, Newbie!
Yesterday, you enjoyed your quarter-pound burger sipping cool Coke. Your friend never showed up and introduced you to anyone. What a liar, huh? In fact, some weird girl in a “Game Over” hoodie was your last memory.

I know you’ve got plenty of questions, so let me break it down for you. Briefly, you are dead. Yeah, people are somewhat frail. But you died before expected, you know, tiredness, a bunch of work, old age, heh.

So make your sweet butt comfortable in this old cinema. Yeah, it’s a little lame and dull in here, but what did you expect? It’s a purgatory, and there’s no janitor to purge the filth in this place. And, in fact, the place itself had a pretty bad reputation. By the way, there’s a mop in the corner.

Oh, cheer up, you have fantastic roommates!
That redheaded kid in an old outfit by the bar is Bellboy. Yeah, she’s a girl, easy-going one, but she can drink as much beer as a bunch of Irish workers after a hard working day, so don’t even think about drinking her down for a bet. That tall lady is Sister June. She’ll probably take you to the School for Noble Maidens, so be careful with her.

That eternally sleeping and grumpy creature is Keyla. She is not going to rush to support you, so don’t even ask her.
The girl looking passionately at you is Ruby. She seems to like you, so let’s see how fast she’ll bring you under control.

My name is Fasaria, I’m the reaper, and it’s my fault that you’re here, or maybe it’s your own fault. Look at how you live, slouch and stuff yourself with junk food.

So, here’s a little deal for you. There’s no way you can just get out of here on your own, and I don’t want anyone from above to know about it. You and I are essentially in the same boat.
Let’s help each other, deal? Help me fix the screw-up, and we will try to return you back into your body like nothing has ever happened.

Besides, the ladies have several personal requests. Do it, and they’ll take good care of you, trust me. You are the only one of us who can walk through all the circles of hell without any consequences.

 

Freaked Fleapit is a game that combines two or more genres - Visual Novel and Rhythm Dungeon Crawler.

You play as a boy who is called Newbie by everyone. Somehow his soul was split from his body and was in an abandoned cinema. This place turns out to be nothing but a purgatory, doors of which leading to various different circles of hell.

Newbie’s tie seems strangely tied up with this location. In addition to rhythmic music, you have to go through all circles of hell, and every mistake will tighten the tie around Newbie’s neck and pull him back.

On your journey, you may meet the girls who need your assistance, and some of them might even become your romantic interest. And your choice will affect the way you get out of this place.

 

  • Release Platforms: PC/Mac, Switch
  • Estimated Release Date: August 2022 (for PC/Mac)
  • Languages: English, Russian
  • Genres: Rhythm Dungeon Crawler, Dating Simulator, Roguelike, Visual Novel, Music Video Game
 

Inside the Freaked Fleapit

Each door leads to different circles of hell

Freaked Fleapit takes its place in the middle of nowhere
 

 

 

"Put it back, you little thief!"

 

Freaked Fleapit gameplay more rely on events in music (such as drops, glitches, etc.) than just rhythm.

 

NEWBIE

Poor fella.
Good, very good boy. Polite, honest, shy, and kind.
Obeys his mum and does exercises every morning.
Has very gentle nature


 
 

RUBY

The poltergeist girl
Eternal child. Hyperactive, erratic, and curious.

“Heeeey, goner!”
 
 

SISTER JUNE

Retired angel
Protector. High-hat. Hard-worker.

“You've decided to bother me with this petty matter?”
 
 

BELLBOY

Lost soul
Happy-go-lucky. Flippant. Open-minded.

“What’s up, boy?”
 
 

KEYLA

Demon. Loner. Heavy sleeper

“Ah, what? Need something?”
 
 

FASARIA

Grim Reaper
Rebel. Irritable. Remains neutral.

“Take it easy, stuff happens.”

▶ follow her on Twitter and Instagram! ◀


 





Your actions and the finished quests will modify the storyline and your relationship with the characters

 

Discord Rank

You get a Discord Rank according to the amount of contribution.
$3-25: Imp, $40: Nightmare, $55: Leviathan, $90: Mamona, $200: Belphegor, $400: Asmodeus, $555: Belzebub, $1100: Lucifer

Telegram Stickers

You get a link to the Telegram Messenger sticker set. Stickers drawn by our diligent illustrators will allow you to express the widest range of emotions through our characters.
We would try to introduce the sticker pack to other messengers and social networks, where stickers can be used.

Estimated date: End of May 2021

Access to Extended Dev-Log

Go all the way with us to build the Freaked fleapit game and its universe.
With this reward, you will get access to an extended game development blog, where you will be able to watch some backstage of the development process.

Estimated date: May 2021

Digital Copy of the Game

You will receive a DRM-free digital copy of the Freaked Fleapit game and a personal license key for it.
The current estimated date of completion is August 2022, but it may change. We will do our best to finish the game as fun and lively as possible.

HD Digital Wallpaper Pack

Get a pack of high-quality wallpapers with game characters for your desktop or mobile devices.

Character Creation Pooling

The world of the Freaked Fleapit universe is constantly growing and evolving right now, And you can control what it will become. We plan to add new characters in the game, so you can take part in polls to see what the next characters will be like, from their looks to personality traits.

Mantis in-game Accessories

The charming mantis Jack is Bellboy’s eternal companion. To make him even more alluring, activate the special personal code in the game to unlock secret quests to collect accessories for Jack!

Digital Soundtrack

Music in Freaked Fleapit is not just a background, but a vital part of the game experience that just won't go out of your head :)
If you want the awesome music from the Magnetude band to stay with you, this reward item is for you.
This reward includes the soundtrack in MP3 format.

Digital Artbook

Our game is full of colorful illustrations and pixel art. With this reward, you will get a digital copy of an art book with illustrations, concepts, and pictures not used in the game.

Dakimakura Pillowcase

You get a 150 cm × 50 cm (20 x 59 inches) standard dakimakura pillowcase with the Freaked Fleapit character of your choice.
Worldwide shipping.
A limited quantity is available.

Estimated date: July 2021

Lossless Digital Soundtrack

Here’s a reward for a real audiophile. We will send you the original Freaked Fleapit soundtrack in lossless compression format.
This reward includes the soundtrack in an option of FLAC or ALAC format.

Early Beta-access

After signing NDA you will have access to the first beta-versions of the game, and you will be the first one to go deep into the universe of Freaked Fleapit.

Your Name on a Film Reel

The archives of Freaked Fleapit cinema store a countless number of reels that hold the strangest memories of sinners’ souls and other souls which got into the Limbo. Leave your name and a short passage of your freaky story in the archive.
(Stories go through pre-moderation)

Your Name on a GLOWING Reel

Same as the above, but your reel will glow with the color of your choice.

Your Name on an Artifact in the Game

Your name will be placed on a random artifact in the endless corridors of the circles of hell in the Freaked Fleapit world. Any player will be able to stumble upon it and probably get a bonus.

Character(NPC) Based on You

Send us your picture, and we will make a non-playable character based on your look. Any player will be able to meet him in a circle of hell and talk a bit. ;)
 

The Anglo-Russian hybrid known as Magnetude shakes the very core of drum and bass for the past four years, drawing for their own unique twist on the neuro infused dancefloor tracks which have graced the catalogues of leading labels such as RAM, Viper, and Eatbrain.
Magnetude’s firing formula continues to bubble and heat up, and a name tipped by many to be a leading force for the future of Drum & Bass.

story:
Who we are at Robot City Games

We first opened Robot City games in 2008 in a small storefront in Binghamton, New York. It's truly a successful small, family business and for years we've put everything we've made into constant improvements and upgrades. 

At first we carried a mix of video games and card games and slowly we started replacing the gaming tables with arcade games to focus on our passion and expertise. 

While expanding our store and arcade at the same time we ran out of room and an opportunity presented it's self when the business next door closed. We quickly rented the adjoining space, had a doorway installed between the storefronts and slowly started filling the additional 1200 square foot space with arcade games, adding lighting and an atmosphere that was lost in modern arcades. We started an eclectic mix of games from all time periods, no matter what the highlight of your arcade experience was as a child, when you turned a corner you were there.

We do not want to be another retail chain store with the same old stuff. While we do sell modern games, we look at our store as more in the style of a curated book store, high quality and organized to cover the entire range of video game history. We look at our arcade in the same way. 

 We saved every dime we could with a bigger goal in mind and in early 2015 we found the right place. A 7000 square foot building was for sale just a block away and perfect for what we wanted to do based on the feedback we've gotten from our customers over the last 7 years. We put a down payment down and started work on our building. 

By 2011 we had built our arcade up to 17 games. It felt like a lot at the time... Now in 2016 we have over 100 and there's still room to grow!


October of 2015 we moved into the new space filling it with games we had been repairing and stockpiling and it was everything we had hoped it would be. 

We now have 18 pinball machines and counting...


After months spent repairing the building, redoing the floors, painting the walls in 16 colors and installing color changing lights to make the walls morph and bend colors, we were ready to provide an amazing environment to play your choice of over 100 arcade games including a big row of pinball and the space to add 20-30 more games when we find the right machines. 


A row of classics...


We were a big hit and everything was going great. We have regulars that drive for hours every week to take in the arcade and grab some Nintendo or Xbox One games on their way out.

 We stock thousands and thousands of console games, modern and retro.

We had become a tourist attraction and also locally known for a great date night, family time out or a great, inexpensive place to go with your friends. We still saved everything we could for buying more games and really become all we can be. All the hard work was paying off as we saw the fruition of years and years of work becoming reality. 

We have arcade games of all eras, practically a museum that you can play! 

So why are we asking for help?


An unexpected roadblock

It seems we have grown too big, too fast. Local government has decided we need some additional safety features and we had to close the arcade side of the new space until we can provide them. We were allowed to move 20 games into the store side but can't reopen the arcade to the public until we build a hallway through our back room for an emergency exit, install a fire alarm system and sprinkler system.

We are saving all we can from sales but they are hampered by the fact that 3/4 of our building is closed and there is less motivation to visit with the main attraction gone.

 

(We are not really protesting, we understand this needs to be done. )


The Impact of your help

We want to be a safe place, we pride ourselves on being a family friendly environment, a fantastic place to take your children, family, friends or your date where you can have hours of affordable fun. 

We overlooked the requirements for a building of this size but understand the need to do the right thing and get it up to code. Safety of our guests has always been important and if this makes it safer for our patrons, then so be it. 


Risks & Challenges

There are no risks. We are a successful business who serves the local community as well as the video game community. We are proud to have become a destination, a stop along the way for gamers everywhere when they plan their road trips and we are proud that international visitors who have not seen a proper arcade in 30 years plan their trips to include us.  We also love our local community and being an active member in revitalizing our city.

Our only challenge is to get this going again ASAP. Any little bit will help in this goal. 

T Shirt perk! Limited Edition Gold on black! Screen printed by Muckles' Ink! 


We are offering great and valuable perks and will be adding special stock and exclusive events to those from time to time to help raise these funds. Every cent we raise in this  campaign will be used towards this goal, anything we raise over this goal will go directly into improving the arcade and arcade experience for you. 

Hoodie perk! Limited Edition Gold on black! Screen printed by Muckles' Ink! 


Other Ways You Can Help

With your help we hope to make this happen sooner rather than later and get this great thing going again. 

If you can't stop by in person to show your support please contribute by sharing this campaign within your online community, we appreciate your help spreading the word and keeping the classic arcade experience alive! If you're able, grab one of the great perks we are offering. 

I've added my own personal collection to our store's stock, a massive video game collection I've built for over 25 years, our already incredible stock has just gotten even better. Come buy some :)


Our Nintendo section, full of rarities collected from the last 25 years!


We thank you and hope to see you soon!

A 7000 square foot building was for sale just a block away and perfect for what we wanted to do based on the feedback we've gotten from our customers over the last 7 years. We put a down payment down and started work on our building. 


By 2011 we had built our arcade up to 17 games. It felt like a lot at the time... Now in 2016 we have over 100 and there's still room to grow!



October of 2015 we moved into the new space filling it with games we had been repairing and stockpiling and it was everything we had hoped it would be. 


We now have 18 pinball machines and counting...

After months spent repairing the building, redoing the floors, painting the walls in 16 colors and installing color changing lights to make the walls morph and bend colors, we were ready to provide an amazing environment to play your choice of over 100 arcade games including a big row of pinball and the space to add 20-30 more games when we find the right machines. 




A row of classics...

We were a big hit and everything was going great. We have regulars that drive for hours every week to take in the arcade and grab some Nintendo or Xbox One games on their way out.


 We stock thousands and thousands of console games, modern and retro.


We had become a tourist attraction and also locally known for a great date night, family time out or a great, inexpensive place to go with your friends. We still saved everything we could for buying more games and really become all we can be. All the hard work was paying off as we saw the fruition of years and years of work becoming reality. 


We have arcade games of all eras, practically a museum that you can play! 

So why are we asking for help? 
   An unexpected roadblock It seems we have grown too big, too fast. Local government has decided we need some additional safety features and we had to close the arcade side of the new space until we can provide them. We were allowed to move 20 games into the store side but can't reopen the arcade to the public until we build a hallway through our back room for an emergency exit, install a fire alarm system and sprinkler system.
We are saving all we can from sales but they are hampered by the fact that 3/4 of our building is closed and there is less motivation to visit with the main attraction gone.
 
(We are not really protesting, we understand this needs to be done. )

The Impact of your help
 We want to be a safe place, we pride ourselves on being a family friendly environment, a fantastic place to take your children, family, friends or your date where you can have hours of affordable fun. 
We overlooked the requirements for a building of this size but understand the need to do the right thing and get it up to code. Safety of our guests has always been important and if this makes it safer for our patrons, then so be it.  

    Risks & Challenges There are no risks. We are a successful business who serves the local community as well as the video game community. We are proud to have become a destination, a stop along the way for gamers everywhere when they plan their road trips and we are proud that international visitors who have not seen a proper arcade in 30 years plan their trips to include us.  We also love our local community and being an active member in revitalizing our city.
Our only challenge is to get this going again ASAP. Any little bit will help in this goal. 


T Shirt perk! Limited Edition Gold on black! Screen printed by Muckles' Ink! 

We are offering great and valuable perks and will be adding special stock and exclusive events to those from time to time to help raise these funds. Every cent we raise in this  campaign will be used towards this goal, anything we raise over this goal will go directly into improving the arcade and arcade experience for you. 
    

Hoodie perk! Limited Edition Gold on black! Screen printed by Muckles' Ink! 

Other Ways You Can Help
 
With your help we hope to make this happen sooner rather than later and get this great thing going again. 
If you can't stop by in person to show your support please contribute by sharing this campaign within your online community, we appreciate your help spreading the word and keeping the classic arcade experience alive! If you're able, grab one of the great perks we are offering. 
I've added my own personal collection to our store's stock, a massive video game collection I've built for over 25 years, our already incredible stock has just gotten even better. Come buy some :) 



Our Nintendo section, full of rarities collected from the last 25 years! 
 We thank you and hope to see you soon!

story:
Facebook | Twitter | Youtube

Good News!!

Our game, Transcend has been GREENLIT!!! That means that the world's largest digital distributor of video games has agreed to carry our game in their store!

But now that means that the heat is on! We are very grateful to the many people who visited our page and voted to have our game Greenlit and we don't want to disappoint them. We want this game to be as awesome as we envisioned it. But we're going to need some help to get it done...


About the Game

Transcend is a very unique game with some very unique gameplay mechanics. It is the story of an average guy who is given the power to bring himself back from the dead and travel back in time. The story unfolds as the player guides the character through mind bending puzzles that utilize intuitive game mechanics that capitalize of the player's special powers. 


Mechanics 

Resurrection: By using an ancient artifact, the bones of an ancient wizard, the player has the ability to bring him/herself back from the dead. This is not merely a way to avoid death so as to make the player invincible to his/her enemies. Far from it. Each puzzle in the game depends on the player's ability to die and come back from the dead. In each level the player will notice that some walls and platforms are transparent/ghostly. While the player is alive, he/she will be able to pass directly through these objects. But when the player dies, he/she collides with these ghostly objects while passing through the solid ones. Instead of being a punishment for failure, in this game, death becomes a means to an end. 


Time Travel:

The player will also have the ability to travel back in time. Imagine if Marty McFly knew that, in the future, he would travel back in time and visit his past self. By knowing this ahead of time he would have been able to cooperate with his past self to accomplish what would otherwise be impossible. In Transcend, you will do just that. In levels that feature the time travel mechanic, the player will be called upon to complete the level once while anticipating what his/her future self will do, then again while cooperating with his/her past self. This mechanic is accomplished by recording the game pad inputs from the player and playing them back on a clone of the player. Such an approach allows for advanced game play by slightly altering the level as the player returns to it a second time. For example, imagine holding down the left button to run left and hitting a wall, but instead of releasing the button you continue to hold it down. With the wall in the way, the player will not move. But what if you were to later come back to that level but this time remove the wall. You will see your previous self running to the left, but with the wall out of the way, he will continue to run. We have packed several puzzles into Transcend that will require the player to think carefully as they use this unique and intuitive mechanic.

 



Angels and Demons: Since the player will be carefully walking the fence between life and death, eventually he/she will come in contact with beings from the other side. Both angels and demons are only interested in the player while he/she is a ghost. Both characters move along their own predetermined path (usually just pacing back and forth) until the player becomes a ghost and comes within their field of vision. When this happens the angel will fly toward (or chase) the player. When the angel comes in contact with the player the player will be resurrected by the angel. After this the angel will resume his original path but will do so from this new location. This means that the player has the ability to move the angel around in order to cause the angel to collide with the demon. When this happens, the demon is killed by the angel. This is important because when the demon comes in contact with the player while the player is a ghost, the demon will kill the player’s soul, thus bringing the level to an end. 



Wormholes: One way to escape the demon or the angel is to jump into wormholes that may be scattered around the level. A worm hole is a passage way through space-time. By entering a worm hole, you immediately come out the other side. That other side may be in the same level, or in another level. It may even be at another point in time! (see the time-travel section). The worm holes will be color coded so if you see two blue wormholes, it’s a pretty safe bet that entering one will cause you to come out of the other.


The Story 

Much thought and brainstorming has gone into the storyline. The game will have an elaborate storyline that includes the main character obtaining necromantic abilities from the residual magical properties from the remains of an ancient wizard's body. We'll tell the story of how this wizard came to be, how he died and how the main character found his remains. Fleshing out this story in the game will give the game a much richer feel and make it more of an adventure game rather than a puzzle platformer.


Meet the Lead Designer

Brian learned the basics of game design while studying Game and Simulation Programming at DeVry University. It was there he was introduced to GameMaker: Studio. Over the years he has become an expert in this engine and is now developing Transcend with it. Prior to the beginning of this project, Brian has created several projects for the Android OS. Titles include a retro-style endless runner called Run Bot Run, a hack and slash platformer called Novitas, and a touch screen running game called Twiddle Race. One title that he is particularly proud of that had to go on hold while he works on Transcend is an ariel combat game with the working title Dog Fight.  


What will we do with the money?

This question has a very simple answer: 100% of the funds received will go to the art studio that will be redoing the art for the game. Even if we do not reach our goal, everything we do receive will go to them. The programming and level design are almost finished and do not require any additional funds to complete.


On our Steam Greenlight page we've received mostly positive comments. The few negative comments we've received were all enjoining us to improve the art. With your help we can make that happen.


Risks and Challenges 

Since you will be contributing your hard earned money to this project we want to make sure that you are always in the know about what is happening in the development process. At no time do we want any of our backers wondering what we are doing with their money. We also consider our backers to be part of our team and we want you to feel as such.

To that end, we take the Transparency Pledge:

We pledge to be open and honest regarding all matters, good and bad, with frequent updates to all backers of this project. We will host a development blog that will update at least twice a week (Mondays and Wednesdays). This blog will contain all details about every aspect of the development process. Every milestone and every setback. We also invite you to follow us both on Twitter for daily updates (@CNazario_design and @BrianDColon). When something happens, you will know about it.

Even though we have developed and published smaller games in the past, this is our first major release. With that comes all the challenges that come with doing something for the first time. We are however confident that we can get this done. And like we said in our pledge, we will keep you updated every step of the way.

story:
ULTIMATE PIXEL TURN-BASED LIFE SIMULATOR with BACK STORY is HERE!

New Life is what retro gaming was all about! Cool and engaging gameplay, mega bulk graphics and acting! Sweet eighties and nineties vibe! And You can play with Your friends and family - up to FOUR players.




New Life is a pixelart game from the Director and Co-Writer of THE WITCHER and DYING LIGHT - Marcin Nowak, teams up with the creators of the first WITCHER game! Real gamedev veterans back to back with great younger game developers!

 It`s the begining of the ninties. You are looking for a new start and find secluded mountain town - New Salem. As You get there You find out that bridge leading to town crashed cuting the only way out of New Salem. Why?


You have two options:

1. SIM. Just live Your New life in New Salem, learn, eat, work, adopt a dog, play mini games, buy a car or a trip to the moon or...

2. ADVENTURE. Investigate strange New Salem`s story! Full of dark secrets, ghosts of the past, various incredible puzzles and TIME TRAVEL...what?!

It`s a turn-based just like a board games. It means 4 players can compete in one game! You can win both in Sim and Adventure Modes. Strategy, economics, fun or investigation and puzzle solving - choice is Yours!

We have full Soundtrack for You. Original music composed by Kuba Wandachowicz and ambients and sound created by Marcin Nowak. They will take You to the heart of New Salem.


BUILDINGS & CHARACTERS  

We`ve got 17 unique pixelart locations in New Salem. Some refere to buildings You might know. We like`em but You`ll be the judge.


16 main characters and few uninvited guests and lots and lots of items. Characters mood change so gameplay can change everytime You play. Live-action actors mixed with pixel art - it takes us all back!


EVERY GAME IS DIFFERENT! You can play New Life many times and gameplay will differ every time. Not only because of Your decisions but also because the game also changes. In Adventure mode puzzles will change in every game so You won`t get bored.

There are also special missions and...

SCARY MONSTERS!

...scary monsters, supernatural and extraterrestial events. Och yes! New Salem was build on a burial grouds. We all know what that means...


Town`s story is full of strange events and creatures! Beware!

NEW LIFE: NEW SALEM & OTHER CHAPTERS

What You see is just a first part of "New Life"! We are already working on next chapters! It`s not like we`re going to add few items or icons, changes are big! You`ll be getting brand new gameplay, characters, buildings and puzzles! All that in a price of DLC`s.


MINI RETRO GAMES

In "New Life" we have a bunch of retro games! You can play them as long as You want and feel vibe of peny arcades again!


EIGHTIES AND NINETIES

You remember times when Al Bundy roared? We do too! Watching "the Goonies" on VHS with Your family, laying on the floor. With only one telephone at home! "New Life" is loaded with retro and pop culture references. Let us know what You`ve found!

It`s all in Your hands. We already know that Steam Team wants to publish New Life! It`s a great news. So expect to see New Life on Steam this July!

But New Life has this great feature like Multiplayer. It`s real fun to play with Your family or friends on one machine. So we are aiming for consoles as well. More support from You would help us achive those goals:

THIS GAME IS MADE BY GAMERS FOR GAMERS!
IT`S A TRIBUTE TO RETRO GAMES FROM MARRIED WITH CHILDREN ERA! :)

PLEASE SUPPORT OUR GAME AND HAVE A LOT OF FUN PLAYING IT SOON!

Risks and challenges

We are a professional team. Obstacles before us are completelly in our grasp. All we need is a financial support to finish this great game. We`ve started in 2014 and we are very close to the finish line.
Because of many new ideas and improvements developement took longer than we first assumed. Production process in very expensive and we have promotion ahead. But most important thing is that we are already working on next chapters! All we need is Your help funding "New Life". Thank You all!

story:
The story

"Embers of the Gods" is a story about a cyclic period in time when the gods are "renewed" or "replaced".  The god of nature going rogue brings about this time of change and manifests itself as anomalies in nature. Cold climate regions suddenly spawn pockets of tropical oasis, desert regions experience blankets of snow and ice. Throughout this period of change, the nature god sends hordes of his minions to destroy the world. The fate of the world, and ultimately the gods, relies on the actions of a commoner and a small group of adventurers.

In our game, players develop their party though exploration, combat, questing, and leveling up. The game world is rich with lore and immersive environments where countless treasures lie undiscovered. Deep lore and compelling story lines motivate the player to realize their true destiny which is ultimately to become gods.

What we are doing

This campaign is to raise funds for the development of a role playing video game that is influenced by old school RPG's like Might and Magic 6 and Wizardry 8. Our team here at Fortune Game Studio are inspired to bring you a gaming experience that will entertain you for years to come. Our goals are to achieve our game development dreams and leave a lasting impression on the world with this game.

This first fund raising campaign is to gain enough funds to develop our prototype demo into a more professional and polished work. Our next round of fund raising will occur after we have completed the work on our prototype demo, and it will encompass the entire development cycle of the full game. However, your contributions to this campaign and accompanying perk rewards will apply to the full game.

* Please note that accompanying demos, screenshots and videos all represent a work in progress and not the final product. The playable demo has many placeholder assets/artwork and may contain bugs and/or incomplete features as it is still in pre-alpha state. Most of the screen shots that are showcased were taken in 1080p, and they appear blurry in the thumbnails due to the size difference. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Who we are

The development team at Fortune Game Studio is loaded with talented and professional developers that are dedicated to bringing this gaming experience to you. Our team and some of their accomplishments include:

  1. Travis Herdt - Concept artist
    • Concept artist at Iron Belly Studios
    • Senior 3d artist at Forsaken Studios
    • Creative lead at Ignite Marketing
    • https://www.behance.net/travisherdt
  2. Gustavo Coutinho - Musician / SFX
    • Music composer and sound designer for games like Reaching for Petals, Roots of Insanity, Space Conquest, Forgotten Wish, Mini Truck Madness, and others.
    • https://soundcloud.com/abrasounds
    • https://www.abrasounds.com/
  3. Pedro Cesar - 3d modeler, Environment artist, animator
    • 3d animator for the short movie Gadanthara
    • Environment designer for Projeto Pro-Memoria
    • Lead 3d artist at JetDragon Games
    • Co-founder of Last Ship Studios, 3d artist, game designer and writer.
    • https://pcportfoliogd.wordpress.com/
    • ​https://pedrocesar.artstation.com/
    • http://www.lastshipstudios.com/
    • https://detaillibrarycommittee.wordpress.com/ca...
    • http://passeiovirtualbh1911.blogspot.com.br/201... 
  4. Mario Graca - 3d modeler, concept artist, animator
    • Editing and production assistant for the short film, "The Archive".
    • Produced 3d assets for a Portuguese television series, "Ministry of Time".
    • https://www.artstation.com/tek
    • http://mariograca.wixsite.com/portf/about
    • https://www.linkedin.com/in/mariograca/
  5. Mark Roller - Level designer, 3d modeler
    • Graduated from Orlando Tech's 3d modeling and animation program
    • Owner of Angry Hobbit Art where he published art packs on the Unity asset store and developed an extensive library of 3d model prefabs for level development.
    • Level designer and audio engineer at Smiling Gator Studios.
    • http://markrollerportfolio.my-free.website/port...
  6. Nemanja Jovanovic "Fracturize" - UI and Icon designer
    • Graphics artist at TBA (Any companies worth noting?)
    • http://nemanjajovanovic.com/
    • https://www.behance.net/gallery/59028137/-Tatto...
  7. Jonathan Gronli - Writer and webmaster
    • Narrative Designer for Towers of Ajura by Darklore Studio.
    • Webmaster for a variety of websites, including the website for Towers of Ajura.
    • Co-writer of and actor in the short film "The Road Home".
    • https://www.linkedin.com/in/jonathan-gronli-m-a...
  8. John Leopold - Animator
    • Rigger and animator at Iron Belly Studios
    • Developed several point and click adventure games with Phoenix Online Studios including the Gabriel Knight 20th anniversary remake.
    • https://jandrewleopold.myportfolio.com/
  9. Rick Smith - Programmer, project manager
    • Owner of Fortune Game Studio
    • Advanced C# programmer and Unity developer.
    • Published several editor extensions on the Unity asset store.
    • https://ingot0.wixsite.com/fortunegamestudio
    • https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/tools/uti...

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for a modest level of funding for developing a large scale RPG:

  • Our funding needs are very concise. We will develop "Embers of the Gods" on a two year cycle with all of our team members working at indie rates. Every position on the team is essential and the budgeting for development is as lean as we can make it while still being able to support ourselves.
  • If we do not achieve our specific funding goals during this campaign, the funds that we do raise will pay our team to improve our prototype demo. We will continue to develop our core game code and improve our presentation to ensure that eventually we do achieve our financial goals.
  • Some of our perks are designed to get you involved with the development process of "Embers of the Gods". The alpha and beta tester perks let you get an insider's point of view, get you involved in identifying bugs, give you early access to the game, and keep you up to date with our progress.
  • A couple of our perks reward you with an in-game item and/or a bonus level. The item will be of artifact quality, which is the highest quality in the game, and the bonus level was our original demo level that ended up being too far out of scope for the vertical slice. There are many areas outside and inside to explore and several quests to complete, involving a village community alongside a majestic glacial lake. Parts of this region can be seen in our trailers and screen shots, but I don't want to reveal too much. This content is exclusive to our Franklin level contributors.

The Impact

Every dollar that is contributed to our cause will have a great impact on our ability to develop this game. We have been able to develop our prototype demo on a very small budget with only a few of us working part time. Your gifts will help us make our dreams come true and allow us to provide some really great entertainment for many people.

  • "Embers of the Gods" is Rick's personal vision quest to bring back some of the magic of old school RPG's that has been missing from the world for so long. "I believe that I can deliver a level of entertainment that will go down in history as one of the all time greats".

Risks & Challenges

There are minor risks and challenges that we will face, but our team is ready to overcome any obstacles that we encounter. Some of the challenges that we face are:

  1. Team dissolution
    • The team is all pro, but it could dissolve at some point for any given reason.
  2. Going over budget
    • It is possible that we may have some oversights that we have not accounted for, but with our careful planning and a deep understanding of the development process, we can achieve our goals within the established boundaries.
  3. Technology dependence
    • Our development platform, the Unity 3d game engine, is reliable and proven in games like Wasteland 2, Deus Ex: The Fall, and Assassins Creed: Identity, but there still remains our dependency upon Unity developers to continue to provide a stable and bug free platform.

What qualifies us to overcome these risks and challenges?

  • With years of Unity development experience between us, our team is competent and capable of overcoming any hurdles that may arise with our development platform. The team at Unity has a capable support network that we can reach out to and resolve issues.
  • If we do go over budget, it is not a game ender. We can always return to funding and continue our efforts through other means and investments.
  • Although our team consists of highly talented individuals that were hand picked for their positions, there are thousands of similarly talented developers that can continue where others have left off.
  • We have a collective level of accomplishment that assures our success and your satisfaction. The team was carefully assembled with all the right talents in all the right places to deliver a stellar product.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel compelled to contribute to the development of "Embers of the Gods", but are unable to make financial donations, there are other ways that you can help. 

  • Please tell all of your friends about us.
  • Share our public website links on social media.
  • Join our online community and get involved with the development.
  • Please use the IndieGoGo sharing tools alongside the "Back it" button at the top.

Links

Please visit and share the following links:

  1. Game Website:
    • http://ingot0.wixsite.com/embersofthegods
  2. Facebook Page:
    • https://www.facebook.com/pg/FortuneGameStudio
  3. Twitter:
    • https://twitter.com/EmbersOfTheGods
  4. Youtube Channel:
    • https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCTZk-tB0-vJ651...
  5. GameJolt
    • https://gamejolt.com/games/embersofthegods/319569
  6. IndieDB
    • http://www.indiedb.com/games/embersofthegods
story_txt:
The story
"Embers of the Gods" is a story about a cyclic period in time when the gods are "renewed" or "replaced".  The god of nature going rogue brings about this time of change and manifests itself as anomalies in nature. Cold climate regions suddenly spawn pockets of tropical oasis, desert regions experience blankets of snow and ice. Throughout this period of change, the nature god sends hordes of his minions to destroy the world. The fate of the world, and ultimately the gods, relies on the actions of a commoner and a small group of adventurers.
In our game, players develop their party though exploration, combat, questing, and leveling up. The game world is rich with lore and immersive environments where countless treasures lie undiscovered. Deep lore and compelling story lines motivate the player to realize their true destiny which is ultimately to become gods.
What we are doing
This campaign is to raise funds for the development of a role playing video game that is influenced by old school RPG's like Might and Magic 6 and Wizardry 8. Our team here at Fortune Game Studio are inspired to bring you a gaming experience that will entertain you for years to come. Our goals are to achieve our game development dreams and leave a lasting impression on the world with this game.
This first fund raising campaign is to gain enough funds to develop our prototype demo into a more professional and polished work. Our next round of fund raising will occur after we have completed the work on our prototype demo, and it will encompass the entire development cycle of the full game. However, your contributions to this campaign and accompanying perk rewards will apply to the full game.
* Please note that accompanying demos, screenshots and videos all represent a work in progress and not the final product. The playable demo has many placeholder assets/artwork and may contain bugs and/or incomplete features as it is still in pre-alpha state. Most of the screen shots that are showcased were taken in 1080p, and they appear blurry in the thumbnails due to the size difference. Thank you for your patience and understanding.
Who we are
The development team at Fortune Game Studio is loaded with talented and professional developers that are dedicated to bringing this gaming experience to you. Our team and some of their accomplishments include:

Travis Herdt - Concept artist
Concept artist at Iron Belly Studios
Senior 3d artist at Forsaken Studios
Creative lead at Ignite Marketing
https://www.behance.net/travisherdt


Gustavo Coutinho - Musician / SFX
Music composer and sound designer for games like Reaching for Petals, Roots of Insanity, Space Conquest, Forgotten Wish, Mini Truck Madness, and others.
https://soundcloud.com/abrasounds
https://www.abrasounds.com/


Pedro Cesar - 3d modeler, Environment artist, animator
3d animator for the short movie Gadanthara
Environment designer for Projeto Pro-Memoria
Lead 3d artist at JetDragon Games
Co-founder of Last Ship Studios, 3d artist, game designer and writer.
https://pcportfoliogd.wordpress.com/
​https://pedrocesar.artstation.com/

http://www.lastshipstudios.com/
https://detaillibrarycommittee.wordpress.com/ca...

http://passeiovirtualbh1911.blogspot.com.br/201... 


Mario Graca - 3d modeler, concept artist, animator
Editing and production assistant for the short film, "The Archive".
Produced 3d assets for a Portuguese television series, "Ministry of Time".
https://www.artstation.com/tek
http://mariograca.wixsite.com/portf/about
https://www.linkedin.com/in/mariograca/


Mark Roller - Level designer, 3d modeler
Graduated from Orlando Tech's 3d modeling and animation program
Owner of Angry Hobbit Art where he published art packs on the Unity asset store and developed an extensive library of 3d model prefabs for level development.
Level designer and audio engineer at Smiling Gator Studios.
http://markrollerportfolio.my-free.website/port...


Nemanja Jovanovic "Fracturize" - UI and Icon designer
Graphics artist at TBA (Any companies worth noting?)
http://nemanjajovanovic.com/
https://www.behance.net/gallery/59028137/-Tatto...


Jonathan Gronli - Writer and webmaster
Narrative Designer for Towers of Ajura by Darklore Studio.
Webmaster for a variety of websites, including the website for Towers of Ajura.
Co-writer of and actor in the short film "The Road Home".
https://www.linkedin.com/in/jonathan-gronli-m-a...


John Leopold - Animator
Rigger and animator at Iron Belly Studios
Developed several point and click adventure games with Phoenix Online Studios including the Gabriel Knight 20th anniversary remake.
https://jandrewleopold.myportfolio.com/


Rick Smith - Programmer, project manager
Owner of Fortune Game Studio
Advanced C# programmer and Unity developer.
Published several editor extensions on the Unity asset store.
https://ingot0.wixsite.com/fortunegamestudio
https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/tools/uti...

story:
Add demo to your Steam library!

Journey of Life is a survival game set on an exotic island somewhere in the Pacific Ocean. Bored with everyday life, you decide to go live in nature and produce your own food, water, dishes, etc. You land on an exotic island without anything other than your sharp brain. To make progress in the game, you must use basic materials to build more complex items and workstations. The end goal of the game is to build a ship which lets you sail off the island to different regions of the world.

But what is a ship without a crew? Join our crew and get ready for an exciting journey!

  • I have been a gamer my entire life, but I found that there was always something missing in the gameplay of today's survival games. A few years ago, I started to teach myself how to make 3D and 2D art. I lost my job this year and after that I decided to pursue my dream. Time is running quickly and I'm getting low on my budget; that is why I need you to help me finish this project!

What We Need & What You Get

  • All funding will go into programming and developing the rest of the game and creating all the arts and models for it. We don't want to make a standard survival game that you can finish in an hour of gameplay. There will be more than 400 in-game items and stations, and this funding would help me make them and have them be the same quality as the previous ones. The funding would also be used to keep paying for a programmer to work on the game.

All backers will receive an icon from their pledge, which will be displayed in chat in single player and multiplayer mode.
 

The Impact

  • We have built one of the most advanced systems seen in survival games. With your help, we would be able to create even more detailed stations and the world. 

Risks & Challenges

  • The Journey of Life is created by Hyperion Studios in collaboration with Feral Computing from London. 
  • As the owner of Hyperion Studios, I am able to create any 3D or 2D object including all graphics for the game. Adam from Feral Computing is able to give life to all of those objects and he has also already helped three other studios publish their games on Steam. In collaboration, we are able to create any game from scratch.

The only thing preventing us from finishing the game is the fact that our budget is running low. If we got sufficient funding for the game, only the sky would be the limit.

Type: FPS-Single Player with Co-op 

Genre: Simulation, Action, Survival

Tags: Crafting, Exploring, Hunting, Farming, Smelting

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you cannot help us finance the game, it would be helpful if you could share this project on your social media profiles to show your support for this project and be able to play the game even sooner.

story:
Our vision for EvoTag

We want

  • To bring the excitement and variety from first person shooter games outside.
  • The performance known from professional laser tag equipment, combined with advanced game modes without the need for extra equipment.
  • To keep it affordable - We want everyone to join the fun.
  • The freedom to setup games anywhere you want, fast and easy.
  • To meet new people. Setup public games and discover those close to you. Join in on events like Battle Royale with up to 100 players.

The Gameplay

To accommodate the excitement, competition and strategy known from first person shooter games like Fortnite, Apex Legends and Counter-Strike, we have implemented different arenas and game types. You can set up a game and arena anywhere in no time. There is no limit for how many (or few) players will be able to enter the battlefield!

The EvoTag App

You will be able to monitor your health, ammo, inventory and teammates on your smartphone, strapped around your wrist with a wrist band (not included, see FAQ). You can arrange your gear on hot buttons on your screen for quick access.

The game map gives you an overview of bases, loot locations and places to capture.

Sound effects will help you identify nearby loot, incoming airstrikes, when you score a tag, when you are hit by the enemy or when a shot just missed you, etc.

In addition to tagging users you also have the option to use virtual attacks, which adds a complete new element to the game. Is the enemy camping in a strategic location? Take them out with an air strike! You want to setup a stronger defense? Create a minefield with proximity mines! Wonder where the enemy is hiding? Launch a surveillance drone!

Backers get a free VIP subscription which forever gives you access to all in-game features! 

The EvoTagger

With a futuristic and cool looking EvoTagger you can eliminate your opponents with a burst from point blank range or maybe a single accurate shot from a distance of up to 100 meters (300 ft).

Shots are picked up by several sensors located on the tagger, ensuring a solid hit detection. Ultra-low latency design ensures that you will hear an audio confirmation when you score a tag even before the echo of your shot has died out!

We have included cheat detection which will recognize if players cheat by covering the sensors.

Current State

At the moment of launching this campaign (April 2019), we have several working 3D-printed prototypes of the tagger. We are able to connect to both Android and iPhone. We have tested the range and had successful hits at 100 meters (300 ft).

The App can create or join a game and has implemented game map, weapons and equipment, ammo, health, shield, inventory and sound effects. You can choose between games where you win by eliminating all enemies, getting the best score and/or by dominating strategic locations. You can define teams or play free-for-all.

The first 1000 EvoTaggers have already been ordered from our experienced production partner. Electronics design has been finalized and the mechanical design is almost complete.

We have a certified test and certification partners ready to secure all needed approvals for CE- and FCC marking.

We aim for July 2019

With this funding campaign, we want to scale the production quickly and get EvoTag to thousands of customers already this summer.

In April and May our production partner is creating production tools and phase 0 units for final approval and certification. In June we expect testing and certification to be completed and real production to start. In July we expect to start shipping the first units to backers.

Concurrently with the hardware production we will finalize the development of the first version of the EvoTag App, including maturing the game play and improving the User Interface. Let us know in the comments section which game modes and features you wish for!

By July we will get the product tested and certified to be able to sell in Europe and the US. Later the rest of the world.

story:
Riscord is an episodic multi-path linear serious text-adventure game based inside a typical teenager's personal computer. You'll play as a sixteen-year-old protagonist who is about to start college in today's online world. 

During the two academic years, the decisions you make will influence the world around you and affect the social wellbeing of the game's characters.

Riscord will never feature the following micro-transactions, "surprise mechanics", and or will not have an exclusivity deal with any platform.

Riscord's core gameplay focus is on player choice. In Riscord, you'll be sending messages to our characters through direct messages, within servers and other social media platforms. Each message you send and receive has a value associated with it, but you can't be buddies with everyone.

You can select a message by either press one, two or three on your keyboard or you can click on it instead but once it's selected it locked in. To immersive you further we've developed a typing mechanic allowing you to type your selected message. Once you've typed your message, you can send it by pressing enter or the send button.

Throughout each episode, you'll be making little choices that will impact the overall narrative of the game without even realising it. Remember, the smallest action's do have the most significant consequence.

Occasionally you will be faced to make a decision that isn't specifically right or wrong, but both choices will profoundly affect the world around you.

At the very start of the game, you need to create your character; you do this by typing a name, username & picking your player avatar. Each avatar currently has three emotions that can change depending on your actions. 

Your desktop is where the majority of the gameplay takes place. Here you can navigate between apps such as Riscord, Tuneify, V.S.S and Chirp. Each app has unique mechanics, which even includes your desktop. Some of the desktop mechanics are the Taskbar, Start Menu and the Notification Centre, all of which are designed to help you navigate around the device with ease. 

With each new episode, we plan on expanding the desktop to include more apps such as Vapor, SBox, YourSpace and many more.

The Riscord App UI found in the main menu uses the same design as the one found within Short Stories and or any episodes. This allows you to get accustomed to the UI before you start playing the first episode.

The options menu isn't just a options menu in Riscord. It also has its own equine mechanics such as two-step verification, connected accounts and blocked accounts. One of which protects you from some of Peters "hacking" mechanics and other random events. Furthermore Blocked Accounts allow you to unblock any account that you've blocked, this can have its own consequences so be warned. 

The help menu uses the same design which is used for Riscord's Server sections of the game, allowing you to get accustomed to the UI before you encounter it.

Riscord has been in development for the last two years. Originally it was coursework for Rowan's Level 3 Diploma in Software Development. Since then, Riscord has grown immensely with UI reworks taking place, refining the games code, story revisions, and commissioning original digital art. 

Last summer an Indie Rock band known as Seagulls hailing from Bucks County, Pennsylvania joined the project bring their musical expertise with them. Music from their debut album Great Pine & their follow up album Thrown Voice, is featured throughout Riscord.

Our characters have their own religious beliefs, likes and dislikes, relationships, sexual identities, emotions and social media accounts. This allows us to make our characters feel authentic and relatable, allowing you to build a special bond with each character.

The following characters are still being developed and yet to have any artwork drawn and or have their backstories written. However, these characters will still make an appearance.

  • Andrew
  • Gin
  • Isabella
  • Jacob
  • James
  • Kim
  • Laura
  • Muzzy
  • Paul
  • More to be Announced

Riscord has a wide range of player avatars all with their unique look. Several of which are designed to be gender-neutral, allowing you to have more control of their personality and identity. This is just some of the avatar art that is already implemented.


As Riscord is an episodic title, we've broken the game down into content phases starting with our first phase "Welcome Week". Welcome Week features the first two episodes, as well as our first, Short Story Event, themed around Halloween. 

Short Stories expand character backstories, new choices and allow you to play as one of our many NPCs. Short Stories gives us a chance to add meaningful new content to the game free of charge. Each Short Story will explore new topics such as World Ocean Day and try new fun mechanics we've been developing.

Each content phase has a dedicated patch. These patches will either lay the foundations for further content, bug-fixes and complementary micro-dlc that adds new characters and player avatars to the game.

Riscord has many reward tiers, whatever is coloured Purple is included within that reward tier bracket. 

By utilising crowdfunding, our studio will be able to remain an independent games studio. As of right now, Riscord has two funding sources. One being this Indiegogo campaign and the second being funds raised by successful bids for the following grants

  • Nottingham Trent University Sustainability Team - Green Dragon Award
  • Nottingham Trent University - Most Commercially Viable Business
  • European Union - EU Innovation Funding Grant

At the current time, Riscord's development has been solely reliant on the additional funds raised by these three grants. However, without the money raised through this crowdfunding campaign, Riscord's release will need to be pushed back to a further date.

Everything raised through this crowdfunding campaign will go directly into Riscord's development. You can see what will be spent on what just below.

Rad Sheep Studios LTD is an award-winning indie games studio, based in Newark-on-Trent in the UK, founded in August 2018 by a small group of close friends.

In 2019, they were awarded the Green Dragon Award for Social Benefit by Nottingham Trent University and have since been entered into the Green Gown Awards by Nottingham Trent University.


We specialise in story-driven experiences that give a player a choice. Each of our games will be intertwined with one another, allowing us to create interconnected games universe influenced by the player and the decision they make.

This heartwarming story features a wide range of characters from diverse ethnic backgrounds. Throughout this experience, your avatar will need to discover what it truly means to grow up in this ever-growing interconnected online world. However, your actions can influence those around you, for better or worse. 

'Talk' is a brand new signposting technology and will be present in all of our upcoming releases, starting with Riscord.

It allows players to be referred to social wellbeing organisations such as Samaritans with a click of a button. 

Our team is made up of BSc (Hons) Games Production students currently studying at Confetti Insitute of Creative Technologies. However, because we're studying Games Production, we're able to work on Riscord for our studies. As well as understand and navigate the complexity of the games industry.
story_txt:
Riscord is an episodic multi-path linear serious text-adventure game based inside a typical teenager's personal computer. You'll play as a sixteen-year-old protagonist who is about to start college in today's online world. During the two academic years, the decisions you make will influence the world around you and affect the social wellbeing of the game's characters.Riscord will never feature the following micro-transactions, "surprise mechanics", and or will not have an exclusivity deal with any platform.Riscord's core gameplay focus is on player choice. In Riscord, you'll be sending messages to our characters through direct messages, within servers and other social media platforms. Each message you send and receive has a value associated with it, but you can't be buddies with everyone.You can select a message by either press one, two or three on your keyboard or you can click on it instead but once it's selected it locked in. To immersive you further we've developed a typing mechanic allowing you to type your selected message. Once you've typed your message, you can send it by pressing enter or the send button.Throughout each episode, you'll be making little choices that will impact the overall narrative of the game without even realising it. Remember, the smallest action's do have the most significant consequence.Occasionally you will be faced to make a decision that isn't specifically right or wrong, but both choices will profoundly affect the world around you.At the very start of the game, you need to create your character; you do this by typing a name, username & picking your player avatar. Each avatar currently has three emotions that can change depending on your actions. Your desktop is where the majority of the gameplay takes place. Here you can navigate between apps such as Riscord, Tuneify, V.S.S and Chirp. Each app has unique mechanics, which even includes your desktop. Some of the desktop mechanics are the Taskbar, Start Menu and the Notification Centre, all of which are designed to help you navigate around the device with ease. With each new episode, we plan on expanding the desktop to include more apps such as Vapor, SBox, YourSpace and many more.The Riscord App UI found in the main menu uses the same design as the one found within Short Stories and or any episodes. This allows you to get accustomed to the UI before you start playing the first episode.The options menu isn't just a options menu in Riscord. It also has its own equine mechanics such as two-step verification, connected accounts and blocked accounts. One of which protects you from some of Peters "hacking" mechanics and other random events. Furthermore Blocked Accounts allow you to unblock any account that you've blocked, this can have its own consequences so be warned. The help menu uses the same design which is used for Riscord's Server sections of the game, allowing you to get accustomed to the UI before you encounter it.Riscord has been in development for the last two years. Originally it was coursework for Rowan's Level 3 Diploma in Software Development. Since then, Riscord has grown immensely with UI reworks taking place, refining the games code, story revisions, and commissioning original digital art. Last summer an Indie Rock band known as Seagulls hailing from Bucks County, Pennsylvania joined the project bring their musical expertise with them. Music from their debut album Great Pine & their follow up album Thrown Voice, is featured throughout Riscord.Our characters have their own religious beliefs, likes and dislikes, relationships, sexual identities, emotions and social media accounts. This allows us to make our characters feel authentic and relatable, allowing you to build a special bond with each character.The following characters are still being developed and yet to have any artwork drawn and or have their backstories written. However, these characters will still make an appearance.
Andrew
Gin
Isabella
Jacob
James
Kim
Laura
Muzzy
Paul
More to be Announced
Riscord has a wide range of player avatars all with their unique look. Several of which are designed to be gender-neutral, allowing you to have more control of their personality and identity. This is just some of the avatar art that is already implemented.As Riscord is an episodic title, we've broken the game down into content phases starting with our first phase "Welcome Week". Welcome Week features the first two episodes, as well as our first, Short Story Event, themed around Halloween. Short Stories expand character backstories, new choices and allow you to play as one of our many NPCs. Short Stories gives us a chance to add meaningful new content to the game free of charge. Each Short Story will explore new topics such as World Ocean Day and try new fun mechanics we've been developing.Each content phase has a dedicated patch. These patches will either lay the foundations for further content, bug-fixes and complementary micro-dlc that adds new characters and player avatars to the game.Riscord has many reward tiers, whatever is coloured Purple is included within that reward tier bracket. By utilising crowdfunding, our studio will be able to remain an independent games studio. As of right now, Riscord has two funding sources. One being this Indiegogo campaign and the second being funds raised by successful bids for the following grants
Nottingham Trent University Sustainability Team - Green Dragon Award
Nottingham Trent University - Most Commercially Viable Business
European Union - EU Innovation Funding Grant
At the current time, Riscord's development has been solely reliant on the additional funds raised by these three grants. However, without the money raised through this crowdfunding campaign, Riscord's release will need to be pushed back to a further date.Everything raised through this crowdfunding campaign will go directly into Riscord's development.
