Each of our games will be intertwined with one another, allowing us to create interconnected games universe influenced by the player and the decision they make.This heartwarming story features a wide range of characters from diverse ethnic backgrounds. Throughout this experience, your avatar will need to discover what it truly means to grow up in this ever-growing interconnected online world. However, your actions can influence those around you, for better or worse. 'Talk' is a brand new signposting technology and will be present in all of our upcoming releases, starting with Riscord.It allows players to be referred to social wellbeing organisations such as Samaritans with a click of a button. Our team is made up of BSc (Hons) Games Production students currently studying at Confetti Insitute of Creative Technologies. However, because we're studying Games Production, we're able to work on Riscord for our studies. As well as understand and navigate the complexity of the games industry.

story:
Into A Dream is a story-driven adventure where you delve deep into the dreams of a man diagnosed with depression. Find the man lost within his own mind, unravel his story, and help him to take the first step towards therapy.

Currently being developed for PC Windows, Mac and Linux. The approximately 45-minute free demo is available on Steam and Itch. 

"I keep having to be reminded it's an indie game because it's head-and-shoulders superior to what I'm seeing from the Triple A game studios right now." - IndieImprint

"A title to keep in mind that has the potential to become an interactive experience with a very powerful social intervention nature." - Glitch Effect

"A wonderful game with rich voice acting, a great sound track and a brilliant art style. The game was an absolute pleasure to play." - ​Itch demo player

Twitter | Discord | Press Kit | Newsletter | Facebook | Instagram | IndieDB

 

Into A Dream has teamed up with CheckPoint, a charity that provides mental health resources for gamers and the gaming community. 25% of the amount raised with The Coping Companion Perk will be donated to CheckPoint. 

The digital Coping Companion is a personalised wellbeing assistant that you can use in any way that suits you. A powerful tool containing over 50 evidence based tips for dealing with everyday stress and anxiety, distress, and more.

The digital Coping Companion is also available as an Add On for Catnap Perk and above.
 

 

  • An emotional and heartbreaking narrative about love, hopelessness and depression
  • Beautiful original soundtrack and dreamlike atmosphere
  • Complex, real characters and relationships based on real-life experiences
  • Fully voice-acted characters

 

Wake up in a mysterious place devoid of all your memories and come upon a recording addressed to you. As you listen, you realize that your mind has been linked to the dreams of a Luke Williams, a man diagnosed with severe depression. You are Luke’s last hope and must prevent him from fading away.

Love, Hopelessness, Inevitability

Into A Dream's story is very relatable and my aim is to tell it as close to a real setting as possible. The themes of love, family, hopelessness, inevitability are present in our lives. Even if we have not encountered them personally, most of us know someone who has.

Mental Health and Depression

It is not my intent to say what depression is, or how it is for someone who is suffering from it, but to tell the story of someone whose emotions and reasoning towards the events that were thrown in his life lead him to it.

I hope that this understanding of reality can be expanded into a discussion of mental health. I believe that we grow when we observe and empathize. I hope that the characters and events in Into A Dream may feel real and resonate with you.

 

Original Soundtrack

The original soundtrack was composed as a narrative element in each scene, using the piano as the core instrument.  Both its softness and richness can easily translate and depict ourselves and our emotions.
It was a perfect match in inspirational story-driven games such as To The Moon or Désirè. However, for most themes, I first finalized the visuals and sound effects of a certain scene, played the level, and let those guide the composition.
 


2D Silhouette Simplicity 

The simplicity helps capture the emotion without being too distracting. The colour and lighting gives a sense of darkness in the foreground, where the characters are and the action is occurring, but brightening up into the horizon to depict a certain sense of hope. 

Inspired by Limbo

From the entire visual design process, I've spent the most time on lighting. Limbo was a huge inspiration in the way light is used.  Each layer of each scene has its own lighting to enhance the dreamlike atmosphere.

Psychology of Color

The monochromatic palette of each dream allows for the color to quickly represent the state of mind of this man, whether his feelings or his association with a certain event. The gradient of light, ranging from full black in the foreground to a light shade of color in the background represents his reality. A man living in darkness, but not without a sense of hope.


Into A Dream’s characters are built upon observations. They were created to be as human, as real and as complex as I can understand and put to paper. 

I am fascinated by people. By how different people react to the same events, how different people have distinct motivations, reasoning and emotions under similar circumstances. To understand why they do so.

The characters were modelled after people I have observed, met and known. Instead of writing dialogues whenever I wanted something out of them, their main purpose is to showcase the characters, their personality and their relationships.

The events that are depicted in the game are also situations that although not having lived through them personally, I met others who did.

 





John Stevens - Hinted as being a renowned psychologist that was asked to venture into the dreams of Luke in order to find his depression's root cause and help him overcome his darkness. John has no recollections of his past while in these dreams.

Luke Williams - A very introverted, quiet, intelligent and driven person. He believes has the responsibility to fix the world, even if beyond his control.

Rita Williams - A kind, strong, warm and creative woman. She's a writer and the wife of Luke.

Anne Williams - Witty, curious, very bright. Anne has a strong bond with her father, Luke. She appears between 9 and 12 years old throughout Luke's dreams.

Isabel Williams - Luke's loving mother. Isabel is quite similar in personality to her granddaughter, Anne. They have a great bond and seem very alike.

Michael Gall - Luke's best friend and partner in his business. Michael is funny, loud, extroverted and somewhat moody.
 

Luke Williams is a father, supports a loving wife and is very close with his mother. Outside of his family life, Luke is an entrepreneur, having created a clean energy start-up with his best friend. Everything was going well in his life until some terrible news which lead to a downward spiral of unfortunate events.

Delve deep into Luke’s dreams, where memories and symbols are blended together; you are expected to disclose the events and actions that have led Luke to his darkness. Meet his close family and friends, and find ways to access his darker dreams. Unveil the emotional, powerful and heartbreaking journey of his life. Help Luke see that his life matters.

 

Into A Dream came to be as a somewhat impulsive decision. After working as an engineer for almost 5 years I came to the conclusion that it was not the path that I was most passionate about. I resigned from my job and started looking for different career paths.

In the meantime I finally decided to download Unity and learn some game development without the conscious intent to actually pursue that path. However, after the first tutorials my storytelling bug took over and I decided to make a prototype. From that prototype, Into A Dream came to life.

Take a look at the prototype:


Into A Dream is already close to be completely developed. All voice acting has been recorded, mixed and added into the game. It will be released in July 2020, without any funding necessary for its completion.  No risk of not getting the completed game! 

This Indiegogo is to raise money for the currently volunteering voice-actors, localization, and communication/promotion. I would like to have the game translated to multiple languages, such as Spanish, German, French, Italian, Russian, Japanese and Chinese. 

I've had a lot of emotional support and feedback from the Into A Dream community throughout development and would like to offer this opportunity to get exclusive rewards and experiences, and being the first to play!

 

Customise your Perk with these extra items. You'll be able to add on any of the below items once you get to check out.

 

 

I'm Filipe! I am an engineer/composer/writer that has worked as a biotechnological engineer and also have ventured into various artistic projects, most proudly as a director of an original musical theatre, with both score and libretto of my own.

Having delved into the game industry due to my love for games and stories, I see this medium as a wonderful and unique way to bring a story to life through a combination of visuals, interaction, music and storytelling, leading to a more engaging experience.

Into A Dream is my favourite game and as a solo developer, I've enjoyed every moment of it. Thank you for helping make Into A Dream a reality!

 


I've been very lucky to work with many voice actors who will all be credited in-game. Below are the voice actors for some of the main characters.
 

 



I've chosen to crowdfund on Indiegogo because of the flexibility it offers. I've funded myself throughout the whole development of Into A Dream and want to use this opportunity to pay the currently volunteering Voice Actors and people who have helped with localization. After the amount needed to pay them has been raised, I'll start focusing on communication and promotion of Into A Dream.

This game encourages more people to add their voices to the conversation of mental health. By supporting Into A Dream, you're helping to reach more people new to the topic of mental health. Expanding the discussion of men's mental health in particular is important for me as it's slowly becoming a more accepted topic.

I want to hear your opinion about Into A Dream. I've been very lucky to have an incredibly supportive community so far and they've helped make Into A Dream a better game for you to enjoy.
 


With Into A Dream being released in July 2020, almost all challenges - there were many - regarding development have been overcome. The full version of Into A Dream was sent to Steam to review in May 2020 and is waiting to be released.

Being a solo developer means:

  1. Diverse skills - You need to be familiarized with completely different skill sets, from designing to programming.
  2. Mental health - With its fair-share of risk, developing can be overwhelming. Having to bear with it all by yourself, maintain the focus and motivation to move forward from within and believing that what you’re doing will pay off in the end are incredible difficult to endure.
  3. Scope - All tasks have to be performed by you, the time committed is only your own. It is easy to overscope due to ambition and to underscope due to fear of not being able to reach the desired goal.

My main challenge now is enabling Into A Dream to reach a large audience. I aim to do this through increasing accessibility such as translation and working with indie game marketing specialists.


Thank you for reading about Into A Dream! Please follow my emotional story-driven adventure and help make some noise about this campaign. Indiegogo has share tools which means it's really easy for you!

story:
About me

Hi, my name is Tomek Soroka. I am engineer and project manager working for about ten years in R&D deparaments. Always had passion for games, started playing 26 years ago. I am learning to code even as You read this. From my early computer days wanted to make my own game. I love to make 3d graphic and music. Since 2014 I discovered that programming is not so hard this days. Last year started small indie studio called Sortech Studio. You can check our apps in Appstore

Links below:

Positive Text Generator - https://itunes.apple.com/pl/app/positive-text-generator/id950368021?l=pl&mt=8

Eagle's Eye - https://itunes.apple.com/pl/app/eagles-eye/id942170232?l=pl&mt=8

Eagle's Eye Free - https://itunes.apple.com/pl/app/eagles-eye-free/id951758977?l=pl&mt=8

                              


So, what's Deep Space Patrol (DSP) ?

2014 summer I started my adventure with Swift and loved it from the beginning. From day one I wanted to make this game. After learning something about coding decided to start with DSP. It was May 2015. After few months of development we can share some of my work. 

Game mechanic is working as intended. There are few tweaks and better graphic, sound and music to be made. Also most levels are in basic state and need some polishing and testing. 

Game is developed for iOS mobile devices. It will be free.

It took me some time to get this working as intended and at this moment we are confident about release. But would also love to make this game evolving experience for players. And most of all would love to make graphic and music as was intended at the beginning. 

For this I humbly ask for Your aid. I choose Flexible Funding because game will be released whether the rise end with $1 or $23,800. More money means better quality of product and more content. And I hope we can build this together.

After initial release we plan to create additional content which will be provided as a free DLCs.

You can check full list of features on our website but here is some recap:

•Online gameplay,

•4 flyable ships in initial release: Corvette, Frigate, Destroyer and Cruiser,

•Independent steering for turrets on right and left side of ship (check video below to see it in action),

•Fast paced arcade fun,

•Story driven campaign – discover secrets and enemies in more than 300 unique systems,

•Fabular and random systems,

•Unique bosses and final fights,

•Player ranks and experience,

•Resources to collect – 3He and Titan,

•More than 200 ship upgrades,

•Mission boosters,

•Unique music score (check demo below),

•And the best of all: lots of fun !


Check Video for Alpha footage:


Check sample music:



Risk involved

DSP release is planned as soon as it is finished and tested. I've planned production with my best knowledge and experience. Investing passion for games and time is best solution to counter all risks that may arise.

Schedule breakdown below:


As you can see, plan is ambitious but possible.



How it works:

Game will be released on iOS platform (mostly mobile devices, although we will test  possibility for implementation on TV and Mac). iOS supported version at this moment is 8.0+ but it may be subject to change if there is real need in framework. 

After initial release we will explore possibilities for Android and Windows versions. 


What do we need this cash for ?

First of all we need better equipment to render 3d graphic and more time for license of 3d software (which is major cost).

Next thing is video and music edition software. 

Hardware and software takes almost  80% of budget. 



Budget break down:




What Donors will get ?

First, opportunity to be part of something special.

Next, rewards:

For everyone - free access to game and all content including future DLCs.

For donors, to honor their aid we created perks described below:


                                                    







All Donors will be credited in game.

All names are pending for approval (no offensive material).

All tests will be carried out on mobile devices with iOS 8.0+ installed and ready for TestFlight.


How I know you will not run with My money ?

I want to make a living of game design so running with cash is not possible. Also I'm investing my time and money for this project already.


FAQ

Q: How long will it take ?

A: We plan to make game as soon as possible. This should be end of June when we release DSP. 


Q: Do I need to pay for play ?

A: No. Game and all DLCs will be free. You will only need iOS 8.0 mobile device and time :-)


Q: Where is demo ?

A: We plan to launch Beta tests on March 2016.


Q: What will be initial release like?

A: We plan special opening event with in game rewards. So stay tuned.


Q: Can I play offline ?

A: No. As we plan to make this game social and with multiplayer access to internet will be required. No worries though, data transfer won’t dry out your internet plan.


Q: Can I have my own name/s in game ?

A: Yes. Choose one of perk that suits your needs and it will be done.


Q: How often will you update game ?

A: We think about 3 to 6 months big DLC updates. 


Q: Will backers/supporters get more stuff ?

A: No. We think that all players should have same start point. 


I’m still not convinced…

A: There are other ways to help us. Keep the word about our project and follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Youtube. Maybe we can convince You in future :-) 

Please share this project with Indiegogo tools.
story_txt:
About me
Hi, my name is Tomek Soroka. I am engineer and project manager working for about ten years in R&D deparaments. Always had passion for games, started playing 26 years ago. I am learning to code even as You read this. From my early computer days wanted to make my own game. I love to make 3d graphic and music. Since 2014 I discovered that programming is not so hard this days. Last year started small indie studio called Sortech Studio. You can check our apps in Appstore
Links below:Positive Text Generator - https://itunes.apple.com/pl/app/positive-text-generator/id950368021?l=pl&mt=8
Eagle's Eye - https://itunes.apple.com/pl/app/eagles-eye/id942170232?l=pl&mt=8
Eagle's Eye Free - https://itunes.apple.com/pl/app/eagles-eye-free/id951758977?l=pl&mt=8
                              


So, what's Deep Space Patrol (DSP) ?
2014 summer I started my adventure with Swift and loved it from the beginning. From day one I wanted to make this game. After learning something about coding decided to start with DSP. It was May 2015. After few months of development we can share some of my work. 
Game mechanic is working as intended. There are few tweaks and better graphic, sound and music to be made. Also most levels are in basic state and need some polishing and testing. 
Game is developed for iOS mobile devices. It will be free.
It took me some time to get this working as intended and at this moment we are confident about release. But would also love to make this game evolving experience for players. And most of all would love to make graphic and music as was intended at the beginning. 
For this I humbly ask for Your aid. I choose Flexible Funding because game will be released whether the rise end with $1 or $23,800. More money means better quality of product and more content. And I hope we can build this together.
After initial release we plan to create additional content which will be provided as a free DLCs.
You can check full list of features on our website but here is some recap:
•Online gameplay,
•4 flyable ships in initial release: Corvette, Frigate, Destroyer and Cruiser,
•Independent steering for turrets on right and left side of ship (check video below to see it in action),
•Fast paced arcade fun,
•Story driven campaign – discover secrets and enemies in more than 300 unique systems,
•Fabular and random systems,
•Unique bosses and final fights,
•Player ranks and experience,
•Resources to collect – 3He and Titan,
•More than 200 ship upgrades,
•Mission boosters,
•Unique music score (check demo below),
•And the best of all: lots of fun !


Check Video for Alpha footage:

Check sample music:


Risk involved
DSP release is planned as soon as it is finished and tested. I've planned production with my best knowledge and experience. Investing passion for games and time is best solution to counter all risks that may arise.
Schedule breakdown below:








As you can see, plan is ambitious but possible.


How it works:
Game will be released on iOS platform (mostly mobile devices, although we will test  possibility for implementation on TV and Mac). iOS supported version at this moment is 8.0+ but it may be subject to change if there is real need in framework. 
After initial release we will explore possibilities for Android and Windows versions. 




What do we need this cash for ?
First of all we need better equipment to render 3d graphic and more time for license of 3d software (which is major cost).
Next thing is video and music edition software. 
Hardware and software takes almost  80% of budget. 


Budget break down:









What Donors will get ?
First, opportunity to be part of something special.
Next, rewards:
For everyone - free access to game and all content including future DLCs.
For donors, to honor their aid we created perks described below:

                                                    


















All Donors will be credited in game.
All names are pending for approval (no offensive material).
All tests will be carried out on mobile devices with iOS 8.0+ installed and ready for TestFlight.

How I know you will not run with My money ?
I want to make a living of game design so running with cash is not possible. Also I'm investing my time and money for this project already.

FAQ
Q: How long will it take ?
A: We plan to make game as soon as possible. This should be end of June when we release DSP. 

Q: Do I need to pay for play ?
A: No. Game and all DLCs will be free. You will only need iOS 8.0 mobile device and time :-)

Q: Where is demo ?
A: We plan to launch Beta tests on March 2016.

Q: What will be initial release like?
A: We plan special opening event with in game rewards. So stay tuned.

Q: Can I play offline ?
A: No. As we plan to make this game social and with multiplayer access to internet will be required. No worries though, data transfer won’t dry out your internet plan.

Q: Can I have my own name/s in game ?
A: Yes. Choose one of perk that suits your needs and it will be done.

Q: How often will you update game ?
A: We think about 3 to 6 months big DLC updates. 

Q: Will backers/supporters get more stuff ?
A: No. We think that all players should have same start point. 

I’m still not convinced…
A: There are other ways to help us. Keep the word about our project and follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Youtube. Maybe we can convince You in future :-) 
Please share this project with Indiegogo tools.

story:
eQubes

Story

Revolutionary and challenging, eQubes is the perfect game for those who love numbers and puzzles. The game challenges players to train their brain through mathematical equations and logic that they must solve in a race against the clock.


 

The success of eQubes goes way beyond the challenge that attracts its users. The game combines the universal language of numbers with an appealing design and a simple and intuitive interface, which invites anyone, of any age, to play. eQubes is unique and there is no other app like it for training mathematical reasoning in such a fun and challenging way.

The game

Equations and cubes were the inspiration for eQubes. The game has dozens of challenging levels and each one is comprised of 6 faces, which represent the 6 faces of a cube.


The gameplay


With only a few minutes to solve each face’s equations, the player must really love puzzles in order to solve these mental calculations... all this while racing against the clock! 

We must warn you though: it's addictive and you won’t be aware of how fast time flies by!

The more equations you solve, the more eQubes you win.


Game currency

The game currency are eQubes. Through the course of the game you’ll be able to win them or you can purchase them (although we want you to be able to play it without spending any money!) 

You’ll be able to use them to gain time in harder puzzles, get a solution when you feel like quitting and a lot of other stuff that we want to implement, like seeing the solutions you were unable to solve, for example.


Mission

eQubes’ mission is to entertain and challenge its players to test their mathematical skills to the limit, while the clock is ticking. eQubes is a revolutionary game when it comes to the selection of mathematical logic games that are out there. In addition to its playful side, while training the brain, you’ll also help stimulate the development and strengthening of various cognitive skills, such as logical and mathematical reasoning, manual dexterity, concentration and memory... skills that can be reinforced by eQubes.

As fun as it is challenging, once you start the game, the hard part will be stopping! Why? Because there are so many equations to be solved while the clock is ticking.


Game developers

Hi! My name is João Lima, and I’m a student at the Faculty of Engineering, in the University of Porto, and the brain behind eQubes.

My enthusiasm for programming and games sparked the desire to create eQubes. Several ideas have helped create a universally understood game that challenges users to reach the last level! We created an appealing design and a simple and intuitive interface. From paper to computer and from the computer to the App Store, eQubes registered very few changes, only improvements!

The game’s development was done in partnership with BloomIdea, a Portuguese company specialized in developing mobile applications that saw its potential and decided to bet on this revolutionary and challenging game.



Campaign

eQubes has been unstoppable when it comes to challenging its thousands of players and fans. After conquering 1st place in the App Store for iPhone and iPad in Portugal, we have been working hard on the next stages of the game, in order to continue to surprise those who love numbers and puzzles.


Believe us when we say that we’re very excited about eQubes and we want everything that was planned for this campaign to happen. If you share this feeling, help us make it happen!

The eQubes campaign aims to:

  • Have eQubes on Android and Windows platforms
  • Provide new game modes such as Multiplayer and Endless.
  • Investment in marketing

Other platforms

We want to break down platform barriers! With eQubes on other platforms, many players can have fun testing their mathematical skills to the limit, while racing against time.


Multiplayer

eQubes’ gameplay will be even better. We’re going to make it even more fun and interactive! It will be amazing to see friends, family and players from all around the world challenging each other.


Endless

The eQubes challenge is going to be even greater and even faster. We are going to implement a game mode where players will only have 10-15 seconds to solve mathematical equations. And for those who think that the eQubes challenge can come to an end, think again! Every time a cube’s equations are completed, the player gains a few more seconds and other equations will appear, hence the reason it’s endless.


Marketing

We are going to invest significantly in marketing eQubes. We want more players to discover and experience eQubes and hope that these can contribute to the evolution of the game, making it increasingly challenging and fun.


Perks

First of all thank you for your contribution! Your contribution is very important so that eQubes can become a better and more challenging game!

Help us and receive exclusive stuff and awesome gifts!


What if we don't reach the goal?

If this happens we will invest the money we raised in the following order:

  1. Bring eQubes to other platforms such as Android and windows
  2. Make new game mods like Multiplayer and endless mod.
  3. Invest in marketing

Risks

eQubes was developed by people who believe in its potential. We have many plans and we know what we need and what the cost is to develop them. We work with a ton of enthusiasm and we are always learning and implementing improvements, so that the eQubes challenges just keep getting better and more fun.


You can’t contribute? No problem!

eQubes is a game that has been spreading by "word of mouth". You know that friend who downloaded a game, told another friend about it and challenged about 5 more friends to play? eQubes has that effect on its players. It's surprising! And the number of downloads just keeps growing. People really love eQubes!

Tell all your friends about eQubes and this campaign! Share it on social networks such as Facebook, Twitter, WhatsApp...

You can also use Indiegogo sharing tools, they are valuable when it comes to helping us out!

A big thank you from eQubes Team!

Contact us: support@eQubes.com

eQubes.com

story:
1.  CATFLAP! - and Japster's Cavern / Background


Hi guys - Really hoping that you can help the little guy / indie developer!

Coming from the 80's bedroom coding scene, first on my trusty Spectrum, then my C64, I've really missed developing/creating fun games...

...So, about 18 months ago, I decided to give old-school mobile game development a try!

Before we start, please, PLEASE do not think I'm trying to get support for yet another 'Flappy B*rd game - My game is honestly *massively* different in terms of gameplay, longevity, skills rewards, etc! - If you're dubious, please download the free tryout/trial version to confirm and hopefully come on side, then come back here!  :)

Okay, now that that's out of the way! - about 10 months ago, after getting to grips with it, I had created 'CATFLAP!' - a real labour of love game, and one that's taken every bit of my spare time, developing into the small hours of the morning to add features, humorous touches, tweak the gameplay, achievements, high score tables, add a HD overhaul, etc, and has evolved into a very fun, addictive, and risk'n'reward style gameplay skill game.  (Note, it has pipes, but contrary to first impressions, it's NOT yet another Flappy Bird clone!)

However, I've become steadily more and more disheartened/disillusioned at the lack of notice, downloads and publicity that it is getting, even after releasing an upgradeable  'LITE' version for absolutely no cost, containing almost all features of the full version (which even then only cost the absolute minimum I was allowed to make it - I wanted to charge less) - which was only 50 pence for Android, and 79p / $0.99 for iOS)

Having paid 2 years' worth of software license fees, developer fees, and money for suitable hardware to develop on, I'm already out of pocket for just under £2,000, uncountable hours of lost family/relaxation time, and only have a few (literally a few dozen) installations, yet virtually EVERYONE who's downloaded it and reviewed it loves it and has rated it highly!

CATFLAP! has had SO much work poured into making it better and better, long-life, etc, that there really is a solid, fun challenge! - 8-Rank High Score tables for ALL 26+ modes, and over 80 (80!!) local achievements to get, ranging from getting clever scores and combos, to how long you can last in a single game, to catching (or even missing!) large amounts of butterflies in a row, Rufus, etc! - MASSIVE replayability as you attempt to get certain tricky jewel combo's, achievements, etc!

Unfortunately, I have nowhere near enough money to invest in advertising to compete with the generic-IAP-heavy big-boys, but I really want to make this game development dream work and maybe help pay the bills. (I'm also not a 1-hit-wonder (currently working on a second, completely different genre of game already, sneak peek screenshot attached!), and I also have around a dozen or so ideas for other games, including an idea for a Pentamino-featuring board-game puzzler that I KNOW will be fantastically playable - early family-and-friends testing confirms this!  :) )

Given the effort involved in creating an in-depth, polished game, I really can't afford to take a chance with another 3-4 months of my life per game, late nights/early morning finishes, and renewing my software license, without at least seeing that it's worth spending that time creating it - that I am RIGHT about CATFLAP! being a great game, and there still being a market for great, fun, none-generic/cloned games and none-IAP-greedy developers....  :(

There are a number of ways in which you can help me out, ranging from either just downloading the game and trying it, through to a simple (and much-appreciated) £1, £2, or £5, pledge/contribution towards my advertising if you think my participation and games in the indie scene are worth supporting!

If I can get a healthy amount of advertising revenue via this campaign, (and manage to establish my 'studio' name/quality for the benefit of future releases!),  (ALL of the contributions will be used for advertising), then if my game does well, I will be giving an ongoing 10% BACK, to the fantastic GamesAid Charity!

I've chosen a flexible campaign in case ongoing support or investment is forthcoming (you never know!)

PS! - CATFLAP! FULL is currently FREE for TEN DAYS, starting from tomorrow, so grab the full version while you can, and please, if you like it, rate it/review it? - Cheers guys!

2.  What I Need, & What You Get

Well, I need to try to get CATFLAP! recognised for what it IS - a fun, long-lasting challenge casual game for ALL ages (yes, even adults too!), with lots of rewards for skillful play.  In addition to this, hopefully a means to help make life a little more financially secure for myself and my family, and keep me creating fun mobile games.

What YOU can get from helping me realise my dream:-

  • A chance to make my games come to life! - to proudly say "I helped this great little game take off, and I'm a supporter of/hero to small indie developers!" - hopefully trying out CATFLAP! will let you see that I CAN make fun games, that I pour my heart into making them, and that I will only get better and faster at it!

  • A chance to help GAMES AID - I'll be donating a fixed percentage (10%) of any income I might receive, when I manage to gain momentum, to this most worthwhile charity cause.


3.  The Impact That Your Help Will Have

Any financial help towards getting the word out there, via KNOWN, REPUTABLE advertising routes will help CATFLAP! gain momentum, and hopefully help it take off, showing that there IS still a market for original ideas/content in the small, 1-2 person indie developers' market, and so help me put my heart and soul into creating more great games!

  • You'll be helping a struggling, ethical indie developer to get their games recognised, and perhaps balance up the glut of greedy repeat-IAP-consumable-only powered games that won't allow you to buy the GAME, but instead require you to buy IAP after IAP after IAP, just to stand a chance of getting some enjoyment out of the game!
  • If I get enough support, I'll invest the time to set up and publish/port the game (and future games) to other platforms (Fire, TV, Tizen, Windows 8/10, etc), and Apple Watch even, if do-able!

  • You'll be helping the fantastic GAMES AID charity, when any revenue comes in.  In short, you're ultimately giving MORE than your initial pledge to charity, if CATFLAP! becomes successful enough!
  • I honestly believe that without the crowdfunding community's help, I simply cannot make any progress in this industry, being unable to promote my game or get it downloaded, as EVERY review site I have tried wants money to assure a (possibly unseen by the mainstream public) review, and they want LOTS of it.  So instead, I'd rather use your contributions to promote directly, via social media advertising (Facebook, Twitter, etc), reputable review site advertising, and generally any advertising option that has a proven impact/result with promoting apps.
  • Of course, if this campaign is successful, I'll add even more features, and invest more time into making CATFLAP even better! - ie. Online achievements / leaderboards, etc (currently they're local ones, restricted to your installation of CATFLAP, etc...)...


4.  Risks & Challenges

There is of course the risk that I don't receive enough (or even ANY!) support.

Hopefully you can plainly see that there is absolutely NO risk that this is a turkey, and that I CAN create more great games / that I have proven that I bring something fun and addictive to the mobile gaming community, and soon, Windows 8+ gaming community, with my first game!

Obviously, gaining NO support whatsoever pretty much kills off my chances of ever getting my game recognised/name established for any future games, but in the event that we DO collectively succeed in making 'CATFLAP!' the success that I think it really deserves to be, then this would be a great advert for the power of Crowdfunding, faith in the small/indie developer, and the kindness of like-minded strangers!

I KNOW that given a chance, my development and game design skills will allow me to unleash some more really cool, much-loved games on mobile devices, Windows 8, etc!


5.  Other Great Ways You Can Help Me Out!

Of course, financial help isn't everything! - the primary focus of this campaign is to get the word out there so that people can try (and hopefully LOVE!) my CATFLAP! game, spurring me on to create more original games, and continue doing something I love, whilst at the same time hopefully helping to pay my family's bills by either buying the full version, or upgrading the trial/tryout version!... 

So, please, PLEASE, regardless of whether you can or can't help directly with funding, I'd be HUGELY appreciative if you could possibly just do one (or even more than one/all!) of the following!

  • DOWNLOAD and INSTALL the FREE/TRIAL version for yourself, and maybe family/friends! (even if you might not have time yet, to actually play it!), to help it compete for installs/attention with mainstream titles!
  • Actually PLAY the free or FULL version, if you're so inclined!
  • RATE or REVIEW it honestly for me / feed back, if you enjoy it! :)   (...or not! :(  )
  • TELL your friends/family/colleagues/any review sites/Youtuber's you may know about CATFLAP! - perhaps even get them to do an unbiased playtest for me!  :)
  • TWEET YOUR SCORES! - If you get high scores that you're proud of on any of the trip modes, then please SHARE/TWEET them using the game's TWEET score button! - this will also help gain interest, as the URL and #CATFLAP! hashtag are included in the tweet, and people might take the time to see what the fuss is about!
  • SHARE using Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, etc, and generally spread the word/gain interest!
  • LIKE my CATFLAP Facebook page, to generate interest in it!  (https://www.facebook.com/catflapgame?ref=hl)

that I am RIGHT about CATFLAP! being a great game, and there still being a market for

:(There are a number of ways in which you can help me out, ranging from either just downloading the game and trying it, through to a simple (and much-appreciated) £1, £2, or £5, pledge/contribution towards my advertising if you think my participation and games in the indie scene are worth supporting!If I can get a healthy amount of advertising revenue via this campaign, (and manage to establish my 'studio' name/quality for the benefit of future releases!),  (ALL of the contributions will be used for advertising), then if my game does well, I will be giving an ongoing 10% BACK, to the fantastic GamesAid Charity!I've chosen a flexible campaign in case ongoing support or investment is forthcoming (you never know!)PS! - CATFLAP! FULL is currently FREE for TEN DAYS, starting from tomorrow, so grab the full version while you can, and please, if you like it, rate it/review it? - Cheers guys!
2. 
What I Need, & What You Get
Well, I need to try to get CATFLAP! recognised for what it IS - a fun,
long-lasting challenge casual game for ALL ages (yes, even adults too!), with lots of
rewards for skillful play.  In addition to this, hopefully a means to help make life a little
more financially secure for myself and my family, and keep me creating fun mobile games.
What YOU can get from helping me realise my dream:-

A chance
     to make my games come to life! - to proudly say "I helped this great
     little game take off, and I'm a supporter of/hero to small indie developers!" - hopefully trying out CATFLAP! will let
     you see that I CAN make fun games, that I pour my heart into making them,
     and that I will only get better and faster at it!

A chance
     to help GAMES AID - I'll be donating a fixed percentage (10%) of any income I might receive, when I manage to gain
     momentum, to this most worthwhile charity cause.


3. 
The Impact That Your Help Will Have
Any financial help towards getting the word out there, via KNOWN,
REPUTABLE advertising routes will help CATFLAP! gain momentum, and hopefully
help it take off, showing that there IS still a market for original ideas/content in the
small, 1-2 person indie developers' market, and so help me put my heart and soul into
creating more great games!

You'll be
     helping a struggling, ethical indie developer to get their games recognised,
     and perhaps balance up the glut of greedy repeat-IAP-consumable-only powered
     games that won't allow you to buy the GAME, but instead require you to buy
     IAP after IAP after IAP, just to stand a chance of getting some enjoyment
     out of the game!

If I get enough support, I'll invest the time to set up and publish/port the game (and future games) to other platforms (Fire, TV, Tizen, Windows 8/10, etc), and Apple Watch even, if do-able!

You'll be
     helping the fantastic GAMES AID charity, when any revenue comes in.
      In short, you're ultimately giving MORE than your initial pledge to charity, if
     CATFLAP! becomes successful enough!

I honestly
     believe that without the crowdfunding community's help, I simply cannot
     make any progress in this industry, being unable to promote my game or get it downloaded, as EVERY review
     site I have tried wants money to assure a (possibly unseen by the
     mainstream public) review, and they want LOTS of it.  So instead, I'd
     rather use your contributions to promote directly, via social media
     advertising (Facebook, Twitter, etc), reputable review site advertising,
     and generally any advertising option that has a proven impact/result with
     promoting apps.Of course, if this campaign is successful, I'll add even more features, and invest more time into making CATFLAP even better! - ie. Online achievements / leaderboards, etc (currently they're local ones, restricted to your installation of CATFLAP, etc...)...
4. 
Risks & Challenges
There is of course the risk that I don't receive enough (or even ANY!)
support. 
Hopefully you can plainly see that there is absolutely NO risk that this
is a turkey, and that I CAN create more great games / that I have proven that
I bring something fun and addictive to the mobile gaming community, and soon, Windows 8+ gaming
community, with my first game!
Obviously, gaining NO support whatsoever pretty much kills off my chances
of ever getting my game recognised/name established for any future games, but
in the event that we DO collectively succeed in making 'CATFLAP!' the success
that I think it really deserves to be, then this would be a great advert for the
power of Crowdfunding, faith in the small/indie developer, and the kindness of
like-minded strangers!
I KNOW that given a chance, my development and game design skills
will allow me to unleash some more really cool, much-loved games on mobile devices,
Windows 8, etc!
5. 
Other Great Ways You Can Help Me Out!
Of course, financial help isn't everything! - the primary focus of this
campaign is to get the word out there so that people can try (and hopefully
LOVE!) my CATFLAP! game, spurring me on to create more original games, and
continue doing something I love, whilst at the same time hopefully helping to
pay my family's bills by either buying the full version, or upgrading the trial/tryout version!... 
So, please, PLEASE, regardless of whether you can or can't help directly with funding, I'd be HUGELY appreciative if you could possibly just do one (or even more than one/all!) of the
following!

DOWNLOAD
     and INSTALL the FREE/TRIAL version for yourself, and maybe family/friends! (even if you might not have time yet,
     to actually play it!), to help it compete for installs/attention with
     mainstream titles!

Actually PLAY the
     free or FULL version, if you're so inclined!

RATE or
     REVIEW it honestly for me / feed back, if you enjoy it! :)   (...or not! :(  )


TELL your
     friends/family/colleagues/any review sites/Youtuber's you may know about
     CATFLAP! - perhaps even get them to do an unbiased playtest for me! 
     :)

TWEET YOUR
     SCORES! - If you get high scores that you're proud of on any of the trip
     modes, then please SHARE/TWEET them using the game's TWEET score button! -
     this will also help gain interest, as the URL and #CATFLAP! hashtag are
     included in the tweet, and people might take the time to see what the fuss
     is about!

SHARE
     using Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, etc, and generally spread the
     word/gain interest!
LIKE my CATFLAP Facebook page, to generate interest in it!  (https://www.facebook.com/catflapgame?ref=hl)

story:
Click me to download! Spirits: Ciel Bleu Windows

 
Click me to download! Spirits: Ciel Bleu Linux
 
Click me to download! Spirits: Ciel Bleu Mac
 

The game has been greenlit! Thank you so much for your support! Click here.

 

Willard Rouse is an ordinary 17-year high school student who is often by himself. By accident, he discovered that he is a spirit bearer, one who could summon and use the power of spirits. After getting kicked out of Rainvalley Academy, he transferred to Ficaso Academy. Much to his surprise, Willard found himself in the company of great friends at Ficaso which led him to think that he could finally enjoy his years in high school without being misunderstood. However, Ficaso Academy is not what it appears to be. Willard started to have suspicions when he learned that the school prohibits students to make contact with the outside world until they graduate. Eventually, Willard realized that all the students in Ficaso are spirit bearers but they are unable to summon their spirits due to spirit jammers strategically placed around the academy. What secrets lie beneath the walls of Ficaso Academy? What challenges await Willard and his friends in their quest to escape?

Discover the secrets of Ficaso Academy; learn more about Shades, creatures who devour the souls of spirit bearers, and meet the powerful Spirits that could be summoned by Willard and his friends. Watch Willard hone his spirit powers and develop his relationships with the people around him!

 

 

 

Promotional Images

 

 

This is only a sample for the Guardian Angel Tier (the unedited Version will be given)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NXt6EA6aF9o

Art Video Process

Story: 100%  

Script: 50%  

Programming: 50%  

GUI: 100% Sprites: 50%  

BG: 50%  

CG: 50%  

Music: All music files came from the public domain

 

 

Larvin/Lharl: Project Leader, Creator, Writer, Artist, BG Artist, Gui Design, Programmer. Deviantart

Lars: 3D Artist, Programmer, Social Media Content Creator  

Elle: Writer, Editor, Social Media and Print Media Content Creator

This is the first project of Lucas Cube Studios so we are extra motivated share it with visual novel enthusiasts. We hope to get constructive feedback that would improve the quality of our work. We will use the funding generated through Indiegogo to complete the remainder of the game.

 

 

Crossroads ($7000)- We will add a menu to give you choices in some parts of the game.

More CGs ($10000) - We will be able to create more beautiful CGs with this stretch goal.

Atalica's Arc($20000) - We will add Atalica's side story when this goal is met.

 

 

Risks and challenges

We have already spent 8 months on this project conceptualizing the story and designing the characters. We will complete this project, with or without Indiegogo's aid but the funding would allow us to polish our work and produce a high quality visual novel with a rich story line that fans of fantasy adventure genre would enjoy. 

Connect, follow, and have a conversation with us on social media:

Twitter https://twitter.com/lucas3studios 

Tumblr https://www.tumblr.com/blog/lucascubestudios

Facebook https://www.facebook.com/larvinlharl

If you have any questions, feel free to ask. :)

story:
Welcome!

We are #seijess.

About Us:

Sei
 - Passionate about video games since early childhood.
 - Knowledgeable in Game Design
 - American Video Game Reviewer for at7addak.com, Gameskinny.com, Examiner.com
 - Primarily a PC Gamer who loves League of Legends.
 - Participant of Extra-Life Charity Events

Jess
 - Has beat the original Sims on PS2
 - Enthusiastic player of Dance Dance Revolution
 - Has a woman crush on Jinx of League of Legends
 - Loves a great game story line.
 - Entrepreneurial spirit

…and we want to open our first LAN Center!

What is a LAN Center?

A LAN Center is a place where individuals can use computer systems connected to a Local Area Network primarily for the purpose of playing multiplayer computer games.

What OUR LAN Center can offer to the Community

  • A Secure Place for Local Teenagers, Young Adults, and Longtime Gamers to play
  • Separate After School Homework and Tutoring program
  • Student workshops for Game Design, IT, and other computer based careers
  • Special needs catered nights
  • Party Room and Lounge
  • Jobs and opportunities to volunteer

Set Up
Our building will have top of the line gaming systems and offer up the ability to play the newest releases as they are released. Gamers will be able to pay for day, week, year passes and/or pay a monthly fee to use our center. Our customers will also be able to enjoy pizza, wings and beverages during down time as well. Tournaments, Special Needs nights, Vintage Game Console Night, Student Workshops, and other competitions are also planned to be offered. While our center will primarily be focused on newer game systems (i.e PS4, XBOX One, Wii U, Virtual Reality, etc.) we will also have custom built PC Gaming Machines.

The Plan
While our initial need seems to be a bit of a stretch we intend on using any money donated towards taking our first steps to making this dream, this idea into a reality. #seijess are currently living in western New York and hope to acquire enough to move down to Long Island to be closer to family and make a difference in a home community.

Stay tuned for information about our after school program in the update section.

story:
A 70-YEAR OLD INVENTOR OF A MULTI-AWARDED EDUCATIONAL, STRATEGY BOARD GAME WISHES TO DEVELOP FURTHER HIS INVENTION INTO A GAME APP



WHO AM I

I am LEONARDO MEJIA YU, born on March 29, 1945 in Inopacan, Leyte, Philippines, grew up in General Santos City, Mindanao and now living with my wife in Manila, Philippines. I have 3 grown-up daughters. I am a public service retiree.


Inspired by my childhood experiences and happy memories in the farm, I thought of games. Surely, it is fun to play games and for quite some time I have been thinking of inventing mind-enhancing board games.


MY INVENTION

 I invented Challenge 21 – a fun-to-play multi-player board game intended to enhance mental skills through the formation (and/or blocking) of nature-inspired shapes and patterns with mathematical logic.

(i.e. The player who first reaches at least 21 points from a combination of patterns, net of all penalties, and declares "Deal!" will be the winner).

 

                       Challenge 21 Cover                       Challenge 21 Board and Chips

Challenge 21 is a multi-player board game (2 to 4 players). It can serve as a tool for bonding activities among family members and friends as well as a tool to bridge generation gaps as it can be played together by people of different ages such as grandparents, parents, and grandchildren of at least six (6) years of age.


A family playing Challenge 21 together 

                         Families and friends playing Challenge 21 together

Challenge 21 is fun, exciting and easy to play. It combines some playing elements/principles of Tic-Tac-Toe (blocking opponents), Scrabble (forming of patterns instead of letters in scrabble with corresponding points), Chess (strategizing), Breakthrough (forming of vertical, horizontal or diagonal patterns), Bingo (forfeiture of right to win if one fails to declare “Bingo” and for Challenge 21 to call “Deal”upon reaching a winning combination of patterns) and Basketball (penalty for failure to comply to certain rules of the game).

Due to its originality, uniqueness and being a creative, fascinating, truly engrossing, and fun game to play, Challenge 21 has WON THE FOLLOWING AWARDS:

NOTE: Challenge 21 is registered with WIPO, patented in the Philippines and in Singapore.


MARKETING REALITIES

After gaining recognition and winning awards, I tried to market Challenge 21 in its present manual form in different venues such as in bookstores, department stores, and in other venues sponsored by private entities and government agencies, but it is sad to say, it encountered difficulties in penetrating the market.

After more than three (3) years of trying to market my invention, I came to realize that people nowadays are more hooked into playing high-tech computer game APPS rather than playing manual board games.


NEW HOPE – TO DEVELOP CHALLENGE 21 INTO A GAME APP

Learning from past marketing experience, I am still hoping and looking forward to seeing my game invention reach-out to people of various ages in different places – but this time, Challenge 21 shall be in a different form.

I am now thinking of developing my invention from its present manual form into a high-tech computer Game APP. I strongly believe that Challenge 21 has its rightful place in society as it could be a tool for bonding activities, help in strengthening family relationships and bridge generation gaps. Also, I believe that the development of the mind towards critical thinking, for people of various ages, is a need that cannot be ignored, and that Challenge 21 could possibly be one of the tools to fill up this need. With these thoughts, I must set-off and move on to develop Challenge 21 into a Game APP.


WHAT WILL HAPPEN TO THE MANUAL BOARD GAME SET?

I intend to continue with the production of the manual board game set to distribute at a low price or if resources will allow donate reasonable number of sets to schools and communities in far flung places in the Philippines especially in depressed areas where people cannot afford high-tech gadgets. This is part of my advocacy when I invented Challenge 21.


WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

We need to raise US$71,000 to develop Challenge 21 board game into a Game App (Mindpulse Challenge) and to construct and open two (2) kiosks (one-at-a-time) in department stores, as well as to advertise the game (both the APP and manual game) in different forms of media. We will also need to acquire some equipment and Paraphernalia such as 2 flat-screen TVs (1 per kiosk) to showcase on how to play Challenge 21 Game App,  4 android tablets (2 per kiosk) for test-playing the Challenge 21 Game App, a total of 6 tables (with chrome-plated monoleg) and 20 chairs for players to test-play both the manual game and Game App as well as for the attendants and one (1) unit server for operational, control, and security in downloading the Challenge 21 Game App.


With your support YOU COULD HELP…

  1. In keeping children away from violent video games
  2. In strengthening family relationships and in bridging generation gaps
  3. In the development of mental skills towards critical thinking
  4. In spreading something worthy and good for society
  5. In the fulfillment of a lasting legacy

Furthermore your name shall be forever credited and acknowledged with the appreciation  and thanks of the Inventor in a link of our website in the Challenge 21 Game APP plus you will receive the various perks stated in the reward portion of this campaign.


MY WISH, HOPE AND PRAYER

I wish, hope and pray that with your support and through Indiegogo’s funding venue, the lasting legacy that I have been dreaming of to reach out to people of various ages in different places shall be realized soon, and hopefully, in my lifetime.

          "COME, SUPPORT A DREAM
                    AND TOGETHER WE SHALL BUILD A LEGACY…                                                      …OUR LASTING LEGACY TO THE WORLD!”


REWARDS

US$5

  • Credit and acknowledge contributors’ names in our website link in the       MindPulse Challenge Game APP

US$25

  • 2 Free downloads of MindPulse Challenge Game  APP (Levels 1 & 2 – Challenge 15 & 21) once completed. We will update you on the progress.
  • Credit and acknowledge contributors’ names in our website in the Mindpulse Challenge Game APP
  • A certificate of Appreciation signed by the Inventor with his photo

US$75

  • 5 Free downloads of MindPulse Challenge Game  APP (Levels 1 & 2 – Challenge 15 & 21) once completed. We will update you on the progress.
  • Credit and acknowledge contributors’ names in our website link in the Mindpulse Challenge Game APP
  • A certificate of Appreciation signed by the Inventor with his photo
  • 1 key chain with inscription “I Love Challenge 21”

US$150 

  • 10 Free downloads of MindPulse Challenge Game  APP (Levels 1 & 2 – Challenge 15 & 21) once completed. We will update you on the progress.
  • Credit and acknowledge contributors’ names in our website link in the Mindpulse Challenge Game APP
  • A certificate of Appreciation signed by the Inventor with his photo
  • 2 key chains with inscription “I Love Challenge 21”
  • 1 T-shirt printed with “I Love Challenge 21”

US$300 

  • 15 Free downloads of MindPulse Challenge Game  APP (Levels 1 & 2 – Challenge 15 & 21) once completed. We will update you on the progress.
  • Credit and acknowledge contributors’ names in our website link in the Mindpulse Challenge Game APP
  • A certificate of Appreciation signed by the Inventor with his photo
  • 2 key chains with inscription “I Love Challenge 21”
  • 1 T-shirt printed with “ I Love Challenge 21”
  • 1 set of Challenge 21 board game

US$550 

  • 20 Free downloads of MindPulse Challenge Game  APP (Levels 1 & 2 – Challenge 15 & 21)  once completed. We will update you on the progress.
  • Credit and acknowledge contributors’ names in our website in the Mindpulse Challenge Game APP
  • A certificate of Appreciation signed by the Inventor with his photo
  • 4 key chains with inscription “I Love Challenge 21”
  • 2 T-shirts printed with “I Love Challenge 21”
  • 2 sets of Challenge 21 board game


THANK YOU FOR ALL OF YOUR SUPPORT!
A virtual hug and high five to all of you!

story:
We are making this studio for the...

Short Summary

Who are we?

My name is Christopher Larue and I am the founder and president of Attainable Entertainment Inc, headquartered in downtown Sudbury Ontario Canada. I am an entrepreneur with a history of game development, graphic design, web development, 3D art and junior animation. I wear a lot of hats! 

I started this online video game company for a few reasons:

  • Every year, thousands of university/college graduates are pouring out of school with barely any experience they need to get hired by a major studio OR they do but still aren't getting hired because competition is so high
  • AAA game engines are free to use and there is no more pay wall to use them, also because of that there is now a ton of resource material (tutorials) to help someone learn how to use the engines. 
  • Digital distribution makes getting a game on the market much more easier than the past. 
  • People want to work from home or on the road in a RV, Sailboat or cabin in the woods.  
  • The culture of collaboration is in full swing (think github)
  • Some developers want to start getting paid based on game sales.  
  • It takes a long time to make a game because studios only have so much staff ($). An online studio could yield a few thousand devs on a single project. Meaning games may be finished faster (which gives us a competitive edge if we do it right)
  • It's WAY cheaper to run an online studio then a physically based one. Which means less lay offs and more creative freedom. 
  • In 2017 the internet is everywhere and people already know how to use it effectively
  • Video games are the future of digital entertainment be it VR, AR or traditional. They are here to stay and only get bigger and better. 
  • Making a game alone is hard, simple as that. Having teammates makes it easier!

I started small and launched v1.0 of the website and system back in November 2016. I gathered 22 developers from all around Canada and started to work on a PC horror game. That game is now in production and moving along which gave me confidence to create the upgraded v2.0 with further reach, improved systems and more accessibility.

Concept art for the PC horror game below: 

What the campaign is about and why it's important

This campaign is about raising money to help build a online video game studio that developers from all skill levels can join and make games that leave us laughing, empowered to even weeping for years to come. Why is it important? We (you and me) are making this for developers that want to start or grow in fields such as...

The magnitude of what you will help us achieve

By getting behind this campaign with your contribution you will allow this studio to potentially become a major player in the industry. We are starting off humble, slow, with a small office but with support from you and others, this studio will create jobs, games, careers, friendships and maybe even romance! Heck, you might meet your future lover by working on or playing a game we make! "Whooaaaa"-Keanu Reeves. 

What We Need & What You Get

Lawyer

I need to get a lawyer to adjust my current agreement and expand on the straight commission compensation. Currently contractors only get paid for a full year 12 months after game sales, I would like to lengthen that time to a few years. Also, I need the agreement to cover more international law. I also need a few other legal forms. 

Website Developer/Network Admin

The web dev will be contracted to assist me in creating a smooth functioning website with all the bells and whistles I originally intended the site and system to have. 

Concept Artist

When developers join the projects they will need to understand what the game theme is and the general direction we want it to go. Concept art also gets the creative juices flowing and devs excited to work on the projects. I have a great artist that is doing great work and I would like to compensate him for his fantastic work and dedication to the studio.

Below is some of the concept art for some upcoming projects that we will open with. You can tell he is a talented guy!

Accountant 

To assist me with the new payment plan set up and doing research on international systems. Also to assist with bookkeeping services as well, especially after an Indiegogo campaign.   

Servers

Of course we need bigger safe and secure servers to run the subversion system as well as the website. Also to save multiple copies of the games we produce. 

Web Domain SSL

To ensure safety in our web traffic, we need an SSL certificate. 

Office

This is to upgrade office equipment such as the main computer. The main computer this business is running on is getting outdated and to keep up with the games we create I need a new rig so I can test and greenlight them. Also helps with office rent too. 

Indiegogo

Using Indiegogo for a crowdfunding method I need to factor in their 5% fee on transactions into the budget. So naturally I added it to the calculation. (They suggest I do this)

PERKS!

Oh boy, it's perk time! I tried to incorporate fun perks that will enable you to help the campaign as well as help future game creation! Plus as a gamer, it would be cool to see your stuff in game! Also, since we are coming at you when we need you the most, all these perks are for every game the studio completes. I figure that offers the best value for your buck, it's a limited time offer so I might as well make it worth your while!

Stretch Goals!

Where do the funds go if we don't reach our entire goal?

If we don't reach our goal, whatever bit of money that gets passed down will be prioritized and put where it needs to go first (web/system design). I already have a solid foundation from v1.0 so things will move along, just more slowly. 

The Impact

The impact a successful campaign would have is pretty monumental for multiple reasons;

  • People will have a studio that accepts them and gives them a real chance to prove themselves in this industry. 
  • We make games that sell and with every game sold we put 5% towards our Cause, Cure and Invention system. We can donate to communities, medical research and inventors so they get the funding they need. Making the world a better place in the long term. 
  • "Money where your mouth is" development ability. Meaning that if our games are taking to long to make, jump in the pit and help the game move forward.  This is a unique ability other studios don't exercise.  
  • Straight commission means that developers can potentially make more (much more) money then the traditional salary model. Thus getting paid fairly for the hard work.  
  • Potential to make franchise hits that are remembered for ages! 
  • Possibly change the way the other industry studios run their studio.

Other Ways You Can Help

As mentioned in the video, be sure to share this campaign with anyone that you know would be interested in starting a career making video games, plays video games or want's to join a group and make new friends. This studio can and may be the studio that changes the future of the game industry!

Spread the word! Let others know that there is a new kid on the block that utilizes the full power of the internet, believes in its developers and pays straight sales commission to its developers!

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the news!!!!

story:
For years I have been waiting for a good star wars game to come out, I'm already 34 years old and still waiting, one could say I have given up on waiting and decided to make it myself, however this is just a modification on a suitable platform where one could Explore, Trade, and Build in the Star Wars universe.
My aim is maximum immersion, very high quality models and scenery, in line with the original trilogy.

Unfortunately my job does not leave me with much free time, and barely pays the bills, a few small donations can help me free up some time to work on this.

I'm in no way trying to make money on this, it is just a dream i want to see come true!


After a year of working on this we are at version 0.76 (40% complete)
Downloadable from egosoft, you guys can check out how its going.
I have spent almost every free minute i get on this, and in desperate need of more time for this.
Im sure you are a eager as i am to dive into the star wars universe and build your own empire or defeat one.

many thanks :)

story:
We are build a new ride in Ontario, California and want to share it with you and make an impact in the local community. 


THE RiDE 7D is an immersive, interactive motion ride experience. You will feel the thrill of a roller-coaster and the excitement of a state-of-the-art laser blasting game all in one!  

After a brief tutorial on safety, passengers are buckled into the latest in motion seat technology, given 3D glasses and a laser blaster before the real fun begins.

Each of our rides offer a unique experience.

Our Fun/Adventure ride is tame and family friendly, set in the wild west and a great place to start. 

Next, we have our Action-Packed ride which has the most motion, shooting and is set in New York City.  This is truly an epic ride and one of our staff's favorites.

Finally, our Spooky/Scary ride has the most jump scares while trying to survive the Zombie Apocalypse. It definitely lives up to Spooky/Scary!

While you're riding, and engaging with the content with your laser blasters, you are racking up points on our digital leader board.  At the end of your ride, you will see how you stacked up against others on your ride making each ride a potential competition

When you come off your ride, we have a photo booth where you can browse your photos.  Just like the big amusement park rides. All our photos are themed to each ride and have your scores on them, just like the ones above.

Now we need your support

We believe in giving back.  So, for every ride ticket you purchase, we will donate 1 ride ticket to the local Boys and Girls Club.  This becomes a win/win.  You get to come experience the thrill and your gift allows someone else to also come enjoy the new ride. 

What will you do with our donations?

We will use any funds raised on Indiegogo to give ride tickets to the local Boys and Girls Club.  Our way of giving back to the local community. 

What do you get?

In exchange for your donation, we will offer you actual ride tickets and photo souvenirs to Experience The Thrill...  All Indiegogo donors will get early access to THE RiDE 7D Ontario, CA location. Whether you choose 1 ride ticket or a bundle of ride tickets, you, your friends and family are going to have a fun time. Plus, you will be the first which gives you bragging rights. If you live outside of California or can't make it, don't worry we have a way you can still participate. See our rewards marked Boys and Girls Club to donate your ride ticket reward to a kid or family in need.  It's the ultimate reward because it helps us and the kids.

Where exactly will your new location be?

We have chosen Ontario Mills, which is one of the largest shopping malls in North America with 200 stores and 1.4 million square feet.  It's located in Ontario, California and it's one of the primary tourist attractions in the Inland Empire.  The mall is just minutes from the Ontario Airport, Convention Center and many hotels.

How old do you have to be?

We have no age limit just a height limit of a minimum of 40 inches and a weight maximum limit of 350 pounds per person.

When do you expect your new location to be open?

We are shooting for an October 2017 launch date.

Please back this project

On the road to success...

Warmest Regards,
Drew J. Kaplan/Founder
THE RiDE 7D
Experience The Thill...

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give us a financial contribution, don't worry, there are other ways you can help us:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
    • Facebook
    • Twitter
    • Instagram
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Information about our two charitable rewards.

The first Boys' Club was founded in 1860 in Hartford, Connecticut. In 1906, 53 independent Boys' Clubs came together in Boston to form a national organization, the Federated Boys' Clubs. In 1931, the organization renamed itself Boys' Clubs of America, and in 1990, to Boys & Girls Clubs of America. As of 2010, there are over 4,000 autonomous local clubs, which are affiliates of the national organization. In total these clubs serve over four million boys and girls. Clubs can be found in all fifty states as well as locations in Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, and US military bases. In total, Boys & Girls Clubs of America employ about 50,000 staff members. (Source: Wikipedia)

THANK YOU for your support!
