story:
Tired of war, ninjas and zombies?

So were we.

That's why, 3 years ago, we started building FireJumpers.

We were just a 2-person indie team. But we were inspired by the grit and heroism displayed by wildland firefighters - battling massive fires to save lives and property - with some very cool equipment!

Our first wildfire game was FireJumpers Wildfire RTS. In this paid, single-player game, the player fights wildfires in locales around the world, from Malibu to Hong Kong. It was a success on Android and iOS, with an average rating of more than 4.5 out of 5.


That's when we got a call from a Canadian wildland firefighting agency asking us to build them an Air Attack Officer training simulation. This became FireJumpersPro ATS (Aerial Training Simulator), which features a multi-player feature for remote training.


Multi-player was so much fun that we brought the feature back to mobile gamers with FireJumpers Sandbox. In this "sandbox", players set up their own wildfire scenarios by choosing a map, specifying the fire location and wind speed/direction, and then inviting other players to join them in fighting the fire.


The new game, FireJumpers Inferno, will incorporate many of the features already developed for Sandbox, including:

  • Sophisticated real-time fire simulation that burns differently each time (depending on terrain and wind)
  • Multi-player (allows a team to tackle the largest fires)
  • "Walkie-Talkie" button (for real-time communication with the team)
  • Air units (helicopters, water bombers, retardant bombers)
  • Ground units (cut teams, hose teams, bulldozers, engines, brush trucks, smokejumpers)
  • Civilian units
  • 25 maps from around the world

But that's just the beginning...

FireJumpers Inferno will super-charge the wildfire fighting gamer experience, and we'd like to invite you to be part of the adventure!

New Features for FireJumpers Inferno:

BUILD YOUR TEAM:
  • Unit experience will be recorded
  • Unit upgrade system
  • Leaderboards for the most experienced units and players
  • "Request Reinforcements" feature

CHALLENGING SCENARIOS:

  • Scenarios including maps, fire, and weather (pre-built and build-your-own)
  • More and bigger maps
  • Fuel for bombers and helicopters
  • "Wildfire Weekend" tournaments

SOCIAL:

  • Create a team of friends
  • Notifications when friends are playing
  • Invite friends to private games
  • Play against other teams

MORE UNITS:

  • More ground units (e.g. hotshots, transport trucks)
  • More air units (e.g. P3 retardant bomber)
  • Police unit to direct traffic

MUSIC & SOUND EFFECTS:

  • Adaptive music (changes based on the action)
  • Improved sound effects

...and for the Pros:

Professional wildland firefighters are some of our biggest fans and for many of you, FireJumpers is more than just a game - it's also a training tool. That's why we are planning some special features for you:

IMPROVED FIRE MODEL:

  • Hidden hotspots or wetspots (where fire blazes ahead or slows down)
  • Different types of trees (pines, redwoods, etc.)
  • Back-burning
  • Terrain steepness
  • Rain and humidity

PROFESSIONAL UNITS:

  • Large water tanker (ground unit) to help replenish other water units
  • Water units (hose team, engines, etc.) will have to refill periodically.
  • Fire hydrants
  • Controlled-burn unit
  • Light water bomber
  • DC-10 Retardant Bomber
  • P3 Super Retardant Bomber
  • 747 bomber

TRAINING ROOM OPTIONS:

  • Support for generating maps from real locations (with ArcGIS)
  • Improved map editor
  • Ability to save custom maps
  • Ability to slow down/speed up time


Reviews from our Fans:

Here are just a few of the 1000+ reviews of FireJumpers Sandbox:

"I have been looking for a game like this for so long!!! The game play is great the general idea is great. I love the fact that the creator cares about the game and continues to update the game and also cares about the people that play and purchase their games. This game is great for any one of any age and I highly recommend purchasing it. Thank you for such a great game." - Barbara
"Amazing This is the first time I ever played a game like this and it is fun!" -Aaya
"Very good game This game is one of the best games I have played. Please continue with the development to make it even better if it is possible ;)" - Rok
"I have played this game before and it's great There are no words for this game" -Jamarin
"Cool This game is very cool one of the best I've seen, I play it almost everyday" -Michael
"Love it I was looking for a game like this for a very long time..... Thank You for this AWESOME game." -Quy
"Honestly One of THE best games I have played. Its not very often you can actually play a game with the developer and tell him the issues you have, live, while playing!! And its a sure thing that the developer won't just give up on this and that there will always be constant updates because the dev plays the game himself!! I was amazed when (for the first time) last night I played the game and he joined my server!! He is very very active in the games community!! And to top it off... The game is amazing!! Top quality:)" -Daniel
"Awesome Firefighting Game This game is an amazing concept and I love seeing it evolve. It's nice to be able to talk to the developers while you play the game. Great teamwork guys!" -Jesse
"Amazing Played for about 30 seconds and upgraded . From the original this has all the best parts and taken to the next level . Great work guys . All the guys at the station play in between fires . Keep it up" -Reg
"Best game ever This is the best game ever made for phone I got my phone taken in school because I'm always playing xD. Thanks guys for making this game" -Aeddin
"One of the best games I've ever played good job guys!" -Jaime

Our Inspiration:

In case you still think that War, Ninjas and Zombies are more exciting than wildland firefighting...


Credit: USDA
story_txt:
Tired of war, ninjas and zombies?

So were we.
That's why, 3 years ago, we started building FireJumpers.
We were just a 2-person indie team. But we were inspired by the grit and heroism displayed by wildland firefighters - battling massive fires to save lives and property - with some very cool equipment!
Our first wildfire game was FireJumpers Wildfire RTS. In this paid, single-player game, the player fights wildfires in locales around the world, from Malibu to Hong Kong. It was a success on Android and iOS, with an average rating of more than 4.5 out of 5.
That's when we got a call from a Canadian wildland firefighting agency asking us to build them an Air Attack Officer training simulation. This became FireJumpersPro ATS (Aerial Training Simulator), which features a multi-player feature for remote training. 
Multi-player was so much fun that we brought the feature back to mobile gamers with FireJumpers Sandbox. In this "sandbox", players set up their own wildfire scenarios by choosing a map, specifying the fire location and wind speed/direction, and then inviting other players to join them in fighting the fire.
The new game, FireJumpers Inferno, will incorporate many of the features already developed for Sandbox, including:

Sophisticated real-time fire simulation that burns differently each time (depending on terrain and wind)
Multi-player (allows a team to tackle the largest fires)
"Walkie-Talkie" button (for real-time communication with the team)
Air units (helicopters, water bombers, retardant bombers)
Ground units (cut teams, hose teams, bulldozers, engines, brush trucks, smokejumpers)

Civilian units
25 maps from around the world

But that's just the beginning...
 FireJumpers Inferno will super-charge the wildfire fighting gamer experience, and we'd like to invite you to be part of the adventure!
New Features for FireJumpers Inferno:
BUILD YOUR TEAM:


  Unit experience will be recorded

Unit upgrade system

Leaderboards for the most experienced units and players


  "Request Reinforcements" feature


CHALLENGING SCENARIOS:


Scenarios including maps, fire, and weather (pre-built and build-your-own)
More and bigger maps
Fuel for bombers and helicopters

 "Wildfire Weekend" tournaments

SOCIAL:

Create a team of friends
Notifications when friends are playing

 Invite friends to private games
Play against other teams


MORE UNITS:



  More ground units (e.g. hotshots, transport trucks)


  More air units (e.g. P3 retardant bomber)


Police unit to direct traffic



  MUSIC & SOUND EFFECTS:


Adaptive music (changes based on the action)


Improved sound effects



...and for the Pros:
Professional wildland firefighters are some of our biggest fans and for many of you, FireJumpers is more than just a game - it's also a training tool. That's why we are planning some special features for you:
IMPROVED FIRE MODEL:


Hidden hotspots or wetspots (where fire blazes ahead or slows down)
  
Different types of trees (pines, redwoods, etc.)

Back-burning  
Terrain steepness
Rain and humidity


PROFESSIONAL UNITS:

Large water tanker (ground unit) to help replenish other water units
Water units (hose team, engines, etc.) will have to refill periodically.
Fire hydrants
Controlled-burn unit
Light water bomber
DC-10 Retardant Bomber
P3 Super Retardant Bomber
747 bomber

TRAINING ROOM OPTIONS:


Support for generating maps from real locations (with ArcGIS)  


Improved map editor  

Ability to save custom maps
Ability to slow down/speed up time





Reviews from our Fans:
Here are just a few of the 1000+ reviews of FireJumpers Sandbox:
"I have been looking for a game like this for so long!!! The game play is great the general idea is great. I love the fact that the creator cares about the game and continues to update the game and also cares about the people that play and purchase their games. This game is great for any one of any age and I highly recommend purchasing it. Thank you for such a great game." - Barbara
"Amazing This is the first time I ever played a game like this and it is fun!" -Aaya
"Very good game This game is one of the best games I have played. Please continue with the development to make it even better if it is possible ;)" - Rok

"I have played this game before and it's great There are no words for this game" -Jamarin
"Cool This game is very cool one of the best I've seen, I play it almost everyday" -Michael
"Love it I was looking for a game like this for a very long time..... Thank You for this AWESOME game." -Quy
"Honestly One of THE best games I have played. Its not very often you can actually play a game with the developer and tell him the issues you have, live, while playing!! And its a sure thing that the developer won't just give up on this and that there will always be constant updates because the dev plays the game himself!! I was amazed when (for the first time) last night I played the game and he joined my server!! He is very very active in the games community!! And to top it off... The game is amazing!! Top quality:)" -Daniel
"Awesome Firefighting Game This game is an amazing concept and I love seeing it evolve. It's nice to be able to talk to the developers while you play the game. Great teamwork guys!" -Jesse
"Amazing Played for about 30 seconds and upgraded . From the original this has all the best parts and taken to the next level . Great work guys . All the guys at the station play in between fires . Keep it up" -Reg
"Best game ever This is the best game ever made for phone I got my phone taken in school because I'm always playing xD. Thanks guys for making this game" -Aeddin
"One of the best games I've ever played good job guys!" -Jaime

story:
First I'm making this game for iOS and android, I need an apple computer in order to make the game for iOS and I need a game salad pro software for the game, the rest of the money is for a marketing strategy. The earnings are for creating my game company. Sharkpedo is an awesome game, you shoot shark torpedos to fishing boats, there are going to be different characters during the game.

I think my game will impact like Angry Birds

I will be facing a lot of obstacles like learning how to make the game. After completing my project I will have to make the people know my game with marketing strategies, it will be really hard to do that, but I'm not afraid of anything and I will complete my project

story:
What Remains takes place weeks after a viral toxin is released into the atmosphere where a large portion of the human population is infected by a deadly virus, most who are infected do not survive the infection. While a lucky small percentage were immune to this virus, others were not, the ones that did not die from there infection started to change into vicious, deranged, blood thirsty maniacs that act only on primal instinct devoid of compassion, or reason. The government declared them "The Infected" and were to be quarantined. But the infection spread faster then anticipated, terror ran rampant, and citizens were forced to evacuate their homes but unfortunately, they could not hide from this deadly viral toxin. All metropolitan cities were declared infected zones and abandoned. 

You, as a player take on the role of a survivor, who scavenges the cities for shelter, food, items and weapons just to survive....  

You are not alone out there, Besides "The Infected", there are other survivors (players) out there,  just like you, fighting to survive. Some are friendly scavengers willing to trade and help, others are bandit just waiting to strike and steal your belongings. Ultimately, it is up to you, the Player, to decide what roll you will play, and only you will decide ... What Remains.

Official What Remains Website
IndieGoGo Exculsive Limited edition What Remains: Chapter 1 T-Shirts
Only 25 of these shirts will be available to the first over $50 dollar contributors. You choose the size S/M/L/XL 
Help support the project by getting your limited edition shirt. (U.S Orders Only)





  • Open World - Go where you want, do what you want.
  • Player Class System - Three Classes to choose from.
  • Large Arsenal of Weaponry (ex.knives,Pistols,SMG's,Assault Rifles,Sniper Rifles, Explosives).
  • Unique Class Based Skill Tree System - Unlock special abilities unique only to that character class, Unlock the ability to craft items for both offensive and defensive use.
  • 1st person/3rd person camera system.
  • Combat cover system.
  • Location Based Damage System 
  • Inventory system - Collect scavenged items and create useful class specific equipment from them.
  • Real time of day and weather systems.
  • Running on Unreal Engine 4 
Player Class System
The Marksman Class: will be your go to guy when it comes to firepower. This class has the ability to use every weapon available in the game, cause a little more damage, carry more ammo, and has the ability to create his own ammunition from scavenged items (Skill tree ability). Plus the name says it all, he's a marksmen and because of that he is the only class that can equip and handle a sniper rifle. More details to come.

The EMS Class: has medical training, This class knows how to stitch up a wound, and treat a gun shot wound. This is the only class that has the ability to resuscitate fallen survivors  out in the world (Skill tree ability), just don't wait to long as there is a time limit. Need bandages made, or med pack for exploring the Infected zones, don't want to loose your loot when you die, make friends with an EMS class. More details to come.

The Survivalist Class: was a dooms day prepper before the viral toxin hit. He was actually preparing for the end of days, some say even hoping. Now that it's here, this class is more then  ready to show the world what they know. He's watched every episode of MacGyver and read every anarchist cookbook out there. This class has the ability to  make explosives and place traps. This class also has the ability to create sentry turrets from scavenged items found throughout the world. (Skill tree ability) More details to come.

Each class features a skill tree that will enhance and unlock abilities unique to that class. More details to come.
What Remains will be an episodic survival-horror game where, in each chapter that is released, time will have progressed changing the environment in which you will fight to stay alive. New paths and area will become available as time progresses. There will be a heavy emphasis on strategic game play where cover and smarts play a major role. If you die in the world, everything that you were carrying becomes up for grabs to the next available passer by.

The Infected Classes:
The Infected will come in 4 classes.

Infected - This is your standard infected carrier. Slow and highly contagious, they possess a heightened sense of hearing and sight. Strong biters and can quickly over come a survivor when encounter in large numbers.

Giggler - Gigglers have reached the pinnacle of madness, the virus has completely stripped the person of all humanity. Extremely strong and fast on there feet. You know a Gigglers around by their eerie and indistinguishably Giggling, the moment a Giggler has sight of you, they will never stop chasing you until either you or it are dead. Gigglers tend to pounce and swarm there targets with a rapid succession of bites, scratches and blows to the body.

Bloater - Bloaters are large husks of flesh that once was a person. Now they are filled with nothing but vile contiguous bile. The moment a Bloater has sight of you it begin to charge at you, and once it has you within its grasp it will start a chemical reaction within the Bloater that will ultimately end with it exploding and releasing all its contiguous bile upon anyone or anything around its area of effect. Its best to dispose of them quickly and at a distance.

Roider - Roiders are a special breed of infected, they have managed to contract a rare mutated form of the virus that has altered there genetic makeup. They poses almost super human strength. Roiders are the most dangerous class, and will usually take more then 1 person to bring down. When Roiders are aware of your presence, they give off a terrifying shriek that alerts all other infected with a given radius, making your fight all that tougher.


I have worked as a professional 3D environment artist / game designer in the Video Game industry for the past 10+ years. I have worked on various AAA titles from pre-production to retail such as Legendary,Turning Point, Lost Planet 3, and, most recently, Call of Duty Advanced Warfare.
Art Station

               

Because of my past work experience, I have the skill and know how to develop a game from beginning to end. One of the reasons why "What Remains" will be an episodic game is because creating the game in sections or "chapters" is more manageable. Creating it like this will allow me to dedicate more attention to detail and fine tune every aspect of the game. 

As with any multiplayer online game, creating an open world of this size and scope is a difficult challenge, mainly because I am just an environment artist. Outsourcing will play a major factor in the creation of this game. The contributions you make to this campaign will allow me to hire all necessary resources including programmers, animators, and concept artists since I am currently working alone. Another Challenge will be the continuous server maintenance and upkeep, I am just a normal 9-6 working guy trying to make a fun multiplayer game for the masses. Which is why a small subscription fee of no more then $5 dollars may be introduced in the future.

Break Down of funds and how it will be spent. 

$5k -$10k - Programmer - full time programmer needed to create all the core game mechanics and functionality, as well as maintaining and updating code as needed through the development of the game.

$5k - Concept Artist - Environment concept art to establish mood, style and lighting, Character Concepts to visualize and define main character classes, and infected classes. As well as visualizing look to charactrer loot item such as backpacks, clothes, etc.

$5k - $15k - Animator - Creation of ALL custom game animation, main character classes and infected either through keyframe animation or Mocap. Mocap will cost much more as i would have to rent the space and hire actors to have this done.

$10k-20k - Character Modeler - The creation of all the in game models. We need 3 main classes with variations in case i add a character creation system, and 4 main infected class with a few variations to each of those as to not make them look to repeated in the game world. This is an expensive task to get done.

$5k - $10k - Weapon Modeler - The creation of all the in game weapon models, since i will not be licensing any of the actual weapon models, i will have clones created that look as similar as possible to the real thing. 

$5k - $10k - General Outsourcing - While i will be creating most of the art in the game, some things that are more time consuming will be outsource to freelance artist. Objects like vehicles for instance can be outsourced, as these objects tend to take time to model and i would rather spend that time refining game play and working on environment art.

$2k - $5k - UI - creation of main game user interface, this can include loading screens, player HUD, and any additional player interface

$2k-$5k - Initial server setup and maintenance.

The rest will go to all the unforeseen factors that always comes up during the production process. 

As you can see every contribution will help fund this project, and help pay for many of the services i need. Please help me make this game.

Thank you for your time.

-M

Official What Remains Website

story:
Hi I am an independent game developer with a passion for good video games and Jesus our Lord.

My small team and I invite you to help promote and donate for the production of our new project, Soul Sword RPG! A videogame to break away from typical Christian game tropes, and provide something family friendly that anyone can play and enjoy. Our game seeks to become a fun experience that is built upon the foundation of Biblical principle, creating a great outreach of Biblical values. Of course, many of you may be asking yourselves, “Why should I? This is not the only videogame to promote Christianity, and they are usually cheaply done. What would make your game any different?” Our answer: we have a plan for a completely new approach.

Although we do respect their honorable intentions, most Christian videogames try to make their videogames into a platform for preaching a sermon. But they’re missing the point. A videogame is supposed to be fun. When anyone sits down to play, whether it’s a videogame, board-game, athletic sport, or even simple make believe, why do they do it? To relax, to have some excitement, and to have fun. Anybody, even Christians, don’t seek out sermons to relax. If you have a videogame wagging its finger at you and telling you how to shape-up, you naturally don’t want to play it much or not at all. The message is wonderful, but the game itself isn’t, because the focus was too much on the sermon and not on the game. The Bible itself says, “There’s a time for any activity under the heavens.” There’s a time to be serious and learn, but there’s also a time to play and be joyful. Too much of either is not a good thing.

Should we ditch the whole idea of a ‘good’ Christian videogame then? No. Christian videogame does not automatically mean that it can’t be fun, and it shouldn’t mean, ‘for Christians only.’ We can present the gospel and be fun. How? Allow us to draw your attention to C.S. Lewis’ masterpiece The Chronicles of Narnia. It is a book series that displayed enduring Biblical principles and morals, yet is still enjoyed by the general public. How did C.S. Lewis manage it? Writing a fantasy that oozed with Christianity yet is still loved by all kinds of people, Christian and non-Christian alike? The key was subtlety. The Bible was the foundation for the world he built. It was the heart atop which layers of wondrous creatures and sites were placed. C.S. Lewis’ values weren't tacked onto Narnia. It peeked through Narnia. Just like the Bible says, “Out of the mouth, the heart speaks.” Whatever is within your core will leak into what you make.

We plan to make Soul Sword with the same tactic. The Bible will be the foundation, where the messages shall be unobtrusive yet profound. From it, we shall stem excitement, drama, and danger! By fun, we mean characters to relate to, engaging story, expansive gameplay, exciting battles, and a vibrant world to be explored. Because that is what a videogame is supposed to be . . . fun. Yet at the same-time, when you save your file to play another day, it will give you something meaningful to think about. Maybe something even life-changing. We want to reach out through fun.

With your contribution we’ll be able to:

 Put out good advertising

 Pay for resources, editing, graphic programs, and software.

 Give wages for professional services: music, writing, artists, and programmers.

 Create an official website.

 Pay for legal services for LLC and copyright.

So whether you believe in the saving power of Jesus Christ or not, we want to invite everyone to come, and just have a good time. Thank You.


                                                    Game Overview

Title: Soul Sword

Target Audience: 16+

Platform: PC

Rating: E10+

Game Summary: The country of Manant is facing disaster in more ways than one. Poverty and thief raids ravage the land. The council members argue amongst themselves and the King is virtually useless to appease his people’s suffering. But there is a secret evil approaching, one difficult to fathom that lies hidden from everyone’s sight.

In the ancient days, Jehovah, the Creator God, would handpick a champion to deliver and lead Manant from evil: a hero they called the Ecclesiast. But the last Ecclesiast had died many centuries ago, and their age has all but disappeared. That is until Jack, a young blacksmith, is spoken to within the deep recesses of his dreams. . . . Jehovah has chosen him. He must now claim his appointed title by gathering the seven pieces of the Armor of Legend. But time waits for no one, and just finding the trials guarding them is half the battle.

Do you have what it takes to challenge your heart and mind? Can you become the Ecclesiast?

Game Outline: Based on classic 16-bit Turn-based RPGs,take part in this action packed game that will put your strategical skills to the test. Dark creatures and dangerous rogues stand in your path that you must face with the aid of your friends. Grow in skill with each battle, and sell your old herbs and weapons for newer and better ones. With hidden sidequests and secrets, new skills wait to be discovered, but the real prize is the Armor of Legend. The blessed armor, ready to grant the wearer great abilities, is not obtained by sheer force. Seven Dungeons stand in your way that will test not only your mind but also your heart.

·  Collect herbs to make elixirs that can aid you in battle and abroad.

·  Upgrade your element launcher to hurl devastating forces like fire, lighting, and more upon your enemies.

·  Traverse the exotic, diverse lands of both Manant and Terroh from the islands to the tundra, from deserts to a volcano.

·  Seven rare Eden trees dot the world, ready to amplify your attack and healing abilities to a legendary degree. If you can find them.

But they’re missing the point. A videogame is supposed to be fun. When anyone sits down to play, whether it’s a videogame, board-game, athletic sport, or even simple make believe, why do they do it? To relax, to have some excitement, and to have fun. Anybody, even Christians, don’t seek out sermons to relax. If you have a videogame wagging its finger at you and telling you how to shape-up, you naturally don’t want to play it much or not at all. The message is wonderful, but the game itself isn’t, because the focus was too much on the sermon and not on the game. The Bible itself says, “There’s a time for any activity under the heavens.” There’s a time to be serious and learn, but there’s also a time to play and be joyful. Too much of either is not a good thing.Should we ditch the whole idea of a ‘good’ Christian videogame then? No. Christian videogame does not automatically mean that it can’t be fun, and it shouldn’t mean, ‘for Christians only.’ We can present the gospel and be fun. How? Allow us to draw your attention to C.S. Lewis’ masterpiece The Chronicles of Narnia. It is a book series that displayed enduring Biblical principles and morals, yet is still enjoyed by the general public. How did C.S. Lewis manage it? Writing a fantasy that oozed with Christianity yet is still loved by all kinds of people, Christian and non-Christian alike? The key was subtlety. The Bible was the foundation for the world he built. It was the heart atop which layers of wondrous creatures and sites were placed. C.S. Lewis’ values weren't tacked onto Narnia. It peeked through Narnia. Just like the Bible says, “Out of the mouth, the heart speaks.” Whatever is within your core will leak into what you make.We plan to make Soul Sword with the same tactic. The Bible will be the foundation, where the messages shall be unobtrusive yet profound. From it, we shall stem excitement, drama, and danger! By fun, we mean characters to relate to, engaging story, expansive gameplay, exciting battles, and a vibrant world to be explored. Because that is what a videogame is supposed to be . . . fun. Yet at the same-time, when you save your file to play another day, it will give you something meaningful to think about. Maybe something even life-changing. We want to reach out through fun.With your contribution we’ll be able to:	Put out good advertising 	Pay for resources, editing, graphic programs, and software.	Give wages for professional services: music, writing, artists, and programmers.	Create an official website. 	Pay for legal services for LLC and copyright.So whether you believe in the saving power of Jesus Christ or not, we want to invite everyone to come, and just have a good time. Thank You.                                                    Game Overview
Title: Soul Sword
Target Audience: 16+
Platform: PC
Rating: E10+
Game Summary: The country of Manant is facing
disaster in more ways than one. Poverty and thief raids ravage the land. The
council members argue amongst themselves and the King is virtually useless to
appease his people’s suffering. But there is a secret evil approaching, one
difficult to fathom that lies hidden from everyone’s sight.
In the ancient days, Jehovah, the Creator God, would handpick
a champion to deliver and lead Manant from evil: a hero they called the
Ecclesiast. But the last Ecclesiast had died many centuries ago, and their age
has all but disappeared. That is until Jack, a young blacksmith, is spoken to
within the deep recesses of his dreams. . . . Jehovah has chosen him. He must
now claim his appointed title by gathering the seven pieces of the Armor of Legend.
But time waits for no one, and just finding the trials guarding them is half
the battle.
Do you have what it takes to challenge your heart and mind?
Can you become the Ecclesiast?
Game Outline: Based on classic 16-bit Turn-based
RPGs,take part in this action
packed game that will put your strategical skills to the test. Dark creatures
and dangerous rogues stand in your path that you must face with the aid of your
friends. Grow in skill with each battle, and sell your old herbs and weapons
for newer and better ones. With hidden sidequests and secrets, new skills wait
to be discovered, but the real prize is the Armor of Legend. The blessed armor,
ready to grant the wearer great abilities, is not obtained by sheer force. Seven
Dungeons stand in your way that will test not only your mind but also your
heart.
· 
Collect
herbs to make elixirs that can aid you in battle and abroad.
· 
Upgrade
your element launcher to hurl devastating forces like fire, lighting, and more
upon your enemies.
· 
Traverse
the exotic, diverse lands of both Manant and Terroh from the islands to the
tundra, from deserts to a volcano. 
· 
Seven
rare Eden trees
dot the world, ready to amplify your attack and healing abilities to a
legendary degree. If you can find
them.

story:
Short Summary

 

HELLO INDIEGOGO! I'm Jamaco Brown, co-founder of J Squared Innovations. As the name suggest, we create innovative concepts encouraging day to day and professional efficiency and in the case of BIZ N BALL, concepts that are extremely exciting, addictive, and fun.

The perfect way to describe BIZ N BALL is the perfect combination of NBA meets an office space.  BIZ N BALL characters are represented by the MILLIONS of us that make up an office setting.  This includes the BOSS, who of course wants you to always give maximum effort.  The BOSS definitely doesn’t want you playing around so in BIZ N BALL if the BOSS catches you attempting to shoot an item in the trash bin, YOUR’E FIRED, GAME OVER!  Then there is HEAD OF HR who wants to ensure that all employees are treated fairly. Therefore, trying the CO-WORKER TRICK SHOT will either provide you additional perks or get you fired not only by the BOSS BUT HEAD OF HR. Now Besides you, the GAMER(EMPLOYEE), being the most important character of the game, your CRUSH is also important. In an office, there is always a CRUSH.  Whether it’s you that has a crush on someone, or someone has a crush on you, THERE IS ALWAYS A CRUSH IN THE OFFICE : ). Thus, in BIZ N BALL it is important to impress your crush. Impressing your CRUSH gets you additional perks including the ultimate perk, THE ALLEY-OOP!!

  Not only can gamers play BIZ N BALL, but gamers can also compete with other players.  Compete with random players (considered co-workers you don’t know) or with friends (co-workers you do know).  Go head-to-head against each other by playing HIRE OR FIRE or H.O.R.S.E. 

 We need your help in providing the world enjoyment and fun by contributing to the creation and development of the BIZ N BALL Gaming application. This project has been 3 years in the making. As a winner of Applit's monthly competition in 2012 with the app idea BODY GRAPH, I was enthusiastic about entering the next month's Applits competition with Biz N Ball which was then branded as OFFICE BALL. Unfortunately, OFFICE BALL didnt do as well as BODY GRAPH in the competition. Although unsuccessful, the belief that the gaming application idea had potential was always there. J Squared Innovations was founded February of 2014 in which one of our primary focuses is diversity: creating ideas that were not only helpful but fun. The idea of OFFICE BALL was presented to my partner and co-founder Joshua Taylor who loved the idea. After providing ingenious and exciting additives to the idea, OFFICE BALL was rebranded and BIZ N BALL was formed. We are extremely excited to present a gaming app idea that is exciting and well thought out.  If you see the potential in the BIZ N BALL as we do, be a part of the creation or simply tell someone of our Indiegogo campaign.

Hope you guys enjoy the idea of the BIZ N BALL gaming application and thanks to everyone for your support.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking supporters for $27, 000 to create the BIZ N BALL Gaming Application.  The funding will be used to hire an app developing company.  The BIZ N BALL project has been uploaded to ELANCE where we are filtering and making a final decision on one of the 27 (and counting) potential companies from all around the world to be the ideal company to partner with. In the event that we do not reach our funding goal, the funding raised will go towards licensing representation. We are also in contractual agreement with Enhance Product Development who will showcase the BIZ N BALL project to potential licensees.  As a result, we have created multiple avenues to ensure that the BIZ N BALL game gets to the public.

To get a better understanding of what supporters get when selecting a funding group, let us first explain the exciting BIZ N BALL PERKS.

BIZ N BALL PERKS:

Sound Proof Chance: THE SOUND PROOF CHANCES are to ensure users that there will be no distractions when trying to shoot the item in the trash can. However, run out of Sound Proof Chances and you should look out for the BOSS.

THE EXCUSE: When THE EXCUSE is used, the BOSS forgives you if he catches you in the act of playing BIZ N BALL.

THE BOSS INTERFERENCE: the coworker or crush will run interference for you to hold the BOSS off from checking on you. In addition to the INTERFERENCE OPTION, the time that the co-worker or crush has provided you from running interference to make the shot will appear. Now that you know when the boss is coming to check on you, you better make the shot(s) count.

THE HEAD OF HR INTERFERENCE: the coworker or crush will run interference for you to hold HEAD OF HR off from checking on you. In addition to the INTERFERENCE OPTION, the time that the co-worker or crush has provided you from running interference to make the shot will appear.

ALLEY OOP ASSIST - The ASSIST IS GIVEN WHEN YOUR CRUSH METER IS AT ITS HIGHEST LEVEL.  This is perfect to use when you’re struggling to make a shot.  When using this option, your crush will rush in to the office where you will alley-op the item to your crush who will gladly dunk that item in the trash can for you.


Risks & Challenges

We understand that there will be challenges and hurdles to face in getting BIZ N BALL from concept to a working game application. The funding amount that we are asking for will ensure full development of the game.  However, if we cannot reach the full amount, those funds raised will go towards licensing representation as stated earlier as well as developing as much of the game as possible.  The BIZ N BALL game will have 4 levels. However, if creating the BIZ N BALL game with 2 levels, for instance, maximizes our supporter’s funding, we are prepared to do just that. Then as the game gains more popularity, we will then develop the game in its entirety. If you’re willing to help us bring BIZ N BALL to life, we are more than willing to develop it for your enjoyment.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate all contributions to this exciting project.  Whether you’re helping in funding BIZ N BALL or sharing the project with your family, friends, or co-workers, we’re just happy that you are on board. We’ve created something that is perfect for all ages and settings. So if you’re that 12 year old kid looking for a new fun game to play or the professional in his/her office with a little time to spare between meetings, this is the game for you. We want to provide fun and excitement to the world and we want to do it through BIZ N BALL.

Also, we would also like to thank Josh Woodward for allowing us to utilize his music for the BIZ N BALL Campaign video. Please support BIZ N BALL and those that have help bring this project to life.

story:
JOIN US IN OUR GOAL TO GROW THE GAME

Our company, Amplified Soccer Marketing, started up in September of 2014. Our team is very passionate about making a big impact on the game of soccer. We believe there is an untapped value in the grassroots youth game and by uniting brands with organizations, the level of the game can improve nationwide. The core of our business is marketing consultation, however, we are also developing assets in the form of websites, camps and a digital magazine just for soccer athletes in our pursuit to grow the game and provide outlets for the companies we work with.

What is Amplified Soccer Athlete?

Amplified Soccer Athlete is a digital magazine that can be found in both Google Play and App Store.

Our goal is to bring soccer athletes around the world an unmatched resource to support you in the journey to #AmplifyYourGame.

From drills and exercises, to soccer-specific nutrition guides, fitness activities and mental game performance, readers will enjoy a well-rounded soccer experience. Product reviews and feature stories are also incorporated to connect athletes with their soccer community.

Content contributions come from some of the top professional training, nutrition, mental game and fitness leaders in the industry.

Who’s Involved?

Beast Mode Soccer, AthleteFIT, Chris "Trainer" Gorres, Performance Conditioning Soccer, Yael Averbuch, SoccerGrlProbs, Dan Abrahams, Donna Fishter, AthleteFIT, Nancy Clark and more. 

Why should I care?

Because it’s the right people at the right time with the right idea. This magazine is not intended to replace any training program from a coach or other professional training staff, but rather provide supplemental information to assist aspirational athletes when training on their own. Help us improve the game by providing athletes with the information and inspiration they need to take their game to the next level.

Where the funding will help us

We already have designed, edited, labored over and released our first two issues! Many talented people have been involved with the first two issues. Initial feedback has been amazing and now we need your help to continue and turn this digital magazine into a media startup. One of our greatest challenges is keeping quality high and keeping the price of the magazine affordable.

With premium content, we want to continue to distribute on a premium platform. We are reaching out to you in hope for your support to help us reach our new goals that includes more visual contributions and creating exclusive content that includes: video shoots, celebrity interviews, events and working closer with other business entities.

What else?

It takes a ton of time and hard work and people and money to get a magazine up going and self-sustaining. It has been one of those Superhuman Efforts. That's why we're asking for your help. Support trainers, athletes and writers you love—and those you've yet to discover. Give what you can, if you want.

Other Ways You Can Help

WORD OF MOUTH!

- Spread the word to a friend about our campaign. Word of mouth still is the fastest form of promotion.

SHARE THE LINK! SOCIAL NETWORKING!

- If you do donate or can't at this time, pass the link (www.indiegogo.com/projects/amplified-soccer-ath... a friend, share on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram, Email (you get the point)

Thank you for your support!

-Team Amplified Soccer

story:
What is Dota IMBA?

If you have played Dota for a long time, you might remember that it was not the only warcraft 3 map lying around during its heyday. Plenty of other, some times very fun, maps existed and were played. One of those was Mimiya's Dota IMBA!

IMBA was a variation of Dota where everything was absolutely overpowered - so powerful, it was broken. And, as Mimiya brilliantly put it, the intent of the map was to have "Imbalance in balance" - create a Dota game where all heroes are super powerful, and super fun to play, but the game is still playable and enjoyable, without any hero being truly impossible to play against.

This project consists in bringing IMBA to Dota 2 - using the Workshop's custom games system, currently in alpha, and soon to be released by Valve. We will not do a direct conversion of IMBA - rather, we'll use its ideas and spirit, and go on a new direction. Our purpose is to have you be able to play any of Dota's regular heroes, and feel like you're playing the same thing, but with new and exciting quirks on your old abilities.

Pudge will still throw hooks, and be a constant fear whenever he's missing, but no longer will he only do that. Night Stalker will still be a fat, rich creep during the day, but at night, he will be fearsome. Lina will still be a fragile nuker with incredible burst, but now she will devastate whole landscapes with her spells.

We will attempt to lovely craft every hero's skills in a way that makes them more interesting and brutal. Remember the feeling you had when you played Dota for the first time, and everything was new and unexpected and surprising - a whole new world? This is what we want to revive!

Who are we?

A brazilian beer-seller turned programmer - Felipe Calife

A netherlands teen studying hard to join the workforce - Hewdraw

A small community of modders who work together to help each other and bring their ideas to life - the Dota 2 modding community.

We are the team that wants to bring IMBA to Dota 2. Myself (Felipe) and Hewdraw are amateur programmers, and as such, we needed all the help we could get from the more experienced modders to bring this project to fruition.

They responded beautifully, answering our every question and doubt, providing a plethora of resources and tutorials, and holding our hand every step of the way. With all that help, we managed to get together IMBA's Workshop version, which is now working, and available for anyone to play! Rocking over 12 thousand subscribers and a 92% positive user rating, we are very happy about its launch! :)

However, IMBA, at the moment, is not what we want it to be. It is merely a seed of something better - a seed which we need your help to make grow!


What We Need & What You Get

As project leader, I have been developing IMBA for Dota 2 for over six months. It went through various versions and evolutions, as I learned more about Dota modding - from simple ability file editing, increasing dota's regular skills' impact, to something a bit more complex, to its current iteration.


IMBA was always doable as a hobby, a side project - something I could use to relax while doing on the weekends. However, not anymore.


Implementing each IMBA hero is a somewhat lengthy process, taking anywhere from 4 to 10 hours (including all the testing and bug-fixing that has to be done). Implementing 2-3 heroes per week, plus new items, fixing newly-reported bugs, and writing news posts, patch notes, blog entries, takes me about 30 hours per week. I cannot reasonably work at that rate any more - I have to devote myself to a task which will allow me to have a roof to live in, and eat, after all :)


So, this is where the community comes in - if there is enough interest in IMBA after all, you can help me keep working on this at a decent rate!


What do we get if we're funded? I will devote all the time necessary to keep pushing updates for IMBA at the promised rate:

  • At least 3 heroes per week;
  • New items, and reimaginings of existing items;
  • Additional content, in the form of extra game modes and customization options.

I also promise to keep development going at least until all dota heroes are in IMBA. No compromises, we only stop when everyone is ported in.

If we do not get funded, then I am sorry to say that I will have to go slow with this project, and keep it as a hobby - we might be able to push one hero per week consistently, but no promises beyond that :(

Stretch Goals

I do not expect this project to go much beyond its initial funding goal; however, if it goes - we have a LOT of ideas for new game modes and extra things which could implement in IMBA - both things that Mimiya originally put in, and brand new ideas. We'll gauge the community's interest, and release the stretch goals if it seems feasible they might be reached. Stay tuned!


Campaign funds distribution

In the interest of being entirely transparent, this will be the destination of any funds raised by this project:

  • 60% will go to the main developer and project leader (Felipe);
  • 20% will go to my biggest helper, Hewdraw;
  • 20% will go to all the contributors of SpellLibrary, a modding resource which helped our development incredibly: Pizzalol, Noya, Kritth, Rook, Ractidous, and Chrislotix.


When this campaign ends, rest assured that we will never start another campaign for Dota IMBA, ever. If we don't reach the goal, that's it, and we won't annoy any of you again!


Whenever Dota 2's workshop tools come out of beta, it is believed that Valve will allow custom game modes to be monetized - i.e. you'll have to pay to use some specific game modes.


If, and when, this is implemented, we of Dota IMBA will accept donations, but never ask for your money beforehand. We guarantee you: IMBA is, and always will be, completely free, and devoid of any kind of game-impacting microtransactions.


Risks & Challenges

Let's be honest: contributing to crowdfunding campaigns is always risky. There's always the possibility that the campaigner will run away with the money and disappear from the internet. There's no contract being signed here, and no legal document binding me to finish any of the things that are promised in this page.


However - and this is, I honestly believe, the best guarantee I can offer you - I am passionate about this project. I played hours upon hours of warcraft 3 IMBA. Hundreds upon hundreds of games, some times solo, against bots.I have been developing this for over half a year for no reason other than my love for the game. I want to see this project completed, and won't quit before I'm done. All I'm asking the community is support for the chance to do it quicker - and probably better!


Let us live the dream together - the dream of bringing IMBA to Dota 2, in all its glory, and the dream of being able to work on modding full-time (at least for a while)!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help directly by pledging to this campaign, there are other ways you can help!

  • Translate this campaign (or just its main points) to another language. Translations to Russian, Chinese, Spanish or Filipino are especially useful!
  • Show Dota IMBA to your friends! As simple as that is, word of mouth is still the best way to spread news.
  • Show this campaign to people you think can help - anyone you know that could enjoy this mod!
  • Keep playing, and having fun! Your feedback messages, telling us how much you are enjoying playing, are the best motivation we could ask for! :)


Legal Stuff

Dota IMBA will never use any copyrighted material beyond the base game, provided by Valve.


Mimiya, the original IMBA creator, was contacted before this project was even started, and approves of it.
story_txt:
What is Dota IMBA?
If you have played Dota for a long time, you might remember that it was not the only warcraft 3 map lying around during its heyday. Plenty of other, some times very fun, maps existed and were played. One of those was Mimiya's Dota IMBA!


IMBA was a variation of Dota where everything was absolutely overpowered - so powerful, it was broken. And, as Mimiya brilliantly put it, the intent of the map was to have "Imbalance in balance" - create a Dota game where all heroes are super powerful, and super fun to play, but the game is still playable and enjoyable, without any hero being truly impossible to play against.

This project consists in bringing IMBA to Dota 2 - using the Workshop's custom games system, currently in alpha, and soon to be released by Valve. We will not do a direct conversion of IMBA - rather, we'll use its ideas and spirit, and go on a new direction. Our purpose is to have you be able to play any of Dota's regular heroes, and feel like you're playing the same thing, but with new and exciting quirks on your old abilities.

Pudge will still throw hooks, and be a constant fear whenever he's missing, but no longer will he only do that. Night Stalker will still be a fat, rich creep during the day, but at night, he will be fearsome. Lina will still be a fragile nuker with incredible burst, but now she will devastate whole landscapes with her spells.

We will attempt to lovely craft every hero's skills in a way that makes them more interesting and brutal. Remember the feeling you had when you played Dota for the first time, and everything was new and unexpected and surprising - a whole new world? This is what we want to revive!


Who are we?A brazilian beer-seller turned programmer - Felipe Calife

A netherlands teen studying hard to join the workforce - Hewdraw

A small community of modders who work together to help each other and bring their ideas to life - the Dota 2 modding community.

We are the team that wants to bring IMBA to Dota 2. Myself (Felipe) and Hewdraw are amateur programmers, and as such, we needed all the help we could get from the more experienced modders to bring this project to fruition.

They responded beautifully, answering our every question and doubt, providing a plethora of resources and tutorials, and holding our hand every step of the way. With all that help, we managed to get together IMBA's Workshop version, which is now working, and available for anyone to play! Rocking over 12 thousand subscribers and a 92% positive user rating, we are very happy about its launch! :)
 However, IMBA, at the moment, is not what we want it to be. It is merely a seed of something better - a seed which we need your help to make grow!
   What We Need & What You Get As project leader, I have been developing IMBA for Dota 2 for over six months. It went through various versions and evolutions, as I learned more about Dota modding - from simple ability file editing, increasing dota's regular skills' impact, to something a bit more complex, to its current iteration.

IMBA was always doable as a hobby, a side project - something I could use to relax while doing on the weekends. However, not anymore.

Implementing each IMBA hero is a somewhat lengthy process, taking anywhere from 4 to 10 hours (including all the testing and bug-fixing that has to be done). Implementing 2-3 heroes per week, plus new items, fixing newly-reported bugs, and writing news posts, patch notes, blog entries, takes me about 30 hours per week. I cannot reasonably work at that rate any more - I have to devote myself to a task which will allow me to have a roof to live in, and eat, after all :)

So, this is where the community comes in - if there is enough interest in IMBA after all, you can help me keep working on this at a decent rate!

What do we get if we're funded? I will devote all the time necessary to keep pushing updates for IMBA at the promised rate:


At least 3 heroes per week;

New items, and reimaginings of existing items;

Additional content, in the form of extra game modes and customization options.


I also promise to keep development going at least until all dota heroes are in IMBA. No compromises, we only stop when everyone is ported in.

If we do not get funded, then I am sorry to say that I will have to go slow with this project, and keep it as a hobby - we might be able to push one hero per week consistently, but no promises beyond that :(


Stretch Goals

 I do not expect this project to go much beyond its initial funding goal; however, if it goes - we have a LOT of ideas for new game modes and extra things which could implement in IMBA - both things that Mimiya originally put in, and brand new ideas. We'll gauge the community's interest, and release the stretch goals if it seems feasible they might be reached. Stay tuned!


Campaign funds distributionIn the interest of being entirely transparent, this will be the destination of any funds raised by this project:

60% will go to the main developer and project leader (Felipe);
20% will go to my biggest helper, Hewdraw;
20% will go to all the contributors of SpellLibrary, a modding resource which helped our development incredibly: Pizzalol, Noya, Kritth, Rook, Ractidous, and Chrislotix.


When this campaign ends, rest assured that we will never start another campaign for Dota IMBA, ever. If we don't reach the goal, that's it, and we won't annoy any of you again!

Whenever Dota 2's workshop tools come out of beta, it is believed that Valve will allow custom game modes to be monetized - i.e. you'll have to pay to use some specific game modes.

If, and when, this is implemented, we of Dota IMBA will accept donations, but never ask for your money beforehand. We guarantee you: IMBA is, and always will be, completely free, and devoid of any kind of game-impacting microtransactions.

    Risks & Challenges Let's be honest: contributing to crowdfunding campaigns is always risky. There's always the possibility that the campaigner will run away with the money and disappear from the internet. There's no contract being signed here, and no legal document binding me to finish any of the things that are promised in this page.

However - and this is, I honestly believe, the best guarantee I can offer you - I am passionate about this project. I played hours upon hours of warcraft 3 IMBA. Hundreds upon hundreds of games, some times solo, against bots.I have been developing this for over half a year for no reason other than my love for the game. I want to see this project completed, and won't quit before I'm done. All I'm asking the community is support for the chance to do it quicker - and probably better!

Let us live the dream together - the dream of bringing IMBA to Dota 2, in all its glory, and the dream of being able to work on modding full-time (at least for a while)!

    Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't help directly by pledging to this campaign, there are other ways you can help!


Translate this campaign (or just its main points) to another language. Translations to Russian, Chinese, Spanish or Filipino are especially useful!
Show Dota IMBA to your friends! As simple as that is, word of mouth is still the best way to spread news.
Show this campaign to people you think can help - anyone you know that could enjoy this mod!
Keep playing, and having fun! Your feedback messages, telling us how much you are enjoying playing, are the best motivation we could ask for! :)

Legal StuffDota IMBA will never use any copyrighted material beyond the base game, provided by Valve.Mimiya, the original IMBA creator, was contacted before this project was even started, and approves of it.

story:
Level 2 Music Complete!

You can check out the track here!

 

 

For PlayStation VR, Oculus Rift, VIVE

 

 

Vanguard V began as a small demo released in 2014 for the Oculus DK2.  Back then the team was small but dreamed of someday creating a studio dedicated to virtual reality game development.  The demo caught the attention of many before retail VR was even available.  It was showcased at events by Oculus, Sony, and others to show solid gameplay in VR.  It was nominated for several awards at the first Proto Awards that same year.  The team knew that to finish the title would take serious foundation.

The following two years brought sweat, blood, and a never ending determination to bring a dream to reality.  ZeroTransform released Proton Pulse to every major VR platform and Pulsar Arena to launch with the Oculus Touch.  We're comfortable working across all VR platforms.

We brought in other great minds and put in the work to ensure the game company was created properly.  The game we plan to make has a much higher bar in quality and scope than the original prototype.  From design, to business, we have the tools to make this happen; now we just need the support to keep going long enough to finally finish it.

Screenshot from Level 2

 

WANT TO TRY IT NOW?  NO PROBLEM!

We will be releasing Vanguard V as an Early Access title on Oculus Home and Steam.  Those who get the Early Bird Access tier or higher will be getting the title at a discount and a key to the title when it's available for Early Access in March.  The demo will also be released but will only ever have the two demo levels.  As an early access title, you will be able to play the game as it's being developed.  You will also have the full title when it's completed during the holidays of 2017.  The Early Access version will be on Steam and Oculus Home sometime in March.  At that time the Early Bird Access tier will be removed.

 

GOALS

The plan is to finish Vanguard V and deliver it by the holiday season of 2017.  To ensure this, the game has been made with a flexible scope based on resources.  We are confident we can deliver the title with the initial goal.  That said, we've designed the title to be capable of much more.  With your help we can take the title to its fully realized vision.

Here is the plan for features above and beyond the base title:

 

STORY

Earth has been attacked by the Parasites, a species alien to Earth, who travel through the star systems devastating worlds as they systematically transform each planet into an incubator to further expand their race. They burrow into their host planet all the way to the core creating the perfect conditions for reproduction. They evolve at a geometric rate, competing with and ultimately replacing all life on the planet in a bid for energy.

 

GAMEPLAY OVERVIEW​

Vanguard V is designed for play on VR headsets, and can be fully operated with head tracking alone. Qu, the main character, is controlled from the third-person and moves where you look in a hemisphere in front of the player. The core gameplay consists of dodging obstacles by moving your head, directing Qu’s course and directing the reticule that can lock onto any Parasites that it passes over, automatically shooting down enemies with Qu’s powerful energy weaponry.

 

 

 

 

 

Qu

Qu is a Valkyrie Scout and has arrived at Earth finding the planet already in peril. Her homeworld was devastated when she was a young child by a Parasite invasion and it destroyed everything she held dear. Her home, her family; the parasites left nothing. She was only four years old and was whisked away as one of the few to survive the calamity.  It has been twenty years since Qu had her first encounter with the parasites and she now finds herself with a choice to flee from danger or save the planet below.

 
 
 
 
 

B.i.T.

B.i.T. (Binocular interface Transmitter) is Qu’s robotic companion.  He is a non-biological but highly intelligent AI, and BiT knows much of humanity. A bit more cynical than Qu, BiT is thankful that humanity has lived in peace, as he feels he has little in common with them and would rather avoid contact if possible. He oversees Qu and is her best friend and companion. He also is a part of her arsenal; he functions as a remote camera, giving Qu a tactical overview of her own situation from 3rd person while also providing information on Qu’s surroundings.

 

The Parasites

Little is known about this threat to humanity. Initially thought to be a meteor on a near-collision course with Earth, it was classified as an unidentified space craft after it made intentional course corrections to impact Earth directly. The orb buried itself inside the planet, hatching to release a vast colony of creatures that consume organic matter and replicate rapidly. The Parasites evolve and change constantly; they have many specialized adaptations, including the ability to escape Earth’s gravity and fly through space! While seemingly unintelligent, they are highly reactive to situations and detect Qu as a threat even before she makes it to Earth.

 

 

 

 

 

 

By moving your head, BiT changes his orientation, following your movements one-to-one. Qu moves at an exaggerated rate based on your head movements, and smoothly and stylishly flies through the levels using her advanced cybersuit. The targeting reticle also moves independently of your view so you can easily and smoothly paint your targets. On some levels, movement of Qu is restrained/modified, both to aid in introducing the player to the controls, and to provide new and varied challenges.

 

Hand Controls

 

The game will be released across all major platforms and the control scheme will be customized to fit with each hardware's available accessories to allow greater control.  You can also use the various hand controllers, be they Move controllers for the PSVR, the Move Controller for Oculus, or the Vive's hand controllers. Simply raise your hand in front of you and paint the targets with the targeting reticle.

 

User Interface

Players view the action in Vanguard V from a third person perspective, though technically, the player is Qu, and is looking through her visor at the video feed from BiT who follows behind her. The interface consists of Qu, the player targeting reticle, and Qu’s personal shield status. Some events change the perspective including a first person sequence.

 

 

 

 

 

Level 1: Re-Entry

 

Qu is flying in space with a heat shield as she re-enters the Earth’s atmosphere. With the heat shield active, Qu cannot operate her weapons at full capacity. Plow through the Parasites while dodging debris. Watch out because the Parasites can also shoot projectiles of their own. 

Keep that shield intact or you’ll burn up! - BiT

 

Level 1: Boss

Parasite cluster through the atmosphere and into the clouds. Qu’s weapons are offline due to the intense heat so she must dodge the shots. Fortunately, she is essentially a fireball and can plow right through individual parasites as the cluster begins to disintegrate. 

Entering the atmosphere hardcore now. Weapons are offline but hot damn, you're a fireball. Use it!

 

Level 2: The Surface

 

Qu enters the scene blasting through the sound barrier. Fly through valleys, Obsidian Falls and caves to reach the beach. Once at the ocean, Qu flies just above the water and remains parallel to the surface plane. This frees the player to look around at the attacking enemies. Qu’s laser arsenal is now fully operational in this stage, so she can fight back against the Parasites that are evolving rapidly.

 

Level 2 Boss: The Leviathan 

The fight takes place on a large cylindrical path. We will be flying along the perimeter of the wormhole. Large rocks help us avoid getting hit from time to time, we look across the wormhole to find the titan flying in the same direction. We need to catch up. The leviathan breaks off some smaller enemies that fight with us on the way.

As you reach the tail of the boss, you see vulnerable target areas. We don't want to give away any more spoilers for this boss!

 

Level 3: The Wormhole

Qu has now entered the giant tube left by the first impact of the enemy. Here Qu hugs the wall and you tilt your head to have her roll to the left or right. Burrowers will fly through the walls to attack. Use your Megabeam to fire straight forward and take out the threat. Dodge pillars, take out the enemies, avoid falling rocks!

 

Level 3 Boss: The Tumbler 

This boss has long legs to maneuver rapidly through the wormhole. It curls its legs inwards to roll through at great speed. The tumbler will also go behind Qu and tumble through pillars. BiT will warn you of falling rocks. Watch the shadows for clues or turn around 180 in VR to see for yourself. 

 

Level 4: The Lava Caves

Qu flies her way through the diamond hot lava caverns. With your heat shield re-activated, dodge lava flows and the elements of the Earth’s core. The stalactites will have parasites. The stalactites fall if you shoot them so time your shots carefully. BiT has short range radar of the caves. Listen to BiT’s directions to avoid danger. Keep that heat shield functioning!

 

Level 4 Boss: Diamond Wyvern 

The level opens up to a wide liquid diamond lake that goes on for a large distance. There are stalactites that the wyvern flies below. Enemies are perched on the stalactites shooting at you. The wyvern is covered in diamond. It is nearly impossible to break. Players have different strategies they can use to be victorious this boss fight. 

 

Level 5 Boss: The Core

Qu has reached the center of the planet and it’s time for the final showdown with the alien invader. Qu flies around the boss from a fixed distance with full 360 degree control. Look which direction you would like to have her rotate and she will follow. There is a layer of rocks with openings along the wall of the final battle. Qu flies under this layer for protection but the core is more than capable of knocking out the cover. This creates more openings for Qu to shoot the core. Dodge the enemy shots, avoid falling debris shaken loose by the enemy, fire everything you’ve got!

We don't want to give anymore spoilers out for level 6 or the final ending!

 

 

 

As much as we are lovers of games, we are also lovers of game MUSIC, new and old. We've assembled a team of considerable musical talent to produce a soundtrack that mixes the very best of new and old.

Turn Around - Composed by Jake Kaufman / Vocals by Jessie Seely

 

Jake Kaufman

A.K.A. Virt. You may already be familiar with Jake's music work on countless video game soundtracks including Shovel Knight, Proton Pulse and will help craft Vanguard V's sonic landscape to fit perfectly with the music and visuals.

http://virt.bandcamp.com

Dan Behrens

AKA Danimal Cannon, brings his lightning fast guitar work and metal-enhanced electronica to pump up the soundtrack.  An expert composer, performer, and all around sound man, Danimal loves to get in there, make great music, and leave the crowds begging for more!  He's also a master at mastering audio, bringing the love to our whole sound system.  Learn more at his website.

http://danimalcannon.com/

 

 

 

 

ZeroTransform has partnered up with WarpZone Prints to develop a number of items.  As fans of the title, they've agreed to produce these things at cost to support the cause.

 

Metal Cards

These metal cards are one of the main reason we went with WarpZone Prints.  They developed cards for the NUREN VR project that looked incredible!

METAL CARDS for NUREN

We will be producing art for red, green, and blue cards.  We will also have a limited platinum card that will be signed by the team.

 

T-SHIRT

Show the world that you support VR with this amazing shirt.  We checked around to make sure that we found the best quality place for this task.  Now you can wash your shirt with confidence.

 

 

FRAMED 3D PRINT

We've captured some action shots from the game in 3D to frame behind a lenticular sheet to produce 3D pictures.  Seeing is believing and believe me, these are incredible.

 

 

THE CLOCK

This clock is stained, sealed, and absolutely gorgeous.  Mad props to WarpZone Prints for creating these.  The back of the clock will be signed by the team and individually numbered.  The clock is just under 12 inches in diameter.  These are limited items.

 

 

THE OPTIC CRYSTAL PINNACLE STATUE

These are for those who truly believe in our cause.  The Crystal Pinnacle has tapered sides and a beveled top with laser engraved art from Vanguard V.  You are a foundation builder and as such you are considered a member of the ZeroTransform family.  Your name will be engraved in highly polished optic crystal in a frosty white tone for excellent contrast.

 

 

THE TEAM

The core team consists of game experienced game developers with a long list of titles under their belt.

 

Justin Moravetz:  Creative Director

“Virtual Reality brings people closer than ever before into a world beyond imagination. Human perception can be seamlessly integrated into a digital existence. Never before has 3D content been so physical, so immersive, than in VR. We are at the forefront of innovation and I’m honored to be a pioneer in the wave of the future.” – Justin Moravetz

Justin Moravetz is the lead developer and founder of ZeroTransform. He was the primary creator of the previous VR titles, Proton Pulse and Pulsar Arena.

Moravetz worked on big titles like Syphon Filter Logan’s Shadow, Resistance Retribution, and Uncharted Golden Abyss, before leaving to pursue is dream of VR development. He believes VR is unexplored territory where new experiences are waiting to be invented. Dreams become reality and reality becomes dreams. He is also an avid chip tune composer, particle effects animator, and voider of warranties. His motto is “Good things come to those who wait. Great things come to those who pursue.”

 

Scot Bayless:  Business Operations

Bayless joined Capcom as Vice President of Product Development in February 2007.  He parted ways with the company in 2009.  During his time he worked on Street Fighter IV, Dark Void and many other titles. 
 
Prior to working at Capcom, Scot worked at Midway Games in Chicago in charge of the studio production there.  Earlier than Midway, Scot also worked for Electronic Arts, SEGA and Microsoft.  In his early days of development Scot worked on many Dungeons & Dragons titles for SSI for the "Gold Box Series".

 

Jeff Hawthorne:  Code

Jeffrey Hawthorne's passion for video games started as a child when he tried his cousin's Nintendo. Since then, he has received his degree in computer science at CAL State Chico with a minor in math. After working for Sony and Play Habit, he became Lead Software Engineer for the one and only ZeroTransform.

 

Gary Spinrad:  Sound

Gary Spinrad has been working with video game audio for over 20 years. Gary's work can be heard on Phantasmagoria II, Leisure Suit Larry, and five Call of Duty titles. In his spare time, Gary enjoys crushing watermelons and performing with his band, Elviss Simmons.

 

Heather Peterson:  Production

Heather helps with all things production.  From schedule to social media, there isn't anything she won't hesitate to tackle if it needs doing.

 

Athey Moravetz:  Character Design

Athey worked at Sony for eight years modeling characters and preparing them for animation.  She handles all things creature and character related.

 

Jake Kaufman:  Head of Music

Jake Kaufman (aka Virt) is an American video game music composer. After starting out creating arrangements and remixes of video game soundtracks, he began his commercial composing career in 2000 with the score to the Game Boy Color port of Q*bert. He continued to compose music for games for the next couple of years, working primarily with handheld video games. In 2002, he set up the website VGMix, which hosts video game music remixes, and continues to administrate it. His career began to take off over the next few years, resulting in him transitioning jobs into a full-time freelance composer by 2005. Since then he has worked on several big-name projects such as Contra 4, Red Faction: Guerrilla, DuckTales: Remastered, and Shovel Knight. Around that time he composed music for ZeroTransform for the titles Proton Pulse, Pulsar Arena, and the Vanguard V prototype.

In early 2015, he and Jessie Seely formed CSP Industries, and launched a Kickstarter for [NUREN] The New Renaissance, a project that they call "the world's first virtual reality rock opera." In late 2015, Kaufman composed and wrote lyrics for Power Overwhelming, the debut album of parody supergroup Big Bad Bosses.

 

Callyn Dorval: 

Is the voice actor of Qu for Vanguard V

Callyn has been involved with theatre from a young age, getting her start in stage work and community theatre. Her interest in voice acting began nearly three years ago, when she was inspired after attending a panel of voice actors for video games.

Since then, Callyn has been developing her craft with a focus in video game and animation character work. She has lent her voice to a number of animated projects and radio plays. As an avid video gamer, Callyn's dream is to help contribute her voice to this wonderful medium of storytelling."

 

Joey Groeneweg:

is the voice actor of BiT and screenwriter for Vanguard V.  

Joey picked up writing eight years ago while staying in Flagstaff, Arizona, home of the Northern Arizona University. Writing mainly, but not exclusively, stand-up comedy, he has performed in different venues all over The Netherlands and parts of the USA.

As impressions are one of the main parts of his comedic repertoire, voice acting was a natural next step.  He has been doing voice acting for about two years now, and has had several roles in games, animations and radio plays.

Joey has been a gamer since twelve and would love to be able to combine his passion for games, writing and comedy and continue his career in this field.

 

Justin Spice:  Concept Art

Justin Spice has provided fantastic concepts that really convey a sense of scale that defines the look of Vanguard V.  He also does work with Jake Kaufman for NUREN.

 

 

USE OF FUNDS

The primary use of the funds is keeping the team fed and expanding the team a bit.  On top of the design, Justin Moravetz also handles the art, special effects, and animation.  We plan on hiring another artist and an animator to assist Justin so he can focus on design more.  We've worked hard to have the tools and tech already in place so funds will go strait into production.

 

 

Can't back us? That's ok!

Help up by sharing our IndieGoGo on Facebook, Twitter, or your nearest mountain top!

See ya soon!
